hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed only one night, but it was a wonderful hotel and would definitely return. Despite the central location, it was fairly quiet and this hotel was compact and easy to navigate. Front desk staff was helpful and quick! The room was comfortable with a full couch and floor-to-ceiling windows that included a bit of Times Square in the view. Bathroom was very large for NYC with a full-sized tub and shower. Bed was very comfortable.Breakfast was simple, but served by cheerful staff who really started off my day on the right foot. Coffee was REALLY good! Thanks guys!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Although I cancelled my March 20-22 stay a week in advance due to the Covid 19 outbreak, the hotel said they could only issue me a credit. I asked to speak to management and then was told that instead of a credit, they would refund the $471.27 I had paid in advance (in order to have a cheaper rate). I have still received no refund and I can not get this hotel to respond to me.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Lovely hotel with friendly staff. We had a corner room and the views were amazing. I’m so happy we stayed at this hotel. The location is amazing. When looking for hotels in New York there is obviously so many to choose from but I couldn’t be happier that we stayed at Millenium Premier

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here for 4 nights after a disasterous air bnb experience. They were able to accomodate us at short notice and Monique was particularly attentive to us on our family visit. We had an excellent stay here.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Every staff member we encountered was super-friendly. Room was very very clean. The location was fantastic, just off Times Square...walk to so many tourist attractions! There's no ice machine, so if you want ice, have to call housekeeping and they bring it up to your room. The free breakfast was just a continental/cold breakfast (nothing to write home about) with fruit, cereal, pastries, coffee. There was also free evening reception with wine, cheese and crackers. The only down side to our visit was the time of year it was unseasonably warm and the air conditioning had not been activated yet so the room was too hot. They only solved it by opening our window, but then you heard lots of street noise.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I absolutely adore Monique she was an amazing host I know I’m only allowed to rate 5 stars but if I could rate more I would she was very kind, patient, and very accommodating she gave me everything that I asked for in my booking I strongly recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a breathtaking stay at this hotel shot out to Monique my new hotel buddy. Thanks for gracing us with her presence.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: First off this hotel is centrally located to everything. The service here is incredible. Didn't even take 5 steps in before this beautiful smiling face was greeting us. If your lucky enough to meet Monique at the front desk then your on the right path. She is so helpful and extremely pleasant to talk to. I wish all hotels had someone like her because she has been a breath of fresh air in this large city.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The Millenium Premier Hotel in Times Square was absolutely perfect for our stay. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful (especially Monique and Veronica) and daily we enjoyed our banter with them. Our room was clean, spacious and had a good view of Times Square. Our stay included free breakfast daily (fresh fruit, yogurt, hard boiled eggs, bagels, cereal, pastries, ect.) and the evening wine and appies, everything was always fresh and the dining setting was nice on the top floor with large windows. I would highly recommended this hotel and wouldn’t hesitate booking here again. From the staff and service to the room and location, everything went above and beyond my expectations!(Photos are view from dining area, literally steps away from Times Square)

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We checked in late in the night for a four day stay and got a room with no good views. We were disappointed and checked back with front desk. They were very helpful and asked us to check back the next day if any rooms get free. The next day we checked with Monique and she was very friendly and helpful and got us a room with stunning views of Times Square and made our trip great. Also liked the reception every evening. Only thing needs improvement is the room service staff. I've noticed the room service staff was lil rude and unfriendly when doing a late checkout, even though I have talked to front desk about it.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Monique who greeted us multi tasked to insure a timely Check in and was helpful in accommodating specific requests to a high maintenance traveler.The location of the hotel is ideal for out of town travelers or New Yorkers simply wanting a night in the theatre district after a show.
user_name:
shimon B
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: What can I say , the minute we walked through the doors , we got a warm welcome. The hotel was clean , rooms were spacious, very friendly staff . The breakfast was a great way to start off our busy day and the wine went down nicely in the evening too . Great location to everything, highly recommend millennium premiere

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Good hotel, very clean and good location near times square. It's absolutely recommended! The receptionist Monique is very friendly and helpful. Das Hotel ist sehr sauber und empfehlenswert. Es ist es sehr nah am times square und der Metro Station.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Overall good experienceWe were located in the 16th floor and had a pretty good view of the illuminated boards on the corner of 7th AvenueRoom very quiet, comfy bed and plenty of spaceBreakfast was typical continental; enough for us and the additional bonus of the free wine and nibbles in the afternoonLocation is excellent, just off 7th Avenue surrounded by central Times Square Only Criticism was the lack of information provided at check in that an additional fee is taken to cover “anything ordered to the room” which in our case was over £120. This needs to be made apparent at the time of booking

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: First off, let me tell you about my girl Monique. My husband and I arrived at the hotel at 1 in the morning after a very long day of travel. Monique checked us in right away, was exceptionally kind, and extremely knowledgeable. Need to know a great place for breakfast? She can tell you that. Need to know if it's rude to call people ma'am in New York? She'll tell you that too. (We're from Louisiana and call everyone ma'am.) After checking in, we headed up to our room. Our view was exceptional, and the location of the hotel was perfect for every touristy thing we wanted to do. The hotel was extremely clean, and the free wine wasn't bad either! This could not have been a better experience.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I love the hotel and the room... but a very special thank you to Monique for going out of the way and ensuring a super smooth check in and the warmest welcome :)I can in early and the reservations were not in place... she helped me get a room to rest till my room got ready....Keep it up guys :)

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed for 4 nights 14th February. Wow.. what a fantastic hotel. From arrival to check out, the staff could not have done enough for us. After a long journey we were welcomed by Monique.. a very warm welcome it was to. We checked in despite being early and went to our room. Monique even called us after a short time to check we were happy with it. The room itself was spacious and spotlessly clean. Floor to ceiling windows meant we had a fabulous view over to Times Square. It’s very secure, you need a room key to get to any of the floors in the lift, brilliant idea. Breakfast was complimentary each morning. Wonderful selection of bagels, cereals, bread, cheese & cold meats and pastries. We could not fault it at all. The coffee in the machine tasted great and was available in abundance along with teas, water and fruit juice. Great start to the day. There was also complimentary drinks in the evening however we just didn’t get back in time to sample these. The location was great, easy to get to tube stations, either end of the street virtually and a lot of the attractions of the city in a walkable distance. We honestly could not have improved on this hotel in the slightest and I would recommend staying here 100%. Special thanks to Monique, you really were the star for us and you are a credit to this hotel. It does have a smaller but very friendly atmosphere here. By far the best hotel I have visited in a long time, in fact i would go as far as to say ever! We will be back on our next visit to the city!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Hi there, My wife and I would just like to say!!Our first time visiting NYC from the UK was made so comfortable and stress free. What a wonderful & fantastic stay we had at the Millennium Premiere Times Square. Firstly the concierge, the wonderful Monique went above and beyond to help us with our early arrival to the hotel. She has such a lovely manner and wanted to help us in every way.Real first class customer care!!The rooms were large with fantastic views..and cleaned daily with all towels changed as well daily. Breakfast,Continental style was fresh and inviting. A great start to the day..The hotel gives there client's from 17.30- 19.30 every evening free wine and nibbles. A fantastic extra included in the price of your room. Pre drinks before you have a wonderful evening just a stone's throw from Time Square.Great service throughout the whole establishment from the Luggage Porters to the food service waiters. Well done you guys. Keep up the good work!!Leigh & Louise Shulman

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: A great botique hotel close to Times Square.Frequent trips to NYC to visit my office in the Times Square area; incredible number of hotels to choose from in the city. BUT the number one reason I return to the Premier (which is not the millenium) is the desk staff. Viviana could not be more professional, and is a real delight for a frequent traveler. She is sharp, attentive, thoughtful, prepared, friendly and simply the reason I return time after time. Management should be congratulated to have such personnel representing their hotel.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We had a great stay. Our rate included breakfast and - a welcome surprise - wine and snacks each evening. The room: very comfy, 8th floor, spacious (loved the sofa) and spotlessly clean. Bathroom had bath and separate shower. Good, solid door to bathroom too. WiFi signal great. Shout outs to Monique on the front desk and Doretta who keeps the rooms looking so good. Hotel location is fab of course. At night you may need to enter through the confusingly named Millennium Broadway/Millennium Times Square on the other side of the theatre.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We really loved our stay at the Millennium Premier Hotel for our anniversary and 2020 Valentines Day! Location, Amenities, VIP Rooms, service, etc. was "top notch." What truly made the stay even more memorable was the hotel's incredible Concierge/Manager (Monique M.). She went out of her way to make sure our stay and overall stay/accommodations were outstading. From a complementary bottle of wine with chocolates and a suite that was truly amazing..., she was the best!!!! Truly recommend this location (ask for Monique). Paul & Judy (California)

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Great hotel for location just off Times Square. Hotel is clean and staff nice and friendly. We got upgraded for happy hour each evening on the mezz level when we arrived free wine and nibles.Breakfast is a continental each morning which was given to us also for free amazing hotel just what's needed in New York.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Perfect stay in New York Good hôtel close to everything Room big enought and cleanGood breakfastWarm welcome from front deskIn particular Monique Nothing to add keep il like that Sûre i will Come backLuc

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel is an a perfect spot. Less than a block from Times Square, it was so fast and east to get to the action, but, when you wanted to get away from it, the hotel was so quiet and calm. The staff was great, especially our concierge Monique. We cannot wait to go back.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Staff Greets guests with pleasure, in timely fashion They got us checked in as soon as the room was available! We didn’t wait long before we got our room!Huge shout out to Moni, treated us as if we we’re family visiting Hotel has great accommodations! Very quiet rooms which are very peaceful!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Very quaint, excellent location, super friendly staff, and clean hotel rooms. ;) We SO appreciated the complimentary early check in,(thank you Viviana Cespedes!) we had arrived early and this was just what we needed. Breakfast was great, the beds were comfortable, our only complaint was that we weren't able to control the temperature in our room. - It was fixed at 72 degrees, which for us MN's was too warm to sleep well. Loved the location, walking distance to almost everything. Quiet, small, loved it.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Good value for the money. Not extraordinary/premier but offers a range of services that are adequate. Narrow lobby with no sitting space. The hotel offers continental breakfast (ordinary). One attraction is the wine time at around 5:30 pm. Would have liked them to offer tasty bites. The location is great and at the heart of Times Square. The room is spacious for New York. Clean bathroom with adequate service.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed for just one night. Four rooms booked. Unfortunately all four rooms were found to be very dingy. It’s a bad word but it’s the best descriptor I can find. The carpets had stains. The curtains didn’t hook right. The bathroom was dated—- clean though. However the shower Fossett was loose. You had to bang on the plug in order to get the water to come out of the top Spicket. It was fine fir a place to sleep and spend no time in. The front desk staff was quick and accommodating for both check in and check out. The main lobby was very clean. The doorman was incredibly friendly and personable. The elevators were quick clean and the main hallways were definitely clean and no issues whatsoever.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I stayed at the hotel for a week long business trip. The hotel is a small and the staff was very friendly. They knew me by name after the second day. They were very accommodating to my needs and went above and beyond.The room was comfortable, clean and with a good view.I will be coming back!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I loved my stay at the Millennium Premier! The staff is so welcoming and helpful. They provide exceptional service and cater to your needs. The hotel is in a great location and the rooms are very spacious. I will definitely stay here on my next trip!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This is my 5th time staying at the Millennium Premier NY Times Square(133 W 44th St, New York City, NY 10036). Aside from the location, view and proximity to Times Square, the staff go above and beyond to ensure great service and a wonderful experience. Monique and Viviana take great care of us every time we visit, advising us on things to do, places to eat and the best hangout spots in Times Square. Its always a pleasure to come back and see friendly faces that remember you and add a personal touch to the trip! I would recommened anyone to stay at the Millennium Premier. Staying at a boutique location allows you to step away from the busyness of Time Square and feel like your at home. Leon

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We usually stay near Central Park, but needed easy access for a quick weekend trip to the city and a Broadway show. This hotel was an excellent choice, centrally located, very quiet, clean, and a great simple breakfast. They even had almond milk on request for a lactose intolerant diet. The rooms were the largest we've ever had in the city, with a sitting room and enormous bathroom. Best of all, the price was very reasonable, probably one of the most affordable weekend stays we've experienced in many years.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The staff is extremely polite and extremely courteous if it wasn’t for the staff particularly Monique Viviana & Hector, I would not stay at this hotel. I’ve been staying at this hotel for over 20 years.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The folks at the front desk were friendly and hospitable. The Rooms were old but clean. this property was close to where i needed to be and a short walk to times square. I'd stay here again. Continental breakfast was limited but was nice.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Just stayed at this hotel fantastic.location brilliant breakfast very good.5.30 til 7.30 on mezzanine level free wine and nibbles good touch before you go out.Viviana and Monique on front desk were fantastic nothing to much trouble for them we needed hairdryer fixing someone was up in 5 minutes and it was not even broken.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I love the location, and the rooms are very nice. The staff from the moment our cab arrived were perfectly attentive greeting us and being helpful. I would like to call your attention to the two women working the check in desk. Their names are Monique and Violana. Our stay was for two days and we had a lot of interaction with them as we came and went. They were lovely to chat with and we look forward to seeing them again in February when we plan to return. I worked in the hospitality industry in Boston for years and I know how important the front of the house is to guests. The Millenniun Premier can rest assured you have that covered. Also, the complimentary breakfast is a nice touch and appreciated. (Great staff there too)Any more questions I would be happy to answer by email... danjforr@gmail.comWe shall see you again in February,Sincerely, Daniel J Forrester.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Would definitely return, staff were very accommodating, and pleasant. Room was spacious. coffee maker, and water in room.. access to happy hour.. with snacks and alcohol.. coffee available all day with espresso machine

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Monica and Viviane were truly amazing - they gave us an upgrade for our engagement which made it so special. The room was spectacular and the service was impeccable.We are frequent flyers to New York and there ain’t no way in hell we would stay anywhere else.Never seen such friendly faces, thank you.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This is a small hotel with only 6 or 7 rooms per floor, so it's fairly quiet. It's next door to the larger Millennium which has the restaurant, bustling lobby, and other amenities. You can walk from one to the other through the lobby of the theater in between them. Room was fine, although it needed a better cleaning. There were some stains on the carpet and some marks on the walls and ceiling. There was a shampoo bottle under the bed and several packets of coffee on the floor behind the coffee station which is just poor inspection and quality control. Layout and size of the room was nice with a very modern bathroom with a tub and a separate (and small) shower. Desk staff was friendly and the breakfast and happy hour were both good. Biggest annoyance was trying to get ice. There are no ice machines so you have to call housekeeping. First time I called I still didn't have ice after an hour so went to the desk and they called again and it came pretty quickly. The second time it wasn't as long.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Since over 10 years, I am coming to The Premier Hotel in New York. Prices are reasonable, rooms have a good size, service is excellent, certainly the lady at the reception called Monique can sometimes do wonders!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We were looking for a reasonable hotel near to the Radio City venue in NYC. The Millennium Premiere fit the bill The rates were reasonable (for NYC standards) and conveniently located in mid town Manhattan. The room was clean and spacious. It wS quiet and had the necessary amenities. I would go there again.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I have been coming back at the premier for more than 10years Always a great experience Great staff Great complementary breakfast Great concierge Monique is a gem and will do her best to accomodate your request Do i recommend Yes but should not say that too loud to the risk of being sold out during my next year trip Go premier Go

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This is an update to a previous review, "Don't Go Chasing Waterfalls..." I was finally able to prepay, thanks to Arelene. She was professional, knowledgeable, and friendly. To date, no one has apologized or addressed the issue I experienced trying to prepay, or the two employees who hung up on me during this process.Check-in was fine, with the help of Sue Ellen. Everyone we encountered was professional, friendly and helpful. The rooms were definitely dated, but they were clean, and spacious. The bathroom was also roomy. The shower pressure and drainage were great and the water was nice and hot.There is a restaurant and gift shop on-site. Additionally, there is a barbecue restaurant and deli directly across the street. The hotel is approximately a five-minute walk to Times Square, with major clothing chains, and pharmacies. It is less than a 10-minute walk from Broadway and the theatres.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel is a hidden gem..Just minutes from Times Square it is clean, quiet, provides all the amenities including a buffet breakfast. The staff were so friendly and are happy to recommend places to go and eat around New York. We will be back!!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I’ve always tried to steer away from staying so close to the hub of Times Square and have opted for a more laid back vibe when visiting the city. This time I thought I’d try something new and boy was I surprised. The convenience and excitement of staying near Times Square made our trip more fun. This hotel was super nice and very clean. The room was very spacious and it was nice to have a view as well. Nearby Irish pubs and Italian restaurants made grabbing a bite super easy. The only negative I would say was that the window’s exterior was super grimy making our view pretty hazy.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Me, the wife and 2 friends stayed here for 3 night. We were all happy with this hotel. It was clean, staff were friendly and the breakfast buffet was a great start to the day. The location was perfect. It was 5 minutes walk to time square. And a nice Irish bar opposite the hotel. I would definitely stay here again. It was about 45 minute drive from JFK airport.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I don’t even know, where to start. I found this hotel terrible and I really don’t know, how it could get such good reviews. I’m still quite shocked by what is considered a four star hotel. We stayed for 5 nights. We traveled with a 10 months old baby and contacted the stuff few days before our arrival, letting them know we need a crib.We arrived late and unfortunately, the baby crib was not prepared in our room. Also, we probably got the loudest room in the hotel, they probably thought we can take it, as we have a baby anyway. After a sleepless night, with the noise of a generator or whatever it was right outside our window, we asked for another room and got one without problems. The rooms though, other than in the pics, are old and worn out. The furniture was partly falling apart. There are stains on the carpet. All over it completely looks like it could be taken out and thrown away. It could be cleaner, there was hair and dust in the bath tub, so I had to clean it before having a bath. Once they completely forgot to leave the big towels for us after so called cleaning. But I had to unpack a new soap three times during our stay, because it was taken away. Probably a try to make up for whatever. What a waste! Apropos, waste. What on earth is going on with all the plastic here? Why is it so hard to just have normal cups for coffee in the rooms and spoons or wooden sticks instead of all the plastic crap? I thought only motels do this nowadays?! This made me feel really bad every day. Also, there are no refrigerators in the rooms!! I couldn’t believe it! Again, we talk about a four star hotel. We asked for one to keep the baby food fresh. We asked three times, three different people and until our departure we didn’t get one or were informed about why. Oh and don’t get me started about the breakfast. It’s very limited and always the same. The breakfast room is way too small! Nice thing though there are the complimentary wine and finger food at 5pm.Also, be careful, because in addition to the price you paid, let’s say, on a booking site, the hotel will force you to pay additional 35 dollars a day so called facility fee. That’s criminal, if you ask me. The only good thing about this hotel is the location. And the stuff seems not really interested in the guests. We are definitely not going to stay here I don’t even know, where to start. I found this hotel terrible and I really don’t know, how it could get such good reviews. I’m still quite shocked by what is considered a four star hotel. We stayed for 5 nights. We traveled with a 10 months old baby and contacted the stuff few days before our arrival, letting them know we need a crib.We arrived late and unfortunately, the baby crib was not prepared in our room. Also, we probably got the loudest room in the hotel, they probably thought we can take it, as we have a baby anyway. After a sleepless night, with the noise of a generator or whatever it was right outside our window, we asked for another room and got one without problems. The rooms though, other than in the pics, are old and worn out. The furniture was partly falling apart. There are stains on the carpet. All over it completely looks like it could be taken out and thrown away. It could be cleaner, there was hair and dust in the bath tub, so I had to clean it before having a bath. Once they completely forgot to leave the big towels for us after so called cleaning. But I had to unpack a new soap three times during our stay, because it was taken away. Probably a try to make up for whatever. What a waste! Apropos, waste. What on earth is going on with all the plastic here? Why is it so hard to just have normal cups for coffee in the rooms and spoons or wooden sticks instead of all the plastic crap? I thought only motels do this nowadays?! This made me feel really bad every day. Also, there are no refrigerators in the rooms!! I couldn’t believe it! Again, we talk about a four star hotel. We asked for one to keep the baby food fresh. We asked three times, three different people and until our departure we didn’t get one or were informed about why. Oh and don’t get me started about the breakfast. It’s very limited and always the same. The breakfast room is way too small! Nice thing though there are the complimentary wine and finger food at 5pm.Also, be careful, because in addition to the price you paid, let’s say, on a booking site, the hotel will force you to pay additional 35 dollars a day so called facility fee. That’s criminal, if you ask me. The only good thing about this hotel is the location. And the stuff seems not really interested in the guests. We are definitely not going to stay here again. Absolutely not worth 200 dollar the night!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Super nice stay. Employees were all super but Monique was great. Thanks for making our stay that super. I was already 3 times in NYC, always another hotel but next time I know where I will come :) And another really cool one in this hotel is the apero time each evening - 5.30 to 7.30, super.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed at the hotel from 20th - 27th October and had 2 rooms. 2 Items (Designer Bags) went missing out of one of the rooms. We reported it to the reception and security visited the room took statements said they would get back to us. On the morning of check out 27th we had to ask what was happening as no one had said anything. Security visited again said the staff member they required to speak to was off and someone would get back to us within 48 hours. They allowed us one room until 16:30 the time we were being collected to go to the airport. Seven emails and 16 days later a security person emailed saying. We interviewed the member of staff they never saw or touched anything. "nothing had been handed into the lost property but they would keep checking to see if it was". I answered back "If you expect something to have been handed in then or in the future you should work in Disneyland you tell fantastic stories".I will await their reply and am prepared to copy the email exchanges.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We booked 3 rooms, the hotel accommodated us together on floor 16, two rooms facing the back of the hotel and one looking right over a Times Square where The ball drops at new year. The rooms were clean, well appointed and comfortable, we slept very well with no noise disturbance despite being in a very busy area. We also got an excellent buffet breakfast every day, and Happy Hour with free wine and nibbles every evening- all you could ask for. I would stay here again.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I have stayed at the Premiere and the Millennium next door many times over the years. It’s my go-to hotel in NYC. Usually I like it very much, but this trip made me question my judgement. Bottom line, the check in staff was surly and unhelpful. We arrived at 3pm and were informed that checkin time was 4pm and that we would have to wait. No rooms were purportedly available. Then at 3:45pm a different person came and we checked in no problem, except that we were given a room on the 4th floor. I have never had a room this low in this hotel. If I had, I never would have returned. There is constant street noise at this level, primarily the beeps of backing up trucks— at all hours of the day and night. DON’T EVER ACCEPT A ROOM BELOW THE 8th Floor in this hotel or you will not get much rest. The complimentary breakfast is excellent and afternoon snacks and wine are good. The rooms are nicely designed though lacking basic amenities like electric outlets on both sides of the bed. The paint needs a touch up, the carpet some patching, and the down-lights proper installation (so they don’t dangle out of the fixture).The crowning blow on this stay was the absence of a bellman to return checked luggage upon our eventual departure. It took 20 minutes for someone to come return luggage to the 10 people who had queued up at the luggage room door. Managers came, radioed, and called, but no one solved the problem for an very long time.Net, the aspirations of this hotel are largely unfulfilled at this time.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We only had a one night stop over from visiting Las Vegas, and Orlando and had two days to look around. it was confusing on finding the hotel as it is to the side of the Millenium Hotel and a theatre in between the two hotels.! Apparently the Millenium is owned by the Hilton chain but the Premier isnt! Yet both hotels have the same owner, so work that one out!The Premier has a small reception area and meze floor where the very small ( too small) sort of eatery is. You cant say restaurant because it isnt!. You have a free for all to sit on a few seats and sofas for a small continental complimentary breakfast! Lucky if you can get a seat or want a leisurely breakfast, that wont happen.One good thing is they offer you free canapes, wine or soft drinks there between 5.30 and 7.30pm,A nice little treat.The bedrooms are quite small but ok for a one night stay, but we couldnt have enjoyed it for more than that! The bed was great though and very comfortable. I have to say though what with the rooms loud air conditioning unit and the massive air conditioning on other buildings units ( and we were on the 20th floor) kept us awake all night even when i turned off the rooms air conditioning..A nice and helpful Concierge on arrival.Would we stay again, no and it being in a very hectic part of NYC Times square. We would stay at the Conrad again over by the Hudson river. Much calmer.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: My husband and I travelled to NYC for our anniversary and booked the Millennium Premier for the first time. We were warmly welcomed by Monique and the concierge team. Throughout our stay all of our needs were tended to and we received and incredible room upgrade- which made our trip unforgettable! The rooms are older but they are nicely furnished, very clean and the beds are comfortable. Views are amazing. We truly felt we were coming home to our own condo at the end of each day in the city-! It is truly an exceptional property. The continental breakfast was a lovely bonus that we enjoyed-! Thank you to the Millennium Premier and a special thank you to Monique for your professionalism, exceptional customer service, humour and thoughtfulness! We will definitely be back! Thank you so much for such a wonderful stay!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The Manhattan Premier hotel was like our home away from home. Only just down the road from Broadway and Times Square. From the moment we arrived until our departure the next day we were warmly accommodated. Not just in luxurious bedding but a scintillating conversation with Hector about South Africa Rugby...one week before we became the world champions. After we lifted the trophy we hoped that Hector was among our friends around the world who were watching. Such was the level of familiarity we developed in our short exchange. And then Monique. Our fixer. She took care of us with a personal touch. Even encouraging me to sleep in, while my colleague shopped. We didn't really feel like guests. More like distant family who hadn't seen each other in a while. Such personable attention to care is not all that common. We stumbled upon it in Manhattan. And as often as we are privileged to return to NYC, the Premier will be hour home for the duration of our stay. With our friends, Hector and Monique who made the trip memorable. Hope to see you soon!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: My son and I stayed here during the 2019 labor day weekend. The room were clean. staff very professional and friendly. The check in and out was so easy. The parking are to this hotel is about half a block away so you take it to the garage that you can see from the entrance door and leave it there until you need it and all you have to do is take the hotel ticket to get your discount. There are a few places to eat as soon as you step out. I will stay here again soon.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: the rooms if you can get a king size ok, but we had a queen size and had to change.the lights are a strange thing, all rooms no light in the so called sitting, when you shut them all go out...a lot missing anyhow in both rooms....a/c leave you without voice so had to shut it off...well the breakfast room too small for the number of persons so people eating standing, or on the couch, coffee machine always ran out of coffee. check in and out fine, fast and good.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel is home in nyc, monique the concierge is the very best asset to the hotel. The services are wonderful. The premier side has complimentary breakfast and cocktail recetion which is lovely cofee and tea plus cold water all day available. I always say if the hotel is sold out i reschedule my trip so i can stay here!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I booked a holiday package through British Airways and, after reading reviews, I changed my original booking from the Millennium Broadway to the Millennium Premier Times Square and was so glad I did. It’s a smaller hotel for NYC and was ideal for a solo traveller. I arrived before checking in time and the room wasn’t ready, but was checked in and given a free upgrade - huge suite with amazing floor to ceiling windows (I could see the Times Square NYE ball from the corner window!)Location is perfect for a UK tourist - Times Square is just around the corner. The subway is minutes away. Breakfast was included which was plentiful and also allowed me to grab a coffee and muffin for the morning I had to be up and out early. The evening wine hour(s) with snacks is also well received in between sightseeing and an evening out on the town. The waiting staff are friendly and helpful - Dixon in particular was a real diamond mornings and evenings.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I have been to New York many times for work, but I have never done the "touristy" trip before. My daughter and I planned a trip, to NYC for her 21st birthday. We stayed at the Millennium Premiere, and checking into the hotel was the beginning of our trip. Monique was the concierge on duty and she was absolutely awesome. She helped commemorate my daughter's birthday and made her feel special. Monique was a 'wonder woman': she had a lobby full of people checking in, she was also helping check people out, store luggage, answer questions, provide directions...you name it. I am a multi-tasker, but she was doing a ton of things at once, and still providing great customer service to everyone. Checking into the hotel was not the focus of our trip, however, it was a great start to what turned out to be a fabulous weekend. Thanks Monique, for going above and beyond for my daughter!! You do a great job and I would stay at your hotel again!!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Stop searching for a hotel! This hotel was perfect. The front desk agent Monique M. was friendly and assisted us promptly. She took care of all our needs and even recommended places for us to visit. The room was spacious and I loved soaking in our tub, after a day of walking the city. The hotel had a nice and relaxing ambiance, with a pretty scent in the lobby and calming music. It gave us a chance to fully relax after a busy day outings.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We chose this hotel with using hundreds of thousands of VISA points. The total cost for the 8 day stay was over $3000. For that much expense we expected better accommodations. Two days into our stay the HVAC died, To be fair they did move us to a new and slightly larger room so they tried to make that right. Two days later the toilet handle fell apart. They did take care of that while we were out that day sightseeing. So they were responsive. The sad thing was that it was literally falling off when we first moved to the room. It had to be seen by housekeeping for a long time, yet nothing got done until a guest complained. The complimentary "breakfast" was like something out of "Shark Week" on the Discovery Channel. Everything ran out in minutes and it was such an awful experience we just gave up and went to the NY Times Deli across the street (the best in the City per one of our tour guides during the week-and we agree) The Millennium "Premier" seemed to be an old hotel the Millennium Hotel (connected on the other side of a Theater in between the two) bought to add capacity. The two Hotels are worlds apart. The Lobby of the Millennium was luxurious, the "Premier"? (not so premier). There isn't even anywhere to get ice for your room without having someone bring it to you (at a cost). They have to run over to the Millennium to get the ice. It just seemed like a "budget" hotel to us compared to so many others. The only good thing about this hotel is its location. I'm sure that's what you pay for as it literally is one short block from Times Square (we could see the New Years "Ball" from our window) and two blocks from all the Theaters in the Theater District. After a week in NYC we saw what we set out to do. Our recommendation, choose another hotel and the "free" breakfast isn't worth it so don't make that a criteria.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: My wife and I stayed for 8 nights at the Millennium Premier hotel and loved our stay. The continental breakfast and Happy Hour were very good and certainly saved us money by not having to buy breakfast and in some cases dinner :). Our room was spacious with chair and coach and we were upgraded to a king bed at no charge. What was especially nice was the service we received from Monique. She was extremely helpful and provided good advice on subway, restaurants, etc. Monique was very personable and was very genuine in providing assistance or simply making conversation.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Could not have asked for a better location, felt like we were steps away from everything!!! The Hotel exceeded my expectations the customer service was exceptional we came in on the red eye from Vancouver and were able to check in early even got breakfast in.Monique at concierge was amazing "it's the little details that make all the difference"

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Don’t be like us and ignore the bad reviews in hopes you’re getting a great deal on a luxury accommodation near Times Square. Day 1 we check in and notice our carpet is damp. We went about our day and later that evening it was still squishy and wet. I called the front and a man from housekeeping came up and asked “can’t you just wear your slippers”? Appalled we nodded and went on. The next morning we decided to bathe. The water that came out of the faucet was YELLOW. We did attempt this again the next day and still YELLOW water. Disgusting. Also, stopper didn’t work so you had to shove a wash cloth in the drain. The weather was chilly (High 50s-60s). Our room was set on AC and the front desk told us it was NYC law that heat couldn’t be turned on until November. Still unsure if that’s true or not. We attempted the “free breakfast” ha! I shouldn’t have expected anything less than what was available (toast, fruit, coffee, etc with no hot breakfast options). No room service available (dining). Housekeeping was not good. I would never stay here again nor recommend this establishment to anyone I know. The only thing going for this place is location (if you like times square). BEWARE!! Don’t be a cheap ass like us and stay here when you could stay much nicer with accommodations elsewhere!!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The Millennium Premier is situated right beside its cheaper sister, the Millennium Times Square. The Premier appears to offer a slightly more intimate experience, with seated check-in. I had booked this hotel as the rate offered through an online travel agency was good value compared to similar 4-star hotels in the vicinity. First impressions were positive - nice cool quiet lobby, seated check in and friendly staff. Despite my 11.30 am arrival, I was quickly checked in, but not before being informed that I was liable for a further USD 34 "facility fee" which included cocktail hour, continental breakfast and Wi-Fi. This practice is a new and unfortunate way for hotels to charge customers extra while avoiding adding to the room rate. My fault for not having read the fine print, however, in this day and age when ALL hotels offer free WiFi, to say that it's covered by the facility fee is simply disingenuous. Further, in a city like New York with its plentiful dining options, charging guests for breakfast is simply a way of forcing customers to pay for a service which otherwise would not be required.I arrived at my room (721) to be greeted by a strong body odour which is common to Indian people. Air-conditioning was noisy and rattling, but I chose to ignore this as the hotel is clearly quite old, as evidenced by the retro fitting of the bathroom and the bedroom furniture and fittings. To be fair, the room (an entry-level "Premier Queen") was very spacious, with a 2 seater sofa beside the floor-to-ceiling windows and a queen-sized bed. Wifi was free and fast. I rang the Operator to ask a few questions and was addressed as "buddy", which I felt to be overly casual and inappropriate. On another occasion, one of the female recepionists was chewing gum openly when on duty - again, I wonder about the training and professional standards. The hotel's location very near Times Square is probably a bonus for most tourists, but I tried to avoid the sensory overload and crowds as much as possible. The continental breakfast "included" in the above-mentioned facility fee was acceptable in terms of variety and quality, if one could find a seat. The facility comprised several sofas groupted around low coffee tables, and several high-top tables and chairs. The seating capacity was clearly inadequate, judging by the queue of guests waiting for seats. For the price paid, I cannot complaint about the value, but I would not return to this property until a refurbishment has taken place.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed in September 2019 for 6 nights in this hotel.The location is very very great just next to Times Square. We couldn't chose a better location.Rooms are spacious which is great for NYC. We had a bath and a shower. Staff is very nice and helpful ! Room was cleaned every day.Breakfast is all you need to start the day and it is very great that it was included in the price.In fact, the price was very attractive compared to other hotels in the same area.The view on one part of Times Square was also very nice to have!We will come back for sure!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Millennium Premier, West 44th Street, is my go-to hotel in Manhattan. Small, boutique style, secure place particularly nice for women traveling alone. I feel at home . The staff is very accommodating..., with big smiles always happy to see me, greet me kindly, They are the best! I love the staff, especially Monique, the Concierge. She and I have developed a friendship, over the years.Mohamad and Acharaf, manning the lounge, are also special to me. During my recent stay, I met both the Manager and Asst manager. I was impressed they took the time to meet me, and they seemed genuinely interested in my suggestions for improvements. Le Premier is perfectly situated, GCS nearby. Other amenities I enjoy....comfy beds and linens, breakfast and cocktail hour. GO! One can’t help but LOVE Le Premier!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I felt compelled to point out that Acharaf, the waiter for happy hour is about the most perfect waiter the city has to offer. He generous, helpful, kind, and always aiming to please. He alone made nt trip worth the cost of admission. I had difficulties with getting the correct room, but with him employed, he made me bit care and have a great time. Hes a gem and I hope hes well taken care of for how great he is.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel is in a great location, just steps from Times Square but still quiet and safe. The bed was very comfortable, and our room was a good size; however, it is getting a little worn and in need of a make-over. Breakfast was adequate but does not offer any hot dishes. There is a happy hour daily from 5-7 pm which offers appies and a selection of wine. Our only objection is the "Facility Fee" of $30 USD + tax that was added to our bill for the advertised "free wifi, free breakfast, free gym/business centre." The "facility fee" was never mentioned at check-in, and the bill was slipped under our door on our last night. When did hotels in NYC start charging this ludicrous fee on top of already extravagantly high accommodation charge? Feels exactly like a Las Vegas rip-off!!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel is in an excellent location. The staff are friendly but we're unable to provide a small refrigerator for my mother's medication. The also would not refrigerate it for her. The did take the freezer backs we brought but she was unable to retrieve them one night when both the porter and resteraunt manager were very ride and dismissive.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Really wanted to give this Hotel a good review after reading some average ones before we left.We booked and paid for our room for 5 nights months before we travelled to NYC. Most people mentioned the rooms were tired and they are. Bathroom grout was mouldy, despite booking well in advance our tiny room had a view into another office building / apartments. A fridge would have been awesome it was 40 degrees Celsius over 100 degrees Fahrenheit when we were there and we couldn't even keep water cold. Our shower bay filled up with water on our firs night so could only have short showers to prevent the bathroom flooding.Staff were generally Ok but not amazing. For instance when I asked why we had been charged $256 / $50 / night on top of a room that was fully paid for a "facility" charge we were told was for the breakfast and the wine tasting. The breakfast we thought was part of the room cost. We weren't told about the wine tasting when we booked in but apparently we were told according o the receptionist despite the fact that she didn't check us in three days before.The hotel is OK but we wouldn't recommend it to any of our friends and family nor would we stay again unless rooms were upgraded.On a positive note the breakfast was good and breakfast staff were attentive. TV channels and streaming TV was handy too. The position of this hotel is brilliant. great restaurants and bars as well as Times square only steps away which was awesome.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Spacious,clean, comfortable bed. Half a block from the center of Times Square many places to eat and great Irish pubs Right in the center of the theater district you can get discounts for plays right there at Tks
user_name:
Ellen B
Central Islip, New York

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Staff is very helpful and nice, room are spacious but very outdated and old.Not renovated and unacceptable conditions.No mini bar and door didn't auto lock to the room.Overall experience is fine but needs some renovations

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We had two rooms for 4 nights. We were able to check in early which was wonderful! Our room was a little larger than our teenage children's, which was across the hall. They had a view of Times Square, but we did not. We had a little sitting area with 2 chairs and they had one chair in their room. Beds and pillows were comfortable. Stand up shower and a large tub in the bathroom. The bathroom was larger than I was expecting. Breakfast each morning with cereal, bread, bagels, pastries, fruit, and yogurt. In the evening were free drinks (wine, soda, etc.) and appetizers. The location was just down the street from Times Square. There was a deli and also a few restaurants directly across from the hotel. After reading a few reviews prior to our stay I was a little worried, but we were very happy with our choice of the hotel!! Everyone who worked there was quite friendly and helpful. We would stay here again!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed for 6 nights. First time in NYC. I love that there are about 6 rooms per floor. The bed was comfortable and we had lots of pillows, which I like. Our room was a nice size. The complimentary continental breakfast and happy hour were very generous and classy. The breakfast and happy hour wait staff were friendly and kept food and drink coming. We got a room on the 16th floor with a city view. It was amazing. I hope to get a similar room again. Now, there are two issues that came up which could have been prevented with better management. But thankfully, they have an incredibly caring concierge, Monique, who would not stop until all was well. Issue #1: On the first two nights, there was no central air ventilation. No heat, no A/C, no fan. No nothing. It simply was not working. It was the last week of April/first week of May, so NYC was still quite cold at night. We had no heat. One of the night staff sent extra blankets, which we accepted. But I made it clear that this is not a replacement for working heat. The night person said that the hotel had recently reset the central air for the entire hotel for summer and that is why there was no heat. But if it was set for summer, then we should have gotten at least a working fan. Nothing was working with our thermostat and air control. Dead on arrival. This was a Sunday night and the night concierge told us that they had to wait until Monday to get it fixed. Uh, excuse me, but this is a 24/7 hotel with guests staying here. It doesn't matter what day of the week it is: if it's cold, the heater needs to be fixed. Other guests had also complained of no heat. Monday morning, we met Monique, the daytime concierge. We told her about the problem. She said she'd take care of it. Maintenance people DID work on the hotel's central air that day, but there was still no heat on Monday evening. We had a second night of sleeping in a bone-chilling cold room. Not comfortable.By Tuesday night, the heat was fixed. But now, there was no A/C for the warm weather. (It had gotten hot for one day.) Only heat was available. Shouldn't guests be able to adjust the thermostat to whatever temperature is needed? But finally, we had fairly adequate central air. Things were much better.We appreciated Monique staying on this and doing her best to get through the line of command to get maintenance to fix the system. I think a new central air system should be considered, or maybe just get the existing one properly fixed and adjusted so that guests can get the fan, heat, or A/C, depending on the need.Issue #2: We reserved the "New York City Break" package which included a daily $25 meal credit at the hotel restaurant, which we took advantage of on several days. When we first arrived, we were told by the night concierge to simply let the wait person at the restaurant know we have the NYC Break package and the restaurant will take the $25 off our bill. Well, the waiter said the restaurant doesn't take that off the bill. He said we need to charge the meal to our room and then when we check out, the hotel's system will know we have that NYC Break package and the $25 per day would be automatically taken off at checkout for each day there is a restaurant charge. We told the night concierge what the restaurant had told us. She apologized and said she didn't know they were doing it that way. However, at checkout, the meal credits had not been applied to our bill. Luckily, Monique was checking us out that day. She also saw that we didn't get our credits. She tried to get a code to enter into the system so that it would take give us the meal credits. It wasn't working. We had rush out to go to the airport, so we paid the bill as-is and Monique said she would get that $ refunded by the time we got to the airport. She called me in Newark airport and texted me the new copy of the bill with the reversed charges for the meal credit. We really appreciate Monique's ability to fix these issues, and she did it with such friendliness. Man, she is quick! A problem solver. These issues could have been prevented with management making sure everybody is on the same page. If you offer a meal credit on your room packages, make sure you have a process in place that everybody knows about which ensures the meal credit is actually given to the guests without us having to chase things down. And it is not too much to ask for a properly functioning air system. We paid what we consider a premium for the stay, so having a freezing room for two nights is unacceptable. I can understand one freezing night, because stuff can break down anywhere, any time. But two freezing nights is a red flag. Monique genuinely cared about this and escalated it.This hotel has all the elements to be considered excellent, but running of the daily business of serving the guests could use some tweaks and some processes in place to make sure things run more smoothly. I walked through the lobby a couple of times and heard a front desk person apologizing to a guest and discussing an issue. I think if some internal things can be fine-tuned, the complaints will be reduced. By the way, all the staff we encountered were very nice and friendly.The hotel is in a great location and it's on a fairly quiet street, a block from Times Square. Really convenient. We walked to the Richard Rodgers and Shubert theatres to see shows, walked to the Ed Sullivan Theatre to see a Stephen Colbert taping, walked to 30 Rock for various things, etc. The hotel is nice looking, upscale, quiet, and overall, we had a great time. I will book again here on my next trip. And I hope the central air will be okay. Thank you to the friendly staff, and especially Monique for all her help.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here for 3 nights. I’ve been to New York several times so had various hotel experiences. This hotel was excellent. The location was superb being right of Times Square and the comp breakfast was a great bonus. Definitely will go back.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The staff was wonderful. The breakfast and evening reception were well appointed and served by very friendly, lovely staff. The room was dissappointing. It was dated and not at all what it was advertised to be. The walls hadn't been painted in years, the wallpaper was peeling, the carpets were stained and dirty and the air-conditioner was a wide open vent in the ceiling that blew directly onto the bed all night so we were either too hot with it off or freezing cold all night. If that wasn't enough it wasn't clean - specifically the shower was filthy and glass from a wine glass that shattered by the window wasn't cleaned up properly. It stayed that way for all 3 nights of our stay. I was drawn to this hotel because of the convenience/ proximity to times square, its 4* rating and the luxury of having both a shower and a bathtub but after seeing how dirty the shower was I wouldn't even think of bathing in the tub. And thank goodness I didn't as we both contracted some type of foot fungus from the floors/shower. I'm mortified!! The bedroom closet was so close to the door that it wouldn't fully open, making it difficult to use the closet at all. We unpacked on arrival and put our clothes in the drawers, because the closet was inaccessible, but were then unable to wear them because after being in the drawers they smelled like sour milk or something rotten. I'm incredibly disappointed! This was a once in a lifetime trip for my husband and I for his 40th birthday and our first time away from our 4 children for 4 days. This was by no means an inexpensive hotel. We paid well above average, even for this area, for what was supposed to be a beautiful, modern, and luxurious hotel. I expect so much better from a hotel with this rating that charges this much.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I arrived at the Premier Inn late in the evening after a 3 hour trip from the airport. I was exhausted and looking forward to a cosy room and friendly reception. However, the male receptionist on duty was rude, abrupt and barely looked up at me. I felt like an inconvenience. And I was given a terrible room - and told "it was one of their best". I was going to stay 5 nights and at this point was very seriously thinking about changing hotels.The next morning, however, I called down to the reception and spoke to Monique. She was simply amazing. She explained all the services available and was (despite my bad mood) always smiley, helpful and informative. She quickly rectified the room situation and made me feel like a welcome guest. Just for her, I would go back again! She was simply wonderful and I strongly suggest guests ask for her if they have any issues.The breakfast staff were also attentive. The breakfast was basic but there is fresh fruit, eggs, toast, bagels and muffins. And it is nice to have something to start the day with. Overall (having stayed in New York before), my impression is that most hotels in New York appear a little musty. So given what's on the market - this hotel is OK (even if by the standards of other cities you would categorize it as more of a 3.5 star). Not to mention, it has a convenient location.But most importantly, its the people that make the stay and I would like to say thank you, once again, to Monique! My stay was made enjoyable because of you!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Its a 3.5/5I was a bit worried after reading the latest reviews. Yet we found the staff helpful and pleasant. The receptionists were happy to help, the breakfast staff were conscientious.The location - I didn’t want another times square hotel, however the deal was too good to refuse. Its Times square so as central you can get.Rooms - They need a makeover but most hotels, even the top names within times square are generally tired. New York is relentless and many central hotels get a battering. They cleaning standard at the premier does need to improve if you look closer. Free Breakfast - Hotel offers free breakfast on most booking sites at the moment. Cold and hot drinks, fresh fruit, yogurt and fresh pastries. NY rarely offers free breakfast so a perk.Evening Wine. Again currently free wine between 4-7pm. Overall comfortable room, good security, needs modernising. Would I stay again? For a very good deal yes.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Literally the most rudest hotel greeting we've ever had Charged $34 per night for breakfast & WiFi. Despite telling her I've PAID for breakfast already she proceeded to tell me I wasn't listening nor getting it in a rude manner. The she changed her mind & said it was to use the hotels gym, which we didn't want to use, specially with a knee injury! She said I had to pay it & I wasn't going to go home. We were duped into thinking this was the millenium hotel IT'S NOT. It's a bolt on the side with less friendlier staff and poor views. The breakfast was a poor selection & in a pokey small room that resembled a youth hostel with seating for about only 20 people. We then asked what the best way to get to the airport, was the subway easy to use? She said "you can do what you like" then proceeded to press play on her IPAD and watch the programme on loud she had paused.Felt like we were an inconvenience to her. Won't ever be returning to a Millenium group hotel if especially if this is how they treat and mislead they're paying guests.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We have stayed in Millennium Hotels in London (at half the price!) and whilst the position couldn't be faulted the Hotel need to be refurbished. The staff we good and the breakfast was more than adequate. Not sure we would stay her again next time we are in New York.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Why does a large hotel greet its guest with a cramped, revolving door that is too tight for a large suitcase? Added to was the robotic young lady receptionist whose main ambition was to get the introduction over as fast as possible. Not a good first impression, but it got better.The room was NY small with space for a single suitcase, with a small sofa and minimal writing desk. Large flat TV, comfortable bed, but no mini-bar. The safe was conveniently located for anyone 6-2 or taller. Comfortable bed and very clean room. Shower and bath.Pretty good continental breakfast was included, with lots of fruit, some yogurt and good bread. A happy hour is arranged every afternoon, and you can get a glass of decent wine and some snacks.A compulsory resort fee of $34 is added to your daily bill, whether you use the gym or not. It is located on floor 16 in the adjacent Millennium Hotel. Working equipment, spotlessly clean, and totally empty.Our room was prepaid, but we still got a bill for the full cost under our door the last morning. The receptionist got very angry at that mistake, yelled and tossed it aside. In the end, she did apologize, but it could have been handled more graciously.The Wi-Fi was free and fast.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I recently visited New York City to see a couple of plays that I did not want to miss. Because I have been having trouble with my knee, I wanted a hotel close to the theaters I would be attending. In past years, I had stayed at The Millennium Hotel several times and found it to be excellent in every way. Now it appears to have been divided, with the original hotel run by Hilton and the more recent “Premier” next door run by a British company. For some reason, last week all the hotels I checked on had doubled their rates, which added financial “injury” to insult. When I arrived to check in, the woman at the desk in the otherwise empty and darkened lobby (at 3:30 in the afternoon) barely looked at me as she handed me the key card. The room I had reserved was indeed large and neat. There was no bedspread, throw, blanket on the bed — just the white top sheet. The spacious desk had a pen in its plastic wrapper, but no note paper, directory of hotel information, TV listings, information about restaurants, the neighborhood, etc. — just the pen. There were lots of empty cabinets— some with their insides clearly removed (perhaps with a mini-bar or fridge at one time?). There were 2 glasses and one small bottle of hotel-branded water, and a non-branded single-cup coffee maker that I had to call housekeeping to get to function. There was no turn-down service (as one might expect in a “premier” hotel for almost $400 per night. And no room service at all. There was, on the mezzanine level, a small lounge that had cheese and crackers and wine from 5:30-6:30pm and yogurt, coffee and pastries for a few hours in the morning. So— location, location, location — but little that was premier.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Seems they aren’t maintaining things there any more - threadbare towels, no waste basket, no robes, no umbrellas, loose fixtures in the bathroom, etc. And a very unhelpful check in person. Asked to have room made up by noon but was never done after 2 more phone calls. Finally found someone vacuuming the hall and he got a maid to at least bring fresh linens. He was extremely helpful - Jose Brown. We and our friends have stayed here for years but we’ll be going elsewhere next visit.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Summary?3.9Good2,158 reviewsRooms2.5Location4.9Service3.8What guests are sayingMORE "Rooms are a bit dated but they did have good service and good food." "Great location, clean rooms, friendly staff and comfortable beds." "WIFI is to be paid separately, it is not included in the price of the room."Families3.9Couples3.9Business3.84/5 · 6,411 reviewsTripAdvisor3.9/5 · 13,528 reviewsExpedia.com4/5 · 13,105 reviewsTravelocity.com3.9/5 · 13,201 reviewsOrbitz.com7.7/10 · 3,602 reviewsBooking.com7.6/10 · 1,706 reviewsPriceline4.1/5 · 13,181 reviewsWotif.com4/5 · 13,186 reviewsEbookers.com3.9/5 · 3,970 reviewsHotels.comReviewsSearch reviewsSteve H1/5a minute ago on GoogleI cant begin to describe how incompetent this hotel staff is. My flight was cancelled from Houston I called to tell the hotel at that instant that i would be a day late. The next day I called to get an early check in and 1.5 hours later as my flight from Austin was wheels up i was told they cancelled because i failed to show. I called them twice the night of. Unfortunately I had to call 10 times and most likely more because they cant figure out the phone system. Then Lisa called to express her concern and they she wished they could make it right but i wasnt staying at the hotel so nothing she could do but if we stayed again they wanted to make it right. Well theres f the staff weren't incompetent we would be at the hotel and no one would be upset. I called her back and it took 4 calls before anyone took a note and Charles cut me off midsentence to transfer me. I think they recruit from the finest truck driving centers. My story will continue as you cant make people have to find a hotel in NY City while they are on their flight to NY city.Lisa, your offer to do something couldn't be more hollow.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I’ve stayed at the Premier before and the service never ceases to amaze me. Not only do they remember your name when you walk by the reception desk, they also help out with anything you ask. I left the plug to my iPhone charge cable at home and went to the front desk to ask where I could purchase one and Monique responded, you can use my personal one. She took plug out of her handbag and I asked what time she was leaving, she only responded “return before you leave”. That is unconditional service that is hard to find in cities like New York. It’s a hidden treasure in Times Square behind Millennium - everyone should check it out! Quite and best service one could expect

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: My Husband surprised me for my 40th Birthday, wow what a fantastic city. This hotel was great, location was brilliant for Times square and train station. Clean towels everyday, hairdryer and shower gel and shampoo and conditioner all supplied.There is a free Wine and Cheese night every night at 5-7 very good.Breakfast was continental but lovely.Would stay here again

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Nice hotel with a good location. Room was clean, quiet and adequate. Breakfast buffet was a little disappointing. Desk clerk Monique was the star of this hotel and provided us with directions to locations we wanted to visit. Since t was my birthday she worked with my daughter to have a bottle of champagne in our room. It was a good stay.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Other than the location, everything else was disappointing. The service level of the front desk has to improve significantly (especially the bad manners and attitudes of the lady staff Mon***e). I have stayed in several Millennium Group of Hotels and this is the worst in terms of service level and room cleanliness. It is really disappointing to see such standards from the Group and we will definitely not consider staying in any in the future. Not sure exactly why but some staff from the front desk seems to treat people from Asian countries very differently too. Lastly, the furnitures in the SUITE are far too old for the Millennium Group standards. From water leaking at the water basin, damaged cabinets & drawers and dirty carpets. And breakfast was sad too. Thank you for the Millennium Group for such experiences that we will always try to forget.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Hotel immediate experience checking in with Monique. Golden was a star experience. Monique was right on top of our request for a room with 2 beds. Could only obtain a single Queen on line. Request granted with a smile. Lovely room, immaculate and well appointed. Continental breakfast more than adequate with multiple choices. On second day an attendant informed us that we were not eligible for breakfast as our room was in the adjoining Mellennium Broadway hotel. Advised my reservation included breakfast but was told our room was not included. Advised attendant to speak with Monique and his whole demeanor changed with a pro fuse apology. Can’t say enough about the kindness and efficiency of Monique. Will visit again and recommend Monique and millennium for a most enjoyable and convenient hotel while visiting the “BIG APPLE”. Entire staff were most courteous and helpful.GBW, Hainesport, NJ

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here a while back. It was ok. I don't think we would stay here again. Needs updating. It was a quiet hotel. Clean but something was off about this place I cannot say what this was. Just felt run down.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed at Millennium Premier Hotel for 7 days whilst we visited New York. The hotel is about 2 mins walk from Times Square and so it’s a great central position. The hotel was nice but the breakfast is buffet style. This is ok and in fact had a good selection of foods. The down side is that whilst you eat you sit in armchairs using coffee tables. Several times there were not enough seats and we found ourselves looking for someone to leave so we could have their seats. Not very good. However if you can put up with that it’s a pleasant hotel. Beware the daily resort fees. This was about £26 per day! It’s supposed to cover things like the gym (which we never even saw). It’s charged on your credit card daily. I later found that the daily charge was replaced by one final charge and the daily charge was cancelled. This is a bit of a shock if you are not expecting it. Also, expect some external noise. The Americans like using their car horns. We were in room 2020 - on the 20th floor and had quite a good view.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Falsely advertised. This is NOT what was pictured. I didn't expect flowers and candles, but I also did not expect: Mold in shower, stains on carpet, stains/blood on walls, rusted appliances, light fixtures falling out of ceiling. Painted over mold. Busted up furniture. NO AC! They use pictures from other lobby. Check in is at different location. They have to be paying for those positive comments or maybe others had newer updated rooms. But ours was disgusting. I complained and was blown off. Some employees were genuinely nice, but managers - nope. I've stayed in NYC and this was the worst by far. see photos. Very disappointed. I made this account just to warn others. See photos of what you actually get. Beware.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The only reason I haven’t given this hotel 5 stars is because some elements of it are a bit tired. If I could mark it 4.5 stars I would!It’s a great base for exploring New York and most of the staff were really friendly especially Monique on reception who couldn’t be more helpful.The breakfast is served on a mezzanine level and is eaten in a lounge-type layout which is slightly awkward and it does get busy but the range of foods available was good. It’s also great that drinks are available all the time in this guest lounge area.Another big plus is the evening guest ‘reception’ in the lounge where complimentary wine, soft drinks and snacks are offered each night for 2 hours.All in all a great little hotel.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Great location, near Times Square , the theater district, and cabs come right in front of the hotel. I was pleasantly surprised with the quick check in process, the continental breakfast and the Happy Hour of wine and cheeses. My room was clean, had a tub and shower, a sofa and no fridge. I could not get over how quiet our room was based on location and busy season., Full window and room darkening shades.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel has a fantastic location in New York City. It is walking distance to Times Square and the theatre district. There are several good restaurants very close by with shopping stores also very close. The rooms are clean and they offer a cocktail party and a continental breakfast which is complementary after you pay the service fee of approximately $30 US.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here one night for a business trip. Rooms are older and kinda beat up and definitely not very clean. See pics. Staff was mostly friendly but check in is odd and the lobby is non existent. Certainly not a hotel on par with prices charged.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Location was absolutely perfect: less than 2 minutes to the famous Times Square, and walkable to the shopping district, as well as to bus stop and subway stations. Room was small but cozy with nice amenities and good bathroom. Breakfast was simple but good. The hotel also offered free refreshments and alcohol drinks between 5.30pm-7.30pm.
user_name:
Kiet Q
Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: My husband and I stayed here on our first trip to New York and I'm so glad we did. It was close to everything and beautiful. The room was small and the bath outdated- but who cares....we were in the middle of New York and it was clean and safe.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel is in a great location. Close to restaurants, shows, Time Square, Bryant Park, subway... everything! The best part of the trip.... Monique!!! From the moment we arrived and she checked us in, we were in great hands. We had 2 rooms reserved and she made sure we were able to be next to each other. Check in was a great experience.
