She also provided some great lunch options close by and made sure we had anything we might need. The rooms are great, plenty of room, very comfortable. The housekeeping staff were very friendly and helpful. It was great to have continental breakfast and happy hour snacks as well. Right next door is the Hudson Theater and Millenium broadway. There are several restrauants within a door or two that were really great. We had the best time! The entire staff was very nice and helpful but I have to say, Monique made the trip by setting the tone at the beginning and getting us checked out and off the airport at the end. I highly recommend staying here.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Spent 4 days at the Millennium Premier Hotel (not to be confused with the Millennium Broadway next door) just a block from Times Square. The hotel is terrific, friendly staff, very nice rooms with views of the city. The Millennium Premier offers a very nice contenental breakfast and a wine and cheese reception every afternoon. The location is fantastic, went to 4 museums, 3 plays and walked to them all. If you are going to see plays, this is the place to stay. The rooms are very well appointed, spacious bathrooms. Be warned, the stand up shower stalls are on the small side, not a big deal.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This modern, boutique hotel is pretty low key but once inside, it offers a few nice surprises. A minute walk from Times Square, the hotel lobby is living room comfy with just two desks for check in, a big sofa and chairs you sink into. Even though the rooms are small, they’re well equipped with sofa, swiveling TV, shower and bath, comfy linens and a direct view of the New Years Eve ball! A complimentary breakfast buffet is served in a second floor lounge along with a cheese and wine reception every afternoon complete with a super Italian espresso machine open 24/7. Rates vary widely but we got a great $118 weekday rate. You have to tack on a $34 facility fee but it’s still a great deal if you’re going to NYC for theater. We walked everywhere and never worried about parking.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The Millennium Premier cancelled our booking for 'contract issues' when we checked they definitely have rooms on our dates. But now hundreds more expensive. We booked months ago and just heard. Absolutely disgusting. Avoid this property.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We had a "ball view" room on the 52nd floor (top). The hotel lobby is great (the restaurant sucks) but the room was very so so - looked like it wasn't upkept well at all. Out of date but ok. Our room was enormous by NYC standards with a "living room" and a bedroom and two bathrooms... the finish was the only bad part. The bedding was "good enough" (and we were so exhausted from all the walking we slept well). For the price, it was great considering some of the terrible places we saw - just don't expect the ritz...

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The premier is an addition to the main tower of the Millennium, and much nicer than the "main tower", which is very tired looking and feeling. The Primer side feels more like an condo building lobby, and the rooms are comfortable, clean, and nice. It about time for repairs and updates, but no as badly needed as the larger part of the hotel. There is no rom service, which would normally not bother me, but it was a huge issue on this particular visit. After 10 hour days, I just wanted to have a quiet bit without going back out in the rain/cold. The main tower's restaurant (Bugis Street-Singaporean food) NEVER had anyone in there, and most days was serving "a limited menu". So, the menu I saw had nothing to do with Singapore. It was mostly sandwiches and a caesar salad.The complimentary breakfast was a bit of a joke, although the coffee was excellent. The options do not include any protein, aside from a cold boiled egg. Some days there was a bowl of plain yogurt (with fruit and nut as toppings). All days there were a choice of 3 cereals and sweet breakfast breads.There is a complimentary wine reception from 5:50-7:00 every evening, which is very nice. The wine was pretty good, and the snacks were much better than the breakfast. They offer finger sandwiches, olives, bread, & cheeses.The staff is extremely helpful and all were very nice. All in all, I will consider a return stay.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: A lot of people miss the fact this is separate to the more luxurious Millenium hotel. They are the same building but two brands with different service levels and hotels.The Premier is the more budget hotel of the two and for us was well worth every penny. However, do not expect anything great. I think 4 star is generous for the hotel. It was a 3 star hotel that you pay more for due to location. Positives are that it was clean and comfortable which is all you really need and the staff were very nice and pleasant. The location is the real winner here. It is 10 minute walk from Empire State and Rockerfeller Center. It is only then 20 minutes from Central Park and Intrepid museum. We barely used the subway thanks to this great location!To summarize, do not book this hotel for luxury but do book it if you want to be right in the middle of everything and in walking distance of the biggest attractions. This hotel really is great for tourists looking to do lots of things.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I’ve stayed at The Premier in Times Square many times and Monique was the friendliest front desk personnel so far. I have had unpleasant encounters twice in the past leaving me an unpleasant memory of the hotel, which was regretful, as the hotels location was prime. It’s within walking distance to Grand Central (so I can catch the train), walking distance to NYC airporter, walking distance to just about all theaters and the famous Juniors cheesecake, not to mention all subway lines are all within a block or two. Monique was warm and welcoming. She’d ask me if I had seen the play I inquired about the day before. In addition to Monique, I find the complimentary breakfast a crucial benefit. Even though I only eat the hard boiled eggs and avoid sweet pastries and donuts (they do have fresh fruit, cereals and yoguart), you have no idea how nice it is to go get a cup of hot coffee from the espresso machine without having to put on a real outfit and having to go outside the building.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We booked two rooms in this hotel for its proximity to Times Square. A 2 min walk at most & so much within 10 mins like Broadway shows & Hells Kitchen. Friendly efficient staff & clean room although a bit dated. Check in & check out without a hitch!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: It's a pleasant stay in this hotel for 4 days. I was upgraded to a bigger room on higher level, so i dont experience any noise from the street. The room and washroom were cleaned. But i would suggest that it will be even better if there is a boiler for water.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We arrived on November 29 for 5 days stay in NYC. At 7:00 pm our room was still not ready and were told to go to the hotel next door which is attached to this one) to talk to the Front Desk Manager. Another couple had the same issue and we both refused to walk next door since it was the Manager's responsibility to come to us. We finally got to a room but found out through another family member that was with us that our room was different from theirs. They had downgraded our room since the other rooms were not cleaned yet.. The next day, Monique the front desk clerk at the time told us that she would take care of us by not charging us for the daily resort fee for 5 days since we were not staying in the upgraded room we had paid for. The morning of our departure we found a bill for $142.10 for resort fees which my husband immediately went and discussed with Monique. She crumbled the paper up and through it away and said she forgot to make the adjustment and would take care of it. Upon my departure she assured me also that she would credit our Amex. A few weeks later, my Amex bill arrived.....no credit. I called immediately and Monique told me it was still sitting on her desk and she would credit. Five days later still no credit. I then called and left a message with the front desk manager who never returned my call so today I said enough is enough and I called AMEX to complain. The hotel accommodations were nice and staff very friendly and attentive. Great location to Times Square. However, arriving at 7pm when you have a 4pm checkin and at 7pm rooms are still not ready....that's a BIG internal problem!! AND the fact that we paid for a larger hotel room and received a smaller room with no room adjustment is NOT ACCEPTABLE and horrible business and customer relations. I have NEVER posted a negative review but after making 3 phone calls, this surely warranted one.Therefore, my next trip this year to NYC will definitely be at another hotel.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Nothing like the pictures - this hotel was disappointing - very tired and in need of TLC. Paper coffee/tea cups in room, very little in the room, no mini bar etc. Breakfast included was a joke - small area with enough chairs for about 14 people - more paper cups - very basic breakfast that was a complete scrum and then charged for on exit at $30 pppd - that was not the deal - would not return. Having asked for a 4 star hotel this was a 2/3 star establishment. Location very central

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The Premier is our hotel selection when we visit New York City two to three times a year. When we arrive at the hotel Monique, the Concierge, always greets us by name with a cheerful welcome, which sets the tone for an enjoyable visit to the City. Monique is consistently courteous and efficient, and we enjoy her charming personality and wit.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel is steps away from Times Square, which was a real plus. Unfortunately, upon check in, there were several issues with the cleanliness of the room. Housekeeping rectified the issue immediately. Hotel could provide extra space or a different and larger space for continental breakfast. Monique Madison at the front desk was fabulous.Overall, though the hotel was expensive, I would stay again for the convenience

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Had a great stay at Millenium Premier with my 10 yr old daughter. It was a great location and a small, quiet hotel that didn't have a crowded bar or lobby to get through which was nice for kids. When we arrived, the hotel didn't have our reservation (through Expedia) however which was very annoying. Thankfully the front desk wasn't busy and they let us use their phone to call Expedia, who in turn had to call the hotel themselves and resolve the issue. Apparently this is a common problem with Expedia where a reservation doesn't make its way over to the hotel that you book. Luckily the hotel had a room for us, despite the fact that it was Dec 21 (close to Christmas) and we were staying for 3 nights. We had also booked a 'ball drop view' room through Expedia and the person at the front desk at the hotel said that Expedia has no ability to guarantee a room like that and they shouldn't advertise as such. It could have been quite the mess for us but within 20 mins everything was resolved, only because the hotel had the room available for us. I can't imagine what would have happened had they not. Continental breakfast and happy hour (one drink plus finger foods) are included which was a nice touch (but you pay $35 US per pay hospitality fee). The room was a good size and modern...but the bathroom is a little rough around the edges; loose faucet, moldy shower...but overall great for a family traveling with kids. (comparing to ROW NYC the rooms were much bigger at Millennium).

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel was very nice, clean with big bedrooms and gorgeous views .All the staff was very helpfull and kind but Monique makes the difference. She was delightful and so nice and helpful. She went out of her way to make us happy, specially my 9 old doughter Yiara. Nothing was a problem for her . She took such good care of us.Grazie Monique for our beautifull stay

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here for 3 nights in Dec. It has an internal connection to Millenium Broadway new york wing of the hotel, we can use all the facilities like the gym etc at the broadway wing. It's just beside Hudson theater, in fact the theatre is right in between the Premier and Broadway wings. There was complimentary buffet breakfast available, nothing special very basic like shelled boiled eggs, toast, cereal, fruits, guava and orange juice, milk and some pastries. Surprisingly the hotel provided complimentary bottled water, so thumbs up for that!We paid extra for the ball drop view. We were put up on the 16th floor and wanted an even higher like 20/21. I checked with the concierge 3-4 times if higher rooms were available but they always telling me I should check later as nothing is available now. I thought maybe they could just note down my request and let me know if any higher floor room was available rather than me checking with them again and again. The location was fantastic... Exit from 44th street and walk to broadway in a few minutes. Exit from 45th and there is a starbucks right next to it. Times square is super close!The room was quite average I thought, it was small (as is the case with most NY hotels I believe) the bed was ok. The TV was placed in a very odd position like perpendicular to the bed and not facing it. Also the closet was just beside the door so whenever we had to open the closet it would bang against the door not making it a very good experience. So overall, the hotel is average with average bf (but attentive staff), average hotel room (but clmplementary botted water), average view from the 16th floor (ball drop view). I would maybe try a Hyatt or Marriot next time.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here for about a week in March of 2018. We were so impressed with the spaciousness of the room, and it's proximity to all of the attractions we wanted to see - we could walk easily to Times Square, 5th Avenue, the FlatIron District or Central Park. There was a wine and cheese reception each evening to go to, which was a lovely treat to enjoy after a busy day of wandering the city!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We were delighted with the large, comfortable room. The hotel is perfectly positioned as a base to explore the city. The complimentary breakfast and evening wine with canapes is an excellent bonus. Monique on reception is fabulous - efficient, friendly and most definitely calm under pressure. I look forward to meeting her again when we return (just hoping that our car to the airport is not late next time)!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed only one night but will definitely return. Walking distance to all main attractions in Manhattan. Room was comfortable, clean and spacious. Great breakfast was included however would of preferred to sit at a table to eat instead of sofa. Staff at reception very helpful and friendly. Thank you for a wonderful stay.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel is in a perfect location for all the site seeing and sub ways. The staff were friendly and obliging, nothing was too much trouble. The breakfast was delicious and the managers reception was great way to unwind after a hard day site seeing and shopping.Great hotel and I would recommend it to anyone who is coming to New York.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Monique and the entire staff were so helpful and generous. The restaurant attached to the hotel had a delicious breakfast and dinner with incredible Singaporean additions. And the bed and room were great.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here for 5 nights in October this year. It is next door to The Hudson Theatre and is not the Millennium Broadway hotel! It is a separate hotel. Despite reading reviews to the contrary, we checked in before 4pm and the receptionist was very friendly and check in was efficient. We were on the 7th floor and the room was a good size and fairly modern. Bed was large and comfy-lots of space. Can’t fault the room at all really. We had paid for breakfast as part of our stay and this is why we have given an average score instead of very good. Breakfast is on a mezzanine floor that is in no way built to hold the number of guests in the hotel. There are not enough seats or tables (people were standing up or went back to their rooms) and the selection of food was limited. It didn’t seem like a breakfast room. It was more like a run down waiting area. As a result, we only had breakfast there twice and chose to go to diners in Times Square for the rest of the holiday. The hotel is a good place to use, as a base, as the location is on a side street, just off Times Square. All in all, I’m not sure we would stay here again. The room and location were good but the breakfast deal was not worth it and there aren’t any other facilities in the hotel so you are just getting a room.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel is a hidden gem. Perfect location with Times Square literally at the end of the road! It’s quiet though as you’re tucked back off the main strip. Free breakfast and wine! Just a ten min walk from The Top of the Rock. Only thing stopping this hotel getting 5stars is the rude sarcastic female receptionist we had upon checking out! Otherwise faultless.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Just wonderful!!! Location = A+. Building = modern flare with feelings of traditions. The staff = AMAZING!!! Monique and Kush where able to get me a better room on a higher floor because they are great. The bell hops where all awesome. The wine and breakfast people where on top of it as well. SO OVERALL, like most things in life the actual real people made it great and enjoyable. Remember that old Quote..... " you get what you pay for"..... worth every penny!!! A HUGE thanks to the entire staff.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The location in excelent, just a few steps from Times Square and to different subway lines. And, that's all. The furniture in the hotel is very old. Shower is terrible and room service very annoying, knocking the door several times during the morning, informing that "it's our last chance to have our room serviced". At front desk, a mix of pleasent and rude employees - most times, we did not even hear a good morning/night.We had to go to Millenium Hotel to pick up some packages that arrived for us during our stay. The guy on the front desk was completely non sense and did not give us our packages, informing that we needed the confirmation of UPS with our name stated on it. We had only the UPS confirmation that it was delivered one day ago. We had to go back to hotel reception so they called the manager of that department in order to "help" us. In two minutes, and only informing our names, all packages were delivered. Terrible rude service!If you are only looking for location, it is an ok hotel, but I would look at the many options nearby before.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Hotel with a small lobby, not too noticeable, but location is near Times Square. Room is reasonably-sized for 2 people, with a brief view of the Times Square area.Check-in requires a credit card to hold USD50. Housekeeping is usually around 8am, but our floor on 18th, the housekeeper mentioned she start hers at 7am. We hang the Do-not-disturb sign on the door and every morning, she will ask if we needed any replenishing of toiletries. Very friendly housekeeper and lobby staff in overall. There is only 1 mineral water though.Transport for 4 people from this hotel to JFK airport is around usd75.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel is centrally located in the heart is Times Square. A considerable number of restaurants and places to eat literally in front of the hotel. Friendly staff always willing to help you how to get around. Rooms are big, clean and quiet.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Had to attend a meeting on West 42nd St. Chose this smaller boutique hotel. Great location! Right in Times Sq. Subway is a block away. Large rooms with comfortable sitting area, soaking tub and shower. Windows that open for fresh air. Wine reception and Continental breakfast was great on the mezzanine which had a cappuccino machine available all day. Toast, bagels, croissants, muffins, yogurt, fruit and cereal. Coffee, cappuccino, espresso, teas, and juice. Personable, reception staff. Won't be disappointed. I prefer a smaller hotel. There is the madness of Time Square at your feet and the peaceful tranquility of a small hotel to return to.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Love the boutique hotel feel of this mid-town hotel! The complimentary breakfast and happy hour are a great added bonus! The floor to ceiling windows makes you feel like you're right in the heart of the theater district! Been staying here for years. Always excellent!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: It is with great pleasure that I write an exceptional review for the Millennium Premier Hotel in NYC! For the past 18 years, my family and I vacation in NYC for the Thanksgiving holiday and for the past 3 years have stayed at the Millennium Premier. By far, this is the best hotel we have stay in for several reasons. The location is half a block from Times Square and central to all of the Theater District. The cost is very affordable for the amenities you receive. The continental breakfast and Happy Hour each day are saving enough to never look anywhere else to stay. The rooms are spacious and clean. The staff are friendly and knowledgeable for tourists visiting the city. Moreover, I can't say enough good things about Monique Madison, Premier Concierge. She has always gone above and beyond to provide the best service possible to the guests. This year, we had a problem with our reservation an upon arrival, she took it upon herself to make sure our rooms were secure and our stay was without incident. We can't thank her enough for her hospitality and professionalism. Because of all of these great attributes, we will always stay at the Millennium Premier when visiting NYC and suggest you do the same. You won't be disappointed.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Great location. The proximity to everything was perfect and we walked all the time except during a downpour. Monique at the front desk had great energy and was a highlight. The room was spacious. Glad for the breakfast and wine reception. There was a personal element even though we were in NYC.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Great hotel and location. Room was fantastic and staff terrific. Would highly recommend this hotel. The room size made our stay very enjoyable. The cocktail hour and breakfast was very much appreciated.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We love the Premier and stay here every time we are in NYC. For avid theater-goers, the location can't be beat. We love the very attentive staff as well as the breakfast and happy hour. Considering what the hotel offers, it's a good value.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Don’t know where to begin, but from the time we walked in, Monique at the front desk was super sweet and helpful. Just like every New Yorker, you have to understand that they have a businesslike way about them until you break through and then they are super helpful and that was Monique to a T.The rooms are a decent size and we were surprised to see both a bath tub and shower, but who really uses a bathtub. They have an evening reception that is great for a small snack or glass of wine. We had about four or five. It was nice to find out that coffee is available 24 hours as well.Free Wi-Fi, but don’t count on that.We came to town for a show and walked a block over to Burger and Lobster.We would certainly stay here again!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Great hotel and good size room considering the amount of space that is squeezed out of the properties in NY. Moniqu was very attentive and accommodating as I had to extend my trip another day. Go say hi to her!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed for five nights at the beginning of November as part of a package with Jet2 holidays and flying direct from Newcastle Upon Tyne was a bonus .Arrived at 3pm and fortunately room was ready for us. Quick and efficient check in and then to room on the eight floor. Views not the best but as the hotel is surrounded by high rise buildings not surprising really.The room itself ,a standard one ,was spacious with a good sized bed,sitting area ,TV and tea/coffee making facilities together with a safe. Bathroom with a good sized bath and usable shower. Room clean and comfortable with housekeeping attending on a daily basis. Couple of slight niggles including only one bathrobe and slippers when two occupants and a little bit of noise from nearby air conditioning units but other than that no real issues. The room did look perhaps a little dated but more than adequate especially as we were on holiday and used it as no more than a base.Although the hotel states the board is room only they do offer a complimentary breakfast taken in the mezzanine. This consists of cereals,fruits,pastries etc as well as tea,coffee and juices. There is certainly enough to have a reasonable breakfast before setting out.Also a nice touch is the free wine and cheese/nibbles available from 1730-1930 hrs......very pleasant and relaxing after a days sight seeing. Also a nice way to set up for an evening out. Comments have been made regarding the size of the room,which can accommodate about 25 people,as being small and cramped. Whilst there were occasions where there was a bit of queuing in general seating was available . However the seats are lounge style,which although works for the evening wine and cheese are not the most comfortable for the breakfast This hotel is sister to the millennium broadway and is joined by a corridor between them both and should not be confused with that hotel .... the broadway is larger but also offers a quite reasonable Thai restaurant. The location of the hotel is central.....on West 44th Street and literally 100yards from Times Square. Walking time to other main attractions,including Central Park,Rockefeller centre,Empire State building etc is about twenty minutes. You are right in the centre of the theatre district and five minutes from the main subway on 42nd Street which gives access to the rest of Manhattan In summary a very good hotel in a central position which has a lot going for it if you are looking for accommodation whilst partaking in a city break and to be recommended

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Up from Delaware for a couple days meeting family. Hotel provided breakfast and Wine/Cheese opportunities to gather with them. Rooms and hotel location were enjoyed by all. Earlier check-in would have benefited our whole group.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This is a top notch quality hotel in an excellent location. We lucked into a large corner room with an amazing view. The check in was easy and quick. From start to finish we were in our room in less than 10 minutes. The front desk was warm and friendly and engaging. I liked the elevators sectioned off by floors which made it quicker to get to the top floors. Considering the amount of floors, rooms and people I found the common areas to be clean. There is some age and wear and tear, but it’s so minor you have to look for it. Broadway shows, amazing restaurants, great sight seeing and shopping all within walking distance. You pay for location and convenience in NYC, that’s just the way it is.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Be careful as you read the reviews posted by others. There are 2 Millennium Hotels next door to each other. This is for the Boutique hotel which is the Millennium Premier. The other is the Millennium Broadway. I was a little nervous after reading the mix of reviews for the Millennium Premier. I had nothing to worry about though. The staff was always friendly, greeting us each time upon our entry to the hotel. They were very willing to help us with our needs whatever they were. The continental breakfast was just that. They had an assortment of very nice pastries which were attractive and tasty enough to be patisserie quality. There was a fabulous espresso machine as well as fresh fruit, yogurt and cereals. The room was very comfortable. The bathroom has a small shower and bathtub. A single robe is provided although it would have been nice to have 2 present without having to consider asking. Overall we had a wonderful stay and would definitely recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Great location on w44th street. 1 min walks to Times Square. Rooms are spacious, beds comfy. Bathroom is good but not the cleanest on arrival. Free wifi.Not sure where the bad reviews come from but we loved it.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I absolutely love this hotel! This was my first stay at a Millennial property and I must say I am soldout convert! Staff was wonderful. NYC Premier Millennial is in the heart of Times Square & the theater district, quick walk to the subway. The size of our room and the free amenities set Premier Millennial apart from other hotels in Times Square - free breakfast, happy hour, and wifi. Parking is literally across the street and a convenient deli, too. Added treat, the deep soaker tub in our huge bathroom. Do yourself a favor, book your NYC stay at Premier Millennial. (Total room cost $250/night)

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Hotel is located 1/2 of block from times square, 2 blocks from the subway in prime location.Pictures on the web site are not a true representation of the views, unless you are on a high floor the views will be of the building across the streetDon't book a king size bed they only have 15 rooms, queen size has a better view and better chances to have the room available earlier unless you may want to wait for it after 4 pm.Check out is 11 am and they charge 50/hr and after 3 pm full rate price.I stayed on a queen size bedroom, the bed was not comfortableHousekeeping didn't clean my room one day and after 3 calls, 2 visits to the front desk, 7 hrs later they finally did, the manager offered to call me but she never did.I paid 371/night and after the housekeeping experience i felt I paid too much of bad service.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Very good value for monies spent - stupendous location - very close to shows/theaters and Rockefeller Center.. Very friendly and helpful concierges. Great continental type breakfast and afternoon knoshing.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here for 1 night and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The rooms were lovely and had excellent facilities. The hotel is a minute from times square and has a lovely deli opposite which was great for breakfast. We didn't get a chance to use the restaurants in the hotel.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: They have bathtubs in the rooms! This was especially helpful as a midwesterner not accustomed to walking so much in the city. I just wished I brought epsom salts! (tip: bring epson salts). They provided a bathrobe and slippers too, which I appreciatedThere only 10 or 12 rooms per floor and lobby, floor, and breakfast area felt very boutique like, private, and cozy (and quiet). Nicely decorated rooms with Keurig coffee maker too. Great view of the city and peek at Times Square (our room could see the infamous ball)We missed getting to enjoy the complimentary happy hour, but did catch the comp breakfast each morning which was ok. Nice fresh fruit and pastries... but a huge espresso machine that could make lattes too (and other coffee drinks with push of button. I asked for an alternative milk, and was joyfully poured a cup of almond milk. (I could have gotten more if I asked). They are promptly done serving breakfast at 10 though... so don't be late.Many theatres are located close to this hotel so makes it a prime spot if you plan to do this during your stay (i.e.: close walking).In an adjacent building is a fabulous 'roof top' bar overlooking the city. We're told the highest (public) bar. "Bar 54" You need to get a 'card' from the restaurant on the main floor, then take the elevator to floor 54. You must show this (card of permission) to be seated. Kinda like a hush-hush speakeasy, that's made easy for out of towners not normally in the know. (walk out the back entrance of the adjacent Millennium Broadway hotel and you'll be facing this other building just across the street to your right)

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: decent rooms, good location but the rest is not very good. The breakfast room is very small. In addition, you have to pay 200+ dollars for the facilities that they advertise are free, such as the breakfast room and internet use. In addition, the staff argued openly around the guests, and at times were rude.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed for 1 night at the end of our holiday. Big, clean and very quite even though located in one of busiest streets in New York. We moved from the hotel next door (AKA apartments) where we could not sleep due to the lack of sound proof windows, what a difference in price ( pretty much half) and a great night sleep. Highly recommended.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: My second stay here, mainly because it’s close to where I needed to be for business. There are better midtown options but by the time I booked, they were much more expensive.Pros - — Quiet compared to Sofitel, Muse - no street noise on the 19th floor; small hotel so little noise from other guests or elevators— Room size is decent for price, with bed, desk, couch. Lots of windows and they open for “fresh” air— Quiet ventilation system (should be normal at all hotels but it’s not)— Decent and fast room service with enough semi-healthy options— Location - near Broadway, 6th Ave., 15 minute walk to Central Park— Coffee maker in room should you need that first thing— some sort of breakfast included, although I did not try it.Cons - — cleanliness questionable - when trying to find a place to plug in my iPhone near the bed, I encountered vomit in the corner by the window, which a previous guest had cleaned a bit but obviously housekeeping missed. Reported and it and they apologized, but it wasn’t that hard to see...have never been fastidious about hotel cleanliness (who could stay in a hotel if you were) but almost left the premises.— Maintenance questionable. Shower barely drained, leaving a little pool. Reported it but not fixed. Toilet often needed multiple flushes.— I didn’t need taxis while there but not clear how easy it would be to get one - no line of them near by.— No place by bed to plug in devices, and alarm clock has the VERY old dock for iPods - the 1 inch wide one that nobody has any longer. In short, quieter than the neighbor Millennium, which is good. But don’t expect much beyond a utilitarian room.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The location is good , but only if you intent to walk to time square, or take underground , but if you will go other places by Uber/Taxi, its very challenging, no parking, no space, getting in and out of the location can consume allot of time due to traffic.The hotel itself is disappointing , rooms are old and you feel you are in a store room, its not comfortable, no proper drawers for your cloth, no fridge, it was very bad experience.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: To start with, the hotel is a sister hotel to Millennium Broadway connected by a passageway and many people get confused. The official check in time is..... at 16! and check out is at 11! That was a shocker.So, 5 hours to clean?! Well, we were checked in at 19 while the person on duty was still getting the keys ready for some other guests, answering the phone that was rinning off the hook, and repeating to us to wait since she had to finish sth, she had started prior to attending us. Before 16 p.m., there is nobody at the "reception", which is just 2 desks. It is like a haunted house. The only person in the hall is the porter who announces in no uncertain terms to all who walk in, that the check in is at 16, so people should leave the luggage and off to see NY before that. The hotel feels very understaffed, disorganized and unwelcoming. Even to use a bathroom while you wait, you have to cross to Millennium Broadway and ask the concierge for a key. The common bathrooms are for clients use only, and only at the sister hotel, but I have seen much cleaner public toilets than that one.To soften the check in experience, the hotel offers what is grandly called a wine reception to get the clients drunk and happy and not so grumpy about the wait. It is a nice plus, but I rather have human smiling reception ready to help and answer questions, and check in, starting at 14 and even a bit earlier if the room is ready. Complimentary continental breakfast is a nice touch. Coffee is surprisingly very good, freshly ground. But the mezzanine is not created for breakfast. It is a bar lounge with a few low chairs and low tables. Eating breakfast crouching over your plate while other guests wait for you to finish and get off so they can sit, was "fun".A computer+printer in the mezzanineto check in and print your boarding passes us nice, too.The room we were given was just next to the elevators (319), it meant a sleepless night both from the noises outside and the elevator motors. I tend to think they might have refurbished rooms that do look like the ones on the official photos on upper floors, but ours was a shabby run down with moldy bathroom/shower.The room itself is spacious, has a complimentary bottle of water and a coffee machine. A/C sounds like a 737 about to take off.Thanks God it was just 1 night, I doubt I would consider this establishment ever again.I guess the only big plus of this place is the location.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I stayed here with my Niece for a special celebration holiday. We stayed for a week here. The rooms were a good size with one double bed and a sofa and tv in the main area. The bathroom was a great size and had a bath and a separate shower. There was a desk and a wardrobe with a safe and a coffee machine. The only thing not in the room was a hairdryer which was a pain but according other family members that came later in the week they did have a hairdryer so we must have been unlucky. It is in a great location just around the corner from Times Square and situated by loads of great restaurants which are feet away. The day we checked out my niece was taken ill and the staff were amazing giving her the room we had stayed in back to rest in while we waited for a taxi to the airport. We really appreciated this as she needed to rest. Not every hotel would be this accommodating so huge thanks to the concierge for sorting this. Breakfast at the hotel is a bit makeshift with there only being a small area to eat in, with chairs and coffee tables, there is no proper tables to sit at. The breakfast is continental in style and you help yourself - finding somewhere to sit can be hard at busy times so be aware of this. Overall i would stay here again as the location was great.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Location was awesome.. pictures on sight not accurate.. reserved a room with ball drop view... saw the back alley and buildings .. no view of the ball drop area or time square!! Easily walked everywhere .. but need to be more specific about what we are paying for

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Super location just around the corner from Times Square- made it possible to walk everywhere which was great. Lovely room with a great view- was glad to have a room on a high floor to help eliminate street noise :) Nice extra of Breakfast & Evening Drinks included. Would have liked a fridge in the room but it wasn’t essential.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The best thing about this hotel is the location. The room was clean and decent size, the bathroom has a nice large tub. I reserved a room with a view and did not get it and was told the hotel was sold out. The staff is what is lacking here. You barely get a greeting when you come in and out. The cleaning staff was nice and got me what I needed quickly. The breakfast area is small and crowded but staff tries to keep up. There is no where to sit but we took it back to our room which is fine. You are literally steps away from Times Square so that is handy and the price is decent. I think next time I go to NYC I will look for something else. It wasn't horrible, just MEH. The one overnight Concierge was very nice and helpful, the others barely give you the time of day. If you just want a clean room with free continental breakfast close to Times Square and nothing fancy, this will do but don't expect too much.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Great hotel close to Times Square. Easy walking distance from most Broadway theaters. Sizable, comfortable rooms and bathrooms. Nicely appointed. I will definitely stay there again when I return to New York.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This is a great hotel for location close to Times Square attractions and yet close to transport links for any other attractions. Room was great, asked for a street view and got one on the 21st floor, top views from there.Breakfast room and breakfast a little disappointing but that was minor as we were there for New York and not the breakfast.
user_name:
GEOFF B B
Portadown, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Visited the millennium premier hotel from the 17-20th of September fab rooms had everything you needed breakfast was good can't say enough about the staff.l would like to say a big thankyou to Monique at reception .Monique is so helpful. We had a problem with our luggage Monique told us to go enjoy our holiday and rang aerlingus for us she took all the stress of looking for our luggage away and when it did arrive rang us to put our minds at rest. Monique is priceless to the hotel hope you give her big bonus this year. Would definitely recommend the millennium premier hotel right in the middle of everything would see there again

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We were stopping over in NY on our way back from Rome. We saw Chicago on Broadway & left for PHX the next afternoon!! Overall the staff was very attentive and helped us with directions and decisions. We will recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We arrived around 10:00am and did a pre-check in, they stored our bags free of charge and we were told to come back at 4:00pm. We got back just before and our room keys were ready. We had a nice room on the 11th floor facing 44th street with a great view of the NYE ball (ask for room 1123 if you are looking for this). The hotel is less than 1 minute walk to Times Square and 2 minute walk to the subway. The room was quiet, clean and very comfortable with nice soft bedding, pillows were great and towels were nice as well. My only complaint is no mini fridge in the room. We received a complimentary water bottle in the room daily which was nice. The breakfast was good, it was basic and not enough seating however we made it work. They had a nice assortment of fruit, cereal, bread/bagels and some pastries. The nightly wine and cheese was a nice touch as well. Overall great stay, if you want to be in Times Square but also want a quiet nights sleep this is the hotel for you.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: My wife and I stayed four four nights in September booking through BA. IEmailed them in advance as it was our wedding anniversary and the staff congratulated us on arrival. The staff were polite, engaging and always met you with a smile.The reception is bright and cool, modern and comfy. Check in and Out was easy and we got access to our room despite arriving early.Room - 14 (13) floor. View looked towards the ball at Times Square which was nice. The room had a large bed and a sofa that you could have slept on. Spacious, clean and modern. Large bathroom with a bath and shower. Flat screen tv with plenty channels. Lifts operate by key card and only allow access to your floor, the lobby and 1st floor so felt safe and secure.Breakfast- tea, coffee, cereal, toast, muffins, fruit, more than sufficient and remember it’s free!Evening reception- again free but not my thing as I don’t drink wine. Different wines available and some soft drinks. Olives, strawberries and some canapés. Again not my thing but my wife enjoyed. Available 530-730. We used this to refuel after being out all day before going out at night. Decent enough and my wife enjoyed.All in a great hotel and we’ll definitely use again if/when back In nyc. Of note we had no resort fees but guess we paid up front.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The staff of the hotel are very friendly, but the facilities are a let down.All guests have the ability to enter the club lounge as there is a standard fee added to your room rate and the place is too small to accommodate everyone.The club lounge offerings would be best described as bread and water only compared to all other club lounges in New York. The only hot things available are tea, bad coffee and toast. Everything else is refrigerator cold including the one canapé they would offer during drinks and boiled eggs in the morning (straight from the refrigerator). Drinks offered in the evening are a house white, house red and 3 soft drinks. Nothing more, nothing less. No sitting room as there are too many people for the space. The ball drop room room was spacious and very good with a bathtub separate to the shower. The bed was very comfortable.However, note that you may not share the same sentiments if you paid for the basic room as the original room we were allocated peered into the office building next door and the television faced the window away from the bed. The hotelier kindly fixed the allocation mistake.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Hotel is great. Monique is the best. Attentive and extremely friendly and accommodating. Highly recommend. Hotel is great location and offers morning and evening tastes. Delish. We have come here often and will continue to do so

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Traveled to NYC in September for a 5 day trip with my daughter for her 16th birthday. Chose the Millennium after reading online reviews. Hotel room was super nice. We had a Queen Bed on the 17th floor. No street noise, black out curtains controlled any light from Times Square from coming into our room. Nice sized couch that can easily be slept on. Room was very clean and larger than most rooms in the area that we considered. Oversized bathroom with soaking tub and separate shower. Lounge had free continental breakfast with good choices and there was also an evening reception with wine, cheese, crackers, fruit and soda. Would definitely return to this hotel. Only snag worth mentioning is we prepaid this room directly on Millennium's website and it clearly stated that we would not owe anything at the hotel but, upon checkout found out we still owed a facility fee. This should be made very clear on the hotel's website otherwise the price could definitely be considered misleading.
user_name:
Alicia K
Atlanta, Georgia, United States

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The place is located in the same building (different tower) with the Millennium Broadway hotel. Hotel is clean and rooms are nice - the location is excellent. But the thing that lowers the rating from 5 stars is the attitude that the staff has.We have travelled quite a lot in States, this is the first time in the quality hotel when the staff was generally cocky and rude.We booked their most expensive room-type with King Size bed (costs extra), we informed them prior that we would appreciate a nice room because it was my 40th birthday. When we arrived the staff told that hotel had overbooked all Exclusive King rooms and we will get the queen one without any compensation. Ok? We told them that we had contacted them several times before arriving explaining for a special request.We demanded to have the king room, so they told us that they need to transfer someone else's booking then - we got a lousy room from the 6th floor, and attitude of the staff was "ok, there you have it". We were disappointed and headed back downstairs, just to listen receptionist blaming us for all. Nice!After discussion, we got a queen room (still paying for the king extra) with a view from 20th floor. The room was nice and we stayed there but all the rest days we saw the receptionist her "attitude" showed always. "Any problems today?" - what?We tried to say hello every time we went through the lobby, usually staff did not even look at us - the just stared their screen. Good example was the night shift guy who we saw on 3 nights, no reaction to customers passing by :DThe hotel is lovely, the location is nice - but like I said the staff has some problems with their service. Seems that customers are just something that are making their life miserable and they will show it back to them. When you pay around 400 USD per night for the room, you could wait some sort of service? Or am I asking too much?

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: (September 2018) A trip celebrating a special birthday and a special wedding anniversary in one. This was our fist visit to the US and we wanted to be ‘in the thick of it’ so chose the Millennium Premier as it’s just off Times Square. Not for the faint hearted or those looking for quiet retirement! While the double glazing mutes the sounds you can still hear the traffic and sirens crossing Times Square and the shouts from the bar from the opposite side of the street and it doesn’t really quiet down until 2 or 3am. The city that barely sleeps.We asked if possible for a room with a view and manager Niek obliged on the 17th floor directly overlooking the Times Square ball drop. Absolutely fab! We were also welcomed with a personal card a bottle of sparkling water, a bowl of fruit and macaroons. Thanks guys, you made us feel special.The hotel itself is cool, clean, quiet and spacious. The staff are all very welcoming and helpful. You feel secure as you need a room card to activate the elevator. Our room was large with a sitting area at the foot of the bed with a big flat screen TV. What the Americans call a double bed we in the UK call a King size. It was massive and very comfortable. The floor to ceiling windows afford you plenty of light and a great view out over the roofs opposite.The bathroom is supplied with toiletries – gosh your toilets are low in the states! The decor was a bit tired, our sink was cracked and it could have done with a lick of paint but it wasn’t terrible. We had a separate bath & shower. The tub was excellent nice and deep and very hot water. The shower in my opinion was a total let down. Absolutely needed refurbishing. The shower head didn’t spray correctly it was like being under a garden hose and the drain smelled like perm lotion! (I used the bath)They supply an iron and ironing board, safe, hairdryer, Ice bucket, coffee machine, comp bottles of water each day. I requested a kettle in reception as I wanted to make a cup of tea, sadly they don’t stock kettles!!!! I was told use the coffee machine to get hot water  Guys, you can’t make a decent cuppa with tepid water. Poor do on that front.Complimentary continental breakfast was perfectly adequate. The only grumblers are those who expect overflowing plates of cooked bacon. You have an unlimited choice of cereals, pastries, toast, hard boiled eggs, yogurt and fresh fruit. There’s a coffee machine which hallelujah produced hot water for my beloved tea LOL. I suggest getting down to breakfast early, that way you find a seat AND you’re hitting the sights before the crowds build. If you get back in the early evening you can partake of the complimentary wine and nibbles. We only managed this one night, but it was good wine.One thing to bare in mind is NY hotels charge a daily city tax. Unlike European hotels this can be quite steep and is added to your final bill. We booked direct with the hotel so all taxes and charges were payed in advance. As we didn’t have any incidentals there were no final surprise additions to pay for and the $50 they ring fenced on my card was returned without problem. You’re less than 1 minute walk from Times Square you can be on a main bus or at a subway within 5 minutes so a brilliant central location.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We have had a wonderful time in NYC until I sprained my ankle walking to a Broadway Show. (Pretty Woman-highly recommend) Made it through the show. Then hired a peddle ride back to the hotel. Within 5 minutes Jacob was delivering bags of ice to our door. We were totally impressed with Jacob and all the service at this hotel. I would highly recommend. Nice continental breakfast and free wine & apps in the evening. Excellent location, quiet, clean and impeccable service from Jacob and other staff in the lobby. Will definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Over charge your card. Don’t care that they have. Promise you that they will take all charges out of the overcharges but then don’t and decide to take out even more funds from your card. Now I’ll wait 30 days to get my US funds back when I have long returned to Australia. Never again.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This is a good place, very close to Times Square, the theatres etc. It is not a place to enjoy outside of the room. Apart from the small lounge for breakfast and evening drinks (included in our tariff), we saw no evidence of restaurants or other amenities (although there are plenty outside the hotel. Get out and enjoy the surroundings.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Clean, comfortable and nice and cool when needed. Was unable to have someone answer the phone about an early check-in, so that was an issue. After that everything was great. I appreciated the independent feel of the place, but never found the ice machine, if there was one. Spring for the bigger rooms.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: A perfectly located hotel should one want to stay in the hustle and bustle of Times Square, and be close to the subway.Our room on the 20th floor was of decent size, with a small lounge area and the large bathroom comes with a shower and bath.The room comes equipped with a Keurig coffee machine (very important!), a safe, iron and ironing board, hairdryer, as well as a gown and slippers. A complimentary limited continental breakfast is served every morning on the Mezzanine level. We unfortunately did not have the time to take advantage of the complimentary cocktails on offer between 5:30 - 7:30pm.Overall, a pleasant comfortable experience with very helpful and friendly staff.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: If I were only rating this hotel based on the room, I might give it a 3. However, there have been several issues with Millenium staff, resulting in my giving a final overall rating of 1. We booked the hotel through a tennis tour company, so we could go to the US Open. Upon trying to check in, I was told our reservation couldn't be found. There was some confusion about which hotel we were booked into, for some reason there's The Premiere Times Square (our booking) and Millenium, which is attached to the Premiere with a lobby. (The Millenium looks a lot nicer ,by the way). Luckily when I asked at the Millenium side, they found our reservation #, but said we were at The Premier. Walked back to The Premier, gave the reservation #, and they found it. But informed me that the reservation was made in the name of the person with whom we booked the tour. I was told this would be fixed. It never was. I even had to use the name of our tour provider to log into the WiFi at the hotel. Next, I received an alert that a charge of several hundred dollars was put onto our credit card (this was after the $50 standard charge that's put on the card and then dropped later). I asked at the desk, and was told it was an error, since we had already prepaid through the tour company. After 5 nights, we went to check out. We had paid for valet parking ($70 a day!), since we're not familiar with the city and had enough trouble finding the place to begin with; we didn't want to figure out which parking garage would allow us to park the car for 5 nights. We didn't drive it at all after it was valet parked. Anyway, the gentleman at the desk explained that because there was a festival blocking the street, they couldn't pick up our car for us. I pointed out that we shouldn't have to pay the $70 dollars for the last night since they couldn't pick up the car. He agreed to lower the price for the 5th night, then placed a call to his supervisor to ask if he could comp us the last night. He was told yes, then only charged us for 4 nights ($280.00). We were given the parking voucher, which he signed, and then dragged our bags 2 1/2 blocks to the garage. We retrieved our car and drove home. Upon arriving home, I checked our credit card, and the erroneous charge had not been removed. In addition, they added another charge! I called the hotel, and was told that our account was in arrears for the unpaid parking night, plus the room had cost more than we paid through the tour! I told them they needed to work out the room cost with the tour company, and I explained what had happened with the comped 5th night. I then e-mailed my contact at the tour company, who said she'd look into it and get back to me. I checked my card balance again, the first 2 erroneous charges had been removed, but now there's a new one! Since several days have gone by and still no resolution, I called my credit card to dispute the most recent charge. NOW, on to a review of the room and our stay. The room was fine, although the view wasn't much. If I looked hard to the left, I could see a sliver of the lights of Times Square. I will say the room was quiet, there are only 7 rooms on the 18th floor, not sure how many were occupied. There was an ice bucket in the room. My husband went down to the desk to ask where the ice machine was, and was told there wasn't one. He was told that someone would bring ice up; they never did. The free breakfast helped on costs, and generally had a decent selection: muffins, bagels, cereal, fruit, and at first, yogurt. After 2 mornings, the yogurt was gone and was replaced with cottage cheese. Disappointing. The men that stood in the room watched everything like a hawk, and swooped in to pick up your plates immediately. It was odd. While our room was not advertised as having a mini frig, there was a large cabinet that the coffee maker sat on, and there was nothing in the cabinet at all. I suspect at some time in the past there was a mini fridge. I would not recommend staying at this hotel; it's been a big hassle.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We enjoyed our week long stay in New York at The Premier Times Square by Millennium.Our room was a decent size for NYC, large bathroom and large enough closet space. Breakfast was simple but very good. Only negative there isn’t enough seating for everyone in breakfast room and sitting on soft low seating whilst trying to eat breakfast is not the best. Would like a table and chair. One let down, we was told check in open at 4 pm, we left our luggage and on return at 5:30 one of our rooms was still not ready. It’s a shame as it did not start us off on the best foot. There was also problems with the room keys, it seem to have been sorted the following day.Wi-fi is a bit slow but I suppose better than nothing. Towels are very small, would prefer a larger bath towel and we only had one robe for two people, found it odd. Location was very good, not far from Times Square subway.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: A direct view of the New Years Ball and literally steps away from Times Square. The staff made sure we had fresh robes and slippers and the room was ready on time as promised. Room service was very easy to order and delivered very fast.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed at this hotel for 9 nights in Aug/Sept. From the moment we checked in, until the minute we collected our bags prior to heading to the airport everything was perfect. The room had plenty space, we were lucky enough to have a view of the ball in Times Square, and the WiFi worked perfectly. The hotel offers a continental breakfast which was more than adequate to set you up, with a good selection of pastries, bread, muffins, bagels, cereal and fruit. There is also a ‘happy hour’ between 1730-1930 where complimentary wine/soft drinks and snacks were available. This is a lovely touch and great when returning to the hotel after a long day, or prior to heading out for the evening. The staff were very friendly, patient and helpful. The size of hotel is nice, not too large or impersonal, but not too small either. The location is great for Times Square, hop on/off buses, theatres, restaurants, subway etc., but we were not disturbed by any noise. Would definitely stay at this hotel again.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We have stayed at the Millenium Premier many times over the past 4 years. This stay did not disappoint. The location to Times Square and Broadway is great if you're seeing shows. Its close to the subway and easy to navigate from. Monique at the front desk beamed as we walked in and welcomed us back. She's a delight and made us feel welcome again. The continental breakfast and wine happy hour are a nice added treat.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The Premier Hotel by Millennium in Times Square overall was great. Had issue with charges to our account, but hoping to get resolved soon. Once resolved, would definitely stay at hotel again. The location was perfect with everything we were needing and wanting to do this trip

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Loved the location as well as the smaller boutique feel of this hotel! Staff was amazing and room was quite big for NYC! The room was also very quiet! Really enjoyed our stay here! Will for sure come back and stay here again!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: My husband and I have stayed here before, which is why we returned. We will not be making another trip. The entire visit was inconvenient. We arrived around 2:30, understandably before the 4:00 check-in, they stowed our bags but assured us they would call if our room became available, otherwise it was "guaranteed" by 4:00. We came back around 3:45 with no luck, we sat on the floor of the lobby with the dozens of others waiting for their rooms. When 4:00 rolled around, we were told they were unable to make keys, so each time a guest checked in, the desk needed to call security at the floor to let the guest into their respective room. After being told our room was "guarenteed" by 4:00, our room was not ready and so we were down graded, thankfully for a slightly lower rate. We got to our "partial view" room by 4:30 and left again by 5:30. We returned around 9:00, still no keys. This time when we got to our room, after a lengthy wait at the elevators, we realized there was no refrigerator and no coffee pot, the latter seemed particularly odd, especially for a rather pricey NYC hotel (which had a very outdated feel in general). When we received our bill in the morning, it did not reflect the new, lower price due to the downgraded room. The front desk resolved the issue and the money was credited back to our account. The saving grace was the professionalism and kindness of the staff. The front desk dealt with the leas-than-ideal key situation well, and when we did arrive to our floor, a well-mannered, well-dressed man was waiting to let us into our room.Despite recalling a great experience in the past, this stay, unfortunately, fell short of memorable for the right reasons.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We had an amazing stay at the Premier for the US Open. The room had amazing views. Monique is incredible and was on top of all of our requests or questions for our entire trip. Looking forward to coming back next year!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Found a great rate for the size of the room and the location. We had an awesome view of times square from the room but was up high enough that it was still very quiet and peaceful. The room was great, very clean, appreciated the options of netflix and youtube on the tv. Staff was very friendly and helpful. We ended up needing an extra night last minute and they were able to accommodate for an even cheaper rate than our original booking. We were in town to see a show on Broadway and this location made it so easy to go back and forth! Only thing I would maybe rate low was the complimentary breakfast which was mostly just carbs (cereal, bagels, muffins, pastrys). There was only one small fruit option and then a bowl of hard boiled eggs were the only protein. Other than that, no complaints!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The rooms were large and very clean, staff helpful ,great location right on Times Square Depending on your room some look onto Times Square but still quiet enough to sleep,l would certainly stay there again

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: A fine hotel next to times square. Had the facilities neeeded and a nice size room. Breakfast room is not that big for a full hotel. I will choose the same for my next trip. Price wise good and in line with others

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Very good hotel right on times square.We had booked a king size bed but got a queen size. (As we arrived late we didn't do anything about it and i'm sure it would have been fixed if we did)Breakfast is ok but nothing special.The bulletpoint for this hotel is the location and price.Great value for money - would stay there next time.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I was very pleased with The Premier - great location, very nice room, and a great price. The staff is very, very helpful and pleasant. Monique was especially helpful - she even offered to bring me back a slice of New York pizza on her lunch break!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: From every employee to the simply modern, gorgeous over-sized rooms, this hotel treats you like a celebrity - everything is new, clean and perfect - the large room is great with every little detail attended to. It is quiet at night and they have the most fantastic security - oh, the breakfast is well worth it!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Very convenient for Broadway and Time Square. Clean room, cool view of the top of times square, comfortable bed, polite staff. I had no issues my entire stay. Granted, I wasn't in the room much besides for sleep.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We loved this hotel. Great location right by Times Square and big spacious rooms! Only downfall was there wasn’t a fridge in the room. But other then that can’t fault it. Thoroughly enjoyed the 2 hours of cheese and wine daily included in the stay! Would highly recommend!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We loved this hotel. Our view was of the New Years Eve Ball and we were just blown away. It is close to everything in Times Square because it is centrally located. The morning breakfast was light, but completely fresh and tasty to start our day. The complementary wine and cheese each night was a spectacular way to regroup from the day and refresh for the evening. The staff were all so great - especially Angel, who provided us with a few great dining recommendations. Such a pleasant experience, can't wait to go back!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Outstanding service. Hector was the man who makes things happen. He will always take care of you! He was instrumental in giving us the most complete directions, tickets for the Hudson River Cruise and always had transportation available for us. He was Awesome!! Give that man an increase in salary! He is worth it!!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel is right in the Heart of New York City, half a block away from Times Square, a block away from Broadway, close to Rockefeller Centre, the MoMA, Central Park and surrounded by great restaurants. Really, you cannot ask for a more centric place to stay. Service wise, it is ok, probably the only issue is that if you arrive after 10pm, then you have to cross to the other hotel's lobby to check in, and even when there is someone at reception, they are not really helpful. The other issue is breakfast, which is only Continental and served in a very small room, not a great loss given that there are plenty of restaurants around, but certainly dissappointing, more so if you paid extra to have it included.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Good room dimension, modern and clean. Bathroom also very large with shower and pool. Coffee and tea supply in the room everyday to use with coffee machine. Perfect wireless connection. Problems only at breakfast: room very small and with uncomfortable furniture, and limited food choice.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: My wife and I had a great 4 day stay at the hotel. Monique, one of the front desk staff members and Patrick the baggage person, were great and made our stay very comfortable. We had room 2019 and it had a fantastic view, and only half a block from Times Square. Martin and Marti

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Great hotel. Top notch location. Easy to find from Times Square and close to the subway and theaters.I would highly recommend staying at this hotel. I traveled with my 15 year old daughter felt very safe.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: convenient, and the theater play head over heels which is in the premises of the hotel is awesome. Times square is steps away, and the view from the room is spectacular, it was well worth the money spent.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Close to Times Square, theaters, and the subway yet very quiet inside. Very helpful staff. Not sure why I have to write 200 characters for a review though but, hey, I can type a bunch of nothing and spaces count.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: A really value filled experience with an overall comfortable experience. Would definitely recommend this hotel to any travellers looking for a spot in Times Square that offers breakfast included. Complimentary cheese and wine served daily was a nice gesture too!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This was a great hotel. Location is fantastic- on a quiet ish street but seconds away from times square. Complimentary breakfast / evening drinks / wi fi / safe are bonus features that you won't see at the majority of hotels in NYC. Rooms are spacious and comfortable. They aren't massively luxurious but realistically you don't spend much time in a hotel room on this sort of holiday so was more than good enough . The concierge was helpful when required .Would recommend .

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Whenever we go to NY we like to stay at the Premier. It’s close to our our favorite shops and restaurant. The room are nicely appointed, clean and comfortable. The mezzanine reception is cozy with great ambience. They offer a free managers reception which was nice. We mingled and snacked with the other guests. Friendly and affordable for Timesquare area.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: It's my first time in NYC and the hotel is in an awesome location, being close to Times Sq. Our room was on a higher floor, was neat and comfortable! Service at the concierge was also decent, helping us keep our bags after checking out. The management might wanna check the lifts out as one of it kept stopping at the 11th floor, which was quite scary.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here on a recent trip to NYC. The hotel was as close to Times Square as we have ever stayed. Reception staff were very helpful. The room was excellent, lots of storage, free safe, large TV with many channels & good air con.Given how central we were, there wasn't any issue with noise. Breakfast was okay although some guests take advantage of the fact it is free!!Overall we were delighted with our stay and would return in the future.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel itself is nice & in a great location. Sadly it's let down by poor customer service. Our first day there was no hot water. As no-one could tell us when it would be repaired we had to have freezing cold showers as we had someone place to be. Breakfast itself was fine if you could get a table. We had no choice to eat out so it was a waste of tine payjng for a rate tgat includes breakfasf when fve facilities are inadequate. The seating arrangements were uncomfortable as the tables are lower than the chairs. When we did manage to have breakfast the member of staff was rude when we asked him to clean the table. The elevators are also very temperamental. We did try to speak to reception about the various issues but there was never anyone there. On our return home we have also emailed and completed an online enquiry form to raise our issues but no response has been received. Not the level of customer service we would expect & frankly totally unacceptable. We will not be returning to this hotel.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: My wife and I stayed at the Premiere for 7nts and loved it, so close to everything including Central Park(20min walk). Basic breakfast included, just be prepared to maybe wait for somewhere to sit. It was our first visit to NYC & would definitely stay again.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Excellent hotel, superbly positioned too. The rooms are of a excellent size. A size I wasn’t expecting. The pictures of the rooms on trip advisor don’t do it justice. I was on the fifth floor. Shower and bath in the room, coffee facilities. Excellent mix of pillows, comfortable bed. Staff are patient and pleasant- there are a few needy guests! Highly recommended

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This was our second time staying at The Premier Times Square. The price is right, the location is perfect near all the hustle and bustle of Broadway, but the rooms are so comfortable and quiet you'd never know all that excitement is out on the streets.Complimentary breakfast and happy hour are great treats.The staff is kind & knowledgeable.Highly reccomneded!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel was nice, the room was a little outdated but it could have been worse. The bed and pillows were not comfortable, but we didn't spend a whole lot of time sleeping anyway. I liked that the hotel was secure as you have to have a room pass to make the elevator work. Also, the location was great, just half a block from Time Square.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We traveled to the city to see shows on Broadway. The hotel's location is perfect as you're an easy walk, minutes away, from most theaters, and close to TKTS, too, which is a nice bonus.We stayed at the Premier, and the room was a very good size and comfortable. The breakfast that was served daily was very simple and met all our needs. The espresso machine in the mezzanine where the breakfast and afternoon happy hour was served was very nice. It was nice to have good coffee at the hotel. The staff at the hotel was very nice, always helpful with any question or requests. The hotel and its location were nice, but the staff made the stay very enjoyable.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The Millennium was a fabulous place for my daughter and I to stay. Close to broadway shows. Fabulous staff. Breakfast was good, and happy hour was great! Quiet hotel. Easy to get on the subway. The only challenge was finding the hotel - but once we figured that out, everything else went very well.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel was one of the best I have ever stayed in, it made our trip to NYC so comfortable. The location is bang in the centre of Times Square, we could not have wished for a better place to be. The staff were very polite and the room was cleaned daily. The room itself was huge! The bathroom clean and modern with a brilliant shower and bath. The bed was very comfortable and large and the tv shower various channels including access to Netflix. Literally a few steps outside and you are in the thick of things. Amazing, perfect and brilliant! Thank you so much for making our holiday so good!
