hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: You really can't beat the location as you're quite literally 'on Times Square'. Checking in and out was very easy, the room was fairly spacious and very clean. Although we didn't pay for breakfast there was complimentary breakfast at no extra charge, which filled us up more than enough. I would definitely recommend it.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We go to New York City for theater. This hotel is very convenient to walk to all the Broadway houses. I do not like long walks, and most of the theaters are within a few blocks of this Times Square hotel.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel is a gem. The staff and service at the hotel were consistently excellent. Spotless rooms with clean bed linen daily. The beds we really comfortable. The complimentary Breakfast and Happy Hour were brilliant. The location is perfect, round the corner from Bryant Park and just off Time Square. There is a coffee/tea maker in the room yet on the first flour lounge complimentary drinks are available all day. Cannot fault thus hotel and would stay again without a shadow of a doubt.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Check-In was very straightforward hotel is situated seconds from time square .Heard little or no noise considering location Room was clean and tidy but fittings looking a bit tired. Some areas needing refurbished.Very little hanging space in wardrobe for a couple ( seven coat hangers) . Complimentary breakfast was fine selection of cereal. fruit, yoghurts, toast, bagels, pastries fruit juice coffee more than enough to get you going for the day. There is complimentary drinks (wine and soft drinks ) and snacks are served Monday to Friday 5:30pm to 7:30pm Very little seating in lounge area got guests should be addressed. Carlos who looks after this area is excellent. Overall had a good stay at the Premier.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This small quiet hotel is located in the heart of the theater district, steps away from Times Square. It's a quiet oasis with nicely appointed rooms and attentive staff. The Premier will be our first choice when traveling to NYC.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Flew into New York from Europe en route to Pennsylvania. Checked in and was received with great hospitality thanks to the nice Kosovan (?) concierge. Mind you, this is a quite down to earth hotel; nothing fancy really, but it does the work, and the staff is professional and care taking. The rooms were tidy and quite, although the place is located right in the middle of the bustling theatre district on W 44th St, next to Times Square. As I had booked theatre tickets for Broadway and had to go to Philly by train (Penn Station) the next morning, the location suited my purposes very well. Loads of department stores in the area, which proved valuable as I had to make some additional purchases before moving on. Also, definitely no shortage on restaurants. Quite OK breakfast for being a budget/mid-range hotel in the US.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I am very frustrated by my stay here. For the price point and location of this hotel, I expected much better. It is not updated, it is very average and appears to be very much worn down inside the rooms.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Only thing good about this hotel is the location . Room was dated and carpet was soiled. Bathroom needed a total refit as shower tiles were mouldy and cracked also no shower screen just a shower curtain. Breakfast selection was limited and breakfast room was dated and dirty!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Wonderful experience from start to finish. The Premier has a complimentary breakfast buffet and complimentary wine & cheese in the early evening. Friendly & Courteous staff too at this boutique hotel. Monique at the front desk was really Fabulous! She let us check in early and our room was a fantastic corner view. We arrived exhausted & we were able to take a nap. Refreshed, we were able to really enjoy Hamilton!! Thank you Monique!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Location AAA. 3 minutes walk from the famous TimeSquare.Rooms are big in size and kept very tidy and up to date.Did not like the area of Breakfast.Very congested.Some time you you have to take your breakfast standing. only one attendant tocater all guests lack quality.Very basic spread.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We booked the hotel and flights via expedia about 7 months before our trip to NYC and stayed there for 10 days. The hotel itself is about 100m to times square and walking distance to most of the main sites (10min to Central Station). So - great location! A small 24/7-deli and a nice irish bar with live musiv (O’Donoghue’s) is just across the street. The hotel is part of the way bigger Millennium Broadway with a very small reception (two tables). Besides the bland reception area we can highly recommend the hotel!The rooms are around 30 sqm with a big bathroom. There were 1-2 coffee stains on the carpet, but besides that it was very clean. We had a room on the 6th floor and could see the signs of times square. If possible I would recommend a room higher than the 6th floor. The staff in the reception and in the Mezzanine-area were always very friendly and helpful. I honestly don´t get the bad service-reviews. Only the room-service could be better.In the Mezzanine-area they serve a light continental breakfast (small bagels with creamcheese, pastries and coffee) in the morning. There are only 16 chairs available so you either get there before 9am or you have to stand while taking your breakfast (or you just go out and buy a bagel at Zaro's Bakery in Grand Central Station). From 5.30 to 7.30 they also serve Managers Reception (Happy Hour) in the Mezzanine. Light snacks and white wine (red/white wine, beer, soft-drinks) are available free of charge and were a great amenity. Great plus!We definitely will come back again.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Was very happy with the choice of hotels. It was convenient to everything we were going to see and do. Some people posted the front desk staff was not helpful or unfriendly, we did not find that to be the case. Arrived early in the morning and were able to store bags in locked storage. The breakfast and evening cocktail time was an added plus! I would stay here again.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This was my first trip to NYC and I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone. The hotel is very close to times square and walking distance to most of the main sites. The hotel is part of the Millennium Broadway, but is very quaint and away from the hordes of people. They serve a light continental breakfast and a happy hour in the evening. The staff in the lobby is very helpful and happy to assist you in navigating the city. The rooms are very spacious for NYC standards and comfortable. The only part I would recommend is a mini fridge in the room to keep drinks cold or bring food back to the room (this did not affect my trip in the slightest). If you are looking at this hotel, I highly recommend!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Our last minute booking on a short trip (two days) to New York City led us to this hidden gym in the theater district on 44th street. The room was spacious as was the bathroom while staff was friendly and helpful. Complimentary food/drink during happy as well as a delicious continental breakfast was an unexpected yet delightful amenity. Lastly, the hotel was within walking distance of most major sights and activities in New York City allowing us to pack a lot into our short trip. Truly great hotel, will definitely be back.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here for 8 nights from the 11th -19th of may. I had previously been to New York with my family of 5 and stayed in the east village so this time when going with my partner I wanted to stay closer to midtown. Bare in mind that we are both in our early 20's and I am a student so I wasn't looking for anything too expensive but wanted a good location and a comfortable place to stay. I had reserved rooms in other hotels further away from times square and when I came across the deal in this hotel I was shocked to see that this hotel was coming in a lot cheaper and a lot more central then the hotels I had previously looked at. I quickly booked this hotel and cancelled all the other reservations as this was ideal for us. It was cheap and cheerful, very central and had lots of bonuses such as free Wi-Fi and a free continental breakfast.Upon check in staff were all very friendly. Check in was quick. Had a problem logging into the Wi-Fi and the staff fixed it straight away. They also sorted us with a taxi to go back to the airport and stored our luggage for us that day after check out. Staff were all so helpful! Room was huge and had lots of room for suitcases etc. Rooms were well equipped with smart TV , corner sofa, desk, coffee maker, bath & shower and hairdryer. We requested a kettle and it was brought up straight away. Room was spotless and cleaned everyday with clean towels and new toiletries. If we hadn't gone by the time house keeping came around they would ring and ask what time we wanted the room cleaned. We also had a fantastic view of the ball drop from times square right outside our window. Beds were super comfy and the shower/bath always had hot water.Breakfast was ideal considering it was free. Yoghurt, fruit, cereal, bagels, toast, pastries, juices, teas and coffees, Saves you having to pay for one somewhere else and fills a gap in the stomach. Yes the breakfast room is small but you can bring the food back to your room if you wish. Hotel was as close as you can get to times square and very close to the times square subway station and port authority. Walking distance to Macy's in herald's square, 5th avenue and central park if the weather is good.Fantastic stay and would 100% recommend.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Very nice facility in a great location near Times Square. Everything was fine except a problem with the heating system during cool weather in May. Very clean and quiet with a nice breakfast buffet and happy hour in the evening.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This Hotel is in the perfect location to get around New York. 2 min walk to Times Square but in a quiet street. Walking distance to TOTR and ESB even Central Park wasn't too far to walk.I'd heard it was tricky to find but our driver found it ok. Best way to describe the location is Gap is on the corner and its just past Virgil's on the opposite side of the road. You can also enter from the millennium next door. The room was a decent size with a large comfy bed, desk to sit at and Sofa with large flat screen TV. Good size bathroom with shower and bath. Looking a bit dated but clean and comfy and you're not in your room long. My only gripe was lack of hanging space and the wifi wasn't great. Iron, ironing board and hair dryer supplied also a free safe And coffee machine with coffee pods replaced daily.The breakfast in the morning was a good addition to get you off to a flying start but very little space to sit. Free wine, soft drinks and snacks between 5 and 7 I think. We only went a couple of times if we were back but it was a nice touch. I would definitely return one day and would have given it a 5 but for the few niggles mentioned.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Decided to try a new hotel close the the theater area. Room clean but small, hard to find entrance of hotel. Late night entrance changes. Room late arrival not ready. Pricey. I don't think I would stay again. CLEAN I have to say that!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: A cold room that couldn't be heated was the worst problem during our visit. Although we had to ask for compensation, it was approved. The price and location, however, justify putting up with problems.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We booked this hotel 6 month in advance of our stay in march. Breakfast and wifi is included when you book it on their homepage. This time we chose to take the Air-train and subway from JFK to Manhattan which worked pretty good, even with our 2 big bags. For check inn we were to early, but could leave our bags in a secured room in the hotel. When we came back we got a very nice room on 16th floor with a view of Times Square. Very big room for Manhattan, king-size bed, which we selected upon booking. We had some problems with the a/c, especially at night. So we decided to open the window at night which worked very good; not too cold, no noise from the streets. Our room - 1621 - was very clean, nothing to complain about. Small closet - but that`s Manhattan. The employee who served us at front desk for check inn was very nice - not everyone at the front desk was that nice.The Breakfast area is too small for all the guests in this hotel; every morning it was a little bit crowded. Not enough chairs/armchairs for all. Breakfast was very good. A large choice of danish, muffins, cereals, toast, bagels and some hearty things to eat, coffee, tea, milk, water, juice to drink. Weeknights they offer an evening reception - red/white wine, beer, soft drinks and snacks. We have been there 3 times and it was very good!Times Square is only a 2 minute walk away.When you want to buy some snacks, drinks, there is a whole foods market on the west-side of Bryant Park, 5 minutes to walk.We liked our stay at the Premier Times Square very much and would definitely come back.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Breakfast was included in our stay. The room were it was served was too small for the number of guests, many were having breakfast standing up. Some of the offerings for breakfast could be improved, for example the processed cheese.......
user_name:
Carlosfec
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: In the heart of the action, but just a few steps away from the massive crowds. Great hotel, great staff, great location. Easy walk from Bryant Square if using the Newark Express bus too. (don't ever try using subway with suitcases folks).Room amenities are really good. Six rooms per floor. Easy walk to most things, and the subway system solves everything else. (Grand Central - Times Square stations).

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The stay was overall poor. Good location but issues with room amenities (hot water & lack of a/c) were major issues that were not addressed, but should have. I also heard other guests experiencing the same issues as I did and were told there's nothing that can be done.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed 1 night for a concert. Booked 3 rooms with wife and family. Whirlwind stay went without a hitch. Chose this Hotel due to it's proximity to concert in Times Square. Online booking with Hotel website was easy and fast. Check-in was efficient and rooms were ready for all of us at 1;30. Rooms, hallways, lobby were all VERY clean. Rooms were contemporary and spacious (330 sq ft). Large bathroom as well. Nice complimentary continentalish breakfast included. Staff was friendly and helpful.It's a no-frills property ( no doorman,no lavish lobby, etc.) but they hit all the marks and do it right. Excellent Mid-town location on relatively quiet 44th st. between 6th and 7th.We would definitely return for another stay.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Was a good experience. All over all very satisfied. Breakfast and Aperitiv was included in the rate, so this was attractive. Some Staff of the Hotel not so friendly, but mostly cmpetent and helpful. The rooms are different of views...

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: As a frequent visitor to New York, I have stayed in many hotels (primarily in the mid-town area) and I have come to expect to pay a lot of money and not get much in return. I was pleasantly surprised to discover that The Premier Times Square was not one of these!!The hotel is ideally located on 44th street between 6th and 7th Avenues which makes for a short walk to Times Square and several subway stations.It is important to note that the Premier Times Square is adjacent to the Millennium Broadway which has a much larger lobby. It is easy to get confused. The Premier Times Square has its own lobby which is much more intimate. (You can access the Premier lobby from the Millennium Broadway lobby by walking in front of the Hudson Theatre which is sandwiched between the two hotels.)First impressions are important to me and so the (uncharacteristic for New York) extremely warm and friendly greeting from the woman manning the check-in desk set a very nice tone for our visit.The room was a nice size and featured a large flat screen TV and work desk. The king sized bed was very comfortable. The bathroom had a separate tub and shower. We stayed on the 14th floor and could barely hear even the loudest traffic noise.A real bonus is the Happy Hour where wine, soft drinks and a few snacks are served.The breakfast buffet is somewhat limited with toast, pastries, cereals, hard-boiled eggs, fresh-brewed coffee and various juices. That said, it is better than paying $30.00 per person to get the same food at a local restaurant!!The only nit that I had was that there is limited seating in the breakfast area which means that you may to eat standing up during busy times.All in all, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay and this will be our "go to" hotel when we visit New York.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: You simply can't beat the location and value. The small boutique nature of the hotel eliminates the crowded lobby and public areas, and allows for more personal interaction with the staff, who are excellent.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Myself and my daughter have just returned from a 4 night stay at the Premier & have to say we can't recommend this hotel highly enough! Check in was easy & our queen size room on the 18th floor didn't disappoint. They was plenty of room for us both along with a good sized bathroom which had a bath as well as a separate shower cubicle. Maid service was excellent, replacing bottled water, coffee for our coffee maker, toiletries and towels on a daily basis as well as generally tidying our room. The continental breakfast had plenty of choice: cereals, pastries, hard boiled eggs, cheese, toast, juices and tea and coffee & provided us with a great start to the day. This was all overseen by fab staff who were very friendly, chatty and helpful. As a bonus, we discovered that complimentary drinks and nibbles were available each evening. Drinks included wine, lagers and soft drinks. The location of the hotel couldn't have been better. Central for Times Square and within easy walking of the Empire State etc but also close to the subway if you needed to go further afield. Overall, the hotel was perfect for our short break & we were sad to leave. We'd definitely recommend the hotel & would have no hesitation in returning in the future. Thanks to all the staff who made our stay perfect!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed for 3 nights, it wasn't easy to find when we got dropped off by the taxi, it was like 11pm though. We had to check in to the adjoining hotel as noone was on the desk at ours because of the time which was fine. Room was clean, rooms cleaned well and plenty towels and products. We didn't use the concierge as we planned our own trip so can't comment. We felt like we had paid a lot of money for it with the added taxes but that was all. Bathroom was nice and we had a little sofa with a TV with enough channels on too.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: My wife and I stayed here from 30 March 2018 and left 5th April 2018. Absolutely fantastic hotel and very good location to Times Square. Breakfast every morning was good even if I didn’t have the option for good old English breakfast . Jeanette who is in the breakfast area lovely lady and if you stay make sure you say hello. Friendly staff and always happy to help. We recommend staying here and we will be back with our daughter once we’ve saved for it. If you want a good location this is fantastic.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed in this hotel for a total of five nights. The location is great, easy access to Times Square and 5th Avenue. But we were really disappointed with the housekeeping here. We left some tips on the table with a note requesting for towels but we were shocked to receive a reply on the note to call housekeeping for towels, they took the tips but did not replenish the towels and mineral water. So we called in to request for towels for a few nights, despite many calls to the housekeeping and concierge we did not receive our towels. So we used the face towels from day 2 till our last day. We are very disappointed with such poor service and would never recommend anyone to even consider this place for a stay.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed in this hotel with my mother and couldn’t fault the hotel or the staff, the staff were very welcoming and very helpful. the hotel is in a great location and the room was bigger than I expected it to be!. Free complimentary WiFi was great in our room on the 12th floor never had a problem with it.And free breakfast in the morning to was great!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This is one of the nicest hotels I have ever stayed at in NYC! The rooms are HUGE by NYC standards - over 330 square feet. The location is perfect- so close to Times Square, the complimentary breakfast and evening wine and cheese reception are a nice perk.Only thing I would add is a refrigerator in the room.I will definitely make this my hotel of choice for future NYC trips!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The location is great, right aroud the corner from Times Square. Hop on Hop off-buses and metro etc. really close. You can walk to various attractions and to Madison Square Garden in 10 minutes.The hotel isn’t a four star hotel any more though. It is definately a bit outdated and the lady at the desk is more interested in everything else than customer service. We really needed to negotiate to get the room we had booked via hotels.com and you could tell she didn’t work for tips.Also prepare for a bill for housekeeping $10 per night + taxes. This wasn’t mentioned anywhere and was charged from the credit card you had to show when checking in.The breakfast was 2/5. The room was small and you didn’t always get a table right away. The TV in the room was also loud and every morning the glases for juice ran out. The only fresh food was pineapple and melon.In the end our room was ok with a nice view. The room and the bathroom were both spacious and we had a good bed so we slept well! This gave us a good basis for a nice trip and that we really had in NYC!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel was reasonably priced in an amazing location one block from the heart of Time Square and all Broadway shows!! Complementary wine and cheese were available daily in a comfy lounge. Breakfast was toobut it was not much more than danish so make plans to eat breakfast at a restaurant. Front desk Staff were friendly and helpful!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We traveled to NYC from Tennessee and stayed here. The hotel is very nice and clean and is very close to Times Square. Our favorite hotel staff person was Monique. She was awesome and friendly. We got engaged in this hotel! We would definitely stay again.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I've stayed at this hotel before but on this trip I was very disappointed with the lack of professionalism from the staff at the front desk during check in and in their inability to resolve the lack of wifi in my room. I asked on three separate occasions for them to address the lack of wifi in the room and they couldn't do anything. My devices could connect to the network in the hallways but not in the actual room, which isn't much help. I asked them to remove the $10/night facility fee since they couldn't address my concern which they were unwilling to do. I can understand technical issues or mistakes, but I will not do business with a hotel--the hospitality industry--when they are rude and refuse to try and make their mistake right. The rooms are comfortable and it's a nice location. It's a shame the staff isn't better because I won't stay here again.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel was wonderful! The location was absolutely perfect! The room and bathroom were spacious and every detail was attended to! The continental breakfast was such a refreshing addition! We will definitely be booking here again on our next New York vacation!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The Premier/Millenium is a great hotel. The bed is super comfortable. Closet space is average but my in my room it was too close to the entrance door. I've stayed here before and will stay again. Great spot & awesome service.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Upon arriving there it was great. The hotel lobbyist checked us in early, talked to us and did fantastic basic hospitality expectations . When we got to the room it was so hot and then the A/C was non existent. Thy charged my girlfriends credit card $192 for no reason and no explanation. Since there was no ice machine in any floor we had to call housekeeping for it. Every time I called for a bag it took about 3 calls and then always between 20-30 mins for ice. The bathrooms were a nice size and was awesome having separated bath and shower but the bath tubs water , when used both times, came out brown. #Gross. We never had a mini fridge in or room and called down to get one. I expected it to go in a little area in a corner by a power outlet but nooo, it was in the middle of the room and completely in the way of everything.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here for 3 nights and really enjoyed my stay. Had a corner room and it was fantastic, nice size with great decor. All the staff were super friendly and helpful. Very impressed with this hotel and a great location. Absolutely would stay again.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This was a big mistake on my part. I was booking the Millennium Broadway for a second visit when a pop-up offered what looked like a great offer on a room in The Premier, after being given the impression it was an addition to the Millennium I went ahead and booked. When we arrived from London we were shocked that we had gone from what we thought was a proper reception greeting and a clean functional room with all the expected facilities, to some guy behind a small desk we had to wait around for and a room with all sorts of broken or cracked everything. Pipes loose and moving in and out of the walls. Stained lampshades, carpets and curtains.It was late so my wife stayed in the room waiting as I went down to the Millennium reception to see what could be done. We had to stay in that room for one night then the following afternoon we were able to get a room in the Millennium.One last note, the breakfast facilities in The Premier is a small room with limited seating and no tables. We walked in and then walked out again to go somewhere better.This hotel is for people on a very tight budget who want a no-frills stay, but I would suggest finding a better option for the same cost away from Times Square.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed at the Premier for 4 nights and overall had a very good stay. First of all, the price was great - $200 per night (plus taxes/fees around $50) and we were steps away from Times Square. The room was plenty big for us with a cozy tv area (tho we didn't even turn on the tv once) and a work area. Also, nice closet and coffee area and the bathroom was spacious. The bed was super comfy. Wish there were outlets on each bedside table (I had to crawl under the bed to plug in my cell phone charger) We had a few issues with the room temperature. One night we were really hot and could not adjust the temp and that is when maintenance told us that there was no AC. They kindly opened the windows for us and problem solved. The hot water in the shower was very sporadic. Some mornings it was just adequate. One evening there was no hot water. The day we checked out, it was the perfect temperature. My favorite thing was the Wine and appetizer hour and the Continental breakfast (there was real fruit :) every day. Not just weekdays like some hotels but every day :) The staff there was very attentive and friendly. Overall, we enjoyed our stay despite the brutally cold weather!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Great staff and reception. Best localization ever for an affordable price Modern roomsVery good breakfast 01 minute walk from Times Square Wonderful restaurant in the same street 2 blocks from Broadway Near metro station.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This is superbly located on the 44th street, right besides Times Square. We were right in the midst of a wide choice of Broadway shows, must-see New York sights and a plethora of restaurants. The hotel itself is very good - very nice rooms & bathrooms and excellent housekeeping service. There is no on-site restaurant but this doesn’t matter as there are plenty of choices within walking distance, including a good breakfast place right next door. The only reason that I held back a fifth star is that they wouldn’t let me check in at 12 noon as check in is at 3pm

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We travelled from Edinburgh to Stewart international airport direct with Norwegian airlines- total of £210 return - bargain. Immigration took about 10 minutes - we had heard of some people taking nearly 2hrs at JFK. We took the airport bus direct to Port Authority Bus Depot - $40 return - it did take approx 1.5hrs - some travellers were taking similar times from JFK and it cost them $60 each way in a taxi - no brainier - we would defiantly use this airport again. Very small approx the same size at London City Airport - very small duty free shop though.The hotel was wonderful - cost $5 in taxi from bus depot to hotel. Room was spotlessly clean and quite big - bathroom huge. Checkin was very efficient - they did take $50 out of my account - I presume just incase we used room service - this amount was refunded on departure.Breakfast was free and included cereals- fresh fruit - yoghurt - pastries - bagels - bread etc - coffee etc. It was enough for us to last until tea time.The cocktail hour was actually 2 hours from 5.30pm-7.30pm and included red and white wine - finger sandwiches - cheese and biscuits and salads - we used this every evening and probably saved ourselves $100 per night - we probably had about 4 drinks each. Staff there were lovely and very attentive - we could not fault them xDrinking and eating in Times Square we found was expensive - approx $16 for a glass of Chardonnay and $25 for a burger (Planet Hollywood).Times Square gets manic in evening and very busy. We got a freedom pass which cost £112 each - this included 3 days unlimited travel on open top bus and our choice of 7 excursions - we were also given a nighttime bus tour - a river cruise - free entry to Comedy Club and a voucher for discounts in numerous shops. We used it for 911 museum - One World Observatory - startup of Liberty/Staten Island - the rockerfeller centre observation Deck - Empire State observation deck - we ran out of time so used the other two on meal vouchers $25 each per visit.This freestyle pass probably saved us $100’s on doing everything individually xEverything is relatively quite close to hotel - Times Square is under 1 minute walk - Central Park approx 20 mins - Rockerfeller Center approx 25 mins and Empire State approx 30 mins.We felt very safe at all times as there are loads of security personal in Times Square and all attractions have airport security in place xWe would highly recommend this hotel xx

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Room and location good but staff unhelpful, they said they didn't have a reservation for us although we had a voucher stating the dates and fully paid for, eventually sorted it out (with no help from them might I add) but they still retained money from our card which should have been for $50 dollars but they have kept almost $900, they assured us we would get it back but to date we are still waiting (over a week now), we raised this on numerous occasions with them but they have totally ignored it, and we were not the only guests that they had failed to reserve a room for.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here for 3 nights. Great spot just off Times Square, but surprisingly quiet. Big full height windows, good size room, big bathroom with shower and sep bath. Added bonus of managers drinks early evening and decent continental breakfast. Friendly staff. Only minor drawback the heating could be a little more effective in the room.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here many times. Really nice little hotel. Unfortunately the exercise room is next door in the Millenium Hotel, necessitating a trek to/from. Good working desk setup. Otherwise strongly recommend.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I booked this hotel on Travelocity due to it’s decent price-given it was close to New Years and we wanted to be near Times Square. Upon arrival, the desk clerk was very rude and seemed annoyed to have to help us. They gave us hand written directions to the garage we were to park our car in and when we arrived there the valet told us they were NOT affiliated with the hotel and didn’t know why we would get sent there. After numerous phone calls they agreed to park our car but we were charged double the amount the hotel told us. When we checked into our room it was freezing cold and we had no thermostat face plate so could do nothing to heat the room. We called down and they said they would fix it no problem. We go out for awhile and come back after midnight to a cold room and still no face plate. Call downstairs and have to wait for maintenance. The guy sees there is no thermostat and then we have to wait for him to go find one. Twenty minutes later he puts it in and we are able to turn the heat on and finally go to bed. The next morning we tell the lady at the front desk and she says, “oh sorry” and continues on with her day. Needless to say, we will not be going back.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This is our favorite hotel in NYC so far. It’s close to everything! Time Square and Broadway right at your fingertips. The staff is friendly and very helpful. The Manager’s Reception on the Mezzanine was delightful! The ambience was sexy, comfortable and the highlight of our stay. I can’t wait to come back!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I loved the location, once you step outside of the hotel its about 15 steps to the middle of Times Square. It was very close to the subway which we used a lot to get around and being right in the middle of Times Square, also very close to numerous stores. I was worried about the size of the room because everyone complains about small rooms in NY but I was not disappointed by it on arrival. The room was a good size for two people. It was very cold, we cranked up the heat in hopes that it would help, it didn't. I slept on the side of the bed closest to the window (about 6 feet or so from the window) and froze the first night. I asked for a second blanket on the second night and it wasn't too bad. I think the problem is that there is a door that leads outside (not accessible to guests) that is part of the huge window. Thew view wasn't terrible but there is not much to see from our room, we stayed on the second floor in room 225. You can also hear all the city noise but I am able to sleep through loud noise. The staff is not friendly but that seemed to be the case with every New Yorker we came across.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I opted to stay at the Premier Hotel as a last minute option as the hotel I usually stay at had bumped up it's prices considerable, and I am very glad I did. The hotel is well located, clean and the room was a good size. The staff were friendly and helpful. I will definitely go back.Found the hotel slightly difficult to locate upon arriving. The front of it’s sister hotel, the Millennium, is very obvious as is the front of the Hudson Theatre next door. On the other side of the Hudson theatre, there is a glass rotating door which takes you into the lobby of the Premier (this can also be accessed by entering the Millennium, turning right immediately, going past the suitcases and through the doors into the Hudson Theatre Lobby and out the other side).The Premier feels much more like a modern boutique hotel as soon as you enter the lobby. Check in was quick and efficient (the queue I’d passed in the Millennium was very long by comparison) and you never have to wait long for a lift.The room was spacious, clean and kept warm for arrival which was appreciated when it was around -10 degrees C outside! There is a safe, umbrella and coffee machine (with tea capsules as well as coffee) in the room. The only thing that I felt was missing was a fridge. The room was very quiet in terms of noise (as was the hotel in general), impressive given it’s next door to a theatre and its proximity to Times Square, which meant that I got a great sleep each night.The bathroom is the biggest bathroom I’ve had in a New York hotel and it was great to have both a shower and separate bath. The only slight downside was that the bathroom was colder than the main room and the heating didn’t seem to reach the bathroom as much.Many of the amenities and services are in the sister hotel the Millenium, but thankfully you do not have to go outside to use these as you can go through the lobby of the Hudson. Found the staff at both hotels to be very helpful when I needed to go between and find anything. Breakfast is complementary and served on the second floor of the Premier. A huge plus point for me was the joint mail centre in the Millenium, which meant that I could get a parcel shipped to the hotel. Other four star hotels I’ve stayed in in this area have charged ridiculous fees for even one package so I really appreciated being able to go and collect it with little hassle (a message was left on the phone in my room telling me it had arrived).There is obviously plenty to do in the surrounding area, including a grocery store (Whole Foods on Bryant Park) a number of coffee shops, pharmacies, shops and more. There are two subway entrances within three blocks and it’s also only a few blocks away from Bryant Park where you can get buses to the various airports around the City.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: clean room, great location and nice breakfast! Easy walking distance to times square and subway. Breakfast included a nice variety of choices. Room was quiet. Pillows werenot great but other than that it was a nice find!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: My son is 8 and is fascinating by New York City and especially it's buildings. This hotel was affordable, clean and yes quiet, despite Times Square being visible from our window. It was easy for us to take the train in to Grand Central and walk to the hotel although that might be too much for some. We visited Central Park, Rockefeller Plaza, Top of the Rock, and MoMA, my son really isn't capable of a full day of walking 6-10 miles. Times Square makes a good central location to transfer to different lines and we took advantage to ride down to Liberty Island/Statue of Liberty. Every staff member we encountered was fantastic and considerate. We were allowed to check in early. On our final night, my son was so exhausted, he had a small accident in the bed. The staff was fantastic about it and we left without any problem. Our room was equal in quality and size to a much more prestigious chain, it had a king bed, large bathroom and L-Shaped couch. Floor to ceiling windows that we could see MTV Studios in Times Square from. We were there in the summer and one block over the Avenue was closed and we ate tons of various food from all over the world for much less than any restaurant in the area.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: What's not to like about the Premier? It's no more than a five-minute walk from Times Square, 6 or more Broadway theaters, and great places to eat (several just across the street). The rooms have a nice modern vibe with lots of conveniences, are very quiet, and are kept spotless by the housekeeping staff. Best of all is the wonderful, always friendly staff, all of whom bend over backwards to meet your needs and make you feel at home. When I add all these features to its reasonable prices, what I get is my favorite NYC hotel. I wouldn't stay anywhere else.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We enjoyed our stay while celebrating our 65th wedding anniversary. Our visit was enhanced by the staff in reception. We have spent our last 15 anniversaries at the Milliennium and Premier and hope to be back next year.  Newt and Renee Gold

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Great location. Had free continental breakfast. Friendly staff. Large room for NYC. Spacious bathroom, small shower with mold on curtain. The bed coverings thin, the room was cold even with heat turned up.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: My boyfriend and I stayed here for one night on December 13th and it was beautiful. We walked past the hotel because it almost hidden but once you get to your room it does not disappoint! The rooms are so spacious for NYC. The bed was so comfy and their was a separate area for a couch. We were on the 18th floor so our view was breathtaking. We had full city views and it even snowed that night which made it more beautiful. The bathroom was gorgeous with a separate bath tub and then a walk in shower next to it. At 7 pm they were giving wine and cheese for FREE! Also, in the morning, the continental breakfast was free too. Great walking distance to everything. For a one night stay we certainly felt very comfortable and would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Poor maintenance of room. My room had a faulty TV, used towels, dirty sofa set and lacking of items such as toilet paper. Very disappointing for such an established hotel at such a price point. Staff are snobbish and arrogant. Basically, what could have gone wrong, did go wrong during my stay here. I would recommend for you to look elsewhere.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Great location 2 blocks from time square , The staff was very friendly, rooms clean but old style. the lounge was included and it save us time to look for a breakfast, however the menu was very limited.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: A wonderful experience as always. In a world of constant change the Premiere is consistent in terms of its excellent staff and service. It is perfectly located at the center of things but manages to maintain a quiet and soothing atmosphere. I WILL keep coming back!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Premier! It was a nice, quiet location that was close enough to Times Square w/o being right in it. It was also nice having a quick breakfast and afternoon snack available.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Although it was a frigid day, lightly snowing, we enjoyed two days in New York in part because of the Premier Times Square by Millenium. The room was clean and reasonably priced mid-week. The hotel was half a block from the theater we were going to. Because The Premier is connected to the Millenium Broadway, you can enter from both 44th and 45th Streets, a blessing in inclement weather and when traveling by taxi.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel is a great find just off of Times Square. It’s central location make exploring NYC very easy and enjoyable. This is hotel will surprise you. Check in was excellent. We had a flight that arrived early. Expecting to drop our bags and get our room later we were told that a room was ready. This started our trip off with a bang. The rooms may be a little dated but are some of the cleanest we have stayed in. The security features make you feel very safe. The breakfast is very good with all you want in a continental. Coffee and tea are available all day. The managers reception is a added bonus. It is nice to unwind with a snack and a glass of wine at the end of the day before you head out for the night. The wine selection is limited but the choice they made is very good. All in all I chalaange you to find a better hotel at this location for the money. Thank you to the staff for making our first NYC trip an enjoyable experience. New Yorkers are some of the nicest people we have met in our travels. Their willingness to help is genuine unlike other locations we have visited. Almost forgot, if you want to enjoy the perks you need to book direct with the hotel not through a 3rd party but it is the same price as the discount sites.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Hotel is clean. Staff friendly. Rooms large. Great location and close to Times Square and subway. Highly recommend. This was our second stay. Best hotel for the $$$. Don’t hesitate to stay here. Great.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel is wonderful! The staff were very nice and helpful. Our room was clean and much larger than I expected. The hotel is a block off of Time Square and convenient to everything! We walked where ever we wanted to go.  The breakfast in the mornings and the manager’s reception in the evenings was an added bonus, with really good food served. I am definitely looking forward to coming back for another visit. Thanks for helping to make our NYC trip a success.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Definitely not a pampering. My wife and I stayed here for three nights. The staff was friendly and helpful. A few repairs were needed in the room in general. It served the purpose of giving us a place to sleep. If the prices are low, it’s not a bad place to rest.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Great boutique style hotel adjacent to the Millennium Hotel. Only 6 rooms per floor, and just a half block off of Times Square, this is a very quiet place to stay. Morning continental breakfast buffet and an evening happy 2 hours with wine, soft drinks, and appetizers get you ready for a full day and a wind down into your evening, and it’s included with your room rate. Very near all subways, Broadway, Times Square, Bryant Park, Grand Central, and 5th Avenue Shopping. Exceptionally clean. A definite find.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel location is it’s high point, just 1/2 block from the excitement of Times Square. The room was generally clean. They had free WiFi and smart TVs in the room.We checked in on a Saturday and had to wait 5-10 minutes until someone arrived at the desk to check us in. After checking in we headed to our room and the cleanliness was acceptable. Trying to settle in we noticed there was no fridge in the room (although a cabinet that appeared to have once held a fridge was there. We figured we would survive with out the fridge and just hit the ice machine to chill out wine. Unfortunately after walking around the hotel ice bucket in hand we found out the hotel does not have ice machines. The person at the front desk told us to go to the lounge and they could get us ice. When we arrived at the lounge no one was to be found. Raising the white flag we decided to just head out and explore, we could get ice later. Once we returned we fulfilled our quest for ice, we bought a bag at Walgreens.There was a happy hour which was nice, but the way the lounge was set up it felt awkward so we had a drink and left. This was also the location for breakfast the next morning. For breakfast it was uncomfortable because there are no tables to eat at, just coffee tables and end tables.Over all if amenities are not important to you like ice, hotel staff, fridge and hotel information then this may be a place for you. Oh I almost forgot, to tell about the amenities they did have, there is a bathroom scale for those of you who watch their weight on vacation, one robe for two to share, and an umbrella (insert eye roll here).

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here for one night —- it was FANTASTIC! Staff were friendly, room was clean, breakfast was a bonus and the location was great! We had a spacious room on the 18th floor with an incredible view of the NYE ball in Times Square.Overall, it felt like we hit the hotel room jackpot!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We had read really good reviews and got an online deal that was difficult to refuse (more than 50% down from a pretty high original price). But the overall experience was pretty disappointing. The Hotel is a mini-skyscraper with a really small reception area (like that of a small condominium) with almost no personnel to receive you. Upstairs the rooms are relatively small, with low quality mattress&pillows, no extra-blankets, a deafening AC, and a gap under the front door that a big rat could easily walk in. We filled it with a bath towel for the night. In addition, the receptionist did not direct us to the hotel-sponsored garage, so we paid 25 extra bucks for the night parking across the street, and the breakfast (included in our rate) was a very basic cold self-serve in a small lounge on the mezzanine level. Altogether, not really terrible, but not comfy at all.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Location is perfect for sightseeing just around the corner of Times Square. Breakfast is ok, very small and not much variety, if you catch the wrong time no space to sit and have your coffee.Stuff at arrival was not really friendly and welcoming us as we expect it from a 4* hotel.No fridge in room, room quite small but that's NYC.Cleaning woman was calling us every day if/when we leave the room (always around 11:45am) and one time was waiting in front of our door, sitting around.Room was clean, but especially hair dryer was not put back to it's place on any day. no slippers

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: My husband and I were looking forward to our reservation at The Premier. We had stayed at the Millennium Broadway a number of times and were told that The Premier would be an upgraded experience. Unfortunately, it was not. The room was a bit larger than the Millennium but the layout was such that the extra space was just a waste. The lighting was poor and you have to search for outlets - there are none by the bedside tables. There is also no direct phone access to the front desk - you have to go through the Millennium switchboard. When I called to ask for the location of the ice machine, I was told that ice delivery was a perk of staying at The Premier and then proceeded to wait on hold for someone to answer my call. Upon check in I was given a faulty key to the mezzanine floor (light breakfast and wine and cheese are offered there) and made to feel like an idiot that I wasn't using it properly. I'm glad we booked far enough in advance that we got a good rate for this hotel. I will not be recommending it or using it again.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel suited my needs- the location for my business was perfect. A small boutique hotel, including breakfast- a gift! Reasonably priced for a NYC hotel, and the rooms larger than the usual NYC room for this price.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Not having the heater work during a freeze warning weekend is probably the worst thing a visitor can experience. ESPECIALLY when you are traveling from Los Angeles and are not accustomed to this kind of weather

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The Premier is attached to the Millennium, but if you didn't know this you will have a hard time finding it as the name is printed in tiny block letters on the wall. The staff in the lobby are friendly and helpful. The rooms are ok, but the shower is very small and mine had some mildew on the wall. It does have a large bathtub if you like tubs. There is a comp. breakfast but very limited space to sit and eat. there is also a comp. bar from 5:30 t0 7:30pm.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Worth every penny!! This is a lovely, small boutique hotel right in the middle of the theater district. It certainly isn't the least expensive hotel you can find, but considering the amenities, it is definitely the best value!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Back again in The Premier and not disappointed. Great hotel 2 minutes walking from Times Square. Very friendly staff. Good breakfast and evening cocktail from 5:30 to 7:30 pm. Big room, clean and very confortable bed. Will come back again

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The Premier Hotel is so nice and spacious. The rooms were quite and a nice getaway from the hustle and bustle of New York. The staff was very friendly. This will be my hotel now every time I come to New York!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Due to a reservation error on our part, we had to book a room in a different hotel for our last night in NYC. We had been staying in another (much more expensive) hotel close by for a business conference. So, this was the one we selected. Oh gosh I so wish we had stayed here for our first NYC trip. What a fantastic gem of a place.From the moment the doorman greeted us, this was just full on fabulous. What a total star he was, we were laughing so much at his jokes that our sides hurt. I would suggest getting him to valet park your car, the road is one way only and that proved a little tricky for our friend who was driving. The receptionist was efficient, very professional and warm. The reception area is small and bright and modern, infact the whole feel is simple and clean. Our room wouldn't be ready for another hour or so, so we were told that we could avail ourselves of complimentary drinks in mezzanine level bar and that if we needed a space to change clothes or prepare for our business meeting that day, one would be made available for us. AMAZINGLY helpful. Our room was ready and we were shown up - LARGE - wonderfully spacious, bright and modern. Clean as a button. A very comfortable bed. Plenty of hanging space, tea and coffee making facilities, but no-mini bar. Sofa, occasional chair ... very spacious. Better yet - QUIET. As we were no longer in the main drag it was lovely and quiet - bliss, not need for ear plugs. We slept like babies.The bathroom was modern and well designed, again very spacious.A good sized bath, a separate shower, excellent water pressure. A shower curtain which puzzles me as it seemed a little twee and out of place. Brilliant hairdryer, well lit vanity and did I mention space ? Lovely soft white towels,bathrobe and slippers.Sadly we only spent one night here, but hand on heart if I ever make it back to NYC for another conference I am booking in here. We had to leave early to catch our flight home, but our friends stayed on until that afternoon and we were informed that that really enjoyed a lovely breakfast.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The best thing about this place is that it is minutes from almost anything. The hotel is literally 1/2 a block off Times Square. It is one block from the 1, 2, 3, RR, N,Q, S and 7 subway lines. As a result....any where in NYC seemed really close.The rooms are large, clean and maybe a bit dated. But for the price....and location...you really couldn't ask for more. Pay directly via the hotel website and you get breakfast included. The staff was really friendly and accommodating.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here for 10 days. Convienently located in the heart of Time Square with multiple subways in the vicinity. The room was spacious and clean. We had a comfortable stay during our time there. Small Breakfast of pastries, coffee, fruits and cereal was provided every morning in the mezzanine. One issue however, is that there is no left turn for cars to enter the street from the main road, which made it difficult for our Uber/Lyft drivers to pick us up as they could not enter and have to go around. There is also no refrigerator in the room. The lift to the mezzanine for breakfast never worked .. you either have to go to the ground floor and ask reception for another lift card or walk the stairs to the mezzanine. Hopefully this issue would be resolved.The staff were helpful and polite. Overall a comfortable stay.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Loved staying at the Premier hotel. We had a King room with amazing city views & good enough glimpses to Time Square. The walk is 30 seconds to Time Square!!!!! The rooms are not far from needing an upgrade but they are still good enough to get away with it. Our bed was very comfortable but my pillow was way too hard!! No fridge made it a pain to store incidentals. We found we could easily hear the people next door through the adjoining door, so hope my cough didn't keep them awake all night :( The man who checked us in failed to tell us about the mezzanine dining room with complimentary breakfast and aperitif 2 hours every evening!!!! Nor did he give us an access key!!!! We stumbled on it the 2nd day while using the computer/printer on the same floor. We would have been very PISSED OFF if we had found out we'd missed this!!!! It is very generous of the hotel to offer this extra, great selection of food for breakfast & happy hour including wine and soft drinks. Also we found the service from every waiter on the mezzanine exceptional!!! They were attentive, ready to serve and friendly!!! Thank you, an awesome way to finish a big sightseeing day in New York!!!! We went to the Irish Pub, O Donahues & Virgils over the road and found them both great!! We also went to a great little Italian place, Bella Vita Pizzeria & Trattoria just off time Square on 43rd St after seeing Aladdin & it was very authentic casual Italiano. Don't tell Mama, piano bar is definitely worth going too as well. Our experience at Premier Hotel was great and we would definitely stay again if ever we return to New York.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Every thing was wonderful will be coming back again, room was ready on arrival ,clean , had every thing we needed , was a great location with in walking distance to every thing we wanted to do. staff was very friendly , helped us out with all our questions and needs.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Quiet and intimate hotel with first-class service and facilities in the heart of Times Square and Broadway theatre district. A little pricey but worth it. Spacious rooms. Pre-dinner drinks and nibbles were complimentary.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This is by far and away the best hotel I've stayed at in Manhattan over the years on our kind of budget. Great location (felt safe), with our spacious, well-decorated room having a good view and being very quiet indeed. Staff were always attentive and very polite. The free breakfast, and 'happy 2 hours' on weekdays, were a real bonus- all making for an excellent 6 night stay. Thank you. Mark and Debbie

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Fast check in, and superb location! close to everything in times square. Nice bedroom the only negative feedback is the size of the shower, very uncomfortable too small.. I was on the 7th floor and no street noises so very good sleep quality.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Perfect place and good service.keep it up!!Would love to see more selections for breakfast. Everyday we have clean sheets and towels which is excellent and very comfortable bed.location is perfect and best value for price

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel was clean, staff friendly, the room was spacious and had good lightning. The hotel is very centrally located and the breakfast was nice. Friendly, quick and helpful staff. Would definitely recommend this to others.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel has such an amazing location, right in Times Square. Checking in process was quick, rooms are great size and the bathroom is very larger. They serve morning and afternoon snacks which are great. Staff is great! Definitely will staying here again.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I highly recommend The Premier Times Square by Millennium. The staff and service are impeccable. The rooms are very large and clean and the most comfortable beds. The price is reasonable for being right there in Times Square which is walking distance to most everything. We loved this place and will be back for our next visit to New York City

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Absolute best hotel - no issues what so ever - price was reasonable, hotel and room gorgeous - the view outstanding, location steps away from times square. I went there for 5 year anniversary with my wife and we were both at awe... would definitely go back!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel was a great find for my wife and me. The location is fantastic with a nearby Metro station and proximity to Times Square and shows. We toured all of Manhattan in seven days and enjoyed the hotel continental breakfast and evening reception. Our room was very quiet and clean.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The room was very large for New York City and so close to Times Square. The bed in our room was not a queen, it was a full size mattress. But it was very comfortable. The room was spotless, however it seems as it was set up for a single rather than for the two of us. When we asked for a couple of extra towels we were told that would be no problem but they never were added. The Premier is something of a sister hotel to the adjacent Millennium Broadway hotel. Our room faced away from 44th Street which may be why it was so quiet. We never heard any street noise at all! We would definitely stay here when we return to NYC.
user_name:
John C
Clermont, Florida, United States

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Very nice, quiet hotel. Friendly staff. Only problem was the bed was too small. Very close to everything. Make sure you go to John's pizza right down the street a few blocks. Awesome pizza!!! We would stay here again

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Extremely helpful front desk staff. Room is spacious given the size of hotel room in Times Square area. The hotel location is excellent. However, the bed is somewhat smaller than what I expected. Other than that, all good!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel is not only in the best location, it is almost hidden from the hustle and bustle of Times Square.The rooms are bright and airy with floor to roof windows. The room is modern and sleek with a comfortable couch. The TV has ALL the channels you could possibly want. The bathroom has a a shower AND tub. If you reserve your room on the hotel website you get access to the lounge where you get a free breakfast and an evening reception with wine and snacks. The staff is beyond professional and remember your every need. We will be back.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: First time in New York. Chose this hotel after reading many reviews. Room was clean but needs a re paint. Needed extra hangers, robe and got them immediately. A great location and our room on the 17th floor had fantastic views

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We were delighted by the Premier Time Square. Only seven rooms each floor but good size with nice bathroom, couch and space to move. Modern decor as in photos on web. Very close to everything Broadway but not noisy. Nor the hustle bustle of a large hotel. We were delighted when we mentioned not having a fridge to reception, that one was delivered. Unexpected but really helpful for a one week stay holidaying in New York. The lounge is a gem also for Millenium members or those with certain bookings. I never use the overpriced restaurants in hotels for breakfast or dinner - they are a dead idea. The lounge let us get get a coffee and a light breakfast at no charge and was much appreciated, as was somewhere to flop after a busy day. This is a winner of an idea. Never use a hotel restaurant for overpriced breakfast or a bar, but this was just great, felt like a special treat (even if we were probably paying for it in the rate). Modern rooms, good price, great location, low stress accomodation. The staff were friendly too.Definitely recommend to friends for visiting NYC for 1-10 days.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here during an August stay to New York. Firstly, walk out of the hotel and turn right - Times Square is about 50m in front of you, excellent location!Hotel looks nice and new, even standard room is fairly good size with sofa and TV in the room.One thing to mention, if you are on a lower floor on the inside edge, the air con fans are very loud which you can hear coming from outside! Takes a bit of work to take your mind off the noise when trying to sleep.The breakfast was okay, decent continental style. Nice that you can make a coffee in disposable cup to take with you. This room is rather small (same room as used for afternoon drinks) so you may have to wait for a seat to become available.The drinks in the afternoon (free) were a good touch, nice afternoon beer or wine and snacks before getting changed in the evening.Reception very friendly and helpful.The hotel is kind of like an annex to the Millennium, so on the last day (they kindly kept our luggage in a room until we left - and also ordered us a private cab) I asked for a changing room, but had to go through to the Millennium and up to the gym to get changed. Overall great hotel, would love to go back one day, albeit staying on a higher floor (away from the air-con generators) !

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Very efficient and location is excellent. The staff are friendly. I wouldn't recomend any meal plan as there is enough in and around Times Square. Access to subway, restaurants, bars and immediate attractions are simple.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Loved staying at the Premier. Large and comfy room. Large bathroom. Finally a more than decent TV in a hotel room and much to our surprise we were able to log on to Netflix! Breakfast had plenty of choices and we also enjoyed the wine reception in the afternoon. Friendly staff. Perfect location for us theater lovers, right in the middle of the theater district.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: My family and I have been coming to Millenium/Premier for 10 years. Monique and the wonderful Premier staff greet us like family. I hope we can continue staying with you for another 10 years. Katherine Carr

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: A good hotel and good value for money .Spacious rooms. Comfy king beds and bathroom with all accessories.The location is excellent next to Times Square, with lots of metro lines. The staff are lovely, attentive and always willing to help.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Everything was great, starting with the breakfast over the afternoon snack and a good night's sleep in very comfortable beds. And we had (room No 1421) a nice view to the corner of times square. Many thanks for a perfekt stay and we will come back!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Wonderful Hotel spacious rooms staff goes above and beyond!!!! Location could not have been better. View from room was of the Times Square ball. This will not be our last visit to the Premier. Thanks for a wonderful trip.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: One word sums up everything about The Premier- Wonderful!! From the moment you arrive til the moment of departure everyone makes you feel and home, and is also the utmost professional.The rooms, the decor, the nice touch of wine/cheese and continental breakfast are all a plus. Can't wait til the next get away if feasible.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: nice hotel, very clean, directly in times square but very quiet. We stay in premier hotel with the lounge at night and for breakfast for the second time. Staff very friendly and professionnal. We recommand this hotel

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I was disgusted upon arriving at the hotel at 2 pm, to be told straight in my face not to expect an early check-in. Surely, there is a better way to greet a guest. I told her that I didn't expect a room until 4 pm. The hotel is well-known for not admitting guests until after 4 pm. That has been the review I read, so I wasn't expecting an early check-in. But I expect courteous and friendly service. That was totally absent.Next, the air-con had problems. I had to wait for the 3rd day for an enginner to fix the noise. In my next trip to NY, I will surely give The Premier a miss !!!!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: My husband and I, with another couple, stayed at Premier last year and were surprised when Priceline gave us this hotel this year when our criteria was a '4 star or better'. This hotel is located in a convenient area near Times Square, though it's front door is tough to find if you don't know where you're going. We arrived in NYC too early to check in and the 2 people at reception barely made eye contact with us and didn't even want to know our names...though the bellman was cordial enough to ask so that we could store our bags for a few hours.The rooms are large enough but the shower in the bathroom was beyond small. The shower could have been made larger without the large bathtub that takes up so much valuable real estate. There was a hook in the shower stall that was coming out of the wall & my wash cloth almost pulled it out completely. The hair dryer had to be replaced as the cord would continually retract and you couldn't get more than a few inches of cord to pull out and stay out.There are nicer hotels in NY that are comparably priced and we'll likely stay at one of them next time we're in the city. Also...we found this visit that if you book this hotel with something like Priceline or Expedia, you will not have access to the hotel's mezzanine level to partake of their continental breakfast in the morning or their 'happy hour' drinks in the afternoon. These were available to us last year, but it seems that they have recently changed the rules.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel is quiet and very well located. You have a very nice breakfast included and a snack at happy hour time with gentle people helping you. Rooms are not big but good enough for a couple. Friendly people at the reception. I'll certainly be back!
user_name:
Cristina G
Rio de Janeiro, RJ

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: My wife and I spent 5 days in NYC in The Premier on our one year anniversary/honeymoon (we'd had to postpone the honeymoon). Our intention had been to get somewhat close to Times Square and be somewhat pampered, instead we were centrally located and generally disappointed. The Premier is a lamprey add-on to another hotel (The Millennium), skinny and tall (only 7'ish rooms a floor). They offer a location that's only half a block away from the center of Times Square and above a certain floor you do have a view of the big apple...though most of the view is of the street and accompanying buildings. The room was relatively small (250 sq ft) with a king bed and a bathroom which had a tub.However, the hotel is just worn down or not kept up well. The wiring of the room is odd, with all lights but the bathroom (and most of the power in the outlets) controlled by a single switch. The room we stayed in had severe signs of misuse and abuse that hadn't been addressed: cigar hole in the carpet, tub drain didn't work (rendering the tub useless), mildew on the counter, crayon on the walls, stripped appliance locations, every single light fixture was crooked or jutting out from the wall, and obviously unprofessionally repaired sink fixtures, non-existent bathroom vent fans, etc. Even the towels, robes, and toiletry items provided were sad/worn or frayed.Services were provided by a nearby hotel and not this hotel itself, and such simple things such as appliances were add-ons (want a fridge...$40, want ice? call housekeeping). We didn't avail ourselves of the breakfast.All in all, I was very disappointed in the experience, the staff, and the facilities. However, it *was* close to Times Square, and the bed was ok...but I don't recommend you stay here if you value quality.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Perfect location for a weekend pleasure trip to NYC. Close to all the action of Time Square but not caught in the bustle and noise. Room was clean, fresh, modern with a large bath by NY standards--had a shower and tub. Staff at the registration desk was friendly and helpful. Great experience. Would definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Unfortunately my stay was ruined slightly as when I returned back to the UK I found that I had been charged again for the room. Wasn't a small amount of money either and mistakes like these could possibly put someone in finanicial difficulty. Before this error, we had a great stay. Location is excellent, not noisy like thought it was going to be. Room was a great size, we had a good view of time square. Hotel was really clean and all the staff very friendly. Breakfast had a good selection of pastries, fruit and cereals. The evening nibbles, cheeses and wine (all free) was a nice touch. Also, the staff were excellent every night we attended. I would stay again but I would be reluctant to hand over my credit card incase the same thing happened. Shame I couldn't give it 5 stars, as we did both enjoy our stay.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Loved, loved, loved our stay at the Premier NY Times Square! Just echoing the other reviews - Monique Madison is the absolute greatest - she greeted my husband and I immediately upon our arrival and made sure that our check in went as smoothly as possible. She was a friendly and helpful presence in the hotel lobby throughout our stay: in the morning when we left the hotel to explore the city and in the late afternoon when we returned to collapse after a fun filled day! Our room was beautifully modern - extremely clean, quiet and with a super comfortable bed. The location also cannot be beat - right smack dab in the heart of everything - Times Square, Broadway, restaurants, shops, subway station nearby for quick transportation for our stops in Soho, Brooklyn, etc. We were sorry to have to leave and we would definitely stay there again!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: My mom and I were welcomed at the desk by the wonderful Monique once again! She always makes us feel so special. Monique is friendly, kind, and genuinely cares about guest satisfaction. She represents what the Premier side is all about, and why we will continue to stay there every time we visit from California! Thank you, Monique!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Near spur-of-the-moment Saturday night visit. Got a very nice Priceline Bid deal (though, regular prices aren't too crazy). Location could not be more convenient for seeing a couple Broadway shows. Room was nice size - well appointed (didn't need a fridge) View of the New Year's eve thingee from Room 625 was fine (though not necessarily "breathtaking"). Only minor irritation - having to call Room Service for Ice - I'd rather get it myself - Seems crazy to tip for ice - That said, the service was almost instantaneous and the nice gentleman got a few extra coffee pods at the same time.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I stay in NYC often for work. In order to attend a business meeting in Times Square I was looking for a hotel within 3 blocks of the location. The Premier had convenient, reliable, careful, polite valet parking. The hotel staff was amazing and treated me as though I had been there 100 times before. The room was absolutely immaculate, clean, full functioning, and extremely large compared to closet size standard NYC rooms. I had a couch, lounge area, desk, shower and tub, and separate coffee area. It was unreal. Happy hour and breakfast were both great. They stored my luggage during my meeting the next day at no additional charge. Many delicious dining options available. There were a good mix of polite clientele ranging between leisure & business. I was able to call and have my car waiting for me upon departure. I will stay there often.
user_name:
NEJaxxTravels
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
