review_body: We enjoyed this very roomy king room, with a partial view of time square! We booked directly through the hotel for better rates and perks (free breakfast and happy hour)! Staff was friendly and helpful! We would definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed at this hotel on a recent work trip. It was within walking distance of work so that's why I chose it. Price was fine, room was nicely appointed, and the business lounge was great for breakfast and cocktails in the evening. Staff was excellent and very helpful. If you want to stay in the heart of Times Square and not kill your budget, you can't go wrong.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: My colleague and I flew from South Africa, via Dubai and spent a week in New York during mid-July on a television assignment. We were booked into a neighbouring hotel and promptly checked out into this absolute find! I had a room on the 6th floor with a good enough view of the Times Square Ball. Cannot for the life of me remember the room number but if you come out of the lift, you head towards your right ... last room on the right.Comments:1. Modern though compact rooms. I honestly didn't mind the size. I like modern. I am not happy in a tired room even if it is large - makes me sad and I want to go back home.2. Great mattress. It took us at least 3 days to adjust to a new time-zone but I can attest to the fact that after I had said goodbye to the jet-lag, I had the best sleep ever.3. Ample size full bathroom - although shower was surprisingly small, even for me at 1.5 meters tall and slight in built - so be prepared for a bit of a squeeze but water always hot. 4. No street noise whatsoever.5. Housekeeping was extremely responsive and appeared in minutes with my requested extra duvet and kettle.6. Reception also really friendly and extremely helpful.7. The lifts are super-fast. This is not something to be under-rated. In the previous hotel we stayed in, we had to wait at least 15 minutes for the lift to arrive. At this hotel, I don't think I waited more than 60 seconds.8. The location .... what more can you want ....you can see Times Square from your room, less than a block away (ask for a room with a good view in advance). Close to all the attractions.9. Ample cupboard space ..... with plenty hanging space.10. THE BEST PART OF THIS HOTEL? The Business Lounge and their staff. Make sure you request that you have access to this super, fantastic benefit. You have access to a computer, printer (for free). You can also chose to have your breakfast here (for free) comprising mostly pastries, muesli, yoghurt, boiled eggs etc. Then 5:30pm to 7:30pm they have a free bar with wines and snacks which on a few nights included salmon. All for free. You also have access to the lounge for tea/coffee and quiet place to work. Beautifully decorated and nice lighting at night. Aircon can be a bit strong. However, make sure that when you book, you do have access to the lounge.Don't confuse this hotel with the Millennium which is right next door which is a much bigger, older hotel. This is the Premier Millennium on Times Square. Smaller and fewer rooms on each floor.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Our travel agent prepaid our 7 night stay via Expedia. A few days after check out I realised my credit card was charged. We had a group of 30 stay at this hotel, all PREPAID and 90% of our group were charged for their accommodation upon checkout. No receipts were given as printer 'wasn't working'. 11 days later and still trying to get the accommodation charges refunded to our credit cards. No one cares at the hotel. On Thursday 27th July, I had organised a bus charter to collect our group and as a courtesy I told the man behind the desk at 6.45am that 39 passenger charter bus would be out the front of the hotel at 7.45am to collect our group. He told me he was finishing his shift in 7 minutes so wouldn't be around. I said "have you got a log book so you could write it up for the next shift. "No we don't have a log book". I said "Could you write it on a piece of paper please for the next shift". He said "It will just get thrown away because they will think it's scrap paper". I just walked away ... his attitude told me everything about the culture of that hotel. Will never stay there again and will never recommend this hotel. So disappointing.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The rooms are big and comfortable. The house keepers are annoying, they kept leaving us with only one towel or no soap. The "Queen" bed in europe is 160cm. in NYC its more of a 140 cm. So we were disappointed.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here for four nights from Aug 1st to 5th. we were really impressed. Check in was painless thankfully as we were exhausted. nice big spacious airy room on 17th floor that was spotless. Bed so comfortable!Room was cleaned every day so well the view was fantastic. staff seemed so pleasant each time we met them and it was an absolute pleasure to stay here.location could not be better. a fantastic find and would love to return from Ireland again some day. thank you so much to everyone.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I just checked in yesterday evening for a 2-night stay. When I asked if I'd missed the evening reception, I was informed I would not have access to the Premier lounge complimentary drinks and continental breakfast due to the "rate" at which I reserved my room. The front desk attendant informed me that unless I book directly through the hotel, I wouldn't have been given access. When I asked for more detail (this came as a surprise and embarrassment on my part as I didn't mean to act entitled), he let me know the policy had been changed some 3 months (!) ago and reiterated that booking through the hotel itself was the only way to gain this. When I inquired about adding it to my reservation, he told me simply "it wouldn't be worth it as there are plenty of less expensive great breakfast spots around" and when I asked for suggestions, offered the 24-hr "Cranberry" around the corner. I've done some looking around on the website this morning and can't find this information disclosed anywhere. Please, Premier, if there is a disclaimer as to who has access to the lounge, please put it in a transparent place so that others may know of your policy in advance. I do find it interesting that at the top is says to Book Direct for Free Wifi, so some things are disclosed but some aren't.I am traveling for business and I looked forward to the efficiency of a continental-style breakfast in my hotel in the morning and drinks to unwind in the evening. I cannot imagine a family who expected to cost-effectively feed their family before a day of sightseeing in the city learning of this at check in and having to then budget for breakfast every morning!  As someone who read reviews before booking this hotel, I thought it important to warn other guests who may be expecting this service only to learn of this policy upon check in, after it's too late to cancel their reservation.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here for 3 nights with our young adult sons. This was a GREAT location for Times Square and the theater district. We also like Bryant Park, which was a short walk from the hotel. It had very little street noise which doesn't always happen in NYC hotels. The staff we interacted with (Hector, Veronica, & Kevin) were all really helpful and friendly. The room service menu was limited, but the food we ordered was good and arrived in a timely manner. There's also a 24-hour deli across the street. We would totally stay here again. One comment for improvement is having a small fridge or ice access on the floor. You can get ice, but you have to call housekeeping and request it. Our only negative was that I left something of value in the room after checkout and when I called the hotel a couple of hours later to request the item be mailed to me (at my cost), they said the item had not been found :(.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I arrived at this hotel yesterday a little earlier than normal check in and asked the gentleman at the front desk ( it's literally a little desk in the lobby, not like most hotels or even cheap motels) if I could get the first room available, which while I waited, he did. Good start. The room was nice, little small, but clean and nice, no problem with the room, yet. I decided to rest for a bit and watch TV before hitting NYC, only to find that the TV did not work, it wouldn't turn on. It took almost an hour and about 4 phone calls to get someone up there to fix. The wait was not the problem, the lies were. Every time I called they promised someone was on the way and yet no one ever came. I finally went down to the little lobby desk to inquire and was treated so rudely as if I was the problem, as if I was bothering them by trying to get someone to come make the TV work in a room I paid for. The gentleman who checked me in defended by saying that he did me a favor by not charging me an " early check in fee", as if I was supposed to stop complaining about a broken TV because he did me a solid ( all he did is give a guy with a reservation a room that was ready, not a miracle worker). Upon checkout I asked for bill/receipt and they gave me someone elses charges and credit card. Bill said charged to Master Card, I don't own a Mastercard, and rather than be polite and try to get to the bottom of it they rudely insisted it was right, because none of them really knew what the answer was so they tried to make a case that they were right and that I really did have some unknown Mastercard. The management is going to apologize for this, but it wont change a thing. I've sent a complaint detailing this to Millenium Hotels corporate and advise you to find another hotel, not worth it.
user_name:
Oren K
Wethersfield, Connecticut, United States

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This was an 6/10 hotel. It was clean but nothing extra ordinary or fancy about it. It was very basic in my opinion. It is about 1/2 a block from time square which was nice. Female staff was not overly friendly to say the least.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: My husband and I just stayed one night in New York because we had tickets to a show. This hotel is located just a half block east of Broadway, but you wouldn't know it. Quiet at night. We had no problems getting a great night sleep. Bed is comfortable as well as the pillows. We were on the 14th floor overlooking 44th. Large clean room. Bathroom was nice, with a separate shower (not a large shower but adequate). In room fridge and safe. Iron and hair drier also in room. Only amenity for the hotel is the restaurant. We didn't eat there so can't speak to the food. We would stay there again. This being said, I need to add something about one of the desk clerks. This did not happen to us, but a gentleman that came in in front of us. You could hear that he did not speak English very well and needed help. He thought another employee had ordered a taxi for him and told him it would be $88 and would be there for him and his family. He asked the woman when the taxi would be here and where he should pay. She said " taxi could be here in one minute five or thirty. I don't know. You go out there they'll help. But it sounds like you want a car not a taxi and one wasn't ordered." I was appalled at the way she spoke to him. It was embarrassing. She barely looked at him and didn't act as though she really wanted to help him. Everyone else we saw at the desk was nice as well as the men that took our bags for us.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Checked in yesterday afternoon. The receptionist gave me a room which was already occupied. With all my luggage, here I was opening the door of an occupied room.Embarrassing both, my family and the other person.Had to go down to the reception desk from the 20th floor to pick up another key of the room on 12th.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed on 6th floor for business trip. There are only a few rooms on the floors so overall quite quiet. Room has very large picture windows that look onto various angles of time square. Very central location to the theater district. We were able to walk to everything with no problems. There was one bed which was quite firm. Found it very difficult to find outlets near my bed where I like to plug my phone in at night. I always travel with a small power strip when I'm on business so I was ok.There is a nice Continental breakfast with hardboiled eggs, fruit, cereal, pastries and bread. Coffee, juice and a cappuccino machine are available in a lounge setting. There is also an evening happy hour but I didn't attend.The hotel is a partner to the Millennium next door and we had our shuttle pick us up from there.Pluses: clean, nice decor, breakfast, location, nice soaking tub, large bathroomCons: lack of outlets by bed, harder mattress, construction across the street.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed at this hotel for four nights at the start of June. Had a great time.lovely place with nice staff and beautiful rooms which were cleaned every day.Free continental breakfast and nibbles and wine,soft drinks,tea and coffee.Great views from windows.Would recommend high floors.Hope to be back next year.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel is all about the location, I found the room to be old and tired. The front desk staff were not very helpful upon check in, they did not give us any information regarding the continental breakfast or the evening cocktails, we had to return to the desk on our way out to ask about this. I would say this hotel is all about the location being just off of times square so you really are in the thick of it however do not get the noise you would if on times square. Personally I would not return to this hotel however this is mainly due to the fact that I would prefer to stay away from times square on my next visit.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel on 44th street is in the ideal location for Broadway and TV lovers. Mere steps to Time Square, most theaters, and ABC, only a few more blocks to Steve Colbert's Late Show at the Ed Sullivan, and just a bit further to 30 Rock. There are two Broadway theaters on the same block as the hotel. And anyone who has read my reviews knows that my absolute musts are a flat-panel TV, room safe, free wifi, and a separate shower. All the boxes are checked.Also a plus: the room looks exactly like the website pics. No surprises. Where did it lose points and make it less that perfect? Just a few minor things. Faucets that leak, no room fridge (and there was easily space for one) and no glass doors on the show (It's a personal thing, I know, but shower curtains are a turn-off for me). The concierge level with free breakfast, the view of the Time Square ball, and a free-to-borrow umbrella in the room delivered redemption.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: My daughter and I have just returned from a stay at the Premier 20th to 29th June 2017. The location is spot on, just a few metres from Times Square so you're in the heart of it without the noise. We were on the 18th floor and had a view of the Times Square billboards from the floor to ceiling windows. Our room was quiet, spacious, the bathroom large and the kingsize bed was the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in. The bed linen was white and crisp and, along with the towels, changed every day. The safe was the easiest one to use I've ever come across in a hotel and the hairdryer the most powerful - only small things I know but they make for a better stay along with a walk in wardrobe and pleasant toiletries. The breakfast was more than adequate with a good selection of cereals, fruit, yoghurts, toast, bagels, pastries, etc and unlimited tea, coffee and fruit juices. Last but certainly not least is the staff. Reception, porters, maids - all were extremely pleasant, cheerful and helpful even when dealing with difficult customers. We mostly dealt with Monique who calmed us down on the first day when we were a little fraught and sorted our problems out while joking with us, making us relax, and putting our minds at rest with the lovely room she allocated us. Nothing was too much trouble for her and she sorted another problem out for us a little later while remaining unfailingly happy and courteous. Yes, it's her job but not everyone conducts themselves like Monique - a big thank you to all the staff but especially her. One of the reviews stated they weren't treated properly because they booked through a third party. That shouldn't have any bearing on it. We booked that way too but were well looked after, would return for another stay and can definitely recommend it as a great centre for a New York trip. Thanks again everyone, Gill and Faye from England

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Bed was very comfy, some decorating needed in the rooms, but I still thought it was quiet apart from the air conditioning. Loved it. We did make an error in going next door for the complimentary breakfast but should have gone to the mezzanine floor. The hotel staff sorted the 50$ bill from next door, which we didnt expect. Our error, but sorted.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I went to this hotel with my husband for a night in the city for his birthday. While checking in, we were given a room on the 5th floor. Now the whole point of staying here is for location! So I wanted a view. I asked for a higher floor. So he gave me a room on the 15th floor while also letting me know there really isn't a view. Please see pics. I was just disappointed because I wanted more. The room was average. Bed seems smaller than average queen size. No mini fridge. Although there is a huge tub, the stand up shower seemed small. No ice machine on the floor...you have to call and request it. These little things bothered me personally. Maybe someone else would enjoy that kind of service. Very close walk to Time Square!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Great location with upscale rooms, not a "boutique" hotel but not a grand hotel either, just enough space in rooms with clean accommodations and all needed amenities (bathrobe, safe, couch, dryer, coffee service, etc). Staff very helpful (see Monique). Price reasonable for NYC.For an extra $25, I would recommend taking the valet parking option; you don't want to be messing around in that Manhattan traffic.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: What's to say that hasn't already been said? It's a great hotel, in a great location, super comfy bed. Room not huge but had all you need. Breakfast basic but adequate, loving the free wine and canapés in the early evening. We will definitely stay at this hotel again on our next visit. Receptionists and porters were very friendly and helpful. What more could you want??

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Wow. I was impressed. We've stayed at a number of hotels in Midtown/Times Square and this one is really good. Our "standard" room was quite large and the bed was ridiculously comfortable. Very clean in ALL areas, including hallways and elevators. I was really surprised at how quiet the room is. We were facing 44th street and right next to the elevator and heard NOTHING. I know there are only 7 rooms per floor, but you normally hear elevators doors or room doors open/closing. Nope, not at this hotel. No road noise either (44th street is a little less busy of a road though than say 42nd street).Location wise it's perfect for anything in Midtown. Half a block from the craziness of Times Square, 2 blocks to Fifth Ave, 15 minute walk to Central Park. Near all the theatres, excellent restaurants and cafes.Have to give a special "thanks" to Kush as he was fantastic. Super friendly and a pleasure to talk with. Had no problem checking us in early and was always quick to make sure we were having a good stay when we saw him.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed at this hotel this past weekend. Large well appointed, clean room with floor to ceiling windows. Very comfortable bed with crisp sheets, comfy pillows, excellent flat screen TV, large room safe, coffee area, iron and ironing board if needed, large bathroom with soaking tub and separate shower, hair dryer, bathrobes and slippers and shampoo/condition, lotion, etc. Only 7 rooms on each floor and our room location was very near the elevator but we never heard anything in the way of elevator noise or noise from adjacent rooms. Security is good with the elevators operated using your room key card. Great location, only a block and a half from Times Square. My only criticism is that there was no in-room refrigerator which would have been nice. But when we arrived back to our room after a concert, the ice bucket had been filled to capacity and there was bottled water. This hotel did not include a continental breakfast but there are many places close by to grab something. Or we could have walked through to the adjacent hotel where there was a dining room. I would recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: very good hotel in an ideal location.lots of good bars and restaurants near by.the hotel provides a lovely breakfast to set you up for the day.the room was very nice and the bed was comfortable we had a view of time square from window but it was very quiet and herd no noise even though we were next to the elevator.the room had a safe in and lovely toiletries.there was a computer and printer to use to print boarding passes etc.had a speedy check in and out and the staff were very nice.
user_name:
ciderqueen2
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Room is nice, good location. 2/5 because the lady at front desk was incredibly rude to us. This was our first trip to New York, and she asked why we were there first off, and we said we had a reservation, and she said "Well I hope so since you came inside". She then asked our age (we are college students)&when I asked about good restaurants, she said we should "look around" because they are everywhere and then implied we would eat at cheaper restaurants, and I presume it is because we booked our trip through a third party. She was so mean to my friend and I that even though this is a very nice place to stay, the fact that they still have someone like her on their staff is enough reason for me to not spend my money there ever again. And my money is just as green as anyone else's, regardless of third party usage or age!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel is a joke! I've never had such terrible customer service in my life. My first day back in NYC was absolutely ruined cause of these guys. You couldn't pay me to stay here. I love NYC but stay away from the so called "premier."

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: My stay here was simply amazing. The Location is perfect. It's like one block from the center of Time Square. I was able to take a very short walk to see my Broadway show, and there are shops and restaurants, street vendors all around. The hotel staff was Great, but I need to give a special shout out to the Staff on the Mezzanine level. Their attention to detail, outgoing, friendly, take care if my needs even before I asked service was immaculate. The staff in that level took my stay from maybe a 7.5 to a 10 out of 10. I will 100% come back here soon because of the amazing service they provided. The HAPPY hour the key provide on weekdays is great and the free breakfast is a nice added bonus. Keeps you from spending around $70 bucks forms family of 3 for anywhere that is not fast food. As far as room quality I think it was good. Very clean well designed. I just with the room was slightly bigger but the rooms here are made for couples so I can understand why they are slightly smaller that I personally was imagining but still a good size and the quality was great. This place is definitely worth a try and again I had a great time and will be staying here again.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Great hotel located on 44th street very short walk from Time Square steps, very close to subway for easy access across all of Manhatten, we stayed on 17th floor which gave us a glimpse of Time Square bill boards, free wifi available within all of the hotel, good sized room, aircon which was great as it was 32c outside, sofa 40 inch tv, nice bathroom with both shower and a bath, large safe located in the wardrobe to secure valuables, also available in the room is hairdryer as well as iron and ironing board, we got breakfast included this includes cereals, toast and bagels, to drink there is tea coffee and a selection of fruit juices. Excellent hotel

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I reserved 4 rooms for last Friday evening. It was difficult to find the hotel and after we had driven past the hotel before my husband drove around the block (approximately 30 minutes due to Times Square traffic) I exited the car and searched for the hotel. I asked Veronica to check me into my room. She said it was policy since I had used Priceline to book the rooms that only my husband could check us into the room. At that point I told her I need to use the bathroom and she told me that I needed to go elsewhere. At that point she had both my credit card and my drivers license. I am covered under the Americans with Disabilities Act and in Illinois we have the Bathroom Access Act. I do not know what human rights act would cover this incident in NYC because I have not researched that issue, nonetheless I would hope that human decency and respect should be a part of the hotel's policy toward guests. Two nights prior Hotel Edison gracefully handled access to my guest room. While I waited the half hour for my husband to circle the block I was able to overhear her complain about a customer who was having difficulty with their room air conditioner and the conversation with the valets and another gentlemen about how awful the NYC subway system is compared to the 1970s and 1980s. The next morning when we were leaving Monique was amazing and professional. It is what I expect when staying at an establishment of your caliber. It is my hope that it is not hotel policy to treat your clientele so rudely and with the utmost disregard for the disabled and merely a retraining of staff to be courteous, helpful and respectful to all guests with or without disabilities.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: My husband and I had a great stay at The Premier for 5 nights at the beginning of May.The hotel itself is in a perfect location – a relatively quiet street that is a 2 minute walk to Times Square where there is the subway station to take you up and downtown. Across the road there is a Deli and a good Irish bar and there is also a 24hr Walgreens round the corner. When we arrived at the hotel we were quickly checked in…I mean very quickly! With this being our first time in the city, I was hoping to get some advice and be informed on the hotels facilities but we were literally told our room number and given our keys – not the welcome I had hoped for. After this though our experience with the other staff was much more positive and everyone was very friendly. We were pleasantly surprised by the size of our room – a good size comfortable bed, a desk, a couch and a great bathroom. It was a little tired round the edges but was very clean. Floor to ceiling windows that gave a great view of the Times Square billboards and there was an iron & ironing board, pod coffee machine, widescreen TV and a safe all available to use in the room. Breakfast was in a small lounge room which was not an ideal setting but the muffins, pastries, fruit and cereal were delicious and provided a great start to the day! On check out, the staff were kind enough to arrange a private car for us to take us to JFK and hold our bags until it was time for us to leave.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Our room felt large and was comfortable. Staff were very pleasant and accommodating. We were a little confused about the relationship with the Millenium and whether or not we could access their services. Great location for theatres, quite a walk from Lincoln Centre. Breakfast was an odd experience really as it isn't a dining room and it's quite basic. Overall though, this was a good place to stay.
user_name:
BelleAustralia_59
Ben Boyd National Park, Australia

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Easy access to Time Square tourist attractions as well as subway stations. Complimentary breakfast OK with coffee, bread etc. Don't expect much from the complimentary happy hour except friendly service.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Was in NY for business and work booked this hotel. It's next to the Millennium hotel literally 1 min walk from Times Square. First impression was that it was basic...not plush or anything grand. However it was spacious bedroom, included a 2 seater sofa, and spacious bathroom with separate bath and shower. It was also clean and very comfortable bed. The room did grow on me! Also rate included a continental breakfast...pastries, fruit, cereals and toast/bagel. Room for bfast was odd in that it was more of a lounge not dining rom. Very helpful staff. Rooms had good coffee machine that did tea and coffee. If you are looking for no frills but good price and spacious rooms, this is a good option. I did however book into the Hyatt after my work trip was over and for my personal stay over the weekend. But this was booked before I came to NY and in hindsight could have stayed in this hotel just fine.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: In NYC for a combination of business and pleasure. Could not have been more pleased with The Premier. Check in was easy....had a larger corner room with double view. Bed was excellent....and the facility seemed very clean and inviting.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: the room was great however didn't have the extras they told us it would such as an ipad or docking station. bed was comfortable. we went to the bar in the millennium on arrival for a drink and pound it completely over priced and the barman very rude and swearing under his breath. don't bother going in there. we found everyone else very pleasant and food prices acceptable after that nowhere charged 25 dollar a drink the whole week apart from the millennium which is premier sister hotel

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The location is perfect for the theatre district. It's just a block down from Times Square, but is very quiet. Easy check in with friendly staff. Upper floor views are amazing. Small footprint without a large sign, so tell taxi and Uber drivers to take you to The Millennium Hotel. Hotels are connected and share services. Rooms are clean, modern, and very spacious by NYC standards. Close to Bryant Park and numerous great restaurants! Highly recommend.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I returned once again to The Premier hotel in Times Square for a combination family weekend/work visit. I have stayed at this hotel (and its next-door sister, the Millennium Broadway) many, many times, and there's a reason I keep coming back: the employees. Sure, the location is nice and the rooms are actually quite spacious compared to other NYC hotels. But there's nothing quite like being treated "like family" from the minute you arrive. While mostly every staff member I encounter is extremely friendly, outgoing and helpful, there are some standouts: Robert Bove in reservations; he helps me out immensely with any and all details regarding my reservation. Monique at The Premier, who helps with check-in, special requests and the like, is a constant ray of sunshine. And Benny over at the bar in the Millennium Broadway makes you feel like an old friend... and remembers my beverage of choice each and every time I stay there. They make each and every stay a genuine pleasure.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Travelling alone for business, my room is the perfect size; a single queen bed, a sofa, desk. Probably too small for a family. My room is tidy, and the bed comfortable. Why a 4 instead of a 5? It was a bit hard to detect at street level once out of my taxi. And it may be worth purchasing breakfast rather than hunching over a coffee table for a bowl of cereal.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The location is certainly convenient. This hotel seems to be the little sister to The Millennium and after hours it's entered through that hotel's lobby, through the lobby of an adjoining theatre, and then into the Premier lobby. The room was OK, basic and a little tired, but OK. The bathroom was good with a bath and a stall shower with lots of hot water. Finally, there's a nice lounge on the mezzanine that we only found the day before we checked out. Since the rooms are small, this would have been a good place to sit with a full (automated) espresso machine. We booked through Priceline and I think I got confused between US and Canadian dollars -- in the event, I'm not convinced we got such a good deal. Turned out that people that booked through a "third party" didn't have the breakfast included which was served in The Charlotte -- the Millennium's restaurant. It was a very nice buffet -- the same every day but still good. As a Premier customer we got a discount so it was $10 a day. I guess my caution is just -- be careful with those Priceline deals. We did get free internet which sometimes costs extra.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: You know when you return to a hotel where you've stayed before, and little things seem to ruin your previous memory of how good you thought it was. After another return visit to the Premier, I can confirm that this hotel preserves those memories. The friendly welcome comes with genuine interest in your journey, the room (1621 - is a 'ball drop' view if you want to spend New Years here), is large spacious, clean and well lit. Crisp white linens, and the comfort of the bed - those memories all ticked. The bathroom is also well lit, has tub and separate shower and good water pressure. Complementary wi if, breakfast and the happy hour all come as standard. This is our 'must stay' when we visit New York, as previous establishments have failed on repeat visits. Premier by name and premier by nature !

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Great location in the heart of the theater district at times Square. Well appointed and clean rooms and a very good price. Tasty continental breakfast buffet in the mornings and very nice complimentary 5-6 pm Mon-Fri cocktail hour with wine, beer, soft drinks, sandwiches, snacks etc. The one thing that stood out the most for us was the super friendly and helpful hotel associates. From the gentleman who checked us in to Monique :) who was so accommodating with advice on Manhattan to providing smaller denominations for my $20 bills to theater advice. Next trip to NYC will definitely include the Premiere

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Superb friendly hotel (especially Monique at front desk). Very helpful. Close to the theaters and Times Square. One of our best experiences at a hotel. Continental breakfast is okay but hot breakfast at sister hotel next door for $10 is a great deal. Highly recommended.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed at the Premier for a few days with my daughter during her Spring Break. Was matched to the Premier through Hotwire and it was a good hotel for our trip. We packed a lot of things into 3 days and the central location of the hotel in Times Square made everything convenient. The room was very nice and the hotel staff friendly. Obviously not at the high end of hotels in NYC…but very nice and would stay there again when I visit NYC again in the future.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: After months of research of which hotel to pick for our first time in NYC we choose "The Premier" and we are so happy we made this choice. We didn't not expect the room to be the size it was (as we heard all rooms in NYC where small) it had a full size couch along with a big bath and lovely shower. It had everything we needed in the room e.g, hairdryer, iron, safe and Wifi. The room was cleaned excellently everyday without fail. (Top marks to the cleaners) The location on 44th was brilliant, 1 minute walk to Times Square and 4/5 minute walk to the subway on 42nd, which was ideal for us and great place for easily getting Uptown and Downtown. A big thank you to all workers at The Premier for our wonderful stay in your amazing city, we hope to see you again in the future. Andrew and Stacey room 821.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The room was spacious and very clean. The bed, pillows, and room temperature were very comfortable. Even though this hotel is minutes from Times Square, it is relatively quiet in the evening, so sleep is not disturbed. The staff was friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Didn't know where to start when looking for a hotel in NY so relied on Trip Advisor reviews. Yes price was a factor but reviews are more important. So so glad we picked this hotel and will definitely recommend and use again.Reception - agree with other reviews that some staff acknowledged you and others didn't, but check in and check out was perfect and any questions were answered in a friendly manner.Room - A decent size with everything you need. We were barely in the room so it was the perfect for us. Toiletries were replaced daily, room was cleaned daily, shower was fine, bed was, well I was that shattered I'd have slept on anything! Free Wi-Fi. All good.Breakfast and afternoon drinks - Breakfast was excellent and part of the reason we booked this hotel. Fresh fruit, bagels, pastries, toast, cereal, tea and coffee. It was quite busy but we found if you went the back of 7 you'd get a table. One morning we went down about 8.30 and it was very busy, ended up eating in our room. No worries though, we just learnt to go down early or be prepared to wait on a table. Drinks and nibbles late afternoon was a wee bonus. Staff were so polite and attentive.Location - Fabulous. Turn left and you're at 6th Avenue, turn right and you are on Broadway. We were on the 11th floor. No noise issues. All in all, a great hotel, good value, fab location. Thank you to all the staff at the Premier.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Great location, staff was generally friendly and we were able to check in early. Small issue with our sink, but for the most part the room was clean and in working order. I would stay here again. Near Times Square, theater district and great restaurants.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Absolutely ideal hotel near Times Square. Join Millenium Group and book for best price - book premier rooms which include continental breakfast and pre-dinner wine and canapés for $200 per night. Premier rooms are above 8th floor - both quiet and large. Ours included good sized sofa - very central, helpful staff. Would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Great location and nice room for New York. Frustrating as there is no bar fridge. To order toilet paper it took an hour. The staff at the front desk where hit and miss with some being very friendly, and some that wouldn't acknowledge you. No perks or a acknowledgement of our honeymoon. Breakfast is basic but a great addition. Beds were comfortable and room was nice.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: A few improvements would bump this into a 5 star rating. Nice size room! Pillows too lumpy; but the mattress was perfect. The heat was inadequate the first two days/nights despite putting the thermostat to 80. The maintenance staff came to our room and told us he had to turn on the "hot water" to make it heat. It never did. Breakfast service was great, especially espresso machine. The front desk staff were awesome!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Amenities was very good and the room size was a good size for a New York hotel. It was a very good hotel located near all the things near Times Square. The security for the hotel was very good as you had to use your card key in order to get the elevator to go to your room. It was a very enjoyable stay.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Tbis hotel have a great location in the heart of Manhattan! Very easy to find and reach your room, no big lobbys or many floor to walk. Room very clean and confortable. Breakfast included. Personel very helpfull. Recommended.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The Premier New York Times Square is a home away from home. The staff were extremely helpful. Being a Coeliac, I was a bit nervous about the complimentary breakfast being offered but I didn't have to worry. Dixon made sure I had GF bread every morning and was always there with a smile. The hotel is literally a stone's throw from Times Square and all other attractions. Would highly recommend this hotel and will definitely be back.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This was a stop over on our way to Europe! Great hotel right in the heart of Times Square. Clean rooms and great staff. Rooms are very quiet the breakfast is even decent. It is a short walk to Bryant park and theatres.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: First time here and can only compliment everyone involved. Rori, the guest relations manager and Robert, the reservations associate, were both very helpful and responsive as we were making our reservations here. This was a special trip for us and we wanted a delightful experience. We got it. The room is great, nice size, with a dynamite view of the city and as much a view of Times Square lights as they have available. Reception team has been great, continental breakfast very good. Do I sound pleased? I am. Thanks to all - I will recommend this hotel to anyone traveling up here. We will return. Ps - location is great for theater goers - just minutes walk to many.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel was wonderful from check-in to check-out! I've stayed in quite a few NYC hotels over the last two years and this one has to be my favorite. The rooms are very nice and modern, not to mention decent sized (for NYC). The added amenities of free breakfast, wine and cheese social hour, and free wifi were lovely. Lastly, the staff couldn't of been nicer. Everyone was so polite and quick to answer any questions we had about the city. I would like to especially thank Monique at the front desk who really took care of my wife and I during our stay.Hidden Tip: One other great thing about this hotel it is located directly across from Jimmy's Corner which is a little dive bar that has the cheapest drinks in Time Square. Talk about convenience!If your looking for a hotel in or near the Theater District I would absolutely recommend staying at this modern boutique hotel!
user_name:
Brandon B
Burbank, California, United States

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We love nice hotels and nice amenities. Lots of times the free WIFI and free breakfast hotels are 3 stars or less. Well, we found this 4 star with top notch rooms, staff and atmosphere including the fabulous bagels, muffins, fruit and coffee. The hotel is in the middle of it all but is nice and quiet, beautiful and friendly. Within minutes we could be downstairs and out the door to the show from the premier viewed 10th story room. Will stay at this little home away from home again and recommend it to all of our friends. Thanks to the personable and amazing staff, too.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: My grandkids and I spent four days at the Premier recently. It was by far the best accommodations I have experienced in NYC and I have been many times. From the minute we walked in until we left, it was amazing. Monique welcomed us and went out of her way to make everything perfect for us. She even gave us the best room in the hotel and what a room it was. We looked out at the ball on top of Times Square. I will never stay anywhere else while visiting NYC. I can't wait to see Monique again. She is awesome.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I arrived early in the day, in the middle of a snow storm.Most of the house keeping crew had not been able to get in to work.Monique at reception, kept looking at rooms and status, until she found a room that was ready to be occupied. That was beyond expectation. I was hours ahead of the time to check-in. She wanted me to be comfortable!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The location of the hotel is absolutely great. You are at time square and close to all Broadway shows. The staff was very friendly and the rooms where of a decent size,especially for New York standards.The complementary drinks during happy hour are greatly appreciated, it doesn't happen often that a hotel is offering free drinks (beer, wine and minerals).Pleased with our stay and would recommend the hotel to others, definitely great place to be for tourists.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: A great hotel for our quick weekend. Our room was exactly like the picture. New Year's Eve ball and everything. Sq. Ft.wise was a small room, but wasn't expecting a suite. Next door was the Theater. Didn't even have too walk outside. A Block and a half from Time Square. Plenty of great restaurants and bars within walking distance. Other than from the airport, never used a taxi. Visited Radio City Music Hall , area around Rockefeller Center,and Time Square. Hector at the front desk was great. Walked to the next door hotel(inside no coats) to a restaurant. Cocktail hour and free continental breakfast. Thanks for a great economical stay, and great location.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Perfect hotel. 2 minutes walking from Times Square. Big room. Amenities. Good breakfast. Free snacks and drinks from 5 to 7 pm. Friendly staff. Clean. Perfect location for shopping, restaurants, theaters, etc. Free wifi. Will go back for sure. Good value!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Great quiet sister hotel to the next door Millennium Times Sq.. Unlike the Millennium, this hotel has free wifi, coffee makers in the rooms, complimentary continental breakfast and complimentary late afternoon wine reception!!! Very nice rooms, very quiet and with nice staff. Perfect for the Theater District

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I have stayed in several hotels in NY so I can compare to my other experiences.Pros of this hotel-Location is a big plus if you want to be around Times Square an go to the theater.Evening cocktail also a nice plus which is not common among other NYC hotels.Rooms are large and comfortable with a nice view.Cons of this hotel-For the price breakfast should have more variety. Items such as scrambled eggs are not served.Revolving door in the entrance trapped trash from the wind. Not a big deal but easy to fix and make reception more inviting.
user_name:
Lisa B
Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: A great location on 44th Street, generous sized room (especially for NYC) comfortable bed, complimentary continental breakfast, plus a wine reception in the evening. The first room they put me in had a heating problem so they moved me the next day to a better room on a higher floor. Which made me very happy. One of my favorite restaurants is across the street! (Osteria Al Doge) and there are two broadway theatres on the block! My only reservation is that not everyone who works here is polite and helpufl as they ought to be. I had some issues with rudeness on the phone, and then later, with one of the people at the front desk. I was prepared not to like The Premier Hotel. But I had a wonderful time here. This place is a real find.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We booked and paid for this hotel stay in advance with Amex .when we arrived our room was not available when it was supposed to be. 4 hours later we were ushered into a room that absolutely reeked of "damp" . The roof in the room was cracked and chipping and the shower had mould growing in it . No mini fridge and no ice on the floor ,you have to call down for it and wait. We complained and were so upset as it was for my birthday .we were not given another room and Amex were 'closed' due to holiday weekend . No surprise there . The millennium next door is the partner hotel and may be a better choice if not choose another hotel as our trip was ruined .

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: we booked this place because the location to times square... which is amazing. its about a 1/2 block walk to the center of times square and the hotel is nice and upscale, not that big, but upscale and modern. the view isnt much but who cares about views??? you just walk over to the times square and you will be overwhelmed with views! definitely would stay again... super clean hotel.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: What a find! Great location for theatre. Surprisingly large room, with a wonderful complimentary continental breakfast. Monique and Patrick were great at check-in and represented hotel well. Would definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Travel can be exhausting these days. Premier Hotel, a small boutique, is a perfect placel to unwind.Times Sq. is 2 minutes away. You escape the hubbub of the city, the moment you enter the quietness of Premier's lobby where two friendly, professional receptionists await you. I particularly enjoy Monique, With a smile,Monique does her best to make guests comfortable. The rooms are well-appointed and good-sized, bedding is very comfortable. Many amenities.BUT, I was surprised and disappointed to learn new management has cut back on both breakfast and cocktail hour offerings. This being one of my reasons to stay at Premier...so nice to pop in the cozy lounge, particularly for breakfast. The staff, I might add, is not happy with the new policy either. Guests, previously staying at Premier like myself. verbalized their disappointment to staff. Several employees asked me to reviewand comment on complimentary services.premier's lobby

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed for 5 nights over the thanks giving weekend!! We loved every minute!! This was our 2nd stay at the premier And it's just nice cosy comfortable and a stone throw away from time square! We have even recommended this friends and family to stay!! Free wifi and breakfast included it's great hotel!!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The staff were very helpful and the complimentary breakfast is a On the light side but is a place for NY. We were a few steps from Times Square but not in the middle of the madness so it was a great retreat. Loved the view and room was clean and comfortable.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Absolutely the best location- just off Times Square and a simple walk to Broadway shows. The staff was incredibly friendly and accommodating, and the hotel and rooms were clean and fresh! There is a great continental breakfast (or you can upgrade for $10 and eat at the restaurant buffet next door at the Millennium Hotel (a partner hotel)), and also a complimentary happy hour at 5pm that includes wine, soft drinks, cheese, crackers, and finger sandwiches. My only complaint is that you have to have ice brought up to the room-- there are no ice machines, but other than that I can't recommend more strongly!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We just stayed in this hotel for three nights & had a very enjoyable experience. It's not the flashiest hotel however represents extremely good value for money. There is no bar or restaurant per say however the hotel does have what it describes as the mezzanine which is a cosy eating area where the buffet continental breakfast is served & an hour long 'cocktail' hour is also served between 5-6pm. The breakfast is a selection of pastries, bagels, bread etc. served alongside yoghurt, sliced fruit, jams & butter etc. You can toast your bagels etc. There is also a self serve bean to cup coffee machine for fresh, lovely coffees & this provides a light, filling breakfast. On an evening, the same room serves some basic 'nibbles' & a selection of hot/cold drinks. Wine is served FOC however unlike when some friends recently stayed there was no bottled beer, not a spoiler though as this quiet hour provides a nice interlude between day time & night time activities & the hustle & bustle of the city. It's somewhere lovely to just rest your feet for an hour before setting off for an evening 'on the tiles'!The room is well equipped with a supremely comfortable bed, large cable TV with a good selection of channels including movies, an iron with ironing board, hair dryer & pod style coffee machine. The rooms have A/C & free Wi-Fi.The location is brilliant, just to the side of times square, no more than 100m away. The staff are very friendly & helpful & you can leave your luggage under lock & key after the check out time of 11.00am. I will definitely consider this hotel for future visits.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I picked the Premier for the first half of my birthday celebration in October as we were attending a Broadway play. I didn't expect much as someone had warned me to stay away from Times Square hotels because of the congestion. Boy am I glad I didn't listen! I booked four nights here because of the location, and the room rate included wifi, daily breakfast in the hotel and an evening happy hour. Also, I tend to prefer smaller hotels.First, it wasn't easy to find the hotel as we arrived by taxi around midnight and there was no obvious entrance. Also, the front door was locked. We had to ask around, and we were told to backtrack two doors to the Millennium Broadway Hotel, which is part of the same chain. Hauling our luggage (yaay for wheels!), we had to enter through the Broadways' lobby, make a quick turn right into a passageway through a theater lobby to get to the Premier's lobby. The Premier's lobby itself is small and intimate, which is nice in that we never had to deal with throngs of tourists or wait in line. We were immediately checked in and directed to our room (on the 16th floor, I believe, as we had paid for an upgrade).The room was surprisingly spacious! We requested a king bed, and there was also a sofa plus ample room for our two medium size suitcases and carry-ons. The bathroom was also a surprise in that it included a bathtub with an unusual counter configuration and a small corner shower. After walking around NYC, I thoroughly enjoyed soaking in the bathtub every night. A white waffle weave robe was also provided, along with lightweight bathroom slippers. Those were nice touches.The Keurig coffee and the complimentary bottled water were very appreciated. Housekeeping was also very accommodating in providing more upon request.And the complimentary breakfast on the 2nd floor lounge was great! We didn't need or want big breakfasts, but we were thrilled by what they had available: fresh fruit chunks, yogurt cups, granola and hard boiled eggs. There was a variety of mini danish pastries and a make-your-own waffle machine. There was a huge toasting tunnel machine for bagels and an assortment of breads. Juices and coffee and water bottles. In the evening, the same lounge served as a happy hour bar. It was wonderful relaxing there with wine, cheese and crackers and brief conversations with other guests. We shared suggestions about the sites we had visited and where everyone had come from. We met a British mother & daughter who met up in NYC because the daughter now lives in Colorado. We met a young Hispanic couple who were enjoying a break in his military service.The food and drinks in the lounge were nice, but the staff was even better! All of them were so helpful and accommodating and generous with the small water bottles. Those come in very handy for taking vitamins or day trekking and were very appreciated! Don't forget to tip them well!The location of the hotel was great, within a short walk to Times Square and near Broadway theaters. We are seniors but were able to walk to the Empire State Building and back from the U.S.S. Enterprise with occasional break stops. It's also not too far from the bus line and subway although I wouldn't want to haul luggage there. There were 45 steps down/up at the nearest subway stop!I think this is a great hotel for independent travelers. No crowds! The most people we encountered were in their intimate 2nd floor lounge, but even then we always found a place to sit and enjoy our breakfast or happy hour. The room rate is not cheap (we paid an average of $400 a night for an upgraded room), but you receive good value and they don't nickel and dime you for everything.I would not recommend this hotel for business travelers who need support services. We had a Fedex envelope sent to the hotel and told the front desk that we were expecting it, not once but about 3 times. When it didn't arrive at the front desk (which is really a desk, not a counter), they told us to check with Shipping. We left a message on Shipping's voice mail and told them what we were looking for. We didn't get called back until a day later, then we were told to go to the Millennium Broadway Hotel to retrieve the Fedex envelope. My husband had to find that hotel's Shipping Department, where he encountered a guard who was not very helpful. We got the envelope a day late and just before checkout. It was a good thing that the contents weren't too vital or time-sensitive. I felt that was the weakest part of the hotel.Finally, the concierge/doorman was very nice about trying to help us hail a cab after we checked out. Unfortunately there is very little traffic on that street (which is a positive too), and any taxis that come by will have already picked up a fare at Times Square. We waited a long time out in the cold with no success. We finally had to haul our bags up to 6th Avenue where we quickly snagged a cab. I don't know if the Premier Hotel has any car services they can call, but it was never suggested and should have been if this is a recurring problem.All in all, we considered our stay at the Premier Hotel a great stay and a great value.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The best thing about this hotel is the location as you are moments from the heart of Times Square. The rooms were nice, very spacious with comfy beds and chairs to sit.Only a very small criticism with the breakfast; we found there was no where to sit to eat as they didn't provide tables but just a few lobby chairs which filled up quickly. However, we didn't really care as we went out to eat. I would go back to this hotel and would recommend to other travellers.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Our room was very inexpensive and we got a room on a high floor with ceiling to floor windows and you could see the Times Square ball from our room. Nice amenities, and bathroom with tub and shower. Large, clean bright room. Convenient location. Reception was very pleasant. I would definitely stay again and would recommend. Only issue is parking is expensive in the area, so might be better to park further east and walk over if you don't have too much luggage.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I have been lucky because I have got a room on the 7th floor facing the time square. The rooms are large, nice and clean. The service at the Mezzanine floor where you can get your breakfast was really great. The breakfast more average.I really liked the location because everything is nearby in walking distance.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I pre-paid my reservation at the Premier Hotel. The receptionist was so rude upon arrival I decided to stay next door at the Millennium. She talked down to me and was unwilling to answer questions. I hope the hotel's management fixes this problem.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I've stayed in many hotels in NYC and around Times Square. I stay in Times Square due to the location of my office here. This gives me plenty of hotel options. This time I was staying for over a week, so wanted to try something new that was a few mins walk from my office.I was very surprised at this hotel, The location is excellent. It is literally in the heart of Times Square and if that's where you want to be, this is a great choice. I don't need to say much about the location, it speaks for itself.The hotel itself is modern, rooms are large by NYC standards and it is very well appointed. The bathroom is large, the room is spacious and surprisingly quiet given its location (remember we are in the middle of Times Square), so there is some noise.The room had a coffee maker, iron and board, a great selection of TV channels on a large TV. The bed was comfortable with nice linen and generally very clean,The gym is open 24 hours and it is quite well equipped.If you don't want to pay for 5 stars, this is an excellent choice. I was very comfortable.Both myself and my colleagues dealt with one very disinterested and, frankly, rude front desk lady. Why these people work in customer service I have no idea. That was the only thing that was not positive in the whole experience.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The Premier has been the worst ever 5 star experience i ever had in my life. I did my booking through priceline, where it was showing me a 5 star property in times square with breakfast included and with gym.On arriving at the hotel i found out the lobby was infact smaller than what a three star would have, and on top of, it the receptionist who checked in us was really very very rude, as per me she does not deserve to be in a customer service job at all. Though i appreciate one thing about the hotel i got the room at 11am versus the checkin time of 3pm.After checking i realised they do not have anything of there own, the gym is located in the hotel next door if you want to access you have to go there. Also they provide you only with a name sake breakfast which has only the bread butter, flakes, tea and coffee. But you have an option to upgrade your breakfast by paying USD 10 per person in which case you will have to go to the hotel next door to have the breakfast. The rooms were very small and was given queen size single bed room and that too on 3rd floor. Since the booking was done using a website which hides the name and reveals only when booked, the rate you recieve should be the lowest available but unfortunately after i booked i saw the same hotel giving high floor rooms at a lower price on different website that too disclosing the name before hand. This makes me feel cheated for sure.I would never ever intend to visit this hotel again as its not at all value for money, only except the location which is the best. And never i would recommend anyone to use priceline for bookings to be done.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We chose this hotel due to location. It was NYE and our one year anniversary! Location was awesome! One block from the action of the ball drop. We could actually hear the concerts begin early in the afternoon from our room. Service was good. Whatever we needed was obtainable with no hassles. The only , very small complaint, was the room is not as clean as I would like. Yes, on the surface it was clean, but it needs a deep clean, If that makes sense. I did feel as though we had clean sheets and bedding. Our view from our window was amazing! We had the best anniversary NYE. I would recommend this hotel and stay there again.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel is amazing! Staff are superb, you can't beat the location (2 minutes from times square) and the room itself was huge!We had a room with a view of the NYE ball, the room was spotless, massive and the bed was so comfy! You also couldn't hear a thing outside which is a blessing in NYC.The hotel rate included breakfast and happy hour. The staff at both were very friendly and professional. Breakfast is a range of cereals, fresh bagels, bread and pastry. I had bagels with cream cheese and egg every morning - this would easily have cost $10-15 in a cafe. Happy hour is what made this hotel so amazing. Every evening we cam back to the hotel to refuel and get ready to go out again. Happy hour was free beers and wine and soft drinks, some lovely meats, cheese, olives. Enough to tide you over between lunch and dinner. It's a very safe hotel, you can't use the lift without your room key. We visited in the summer and it was scorching hot, but the hotels aircon was very good and super quiet. This is now our go to hotel in NYC! Can't fault it!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This was a great hotel in a fab location. We had a room with a view (looking over 44th St with the tower of screens in Times Sq clearly visible from our windows) on the 14th Floor. Noise was fine, we heard horns and sirens but that's just NYC and we both tuned it out soon enough. It didn't keep either of us awake. Room was spacious with a sofa and a good size bathroom with separate bath and shower. It was tidy and clean. The staff were great, both in reception and housekeeping. I would say the hotel has a relaxed atmosphere and not uptight at all. The reception desk is manned all night.We didn't actually take advantage of the continental breakfast or evening nibbles but it was good to know it was available.We wouldn't hesitate to return.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: If you are looking for a boutique smaller hotel The Premier is what you are looking for. Great location between 7th and 6th Ave. The staff is very helpful and friendly. Monique at the front desk is like a family member. She is so sweet and caring. We love her!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: When we checked in, we were allocated a room at the front of the hotel on the 7th floor which had a great view over towards time square, the room had not been cleaned though. We complained and were then moved to a room at the back on the 2nd floor. We complained again and asked for the original room after it had been cleaned. We were told it was not available as the air con was broken, we think this was just an excuse as they did not want to rush to clean it.We stayed in the second floor room which was missing a piece off the bottom of the door so there was a half inch gap, we complained, but it was not resolved during our 5 night stay.The location is great and the free continental breakfast and evening drinks with nibbles is good but that's about it. The sister hotel next door, might be better.On the whole, disappointed, especially as it was part of a birthday trip for my partner to NYC.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: There's so much to write , so I'll give a bit of context and then break events down point-by-point. Forgive the novel, but I felt you deserved a full picture.My girlfriend and I had been talking about going to NYC for Christmas, but we never had the budget in place. This year, we saw that Premier had a good deal and booked it in November. Coming away from it, I'm not sure I'd want stay with them again based on the staff's lack of professionalism, foresight, and overall knowledge. --------------First night: Employee talking about me while I was right there1. Since we're on a budget, we planned to make our 9 hour drive. The trip turned into an 11 hour drive because the hotel does NOT have a visible sign. "Millenium Broadway" is visible, but it’s a different hotel. It does not say "Premier" anywhere except a small logo on a glass window that you won't find if you're driving by. So, we passed the entrance twice and it takes forever to loop around in traffic, right? I parked the car a block up to go search for the place manually and managed to find it and check in. After being in the car forever, I wanted the Valet to park the car. He offered me different parking places that are cheaper that I'd have to go find. Being unfamiliar with the city and tired, I just wanted him to take the car and park it. When I stated that, he said, "well, but it will take about an hour for us to get it for you when you need it." He said there was a parking place across the street. I said, fine, I'd take it myself since it was within view. I waited 20m in line for them to tell me they were full. So, I parked the car let the valet know I'd really like him to take it. He offered other places. I said, "let me be clear that I have been in the car for 11 hours and I'm tired. I don't really want to be in the car anymore." He got the picture and I showed him to the car. His body language was very annoyed and then he said, "oh, it's ALL the way up there?" It was literally right up the street. It took less than 10 seconds to walk there. Maybe actual 10 seconds. On the way to the elevator, I couldn't believe my ears when I heard him tell a co-worker in a frustrated voice, "she wants me to get her car and It's all the way down the block." He even said it in front of another guest! I was so surprised at his lack of professionalism. It said a lot about the atmosphere there that he felt comfortable saying that to his co-worker in front of myself and another guest checking in.Day 2-4: Double charge that they could NOT get fixed2. The next morning, my girlfriend and I had planned to do some shopping, so I checked my bank account and found a 586 dollar charge on my account for the stay...but we already payed that in November! I thought, okay, no big deal, I'll just let them know this happened. I went downstairs and found Monique at the front desk and let her know the situation. She called someone, firmly let them know of the situation, called another person to let them know check-ins need to be more attentive as it displayed we paid and let the manager know, saying it'd prob be dropped by the afternoon with a smile on her face. She was ON IT and knowledgable! But, by mid-afternoon, it was still there. I was out and called in to check on progress, asked for the manager, explained what the call was about, and was put on hold. Then, a guy picked up who wasn't the manager and asked me what I was calling about with an annoyed tone. While trying to explain the situation, he kept interrupting me to tell me my charges incidence fees. I kept trying to tell him that I was talking about the additional stay charge. He kept re-interrupting me to correct me on what I was talking about, and I had to raise my voice to tell him he wasn't listening to me, and he said, "you can be pissed but that's not going to fix the problem." What did he think I was trying to do? He said he'd transfer me to the manager, and then told me the manager was busy. I let a "of course he's busy" slip, and he said, "oh of course he is, because there's 729 rooms and only one manager," and then put me on hold. I was not transferred to the manager, but a lady named Victoria. She was very professional and though she hadn't known anything about the situation despite Monique requesting this on the phone the day before, she said she'd put in a request to have the charge dropped because accounting had already left for the day (it was like, 2pm). I let her know we had already done that, and she assured me that it would be dropped within 24 hours. 24 hour later, it was still there. Exasperated and now my girlfriend paying for everything, I decided to go to the manager in person on the Millenium Broadway side. When I went to the front desk, the lady told me he was in a meeting and it should only take 15 minutes. A half hour later, I asked if he was out. She said he wasn't and I asked if she could let him know I was waiting. She said she didn't know where they had the meeting and had no way of contacting him. I found this really surprising and frustrating -- everywhere I have ever worked, if I have needed to contact the boss about something, there has always been a way to do that. I sat down again and waited, and after an hour, I had to leave. While on the other side of town, the manager called me to visit. When I got back, he told me he'd fix it by calling my bank and giving them a code. My bank said they didn't do that process anymore and he was confused and told me he didn't know how to work the system, but he'd try to fix it himself, then said he wanted to give us free breakfast in apology. I told him I'd rather accounting did it and that we already got free breakfast and asked if it could be a dinner. He agreed to a $50 room service dinner and gave me a card with a previous manager’s name crossed out and his own scrawled underneath it. Then, the room service guy wasn’t informed and tried to get us to pay for it. AND we were charged tax and gratuity for it! I couldn't believe it. The next morning, our last morning, I got up early and visited Monique. She checked our account, deleted the gratuity pay and extra charges we shouldn’t have had, and when we checked out and someone asked us for another random 80 dollar charge, she told the lady “no, not for this room.” She then made it clear she’d follow up with the manager that everything was dropped. And by the next day, it was.We still had a good time, but it really took a lot away from the experience because I spent so much time worrying about money and being frustrated.The good things were: breakfast was good, the hotel looked clean, and the room was gorgeous.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Everything was wonderful! Incredible location, half block from Times Square. Beautiful afternoon wine hour, free continental breakfast and Wi-Fi. You will pay more, but you won't get better. Will be our new hotel everytime we come to the city.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Booked 4 nights at The Premier Hotel during the week before Christmas. I was able to get an incredible rate through Priceline. The location is very good, the staff were all very helpful, and the room was larger than most standard rooms in NYC. The only issue that I had is that the shower is a bit tight because there is a separate bath tub. The rest of the bathroom and room are very spacious. Everything was very clean and I would not hesitate to stay here again, especially at the rate that I booked.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: You can access the lobby of this hotel via two ways - through the lobby of the much fancier Millennium Hotel and then down a hidden passageway, or through a revolving door that is accessible from the outside but super easy to miss - and the lobby itself is barely there. But after that odd introduction, you are in for a treat - spacious and quiet rooms, a "concierge" lounge for members, friendly service and quite reasonable prices for a NYC hotel. I really enjoyed my stay here and will be very happy to stay here again.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Brought my daughter and grandson to NYC at Christmastime for his first visit to this city I love. This hotel was a great value: large rooms, wonderful Times Square views which he loved, terrific water pressure, good light in the bathrooms, which is a pet peeve of mine, and the best soundproofing I've had in a hotel. We had 2 rooms on the 11th floor, and heard NO street noise. My grandson sang at the top of his lungs one morning, and I was in the next room -- did not hear him at all. And the staff was just as nice and helpful as could be. Great location for access to subway, theater, restaurants. Highly recommend, especially for the price.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We have just returned after a 4 night stay at the Hotel, We booked this hotel after reading many positive reviews. We arrived at the hotel early in the afternoon and did not think we would be able to check in, however we were checked in immediately. The room was lovely, comfortable bed, very clean and tidy and nice bathroom. There is also a safe in the room, which is convenient for keeping travel documents and cash etc. Complimentary tea/coffee making facilities and complimentary bottle of water was a nice touch. There is a free continental breakfast provided which gives a varies choice of cereal, toast and various pastries. There is also a happy hour between 5pm and 7pm, which offers beer and wine.The location is perfect, 2 minutes walk to Times Square and Broadway, The Subway is located nearby and it is within easy walking distance of 5th Avenue, Grand Central Station and the Empire State Building.There is a wide range of restaurants to choose from, with the excellent Red Flame Diner a mere 5 walk away.I would definitely recommend this hotel and would happily stay there again.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Unfortunately I couldn't recommend this hotel to you. Firstly the lady on the front desk at check on was more interested in talking to a colleague than telling us the information. She told us she had written down breakfast and happy hour times but only gave us our room cards, nothing else. Secondly, reception closes at about 10pm and if you need assistance with anything you have to ring the neighbouring hotel down the same block and they will assist you. I don't really like the idea of this, I prefer reception to be open. We needed to check breakfast time when we arrived back to the hotel at 10pm but couldn't as there was no one there to ask!The bed was comfortable, the bathroom wasn't the best.
