There was NO heating in the bathroom whatsoever, the heating in the room was blow heating (noisy) but this didn't extend to the bathroom. Not good in December! There was only 1 bathrobe and slippers in a roon for 2 people. Also only 1 shower cap per bathroom. It's a room for 2!!!There were no plugs beside the beds and only very limited plug sockets in the room itself.I was disappointed with the tea making facility, no liquid milk option, only powdered creamer. Little things matter. There was an awful drilling sound before 7am each morning, I'm not sure what it was, possibly the plumbing as I don't believe there was any building work on the hotel or surrounding area.I was really happy with the computer and printer facility as this averted a near tragedy for us when we hadn't printed out the correct theatre tickets. Thank you! Breakfast was ok, the breakfast room was not. Comfy chairs and low tables, the chairs were shabby and torn (not all of them) and some people were standing eating cereal as there wasn't enough seating to accommodate. The nibbles at happy hour were minimal but ok and the drinks were free, happy days.All in all I was disappointed and will not return nor recommend. I should've returned to the Americana hotel, Times Square, it was so much nicer.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: My husband and I stayed for 6 nights for his 40th birthday. We requested a high floor room and received a lovely email acknowledging our request and when we arrived we were allocated room 1919. What a fantastic view we had right onto Times Square. Overall a fantastic hotel with extremely helpful staff. Will definitely be our hotel of choice next time we are in NY

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here for 5 nights in December while visiting NYC. I have been to NYC 4 times now and this is the first time I've stayed in Manhattan. As expected, things cost more in the city but the trade off for not having to ride in on the subway each day are well worth it. The Premier is an amazing hotel that sits just one half a block off the main strip for Times Square. Easy subway access, tons of restaurants, walking distance (10 minutes) to Rockefeller and so many other things.The hotel personnel were very friendly and helpful anytime we had a request or question. Free breakfast served every morning for guests. Breakfast is not huge but has cereal, milk, breads, fruits, coffee, eggs and other juices. Very nice atmosphere.The room was very clean and had all the essentials such as an ironing board, hair driver, shower, bath tub, desk, TV and a view of the ball at Times Square. WiFi in the room was spotty but worked well when it would stay connected.I would stay here again without hesitation.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: It is a nice hotel. There is a complimentary breakfast that is nice. Also, there is a complimentary wine and cheese serve from 5:30 to 7:00pm that is wonderful. Saddly the hotel charge me twice for the reservation. Contacting the Accounting Department to solve the issue was not easy. It was the only negative experience from the hotel.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We have been at the premier hotel New York City early December. The hotel is nice, in a strategic position very close to time square on the 44th. The rooms are bigger than the New York standard but very basic. People at the reception are professional but not very warm and friendly. Breakfast is very very basic, they sell it as continental breakfast but it consists only in some muffins, cereals and fruits. We had some problems with AC and the toilet not flushing in one of our rooms. The maintenance took care of everything but was annoying. I would recommend the hotel because rooms are quite big and for the strategic position but the price is a bit high considering the quality of services offered.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I stayed at The Premier for two nights. I found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. The room was small but not uncomfortable. It was very clean and quiet for a midtown hotel. I would absolutely stay here again.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I stayed on the Premier side of this hotel. The welcoming attitude and friendly staff in NYC made it special. The doorman during my stay made it that much more enjoyable by giving me tips of where to eat and place to go. The rooms were excellent and roomy with comfortable beds.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I was staying with other work colleagues so I didn't have much of a choice. I had just stayed two days at EVEN Hotel which I really enjoyed so I think that effected my experience here. Here are the positives: great location (if you have to stay near Times Square); smallish hotel so it's pretty quiet, the lobby staff are great, there is breakfast and a happy hour (see cons below). Nice amenities (ironing board/iron, safe, shoe polish type stuff, hair dryer) in room. Internet connection was very good. Bed was comfy. Great black out curtains. Complimentary bottle of water provided.Cons: the decor of the rooms is kind of tired (I'd date it 1995) and more importantly is very last century in that there are inadequate outlets or other means of charging devices (make sure you don't just bring USB charger as there were no USB outlets). The closet was so small and jam-packed with stuff (see "amenities" above) that it was difficult to keep your small carry on sized suitcase in the closet on the luggage rack and still be able to open it and access it and then forget about trying to hang stuff because they'll be hanging down to your suitcase. The bathroom was huge and included a bath tub which means that the shower was a tortuously small space, the width of the door. The lights are all on or all off (except for one desk light) so you couldn't really set your own mood. The TV takes up so much space on the desk with the space-aged lazy susan it was on that you literally have about 2.5 feet between the TV and the wall to work. Lastly, the sleep quality. It boggles my mind that we pay so much for hotel rooms in large cities that can't be used for SLEEPING IN because of noise and other factors: it's near Times Square. Ear plugs and the fan going aren't enough to drown it out the noise. The door had about a 1.5 inch space at the bottom that required you use the bath towels to blot out the light from the elevator lobby. Surprisingly, when I did that, I noticed light still emanated from AROUND the door. Then of course there's the slamming of the doors because all the other guests don't understand that the automatic door mechanism will SLAM THE DOOR SHUT if you don't hold the door and let it close gently. So, the room is actually a very expensive place to store your stuff (but not easily access it) near Times Square where you can get some work done because of the good internet connection and take a nap or two.Then if you want to use the subway, you're walking about three blocks ACROSS Times Square (a feat in and of itself during the holidays)...Lastly, the happy hour and the breakfast. They are fine for what they are..haven't read the reviews here and I'm sure people feel the breakfast didn't have enough variety or whatever. My complaint is that the space they make everyone cram into was inadequate and with seating for maybe 20 people, you'll probably be standing with your breakfast. It was an average experience overall...

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I visited New York on business during a busy week in December and ended up here more or less by happenstance - and I was happy that I did.The Premier Hotel is maybe half a block from Times Square, and an easy walk to other attractions such as Rockefeller Plaza. It is close to countless restaurants and theaters.There is a fairly small lobby, which is not atypical in New York, but I was quickly greeted by the helpful hotel staff. I actually arrived slightly early, but they found me room anyway that was very welcome after an early morning trip.The room itself wasn't large by midwestern standards, but was just fine and, again, typical for New York. The decor was modern with a little bit of a twist. I liked having a room with some personality. There were plenty of plugs for electronics, a large flat panel TV, and Wi-fi was included in the price, all good. My view was out the front, which turned out to be really cool as I had a view of part of Times Square including the "ball" that falls on New Year's eve.They have complimentary light cocktails between 5 and 7 that I did not try, but would be nice after a long day. They also have a free breakfast that I did - It wasn't especially fancy, but they did have some very fresh fruit, including pineapple, and a variety of breads and cereals. The staff was extremely friendly.This hotel is an excellent choice in mid-town Manhattan, and especially good if you are going to one of the many nearby theaters.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The Hotel location was great as it was a short walk to Times square. The Lobby staff was also friendly and helpful, Another nice feature was the cocktail hour each evening. The room we had was a little dated and the room configuration is a little different, but the bed was comfortable. Would have liked to have fridge but not a show stopper. This hotel is affiliated with the Millennium Hotel two doors down. This hotel appeared more updated and much larger but did not get to see the rooms. It would also be a great choice based on location.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I stayed in this hotel for work in September and while I didn't actually select this hotel, I was very pleased. The location is right off of Times Square, so you're close enough to the action, but still removed a bit from it. It can be hard to find the entrance. I ended up having to check the address before walking in. The lobby is very small and cozy. Check-in was quick, if not overly friendly. (She did warm up as I said hello to her every time I entered or exited the lobby.)My room was a standard Premier Room. There are only seven rooms on each floor, making it feel very boutique. My room had a bed, desk/chair, wall-mounted flatscreen TV, and a loveseat. The furnishings were vaguely Scandinavian. I also had a small fridge. The bed, pillows and linen were comfortable. The bathroom must have been from a previous design scheme, very different than the blonde woods of the bedroom. There was a separate tub and shower, a long counter with sink, and toilet. It was very clean, if a tiny bit dated. The water pressure was adequate and the towels were on the fluffy side.Wifi in the room was very fast. And the AC worked very well. I was very fortunate that I had a view of the New Year's Eve ball in Times Square as well. (I cannot imagine how expensive that room has to be on NYE.) Apparently, there is a lounge with breakfast and afternoon service. I was unfortunately working and couldn't make it for either. Overall, I really was happy with my stay and would definitely consider returning to this hotel. The location is great if you need to be in the midtown area and I particularly liked that it felt like an oasis in the midst of Times Square.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: My family stayed at the Premier Hotel this November to cheer my daughter on for the New York marathon. This hotel was the perfect location if you want to be in walking distance to times square..close to GMA show and starbucks close by! The hotel is clean and although front lobby is small the staff treats with respect and kindness and you feel immediately at home. The rooms are very clean and bed comfy! There is a breakfast in the morning and happy hour cocktail at night conveniently located on one of the floors. I would definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Didn't realize at time of booking what a great hotel we booked. It's in a great location in Times Square, provides free breakfast in a relaxed atmosphere, free drinks, including beer and wine 5-7pm and the room and hotel itself is of a good standard. Would definitely recommend

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed at this hotel for six nights after reviewing several in the area just off Times Square. Decided because it offered free breakfast and also a happy hour where drinks were free from 17:00 to 19:00, turned out to be a very good decision.The hotel is literally one minute from Times Square, a subway close by, most of the attractions and shops easy walking distance, the staff were very easy to talk to, friendly and informative, we had a queen sized room which was very clean, love the fact that we had a walk in shower AND a bath. Back to the happy hour, given the price of drinks in the local area you can make a big saving here, so seriously consider, my partner bought a glass of wine next door and it cost $17.50, makes you think doesn't it ? I estimate we saved approx $5/6 hundred dollars in six nights, probably more seeing as we were a party of four.Also one of the more comfortable beds I have slept in.I would DEFINATELY stay here again.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I visit Times Square to go to Broadway about every 6 weeks during the season. I usually stay at the Mela (across the street) or the Millennium. However, I price lined this hotel and it was amazing. The room was spacious, even had a little sitting area. Bathroom was clean and modern. The Continental breakfast which is offered at no extra charge was really really good. Another plus for this hotel is the security. You must use your key to access the elevator, so it cuts down on folks who might just decide to follow you in the elevator. Truly my new favorite place.
user_name:
Susan G
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Perfect location very close to Times Square central to everything including Central Park 5 th Avenue ect amazing staff so welcoming on arrival extra large room with lovely furnishings large luxury bathroom and toiletries extra comfortable Bed with quality linen room includes breakfast and two hour happy hour with drinks and snacks every evening. Such good value. Thoroughly recommend to anyone visiting New York. This is the best. Well done. Excellent

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: What a lovely hotel..yes the furniture and decor is a tad dated but lovely and clean the bed and pillows are sooooo comfy..bathroom is well stocked and refilled daily with shampoo body lotion etc..tea & coffee replenished daily the complementary breakfast is really good there's plenty of choice ..and the same in the early evening with the hors d'oeuvres there's also complementary wine beer and soft drinks .the wine is lovely nit the cheap tasting vinegar stuff we were expecting!! Location is second to none right in the heart of the broadway theatre district..don't hesitate to book if your looking it's a gem of a hotel...

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Ok, let's not waste time.Wonderful position, in the middle of Manhattan, just two blocks (maybe less) from Time Square. Quite calm for the location, even at night.Concierge and staff are really kind and gentle and always ready to help.The Hotel has little aged Rooms that didn't met my expectations, expecially for the price payed.Clean.Anyway, from there, You will reach any place.Suggested if You don't find nothing better.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here in early November. What an excellent stay we had.our room on 18th floor was quite large for a new york hotel. It was very clean.It had everything we needed e.g. tv coffee maker iron hairdryer etc. The hotel offers a free continental breakfast which was great and also there is a happy hour (2 hours) that offers you free nibbles wine and beer which was amazing. The location the staff the room were all excellent. It was my birthday while we there,and when we got to our room there was a birthday card a packet of macarons and a bottle of fizz on ice waiting for me and my wife.We will definitely be going back.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We travel to NYC several times a year but this was our first stay at the Premier Hotel. We found the location and service to be excellent. The best value for our stay was the managers' reception daily from 5-7 which offered quality wine and beer and a variety of healthy snacks, fruits and roasted veggies. The choice changed each night. The breakfast buffet was quite satisfying too with fresh fruit, yogurt, hard boiled eggs and a cappuccino machine. The room was spacious and the bathroom unusually large for a city hotel. We will return!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Nice hotel, clean rooms. Free breakfast which is rare for New York! The best part is undoubtedly the location. We were in NYC for my husband's first ever visit, and this was the perfect hotel. Convenient to Central Park, the Empire State Building, Times Square, and of course all the theaters you could possibly want. You also have free wifi which is also rare in New York... however would I stay there again most likely know as I prefer the palace hotel which wasn't available when we went last year

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We have been to NYC 4 times and this was by far the best hotel we stayed at. The rooms are big, the wifi actually works and works well in the rooms without any up charge, the nightly complimentary happy hour with munchies, wine, and beer also was just fantastic. The front desk people were awesome at checkin. Honestly, we don't have a bad thing to say about this place. We will definitely be back.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We purchased a 5-night stay at this hotel through Hotwire for $220/night. That is a good price for any decent NYC hotel, but for The Premier it is an outstanding value. The room was exceptionally large by NYC standards, and the bathroom (with tub and separate shower) was quite spacious, as well. The room was well furnished, with a sofa, separate desk and chair, and one wall of floor-to-ceiling windows that provided an incredible view, from our 17-th floor room. Although there was no refrigerator in the room, a request at check-in brought one delivered and set up in less than 30 minutes, at no charge. All of the staff, from the front-desk personnel to the breakfast and happy hour servers, were very attentive, friendly, and eager to serve. The breakfast is continental style, which suited us just fine. Every evening they have a nice happy hour with wine, beer, and other beverages, and light hors d'oeuvres. The hotel is well-located squarely in midtown--on W. 44th st., between Broadway/7th Ave. and 6th Ave., a brief walk from both the Times Square subway station and the 42nd st. IND station. We were very satisfied with every aspect of this hotel.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Nice hotel, clean rooms. Free happy hour and breakfast! The best part is undoubtedly the location. We were in NYC for my husband's first ever visit, and this was the perfect hotel. Convenient to Central Park, the Empire State Building, Times Square, and of course all the theaters you could possibly want. Great experience.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I have arrived at the hotel at 4.30pm and I have been told my room is not ready and I will have to wait for an hour. Check out time for hotel guests is 12 so unsure why the hotel are so unorganised. So I have been up since 3am travelling from the UK and book a "so called" 4 and half star hotel and this is the reception I receive.So far not happy at all as all we have been told is wait in reception.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: My husband and I have been to NYC more times than I can remember, but the trip we made in October was one of the best yet primarily due to the fact that we stayed in the amazing Premier hotel. Our stay was perfect from start to finish. Everyone at the front desk was professional and helpful. Our room was on the 8th floor, very quiet with an awesome view including a view of the Times Square ball. Housekeeping did an immaculate job every day. The room was very clean and spacious. Loved the bathroom with the separate tub and shower. I also like a cup of coffee when I first get up in the morning so the Keurig machine was such a nice touch. We really enjoyed the complimentary breakfast every morning and we also took advantage of the complimentary wine and cheese hours in the afternoon. It was such a nice place to relax before we headed out in the evenings. We also took advantage of the Charlotte bar next door at the Millenium hotel. We stopped by there several nights after attending a couple of plays. We were able to walk everywhere since the location was perfect. We're coming back to your great city in January for my birthday and would love to stay at the Premier again!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: My mum and I just spent a week at the Premier. I can't say how much we loved our stay. The rooms were immaculate and spacious, the continental breakfast was perfect, the location of the hotel was the best. The staff were all gracious and friendly and went out of their way to help with directions for us when we needed them. I'd stay again!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We spent three nights at the Premier before our New England/Canada cruise. We traveled with two other couples and the concierge managed to get us all one the same floor, three. Our rooms were all very nice and the bathrooms were outstanding. The location was perfect for our stay and the breakfast was plentiful enough for us, but the best part of our day was the happy hour. The snacks and beer and wine were a perfect way to relax after a busy day. The only concern we had was probably our own fault...we were looking for advise in regards to purchasing theater tickets and the concierge was not at the desk so we wondered over to the Millenium. We ended up getting our theater tickets and our hop n hop off bus tickets from their desk. The up charge was very costly. Forty dollars a couple for out bus tickets and over ninth for our theater tickets. They did refund our bus ticket up charge and apologized but we learned a valuable lesson. I would absolutely return to The Premier Hotel!❤️

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Great room, great service. Loved our stay. Friendly, helpful staff and the location could not be better. A block to times square but none of the noise. Breakfast and afternoon social was a treat. Will come back if the price remains reasonable.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: You can hardly be better located. I t takes you 20 seconds to get to time sqare. Everything of interest in New York can be reached from here easily. The hotel nicely arranged, for New York standards big rooms, breakfast included and snacks and drinks starting at 5 pm. Prices are absolutely competitive. The staff is friendly and supportive. The Premier will defintitely see me again.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I cannot fault this hotel. Right next to Times Square and the staff are very friendly. Part of the millennium hotel group if you wish to upgrade your breakfast to a cooked breakfast it is $10 and you go through to the millennium hotel. Not always worth it as you have coffee and pastries for breakfast which lets face it can be enough for anyone first thing.Overall great hotel and reasonable price. Would definatly recommend.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Had to search for someone to check us in. Lady at the front was upset that replacement had not arrived, she said "I've had a bad day and want to go home". She walked away. Once we finally got checked in (not by her), we found there was no AC. Room was very warm. We where told that it was" a State Law to turn off AC after August" to open our windows. Really? Why lie to your guest. We checked with hotels around this location and everyone else had AC. To many hotels in the area to stay at one that lies to you.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here for 2 nights. The location is great. We arrived into the Port Authority building on the metro from JFK and walked here with our cases, it was no distance. We were given a room on the 18th floor which was lovely, very spacious, clean and had all the facilities you could need. Breakfast was small but everything you could need for a breakfast really with different breads, pastries, cakes, fruit, cereal etc. It did get very busy, we went early but seating soon filled with some people arriving and not being able to sit. The staff were all very friendly and there was the facility to leave luggage after check out until later that day which was great. Would highly recommend.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel is quaint and has quite a view of the city. rooms clean. Comfortable. people at the desk are very service oriented and helpful. I had a very big problem with my 3rd party booking with hotwire, and the asst manager worked miracles for me and now I am happy with my stay.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Obviously, so close to Time Square the location is great. However, the hotel itself needs renovation and is not so much up-to-date. The rooms are OK in terms of space though, however having a curtain in the shower is something from 20 years ago and not so much appropriate for 2016. The breakfast is very limited, and not a very comfortable place to sit. Value for money is not what it should be, I guess you pay for being around the corner from Time Square.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: First time to New York! The location was perfect. We were able to walk to most places in Manhattan. Breakfast and Happy Hour saved us a great deal of money. The staff were very friendly and helpful! Our room and bathroom were large. I would stay here again!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: the hotel room was nice. the bathroom is big and clean. I used the concierge service in the main hotel next door. they were a lot more helpful and friendly than the premier. I had called the premier before the trip asking about the taxi service from the airport. I didn't get a name but a male told me $36 which was incorrect. of course it is based on your meter and the traffic. it cost us $60.00 and took an hour and a half from LaGuardia airport at 11:00 am weekday. going back it only cost $26.00. due to less traffic. he also told me the big bus tour was the same price if you buy it from them. it actually is cheaper online the day before. we had breakfast also next door and it was good and had a good price. other than getting misinformation it was a nice stay. also the day we got there the person at the desk was not very friendly although she did get us a room early with no additional cost. it was next to the elevator and the view was terrible but at least the elevator noise was not bad.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: All the stars in the review are just because of its location.Everything else apparently was very mediocre, from reception-services to morning breakfast to room services.While I was gone, they took off almost all my formal clothes for laundry without my permission; and was returned only 3 days later.Front desk manager's attitude was pompous and ignorant right from the start; be it about dealing with the laundry-issue; and finally disagreeing to even call me a taxi (His exact words: "In NYC, we cant call a taxi, you'll have to find on your own"), thankfully Uber came to rescue!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We try to get to NYC twice a year and almost always stay in a boutique hotel that serves breakfast in their lounge in the AM and wine and cheese in the evening. We recently stayed for 4 nights at The Premier Hotel (our first time at the hotel). We were very happy with our choice. Check-in was smooth, and our room was ready by 3 p.m. The room was very pleasant, modern, and large by NYC standards. The bathroom was especially spacious with lots of counter space and both a tub and a tile/stone shower stall. We were on an upper floor and away from any noise. The “tap” room key card makes entry easy; the key is also used on the elevator for extra security. Breakfast in the lounge provided just enough selection (and the coffee machine was fantastic; a double espresso decaf in seconds; heaven!). The lounge seating was comfortable and allowed for private conversation. For those who like a more substantial breakfast, a sign outside the lounge (and in the lobby) let people know they could go to the restaurant next door and get a discount as a guest of the hotel (we were happy with the continental breakfast in the hotel so didn’t try the restaurant). The wine and cheese in the evening was also a relaxing event. Two minor quibbles: the music in the lounge (at breakfast and in the evening) seemed a little intense – something a bit more relaxing would have been nice; and the seating in the lounge was limited. We always got a seat (we went early), but some people had to wait or couldn’t be accommodated. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel is in a great location just a few blocks from Times Square and so there’s easy access to theatres and restaurants (but it’s far enough away so that you can avoid the noise and the crowds). There seem to be a good selection of restaurants and pubs very close to the hotel. For us, the nearby pub was great for a drink and a snack after seeing a show. We both agreed that, without question, we would happily stay at The Premier Hotel on a future visit to NYC!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed in this hotel for a few days Oct 16.  Great location right at Times Square, perfect for sightseeing. Rooms a little bit dated but good size and spotlessly clean. Terrific touches such as complementary water in the room, continental breakfast and drinks and nibbles in the bar early evening. Breakfast served in the bar and sometimes a little difficult finding a seat, but as it's complementary it's worth the wait! Amazing friendly, helpful staff, nothing was ever too much trouble for them. Hector and Monique at reception were just brilliant. Would definitely return.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We have never stayed near Times Square before, but we got a good deal and figured it was worth a try. We were pleasantly surprised by how quiet it was and how convenient. We did request and receive a room on a higher floor, not sure if that made a difference. The room was very comfortable and well appointed. The breakfast and happy hour are adequate but nothing to go out of your way to do. All in all, we had a great visit and would stay here again.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here for four nights in middle of October. The location of the hotel is superb as only mins away from Times Square. We had requested a higher floor to get a better view which we were given with no problem and it couldn't have been better. Check in was a breeze we were given a warm and friendly welcome. The free breakfast we didn't take full advantage off however we did grab a coffee every morning. Happy hour is a lovely idea we didn't have time to stop and enjoy it as we were trying to fit so much in. An added benefit with a computer and printer available, we had some emailed tickets which were only issued 48 hours before the event so the convenience of being able to log in and print them off was superb. All the staff were very friendly and able to offer any help needed. Rooms were huge and very comfortable and kept very clean. It's the first hotel I'd book for my next visit back to New York, a quiet place amid a very busy chaotic city.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: In the Heart of Midtown, yet amazingly quiet. Great, attentive staff! The hotel was convenient to everything and the housekeeping staff was especially attentive. Great continental breakfast and complimentary cocktail hour.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: If you looking for a nice and functional hotel in the middle of Manhattan this is a perfect solution....Rooms are modern, with a wonderful view of the skyline of Time Square.Pity for the breakfast....not many place to sit and air conditioning it's too stronger (but this is an aspect common in all USA!!)

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: My husband and I stayed at the Premier on our Last trip to NYC. The location is ideal and only 1/2 a block off Time Square, yet the room was quite and sleep came easily. The room was clean and not cramped at all. The bonus surprise was the happy hour everyday between 5 and 7 pm. Wine and beer complimentary with light snacks. It was a great way to recharge and relax before heading out to a show and dinner.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed in the hotel for 8 nights. First night they overbooked my kind of room, so got to be in the penthouse for a night, and was excited from the size of the room, so specious and nice.The very next day they had my room ready, and I was surprise to see my room is almost as big!I've been to NY few times, and in some expensive hotels as well, but this was by far the biggest room. (Which is not a suit)My room was very clean (was cleaned every morning, and they came back again at 17:00 to check if clean towels were needed), The complementary breakfast is nice, The stuff were extremely nice and helpful when needed, And the location. Right in the corner to Sephora. Which is awesome and aweful at the same time ;) Very close to subway stations, and of course to Port authority, Both standing shower and bathtub, Bottle of water every day,Magazines on the coffee table,Coffee machine and supply of coffee everyday if needed, And the view from my window was definitely NYC. (Pictures added).To sum things up, When I'm back in NYC, will go to this hotel again. For sure.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Gorgeous hotel , very friendly staff but special mention goes to Monique whose is a genuine , friendly and funny member of staff . All the extra touches in room are much appreciated , to come into your room and find bed turned down for you was an unexpected touch , breakfast was more than ample . Locaion great , minutes from times square but so handy for all attractions . Looking for a New York hotel then look no further

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed for a week absolutely wonderful the staff so helpful and polite room was spotless.We enjoyed a continental breakfast great food and evening hor's douvres with wine or beer at no extra cost you have to stay here it's a no brainer

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Just visited this hotel on 30 Sept 16, and what a great find. Only about 6 rooms on each floor, and we didn't hear any noise. Lovely hotel and all staff were always pleasant and willing to help with anything. We had a queen room, bed great and so comfy, room even had a sofa. Bathroom had separate shower and bath, and also had bathrobes and slippers, along with complimentary toiletries. Breakfast was more than sufficient with bread which could be toasted, bagels, croissants, cereals, hard boiled eggs, pastries and drinks, great start to the day. Free wifi, which was great for my daughter. Also between 5-7pm there was drinks (beers, wine, soft drinks) and snacks which were free, a lovely touch, and a bit of chill out time. Another small touch was there being an umbrella left in the room to use, as was raining the day we arrived. Even to get a taxi the concierge would go outside to flag one down for us.Times Square literally at the end of the street and about a 10-15 mins walk to Empire State Building or 5th Avenue. Great Irish bar across the road from the hotel, food and atmosphere was lovely. Also a great meal (American portions) and the best cheesecake ever at Juniors Restaurant, from hotel, go to bottom of street straight over Times Square and its just on the right, near the theatre showing Matilda....well worth a visit. We couldn't eat our cheesecake so they boxed it up to take away with us. Myself and my daughter loved this hotel and would definately go back again and would recommend to others.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I'm struggling to see why this hotel has a rating 4 and 1/2 stars. Besides the size of the hotel room, the hotel itself is basic. CONS: Hotel Room: No minibar, not even a fridge. Shouldn't this be in a "luxury" hotel? Only 1 bottle of water provided.Threadbare/cheap small towels: My husband took a shower after we checked in and showed me the towel which looked like the equivalent of something you'd find in a 1-star hotel...it actually started ripping as he dried his back...I had to laugh!! It was also barely bigger than the size of the hand towels. Shower curtain: this should not be in a "luxury" hotel...gross. No plugs by the bed: as mentioned by othersFaucets: in both shower and sink are ridiculously old and basic and badly in need of updating Breakfast: way too many people, hardly anywhere to sit. There were a few items like toast but nothing to actually put on the toast. Do yourself a favor if you stay here and just go to the Red Flame diner a block away for breakfast (we did every morning after experiencing that debacle in the hotel)...cheap, tasty, and great customer service! Happy Hour: again hardly anywhere to sit...but the concept is niceCheck-in: Walked in to an empty lobby with no one around except a woman sitting at a desk. She couldn't be bothered to stand up from her desk. There was no greeting or eye contact when we came in. I had to say "hi checking in" and all I got was "what's the last name?" and then was asked for ID. After all was done, I had to ask where breakfast was. Her response was "Mezzanine." I'm not a mind-reader so I had to ask where exactly "Mezzanine" was because she didn't provide that information and of course there was no sign indicating where breakfast was in the elevator or the room so glad I asked. Check-out: At check-out, same woman who checked us in just says "you're all set" after handing her the keys. Nothing else. No "have a great day." No "thanks for staying with us"...nothing. Staff: Other staff members we encountered during our stay (such as the bartenders at happy hour), were very pleasant. These issues I would pretty much expect from a 3-star hotel. I would expect WAY more in the way of customer service at check-in and check-out.PROS:Hotel Room: by NYC standards, the room is quite large with floor to ceiling windows...nice! The room is also located on very quiet floors. Keurig coffeemaker.Bathroom: the size is large. But again as mentioned, the faucets and the shower need to be updated as well as better towelsLocation: fantastic, right in Times Square, close to subway lines and Bryant ParkGiven the pros, I still wouldn't stay here again. Way too many other hotels in NYC.
user_name:
Chandra W
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The Premier Hotel is a bit hard to find due to minimal signage at the street. The various desk clerks I encountered were very pleasant and helpful about the hotel and the area. My room was quite large by NYC standards. One of the desk clerks said the building used to be an office building, which may also have accounted for an odd feature. Aside from the bathroom, there is one light switch. It's all or nothing. Other than that oddity, the room is well lit but lacking adequate electrical outlets. I sleep with a CPAP and need an outlet near the bed. Fortunately, I carry an extension cord, which saved the day in this room. The bathroom is large and well-appointed. There is a tub and stall shower. The mattress was quite comfortable. There is coffee and tea in the room. The former mini-bar has been removed (Thank you). There is no mini-fridge or microwave oven. The room comes with a Continental breakfast, which is good as Continental breakfasts go. There is a 5 to 7 serving of complimentary beer, wine, and appetizers. All in all, this is a hotel to return to.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The proximity to Times Square and the view from our room was beyond compare! The staff was pleasant and helpful and met all of our needs. The room was clean and comfortable. We would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The Premier was an average stay. Great location off Times Square. Consider that when planning to request transportation, because it's often congested. I suggest walking. The staff was friendly. The room was very similar to those in Europe, size wise. Expect a small shower as well. We didn't try the continental breakfast offered.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here for one night but should have stayed here for all three nights while in nyc. Overall nice hotel. Rooms are a little dated but still clean and cozy. The breakfast is slim, just warm beverages and pastries, cereals and bagels. I would have preferred a hot full breakfast. However they make it up with their happy hour from 5-7pm where you get complimentary alcohol and cheese, wine and little sandwiches! Location is close to subway stops...about a 6 min walk and time square. The entrance is hidden because the hotel's sign blends into the building. It is attached to the millenium hotel so look for that instead.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: First, the hotel is clearly understaffed. The front desk is unstaffed at night. (See photo of empty reception desk.) Ringing the bell got no one. A sign said to go to the front desk at the hotel next door. Why in the world would one stay at this hotel if it is necessary to use the front desk of the adjoining hotel?Next, there is the bellman who did not want to get my wife a cab. Although this hotel is near Times Square the traffic flow in 44th is not ideal. It is hard to get a cab there, and the surly bellman caused my wife to miss a much-anticipated restaurant reservation. Third, there is the room. We had a safe placed so high in the closet that my wife could not reach to use it. There was a cabinet with a fallen shelf and a door almost off its hinges. Finally, there was the shower. The shower (see photo) was a small square that appeared to have been an afterthought. With a curtain, instead of a door and too-small a lip it presented the delightful experience of both having the curtain repeatedly clung to one's body while simultaneously flooding the bathroom. With so many charming hotels in the area that actually staff their front desks and demonstrate an interest in customer service you should avoid this one. Millennium (with which the Premier is affiliated) should be ashamed.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The Premier hotel is in an excellent location, right by Times Sq. and a short walk to the subway. The room was light and airy, although stain on the carpet wasn't good. In the shower the walls were dirty, you could see the water had run down in between the dirt. We were there 5 days and it wasn't cleaned off! When you book in they take a credit card in case of breakages, room service etc they said they wouldn't apply it to the account BUT yes they did. That's $500 off, So beware, it could have spoiled our holiday but luckily we had enough funds. They said we'd get it back when we check out, BUT again, it took a week to be credited into my partners account. Not good. The breakfast room was the bar area and thus there were no tables where you could sit at without being hunched over. I am disabled so found the low easy chairs difficult! Staff were friendly and available to help with any questions or bookings.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The location of this hotel is brilliant if you want to be in the heart of Manhattan and right by Time Square. The hotel has 21 floors, we were on the 19th and although we could still hear the sirens and city noise it was only faint and did not disturb our sleep at all. There were only 6 rooms on our floor and we had a corner room. You can access the hotel either at its front entrance on West 44th Street or from the rear of the sister hotel (Millenium) on West 45th Street which is a great short cut if you are coming in from that direction. We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights and booked 12 months in advance and got a great deal which included continental breakfast and a "happy hour" between 5pm & 7pm. Breakfast is pretty basic but we found it sufficient. A choice of cereals, bagels (on some days) bread which can be toasted, muffins, pastries, fruit, boiled eggs. Choice of spreads such as jams, honey, cream cheese. Fruit juices, coffee and tea. The room where the breakfast is served (Mezzanine) accommodates about 30 people on comfortable chairs with low tables. The happy hour is also served from the Mezzanine and is a choice of white or red wine, soft drinks, coffee or bottle beers (budweiser), you can have as many drinks as you like - no restrictions. A small selection of nibbles is also served each night, olives, houmous, flat bread, cheese, grapes, strawberries and sandwiches. We enjoyed this 3 nights out of the 4 which we stayed there. The only negative thing I would mention is the choice of music for both breakfast and the happy hour. It seems to be the same CD (dance music) which is played and possibly wouldn't appeal to all - maybe change it to something a little softer, particularly at breakfast. The lobby/reception area is well kept and always manned. We found the staff to be friendly and helpful. Checking in and out was quick. Check in is 4pm and out is 11am. The hotel kept hold of our cases in a locked room so that we could enjoy our last day - we collected them at 4:30pm before heading off on the subway for the airport. Our room was a very good size, queen size bed, large flat screen tv with comfortable sofa area and coffee/tea making facilities, a bottle of water - replenished everyday. In the room were also a iron, ironing board, hairdryer, ipod charger/alarm clock, bathroom scales, bath robe and slippers and toiletries. Room was clean and tidy, bed made and towels changed everyday. The Air Con worked fine and wasn't very noisy.The bathroom had a separate shower cubicle, bath tub, sink with large mirror and toilet. We felt that this hotel was excellent value for money and we would have no hesitation in recommending it to friends and family. We would definitely stay here again as it ticked all our boxes.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We have been returning to this hotel year after year because it never fails to satisfy.The amenities of breakfast & cocktail service are so much appreciated. The rooms are just right and the service is superlative. Privacy & convenience & location make this establishment first rate!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Location - Manhattan is all about location and the location for a first time tourist to NYC is absolutely superb, literally a 300 yard walk from Times Square and you are at the hotel entrance.First impressions of the hotel are good, well kept front area and very clean and tidy lobby.Only 120 rooms in the hotel so the lobby is very quiet, reception was manned every time I passed by very friendly staff.This hotel is part of the more recognized Millennium Broadway Hotel, there is an old theater in between both hotels which is currently in the middle of being renovated with the opening date in 2017.Check in took less than 5 minutes, very quick, pleasant and straightforward. No issues whatsoever.The room itself is very good size for NYC, excellent large bed, tv and coffee making facilities, bottles of water - replenished everyday. Room was clean and tidy, bed made and towels changed everyday.Air Con is excellent and not very noisy.The bathroom is probably where this hotel is let down, it is slightly dated with some broken tiles and old fashioned decor however; this would not put me off staying here again as the positive aspects far outweigh the negatives.This hotel has a free continental breakfast and happy hour from 5-7pm on the mezzanine level serving beer, wine and cheese and biscuits - absolutely fabulous idea giving guests time to mingle and relax after a hard day of sightseeing.Overall this hotel is excellent value for money and I would have absolutely no hesitate in recommending it to friends and family.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Functional hotel on quiet street with quiet, clean room facing the street and free WiFi. Small foyer, friendly professional staff. The first surprise was the non-negotiable check in time of 4-00pm after a 30 hour trip to get there. We have experienced more flexibility at other hotels but this was a minor irritation. Good selection of free TV movies for when you get too tired to walk any more. Great location 60m from Times Square and other attractions are within walking distance. New York was enjoyable and plenty of friendly help on the street to get where we wanted to go. Hotel is close to Grand Central Station and the Port Authority where you can catch the bus to the airport. The subway was also close by. An added value for the hotel was the free drinks and snacks between 5-00pm and 7-pm each evening where you could meet other travellers and swap stories. Continental breakfast was adequate but the seating in club chairs around small coffee tables was odd but the food fresh and healthy and plenty of it. A small point was the noisy aircon on entering the room that became quiet when the set room temperature was reached. We liked that you could open the windows in the room as well. Plenty of food outlets close by and a nice market at Grand Central station for anyone looking for some snacks. Library and park just around the corner which was great in the warm weather for somewhere to sit and relax and watch NY in action.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Full disclosure: This review is going to be a bit better than it otherwise would have been because of the hotel comping one of our nights. Our flight got in a bit late and caused us to arrive at the hotel at close to 1am. Upon check in we were notified that we would have to wait as our room wasn't ready yet. At 1am!?! What if we arrived closer to 4pm - the one check in began!? The man at the desk then told us that we might be able to move to a higher floor the following day. Fine - we go to the room, my husband prepared to shower and I walked into the bathroom to see this (see photo) on the ceiling - I'm no expert but a hotel room costing more than $450 per night should not have black mold in the shower. The following morning, as directed by the night manager, we called and asked to be moved due to the room conditions (mold, no tissues, no soap). The woman whom my husband spoke to said "it might be possible but wasn't guaranteed". Fine - we left the hotel for sight seeing (that's why we were here in the first place). After a long day of exploring, we returned to the hotel and asked about the possibility to move. The woman at the front desk was rude, abrasive and scolded us for not packing our things so they could move us while we were out. She threatened that they were about to give our new room away. First, no one told us we were to pack our things. Second, the woman my husband spoke with didn't say we would even get another room. Thankfully a very, very nice gentleman got us set up with a new room and offered to pass on our experience to the manager. The new room was fine - no mold, had soap etc. and the front desk man was able to relay our experience to the manager. While we never heard from the manager, we were comped one nights stay. While we appreciate the accommodation, it doesn't erase the attitude of the woman at the front desk. The Premier Hotel should consider reprimanding such actions.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Hotel located right in the heart of Times Square, so there is plenty to see and do within walking distance. Close to subway and tour bus stops. Surprisingly the rooms were very quiet - no street noise. And they were spacious with comfortable beds. The staff was friendly, knowledgable, and helpful. Both Kevin and Monique made every effort to be accommodating. The free afternoon mixer was a nice touch as well.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This was my first visit to NYC and I spent A LOT of time researching for it. The Premier Hotel looked really good on paper and the Trip Advisor reviews were very complimentary. All I can say is that they weren't wrong. I couldn't recommend this hotel more highly. Yes it is always going to be expensive to stay right at the heart of the action in NYC, but I felt this hotel was fantastic value and well worth it.Firstly the service was outstanding, especially Kevin on the concierge who was so nice and so helpful, nothing was a problem. All the staff were so friendly and helpful and genuinely seemed interested in you and your visit to NYC.The complimentary bar and snacks in the evening were fabulous, there was a choice of red and white wine, lager and soft drinks along with an array of fruit, bread, dips, cheeses, salad, olives etc. Amazing and this happy hour (I think it was 5pm-7pm) was just about to start as we checked in, perfect! This was on every evening and was very welcomed after a long day sight seeing. The happy hour staff were also very friendly and accommodating. There was one gentleman (I didn't catch his name) who always had a big smile on his face and made you feel so special. One quieter evening my mum and i were just finishing up our drinks (the happy hour had finished at this point) and he came over to say he still had some beers left if we would like one more before we went for dinner, how nice!! The same room is used for the (also) complimentary breakfast in the morning which we tried a few times and it was very nice (cereals, juice, pastries, coffee, bread etc). The room isn't the largest but considering there was usually only one member of staff on you hardly ever saw any dirty tables or anything running out. Some of the furniture maybe needed some attention but that is my only slight niggle. Out room was surprisingly big (as I had heard NYC rooms could be very small). There was plenty of room for 2 people to live comfortably, it was modern, spacious and clean. The bed was very comfortable, there was lots of storage and room to put your cases. The bathroom was huge with a tub and a separate shower. I loved the robes, slippers and toiletries provided. There was a small area with a couch and a TV (which moved round so you could watch it from the bed). We had a view of Times Square and the coffee maker and water was replenished daily. There was also a turn down serviced which really added that extra touch.The location of the hotel is fabulous. You literally turn right and walk not even half a block and you are in Times Square (our room was about half way up and we never had any problems with noise). So perfect for all the sight seeing we wanted to do (its right near the Good Morning America studio). It was amazing to walk out onto Times Square each day, it never got old (even slightly!). So a great location for everything really, the theatre district, sight seeing tours, shopping etc. You really are in the heart of Times Square (which is exactly what I wanted!).There is a small Irish bar (O'Donoghues) over the road from the hotel that we frequented more than a few nights, good service, music and prices. So if your looking for a great hotel, with great service and great rooms book here. If I ever get the chance to go to NYC again I will certainly 100% be staying here.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: A very nice hotel, seemingly an appendage of the Millenium next door (which also does their in room dining, etc). Helpful staff at the front desk which is literally just that- two desks. Feels more like a concierge. Room was of good size for midtown Manhattan, comfortable and quiet and nicely appointed. Free continental breakfast was a bit sparse but still OK. It was "hidden" in the sense that there is almost no signage for it on 44th street. Its just East of the Millenium, door actually is oriented to the East so easy to drive by the first time! But a nice little hotel.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This was one of the best if not the best hotel stays I've ever had. I want to cover a few points first before I get to what I thought was the most important feature. The hotel is perfectly located less than a half block from Times Square. The rooms are a nice size particularly the bathroom which has both a tub and separate shower. We were very surprised how quiet the rooms were being located so close to such a busy area. The continental breakfast in the morning is certainly adequate to get a good start with fruit , pastries, hard boiled eggs, etc. The evening cocktail hour with wine and beer and an assortment of cheeses and other snacks was enjoyable. What I thought really made this hotel exceptional was the service. I think the hotel has about 140 rooms, but you were treated as if you were the only guest. Monique at the front desk was wonderful and served as a great concierge providing great suggestions and directions. Housekeeping was excellent and always met our needs. Finally, I want to mention Mohi who worked at breakfast and the cocktail hour. It is so nice to see someone take such pride in his work . Although he was usually maintaining a room with 30 plus people making sure there was adequate food and tables were cleared, he always made you feel that you were his only guest. All of the staff went out of the way to make you feel welcome. I doubt we will ever seek another hotel when we visit New York.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: You can't get much closer to the action than here - a minutes walk from Times Square: however never had any issues with noise. Perfect tourist location - you can walk to subway station, theatre district. The room we had was modern, spacious & clean. The bed was really comfortable. The staff at the front desk were always very helpful. Having the free breakfast included was really handy - only a small selection of options: but enough to start the day. I would highly recommend staying here.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Great stay, right in the heart of Broadway. Walk out the door and you're half a block to Times Square. Continental breakfast in the morning and happy hour in the afternoon. Clean, modern and Monique at the front desk was wonderful!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The Premier Hotel was easy to book and had great amenities-cocktail hours and a large buffet breakfast. It was located right around the corner from theatres and great places to eat. Hotel personnel were never rushed and very pleasant. Wee will stay here again.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here for 8 nights. Arrived around 1pm. Couldn't check in til 4pm. For me this is a late check in time. Left cases with reception and walked to the iconic red steps of Times Square. This took 4 minutes to walk (slowly!)We had a king room on 3rd floor. No view but great room. I have stayed in NYC before and this room was twice as large as my previous stay. I could easily swing a cat in the bathroom. Bath and separate shower. Good water power and temperature. Room has tea/coffee maker. Hair dryer. Free safe. TV. Alarm clock. Free bottled water. Iron and ironing board, hangers and umbrella. Amply draw and hanging space. Bed and 5 pillows very comfortable. A little bit outside noise but nothing to moan about. Free wi-fi if very strong. Never dropped out at all. Air con looked simple to use but I couldn't work out how to turn it off. Again if I had asked I know they would have shown me. Maybe a little 'how to use' card by it would help for us blondes. I had read mixed comments about the FREE breakfast, but it's terrific. A great way to start the day. Toast, bagels, muffins, fresh fruit, hard boiled eggs, cereals, pastries, etc. Guys working this room are great. Ok so there's not an abundance of chairs. Maybe 30. They let you take your food and drink out so have breakfast in your large room if it's too busy. Or grab a coffee in a take out cup and a croissant! Cant understand how people moan about stuff like this. It's all great!! They also have free alcoholic/soft drinks and nibbles early evening but we never used this. Awesome touch tho!All the staff I met were fantastic. Always more than happy to help. Lifts and room doors have a safe swipe access Maid service daily, fresh towels and toiletries replenished even if you only used a tiny bit. It was a little odd that there was only one bathrobe and 1 pair of slippers in a double room. But we never used 1, so had no need for 2. I am positive if we had asked we could have got another one.Location of this hotel is fantastic. Close to bus, train, underground and of course times square. Although the hotel is on 44th, you can walk through the Millennium hotel to get to 45th and the the carpark opposite to get to 43rd (where you must go see Beautiful)I am not one to go searching for dirt or looking for faults/problems in a hotel, but I dropped something on the floor in the room and wouldn't fancy crawling under the bed! The bathroom is a little fired but much better than some I have stayed in!!I will definitely use and highly recommend this hotel. Don't think twice, just book!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Hotel was great, clean and spacious. Good continental breakfast included but gets very busy at times as only small seating area so best to go at 7 or after 8.30! The staff are wonderful there. The free alcohol and nibbles in the afternoon is another great bonus! Close to all attractions and would def stay again! A lot nicer than the Millenium hotel next door!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: From the start, Lydia in reservations was great. Especially when I had to alter our reservation due to Hermine the storm. We arrived to meet Kevin at the front desk who genuinely carried on a real conversation with us as we checked in including giving us the thumbs up on a restaurant we wanted to go to. And he was right, it was great. Our room was much larger than expected, very clean, had a wall of windows with the most incredible view.....of the New Year's Eve Crystal Ball. I love hotels that take sheets and wrap a duvet so that you have a pristine clean cover on the bed.... Not like those yucky bedspreads you find in hotels. The bed was comfortable as was the sofa and the tv could easily be swiveled from sofa to bed. It had a large desk area and the thermostat which was on the desk wall was easy to adjust. Fresh bottle of water in the room. The bath had a deep tub and separate shower. Plenty of bath supplies as well as a weight scale....which we didn't use in light of that incredible French meal. Quality wood hangers for your clothes, a safe for valuables, Keurig coffee maker and even an umbrella if it rains were all available. They offer an early evening beer/wine hour with snacks which we didn't partake and a nice continental breakfast with cereal, fruit, bagels, danish, muffins and even hard boiled eggs and juices. Our bill was at our door first thing on the morning we checked out. Only 6 rooms on our floor which made it very quite. Very secure with your key card needed on the elevator. Best staff I have ever encountered in NYC. Lastly, the price was so reasonable for what we experienced.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Recently stayed here for 3 nights... This hotel is in a GREAT location literally less than a block from Times Square. It is also very clean and the staff was very pleasant and helpful when it came to storing our luggage when needed or when we needed assistance with how best to get to where we needed to go via the subway. My only caution to you is that the showers are quite small and the housekeeping would tidy our room very late in the afternoons...But overall, a nice stay and I would definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The home of Monique was our hostess at the top, always listen to us.Clean rooms, kitchen ware ok, the food corner for the morning's small.Bravo for the snack 17h.Hôtel très bien situé à 100 mètres de time square et très silencieux.Excellent stayAlain et Chantal

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Excellent location as walking distance to Times Square , breakfast included continental style and nibbles from 5-7 , feels like a premier inn - no fridge in room, no plug sockets beside bed but clean, friendly staff and would go back again. Sister hotel is next door think the premier is the budget version

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Great hotel, great location, great staff! Hotel next to Times Square and the subway. Very comfortable large rooms. Good breakfast, compared with New York standard, and a charming happy hour with wine and snacks at the end of the day. We love it!!!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: They had a nice little breakfast and a great happy hour, with wine and beer and snacks the people were so nice. It was a great location close to everything in time square.. I would stay here again..The price range for New York time square was good. the street was very quiet at nite.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel is amazing !! My first experience with them was through email and all questions were answered . I booked it and was I happy I choose that hotel !! We stayed there for 5 nights and arrived on the 4th of August . It's about 1 minute walk to Times Square but yet at night time u cannot hear any noise . Hector checked us in and he was so friendly . Anytime we met anyone who worked there was also so friendly . The hotel is spotless and rooms very spacious compared to other New York hotels . Hotel offers complimentary breakfast and happy hour every day . This was a lovely touch also . This hotel is also great value . Highly recommend this hotel and will be back on our next trip .

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We had a good stay at the hotel for four nights. We slept well and got ready for a day out, but there's really not more you can do at this hotel. If you want to have dinner or drinks at your hotel, or a gym or a spa, this place isn't for you. But if you're spending your day out and about, this hotel will get you of to a great start with a small breakfast buffet and a very good location!The breakfast excludes bagels and toast with butter and cream cheese, a few kinds of cereal, eggs, fresh cut fruit, pastry, coffee, juice and yogurt. Not a great selection for a hotel breakfast but filling and handy!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Breakfast and cocktail hours a plus in NYC, small but nice extra. Was taken back upon checkin when told $100 was charge upgrade for a king bed. You've got to be kidding! Needless to say my queen bed was comfortable enough. I was happy that we were given an early checkin-very convenient. Room was good size for NYC. Bathroom was as large as bedroom, what a nice surprise! No ice maker, but front desk sends person to retrieve bucket and fill with ice, so no big deal. Small boutique hotel attached, and part of Millennium Hotel (which used to be my favorite before shabbiness started). I'd stay here at the Premiere again. Location is always a plus!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Our first visit to NY to celebrate my 60th birthday and we found this gem of a hotel right in the heart of (50 metres) from Times Square. We had a large room with views of Time Square, bath, shower and toilet plus lounge and Tv in a corner. Beautifully cleaned and extremely quiet considering our proximity to Time Square. Complimentary continental breakfast each morning and wine/ beer/ juice and tapas each evening. The young guy working in this are his name starts with an A?......extremely polite, attentive and courteous. We looked forward to when he was rostered. Monique on front reception was also extremely helpful and vibrant great asset to this reception area. Concierge/ doorman also very obliging. Loved our stay and if we are priveledge to ever visit again we will definitely be booking our nights at the Premier Hotel...thankyou for etching fantastic memories in our hearts......

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: My wife and myself went to NY to celebrate our anniversary and chose to stay in this hotel after doing some research (I read like a thousands of reviews. I did not want to mess up this special occasion, but still had to stay within the budget). We stayed three nights over the weekend. The hotel is literally 2 min walking distance to Times Square. This district is a very busy area with thousands of tourists crowding the streets. However, the hotel itself is somewhat isolated from it. We did not have any problems with noise at all. I intentionally chose this location to stay close to the Theater District, but if not for that, I'd probably choose a less chaotic location in Manhattan.The hotel is well maintained, clean and comfortable. The room was very spacious, larger than expected. The size of the room is comparable to mid level chain hotel rooms you find everywhere in suburbia. This is large for NY in my opinion. The room was next to the elevator, but again, no noise issues. Bed was comfortable, everything was clean. A few spots on somewhat dated carpet in the room and hallway, but really nothing major. Bathroom was really spacious, it had both shower and a bathtub. Water flow was good, water was hot, all faucets were working fine. The sink had a cosmetic hairline crack, I did not affect the use of it. I thought that sink ought to be replaced from an aesthetic point of view, but I would not dwell on it. My wife was using a hairdryer, this apparently blew a fuse and the lights went out in the bathroom, but I fixed it really quick by pushing reset button once I figured what happened. Breakfast was really good. At the check in they said somewhat apologetically it was only a continental breakfast. Well, it was good for continental breakfast. Was certainly sufficient to get me through lunch during busy day of exploring NY attractions. The lobby looks a little odd, it seemed like a few desks were simply put on the floor, computer screens were added, and voila, lobby is ready. But I am really being picky now. Overall, we got a good value for the money we paid, considering the location and time of the year. This is not a luxury place, but it is really comfortable.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: - no plugs at bedside tables- lamps at bedside tables only worked with major lights on - hair dryer blew bathroom light fuse, so no lights in bathroom for a morning - no vacuum cleaning under bed for some time (dust)- very dirty vent in bathroom (dust)- elevator malfunctioned and clunked, stopped and went back to lobby before reaching out floor, twice- weird construction and entrance through odd space next to hotel after 11pm- at this price point why no full breakfast? outstanding continental breakfast but as I said, value not commensurate in my opinion. holiday inn express manages a great bf!!- no minibar no fridge in room... what ?!?- excellent customer service from staff- luxury and value factor not really there, will not return

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Extremely convenient midtown location right next to Times Square, but tucked away enough to be very quiet. For NYC, the room and bathroom was relatively large. Clean, and well-serviced, but basic room. Breakfast was basic but adequate (fruit, toast/bagel/pastries, cereal, and hard boild eggs, along with juice and coffee). Nice coctail hour with wine, sodas, juice, crackers/cheese/fruit, meat board, etc. Selection of coffee beverages available 24/7. The gentlemen servicing the breakfast/coctail hour were absolutely lovely - professional, courteous, as were the housekeeping staff. The concierge/front desk staff, not overtly rude in anyway, but also somewhat dismissive and not terribly helpful (usually talking and joking amongst themselves together with the porter/bellman) and offering only the most cursory of advice when advice was requested. Good wifi. Front door closes at 11pm but not a problem at all as you enter through the millenium hotel entrance just steps away. Overall a good stay, but definately not a luxury hotel.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: If you're a big fan of the 90's go to the premier hotel where almost nothing (furniture, atmosphere, design) has changed for 25 years. Even if everything is well-maintained , this hotel need a huge refreshment. Free breakfast is terrible but location and the complementary wine service from 5 pm to 7 pm in the mezzanine lounge are both great.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: unsure of staying in the boutique side of a recognised hotel chain we shouldn't have worried. Minor hiccup when we arrived after a day of Delta delays, no one on reception to check us in. Only 20 metres to the main reception so no issue. After that we found the our reception always manned,fully attentive and extremely helpful. The mini suites are excellent and large for a major city hotel.Try for a street view with glimpses of Time Sq. Basic complimentary breakfast and 2 hours of evening wine and beer is a nice touch and whilst the breakfast/drinks area is small we always managed a seat. Wifi free, we stayed 5 days and will be back next year. Good value

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Staff gracious. Multiple language. Rooms nicely done, spacious & comfortable. Quiet. Breakfast included. Cappuccinos. Concierge friendly and helpful. Security - room keys to access floors. Door men. Fantastic quality for the price.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: What a great experience!!! This hotel is perfectly located in times square. It comes with breakfast and happy hour. The people are so helpful and friendly. the bedrooms are quite large for a New York Hotel.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Monique at reception was lovely and really helped us settle in after a red eye flight. Definitely went above and beyond expectations.Location was perfect. Very close to time square but still quite enough to sleep and not get overrun by crowds on the street.Rooms were good, could be updated. Size was OK. Not large but acceptable.Some issues: They had 'alarm tests' during the morning for several days which were annoying when trying to sleep in. Also housekeeping woke us up a few times, need to put DND sign up.All in all, solid place and would visit again.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Location is fabulous- near Times Square, Byrant Park and 5th ave.2 blocks from the subway.Rooms were comfortable and clean. The hotel offers complementary breakfast and also afternoon snacks and drinks which is awesomeWe loved staying at this hotel and would definetly stay here again.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here because it is right off Broadway and was so close to all the theaters .We could walk everywhere. The young lady who works the front desk Monique was fabulous. She is so helpful and she has a delightful personality. We will return just because of her, outstanding.There was a mixup on our reservation by hotels.com and Monique got it taken care of in short order. Hotels.com did not send over the second confirmation number so the computer was showing only one room,but she got it fixed in short order.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Booked this hotel through travelzoo and it did not disappoint.Excellent location, breakfast and happy hour were nice perks. Front desk was a bit slow checking in since there was only one clerk working but she was polite and prompt.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The location is great! It takes you only minutes to get to Times Square, there are tons of restaurants in the area, many musical theaters ans shops are just around the corner. The next subway station is about 5 minutes by foot away... Fab!Our room was on the 7th floor so we weren't in on the nice city view. But the room was clean and of a decent size. There was even a small couch on one side of the room. We liked it!There is also a complimentary breakfast which is ok but nothing special.Would recommend thus hotel to my friends.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Absolutely perfect location. Large rooms compared to the other hotels in NYC. Free continental breakfast (eggs, fruit, yogurt, baked goods etc), free happy hour (wine, beer, soft drinks, coffee, tea, espresso based drinks).The place is modern and very clean. The staff members are pleasant and helpful.The negative:It is difficult to find (no large sign, no large doors, no staff present by the curb). I missed it even though have googled it several times. I ended up parking in the garage. When we arrived the hotel computer system did not work and we were sent to Millenium to check in,

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Even though we had some small issues with the King size beds- Monique worked with us and was able to get us what we wanted. She was wonderful. Great location- very clean rooms- great staff. There were also free cocktails and munchies from 5-7 which was great after running around all day. Only issue was the ice. Had to order it through housekeeping and the parking was quite expensive but found a parking garage right across the street a little cheaper and closer.
