Will definitely stay again and would recommend it to everyone,.
user_name:
Elaine F
Virginia Beach, United States

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Great location! Nice size rooms. Staff was very friendly. The only thing we were upset about is that we asked for a king room and got a queen. There were no king rooms left but Monique found us one. She went above and beyond to satisfy our needs. She was AWESOME!! Also, access to an ice machine would have been nice. We had to call for ice delivery every time we needed it. Would definitely stay there again!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: First off, let me say that I would re-book The Premier Hotel. I hope management reads this review and make a few small corrections to make their guests' stay even more comfortable.The Premier Hotel is ideally located right next to Times Square - in fact I could see the famous New Years Eve Ball from my hotel room window. I often am in NY for business and being in Midtown makes it easy to get to all my meetings and see a show when I have the freetime. Because of this reason, I would rebook the Premier.However, there were some minor problems that made me not enjoy my stay 100%. The AC unit in my room made an annoying rattle noise that kept me awake until I decided to put in ear plugs. The street noise level was not heard, but inside the room it was so annoying. I was in room 919. Secondly, I was blessed with permission to have late check-out as I needed to sleep in longer than normal. Unfortunately the front desk did not alert house keeping and I was rudely woken up by the maid. She was rude and told me I had to get out. When I explained that I was granted late check-out, she didn't believe me and said I needed to get out of the room. I told her to check with the front desk and slammed my door. It was unacceptable to be treated like this. Lastly, I wish my room had a hairdryer.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Lovely hotel, nice big rooms. Super comfy and central. Couldn't have asked better. Perfect location for getting out and about. Nice complementary continental breakfast and brilliant room service. Friendly and helpful, would definitely go back if in NYC again x

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed for 4 nights last week and cannot recommend highly enough, after reading mixed reviews before we left we were slightly anxious but previous negative reviews couldn't be further from the truth! Hector on reception greeted us with a huge smile & honestly makes this hotel, he gave us so many great recommendations during our stay we cannot thank him enough! Room was fantastic we were on the 18th floor and had great views, room was clean & spacious, we could not of asked for more. Location is fantastic about 15 steps away from the heart of Times Square, lots of bars & restaurants near by, we did tend to stay away from the area during the evening but great options if you don't fancy venturing far - a must do is the R Lounge at the Renaissance hotel you can sit back with a glass of prosecco watching the hustle & bustle of Times Square it really is a great spot! The breakfast was sufficient, your not paying for it so cannot complain and the happy hour was a fantastic treat after a hard days sightseeing and shopping (chardonnay is top notch!)The staff really make this place everyone is very welcoming and helpful!Cannot wait to return, thank you Premier Hotel :)

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We had a great stay here.. Staff was awesome, room was awesome.. Very Quiet. Great breakfast and Happy Hour!! Would stay here again.. Perfect location to walk to Time Square.. Great places to eat. Near by.. Thanks for a great stay in NYC!!!!!!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We visit N.Y.C each year for a special occasion to celebrate. This is one of the best hotels so far. We drove here and there is an indoor parking garage right across the street (not affiliated with the hotel but very convenient). The receptionists at Premier,Veronica, Monique,Viviana and Kevin are all excellent in their job and knowledgeable giving exceptional service with positiveness. We stayed 10 nights enjoying the a.m. breakfast, coffee 24/7, the early evening drinks & snacks. A nice touch of complimentary service. Our room was very comfortable and very clean. We definitely will return to The Premier on our next trip to N.Y.C. because it is a "PREMIER HOTEL".

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Revisiting New york City for the 4th time with my wife. Although we visit all the time it's the first time we stay at the Premier. Enjoyed this visit so much, especially since this hotel is so close to everthing we needed, Broadway shows, restaurants, shopping. We also enjoyed the free evening brunch and continental breakfast they offered. A nice suprise that other hotels we had stayed before had never offered. The staff was great special thanks to Monique and Carlos Bonet, who went above and beyond to make us feel welcomed. The room was nice and clean and our bed was huge and comfortable. Needless to say we will be going back on our next visit. We highly recomend this hotel.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: My first impression likely set the tone for this review. When I am greeted by a front desk clerk for check in I only expect two things 1) to be welcomed to their hotel and 2) to not be seen as just another visitor. In my case both failed.Is it too much to ask to stand up from your desk chair and greet me? Instead, I got "Hello. Can I see your license and credit card?"The room was average yet spacious especially for NYC and the location. The hotel as my wife put it, "has no atmosphere or vibe". Very true. It's a place to lay your head so if this all you want or expect, this hotel is in a great location.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The location of this hotel,is great. The rooms were nice and clean. We really enjoyed the breakfast bar and the evening wine and appetizers. Two of my very favorite people working at the hotel was Dixon Ramirez and Carlos Bonet, fabulous guys!!!They both deserve a raise!! They took great care of us. I would definitely stay at this hotel again!!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here 4 nights and I have to say this is the most disappointing service and hospitality I have come across since few years. The hotel location is great no doubt with big rooms and big bathrooms, that's why the staff is full of ego. Upon arrival we were allotted a queen bed room. We were celebrating our anniversary but that did not matter to the hotel to either provide a better room or better service. The problems - 1. No power outlets near bed side tables.- we called up the reception and asked how to solve this problem , all 4 star hotels have either a power outlet or provide an extension cord. They said we can't do anything point black. Rude 2. No tea coffee maker - I found this rather silly. They don't offer it and upon asking said we can't provide it. How are you a 4 star hotel ??? 3 star hotels also provide this 3. No mini bar in room - they said if you want we can provide you a fridge at a daily rental!! Like seriously ! Your hotel is a sham. Which 4 star hotel doesn't have a in room mini bar ? 4. Courtesy of staff - the reception is always empty no one at front desk. They are so busy at the back doing whatever . Even if you want any help they always say no for mostly everything.5. Drinking water - so one bottle was kept in room free of cost, we asked do we get more during the stay? So she said no you get only 1 bottle for 4 nights! Can you imagine the rudeness. The hotel does provide you breakfast in the morning which is also really basic , it's just cornflakes, toast and milkI would never stay here again, nor recommend anyone from staying here.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed at the premier for three nights in July and were completely satisfied with the hotel and staff. They treated us with utmost courtesy and were eager to help. The room was spacious and well appointed (a noisy a/c was my only quibble) and the continental breakfast was varied and delicious. Happy hour on the mezzanine had free beer and wine. The location near, but not on, Times Square was perfect. And free wi-fi. But really it was the staff that made our stay so enjoyable.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The Premier Hotel is located 100 metres from Times Square and most Broadway theatres are within a short walking distance, so it is in a good spot if you're into the theatre. Despite being close to Times Square the room was quiet and clean. Everything worked as it should. The staff were pleas at and efficient.The complementary continental breakfast and evening happy hour were great, my only small suggestion is to change the Muzak to something with a melody.Overall it was a great place to stay and we are looking forward to returning in a few weeks time.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: If your trip is for pleasure and know you will be out of the hotel the most part of time it is really an excellent option. Just one block from Times Square and near of more than 3 subway stations. The hotel very good, excellent rooms and the only point is the breakfast ..... Very very simple

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We just returned from 6 days in New York staying at the premier it is a fantastic hotel lovely big rooms fantastic staff great location great breakfast and lovely idea in the evening free drinks and tapas would definetly recommend to stay here brilliant a special big thankyou to Kevin at reception who was so good and polite and helpful Enjoy your trip to Manchester in August. Also a special thankyou to Monique who also was fantastic both really pleasant people and made or stay brilliant a credit to the hotel and to Americans we will be back thankyou

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Rough personnel, I left car for valet. $70-overpriced, when apparently $50 in near parking areas (I found later ). Takes 45 min to 1 hrs to get a car back. Then they took it away without letting me know that the car was here. I was in my room waiting, they said they called 3 times to room-lie! I had to wait another hour to get a car again.I put sign-do not disturb. They cleaned room anyways, removed our tooth brushes from glasses and put them on dirty sink counters. And fun part we came back 11:30pm and after shower we realized that A/C is not working with 90'F outside! We had to wait until about 1am while our AC get fixed.Bottom line if you want to receive NY style "I don't care about you" type treatment come to this hotel.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: First time in NYC and we were greeted with a warm welcome. We had asked to change rooms as we were first given a backyard view rather than a street view. But they were more than accommodating in changing our rooms. The room was clean and fresh with all the amenities you need. The staff are all very helpful and the location was fantastic, will definitely be back! Highly recommend.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This is not a 4.5 star hotel by any means. The room décor is very basic and dated. The lobby is virtually non existent. The customer service is mediocre at best. The bathroom condition is below expectations. I had to wait for a receptionist every time, as there was no one at the front desk. The showers have a shower curtain (!!!), the wallpaper is peeling off in the bathroom, and the AC vent was covered with a thick layer of dust. In addition, the AC did not work at all one night, Not a cheap place, you're better off going elsewhere. How is this a 4.5 star hotel? This should have been 3.5 at most. You can do much better for that price.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Then staff at the check in and around the hotel were very friendly. The wifi and the elevators were very fast too. The location is fantastic as it is extremely close to time square. We will definitely recommend this hotel to friends. Bless you The Premier Hotel.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This is an awesome place to stay! Location is steps from Times Square but rooms are quiet. The free breakfast and happy hour were great. Staff was always nice, friendly and helpful. Kevin and Veronica checked us in. They were so nice Emmanuel was helpful with a couple things. We would return here in a heartbeat! We booked through travel zoo and got a great rate!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Positives:Location can't be beat. Heart of Times Square. Free drinks and canapés during happy hours. The red wine was great as was the service from the bartender. Bed was comfortable.Negatives:Check in staff were a little abrupt with us and a few guests checking in. They mentioned several times that they were at capacity and nothing can be done about getting in early or changes to bedding configuration. 4pm check in seemed a little late for us. No fridge in the room was pretty annoying. Our room was on the second floor, so a lot of street noise all through the night. Our view was of a gravel balcony through our grimey window. Hotel is hard to find the first time. Cab had never heard of it.It was still a pleasant stay thanks to the location and I've heard the size of the rooms are large compared to other NY hotels.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel was the second hotel we stayed during our ten days holiday in newyork, first was residence inn by marriott central park that was much better. We stayed at the premier hotel for three days, it was really dissapointing for us. The location is really great, it is in the heart of Times square, you are very close to some important places such as Times square, port authority bus terminal. But unfortunately, the premier hotel is the meanest hotel we have ever been. They let the guests have breakfast in a very slipshod place!! The plates are extremely dirty, to get the cleanest one I had to check all the plates . They put only one small bottle of water for two in the rooms. There aren't any mini fridges in the rooms, so you can't keep cool anything. In addition they don't let the guests sit at the restaurant during check out , which is extremely rude for me and not a hospitable way!!! The staff is generally good but strategy of the hotel is awful!! So for us , the premier hotel is Never again!!!!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: After hearing so many times that most spaces are cramped, I was pleasantly surprised at the accommodations at this boutique hotel. Roomy (for NYC), stylish, comfortable. The staff was friendly, knowledgable, and helpful. The hotel offers a light breakfast and happy hours snacks and drinks. Right off Time Square but without feeling like it. Great experience overall. When I return to NYC, I will certainly return to this hotel.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Love the location of Premier hotel. In the theatre district and just far enough from crowded Times Square so you don't hear the noise and close enough to 6th avenue on 44th. There are at least 4 excellent restaurants on this street so you can stay in the area or go elsewhere. Lobby personnel friendly and helpful. Rooms are spacious with a large bathroom. Shower requires handle bar but otherwise excellent. Safe in the room and queen size bed comfortable. Coffee/tea maker in room. Breakfast was quite good. Variety of muffins, croissants, bagel as well Cereal and yogurt. Some fresh fruit as well. Faema machine makes cappuccino, decaf coffee and water for tea. Concierge helpful if you require booking excursions. Would recommend this hotel and I hope to go back.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This is my second stay here and I have been very pleased both times. I've stayed at various hotels in NY always for business so cost was not an issue. This is a nice boutique hotel in a convenient location...many restaurants,right next to time square, walking distance to Empire state building, Rockefeller Center, Bryan Park, etc. Even though it's in Time Square, the rooms were extremely quiet so you get a good night sleep. Service is excellent: front desk personnel are very helpful. One of them even remembers my name even though I only had a 3 night stay. They offer free breakfast, which to me is always a plus ; you don't have to waste money and time finding breakfast, getting coffee in the morning. The room is spacious for NY standards and very clean. This is key because I've stayed at NY hotels that were pricier but didn't have the same cleaniness.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Had a wonderful experience staying at The Premier Hotel! Great room. Great location. Amazing view of Times Square. Great service. Friendliest staff. Special thank you to both Monique and Philip they went above and beyond to make our stay top notch! Will definitely be back!!!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: my wife and I have been frequent vacationers to NYC. Stayed here last year for the first time and fell in loved with it. This years trip was booked around us being able to stay here again. Our trip is fast approaching and we can't wait. Cheers!Alan and Tanya

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Superb service! Great location without the excessive noise of Times Square (seconds from times square ). I would stay here again. Oh, and, did I mention the outstanding sevice!?!?! I was traveling alone with my 7 year old and the place is very safe with key cards needed to use the elevator. The hotel is small which keeps the noise and traffic down. Our room was on the 20th floor, very clean, nice view, quiet, with great service!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Spent a lot of time trying to find a reasonably priced hotel in a good location. Having stayed lived in the upper east side for a few months, I know my way around but for the sake of a touristy few days, wanted something near to the buzz of Times Square! Found this gem - sounded too good to be true at first but upon arrival, realised it was as good as it sounded!Kevin helped us check in - really lovely, asked about our journey and plans, made us feel very welcome.Room was on the 3rd floor and was enormous! Only 2 of us staying, but plenty of room and a good view. Room had a complementary tea and coffee maker, 2 bottles of water, full size iron, ironing board, hair dryer, safe. Bathroom had a shower and tub, shower a bit on the small side but hot and clean so it didn't matter. Also a good size tv and radio, plenty of space to relax in the arm chairs provided in the room. Housekeeping also great, weather was super hot while we were there so every day someone knocked to offer fresh towels just in case we had already used the clean towels given in the morning!Breakfast from 7-10am was included which was a god send as we all know how expensive NYC can be. Served in a small mezzanine area with a TV. Bagels, croissants, toast, yoghurt, fruit, cereal and tea/coffee. All you really need! And the staff are so lovely!! Happy to help or stop and chat. Makes a huge difference! Happy hour and snacks are also included and served from 5-7pm, cheese, olives, ham and fruit, with soft drinks, tea/coffee or beer/wine! At first we weren't sure if we needed to go, but after sampling it on the first day, realised that it was the perfect way to relax and refuel before going out for a show or late dinner. Finally the location - Times Square is less than a 30 second walk, all the theatres for shows are scattered around (took us about 10mins to walk to the August Wilson theatre for jersey boys) Rockefeller centre is a 5 min walk as is grand central station. Macy's, Empire State Building, saks etc all around 10 mins away. Fantastic location! Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone planning a trip, and will definitely be going back!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Decent place with free breakfast and free WiFi. Extremely quiet. Times Square aren't visible from the room I stayed in and are now blocked due to a development opposite the hotel. The location is the "bang-for-the-buck" feature because it is located at the heart of Times Square. I felt that this is a perfect stay for solo travelers but slightly pricey if you are on a budget.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This has been my favorite hotel in New York by far. My room was beautiful and was a good size (for New York that is). It's also in a very convenient location. Also, who wouldn't like the free happy hour! I will be back.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Perfect location, big rooms but a small bed which may be a small "minus" but very good cleaning ,very nice and helpfull staff and a extra plus for the service with " lounge-snacks"! We will absolutely stay there again and we will really recommend this hotel!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Got to the property at nearly 5pm on Saturday night from the Newark Airpost...check in handled by Kevin...put us on 18th floor overlooking portion of Times Square....only 7 rooms per floor led to feelings of privateness and quiet. Room was large with a studio apartment feel...comfy bed, nice I-pod dock for entertainment, floor to ceiling windows gave great view. The complimentary breakfast and happy hour is what every traveler needs...something quick(plenty of options) for breakfast before you make your way into the maze that is NYNY....in the evening a nice spread of nibbles and a cocktail of beer or wine are just what you need before you hit the town for nightlife!! Shipping department handled some items for us without hitch.....Monique was eager to point us toward a nearby place for Sunday brunch(great choice). The fact that it is next to Millenium Broadway and has egress from both 44th and 45th streets makes it super easy to negotiate around Times Square. Would most certainly stay there again! Very centrally located and convienent!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: A real gem, tucked just round the corner from Times Square. it is so peaceful and the room was amazing, crisp white linen, light wood furniture and a great bathroom. Breakfast was as good as any hotel I've stayed in. I can't say enough good things about this hotel. I stay in NYC every 8 weeks and will be staying here form now on.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: What a beautiful hotel ! The rooms were lovely and spacious. As a solo traveler, I really appreciated how close to Broadway I was. After leaving the theater, I could grab a snack and walk back in minutes. The Premier had a delicious continental breakfast as well as a happy hour. It was great to enjoy a glass of wine before the theater. I would definitely stay here again.Three cons: When having breakfast, I left my room key on the table to show someone was sitting there. When I got back, both the used plates and key were gone. When I asked the waiters, one had picked it up and was ready to throw it out .He acted like it was no big deal and I could just go to the front desk and have another one made. That was NOT appreciated! Secondly, when I asked for ice( someone delivers it) it was brought in a plastic bag instead of an insulated bucket. It didn't last long. Thirdly, a mini fridge and microwave would have been really appreciated. There was plenty of space for them.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Very clean and a comfortable bed,furniture a little bit tired. 5.00pm - 7.00pm everyday was happy hour with free beer wine and a selection of snacks. Excellent location only 2 minutes from Time Square. Continental breakfast included good start for the day..Please note the Premier Hotel is located within the Millennium Hotel as there were no visible signs which did cause confusion to us and the taxi driver. Evidently we found out this seems to be a frequent occurrence ..

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: My wife and I shared a birthday week in New York and chose this hotel as our base. Location was excellent, rooms large and well appointed and the concierge services very helpful (thanks again, Monique!). One of the best choices we have made for a lovely and value priced hotel in Manhattan. Quiet at the 15th floor. Vehicles available for airport transfer. Early breakfast well presented and a 5 pm happy hour with wine and snacks - superb!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Spent this past weekend at the Premier. This was a very nice hotel in Times Square. Broadway theaters are everywhere within walking distance. From 5pm-7pm this hotel features free drinks and snacks for guests. A real plus! The staff were very friendly and helpful. Beds were comfy and our view out our window was not bad.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We were surprised by our initial greeting at the Premier Hotel, “Too early to check in”, given the tripadvisor reviews for front desk friendliness. We were not asking to check in at 9:30 am but were asking to check our bags. We were able to check our bags and the person who checked them for us was very gracious. When we did check in later in the afternoon the front desk staff member would never be called warm or friendly, but was efficient. The complimentary cocktail hour was lovely, with a wonderful assortment of appetizers and wine, and the staff there was personable. Breakfast was very nice. The room, typical size for an inner city hotel, and the bathroom were comfortable. The bed was comfy. We got a great deal online and, for the same price, I would go back.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: It was a great hotel. Lovely room and bathroom. Breakfast was with a good choice of different foods, eg fresh fruit, cereals, bagels, toast, juices etc etc.Pleasent surprise for us was the cocktail hour at the hotel with small bites and a very decent wine to go with it (or other refreshments). Thanks to the staff of the hotel, everybody was very helpfulNext time I'm in New York this is the place to stay.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I was looking for a hotel close to Times Square and decided to Priceline it. I entered the amount I wanted to pay in the Times Square area. I was confirmed for this hotel. I immediately started looking for reviews from other people who stayed here. Most were fair and some weren't. I have to say that I have no complaints with my stay. From the moment i checked in, EVERYONE in this hotel, including their sister hotel, were so nice and helpful! my room was nice, clean, and had a great view! I would definitely be staying here on my next trip!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: had a great time, very friendly staff especially Monique at the front desk. Surprising it was quiet for the location which was great to sleep in and complimentary breakfast was nice. I will be coming again.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I recently had a great experience at The Premium Hotel NYC. The local is perfect, simply half block away from the Times Square, without the noise and the lights. The room is relatively big for a room in Manhattan, the only negative point is that they only offer a single double bed, with no option for a double queen size bed. So for my next trip to NYC with my family (2 adults, 2 children) this may be my single point of concern. All the rest is good! I've been hosted by Monique which was very charismatic and gave us full attention! Thanks Monique! I recommend this hotel!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I have been going to NYC for many years, and The Premier Hotel is my new favorite. The staff was phenomenal, Kevin checked us in and was beyond helpful. He was professional and fun, playfully poking fun at our Boston accents. :) The room was immaculate, and big for NYC standards. Very comfortable, large bathroom, fantastic view! Monique checked us out, and held our bags for us until we needed to catch our train (which was 6 hours after check in) which we were so grateful for. There are thousands of hotels you can stay at in NYC, but the customer service in this hotel cannot be beat. I will absolutely be coming back!!!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Myself and my partner have just returned from 6 amazing days in New York at the Premier Hotel. Everything about the hotel was great, the rooms very spacious and clean, the bed was huge and very comfortable. The staff were very helpful. We didn't make it to the 5-7 happy hour as we were out at these times and had breakfast on just a couple of days but these were both great inclusions to the cost of the stay, also free wi-fi. The location was fantastic close to Times Square and Theatres.Would definitely recommend to any friends and family and would stay again if we are lucky enough to return to New York.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We purchased a night at this hotel through Hotwire. It was an absolute joy to be able to stay so close to Times Square and Broadway! The hotel is small, but offers a wide variety of amenities through it's sister hotel next door, The Millennium. There was nothing I can think of that I didn't enjoy! The hotel was clean, spacious and our room offered a spectacular view from the 8th floor. The evening reception was a pleasant surprise. It was nothing special and offered Bud or Bud Light along with a white and red wine. Small hor d'oeuvres such as cheeses, hummus, and grilled vegetables were abundant. The area on the 2nd floor also offers a very nice continental breakfast every morning. They also have a machine that makes espresso, caffe americano, and cappuccino. The front desk staff is also a joy! We worked closely with Monique and she was an asset to the hotel. She was warm, inviting, and very knowledgeable about the area. I would stay here again in a new york minute!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We had an excellent stay at this hotel! The room was quite nice - although I'm sure I asked for a Queen-size bed and got a full! The3 place was neat and clean, everything was just as you would like it.They even offered free continental breakfast and somewhat of a cocktail hour. The fruit, cereals and baked goods were much appreciated in the mornings and the snacks in the afternoon was great before dinner.The staff was extremely nice.One suggestion is not to get a room near the elevator - it can be noisy and all the lights go on when you hit the switch (which is difficult if only one person wants to read in bed).Otherwise, was very happy with our selection!Free wifi too!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: My husband and I stayed here Memorial Day weekend and had a wonderful experience. The staff was friendly, the Hotel was clean and modern, and the room was a very decent size for being in NYC - not to mention the beds were so comfortable! As an added bonus there is free continental breakfast daily as well as free beer, wine, and snacks from 5-7. It was also suggested that we take advantage of the parking garage across the street to save money on valet (only $45 a day). Would definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: My husband and I made a quick trip into the city while visiting family in New Jersey. We loved staying at The Premier Hotel! First thing when we went to check in we were greeted by Monique who so helpful and friendly! She truly was wonderful and made our trip start of great! Also the staff at the happy hour and breakfast were very attentive and helpful. We will definitely stay here again and already recommended it to several people for a nice stay right near all the Broadway theatres and restaurants!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel was very clean and modern. The beds were the best I've slept on in a hotel. Monique at the front desk is very efficient and helpful. Location was perfect for the theater. Complimentary breakfast and the evening happy hour an added plus.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: A very satisfying combination of upscale midtown city hotel with a boutique feel. Rooms are clean, spacious, well-lit, contemporary and comfortable. Lots of mirrors, nice sitting area and large bathroom. Built in a tower concept, the halls are wide and short with only six or seven rooms to a floor. Very quiet. It adjoins The Millennium Hotel, but everything you need is contained within The Premier, including a wonderful continental breakfast with attentive hosts. And a happy hour in the same comfortable lounge area. Great location just a few steps off of Broadway. Definitely worth the price.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel was perfect in every way! Our room had a perfect view of the 'New Years Eve' ball, the staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel was conveniently located right near Time Square with plenty of restaurants, convenience stores located nearby. The Premier lounge saved us plenty of money and was a great way to meet other guests staying at the hotel. Well worth the price tag because it made our stay in NYC!!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: As I checked in, I was pleasantly surprised by the cleanliness and the size of bathroom. The room was neat and decent sized, given that you are within a block of Times Square. A continental breakfast is included and is reasonably good. The staff is courteous and guided us well, in terms of where to find tickets for the Broadway shows and in calling a cab for our early morning flight. Overall, an excellent experience. The free wifi signal is very good.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We were searching for a moderately(for NYC) priced hotel near Times Square and we are happy we are happy we found the Premier Hotel. It is literally one block from Times Square. My room was on the "inside" side of the hotel(not street side) and was totally quiet. The rooms are modern and well equipped. I don't think wi-fi is free but a breakfast is included.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The location is ideal--you're at the center of the city. You can get around to anywhere, or if you want to stay put, great restaurants, and stores, not to mention Broadway theaters are within walking distance. My hotel room was lovely--spacious, clean and beautifully appointed. Amenities include a lovely continental breakfast (with cappuccino), and cocktail party with wine, beer, cheeses and cold cuts--every day, at NO CHARGE. But the service and staff are the cherry on the whipped cream! The concierges Monique and Kevin, couldn't be more gracious, helpful and warm. I'll be back!! no

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We had tickets to Hamilton and I made reservations via Expedia so I wasn't sure but know it would be a convenient area to stay. The Libby staff are just ok, the room was nice and quiet and clean. Very nice and surprising.i liked the bfast free sweets, coffee, and hard boiled eggs. My husband got his big buffet bfast for 10$ at the millennium it's sister hotel.It's on 44 th between 6 and 7 and is a great location. I would stay here again.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The room is great, with space, the bathroom, everything, kind of boutique but with the great space you need. Its located half a street to time square, and almost everything is walking distance. We almost never use taxi. And the price is great!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel and staff are great, rooms are spacious, as their respective batrooms, rooms include iron and iron board (I actually used them twice cause shirts needed ironing but not enough to merit sending them to dry cleaners service the hotel offers as well), hair dryer, safe, coffee maker and even an umbrella; most of this things are standard but considering some hotels are of late neglecting one or two of this, not absolute necessities, its important to note you can count them on them in this hotel. Ample tv channel selection. Its a hotel part of a bigger one so it feels like being in boutique hotel hidden inside a big New York City Hotel such as the Millenium. Half a block from Times Square, walking distance from moat Broadway productions its a great location. Recomended stay, specially considering cost/benefit, I may be wrong but for the price, I dont think I could have had a better experience.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: They make sound like five start hotel and it is not. Service at the front desk was not always nice. Breakfast is just ok, not very comfortable seating area to eat. Location is great. I am sure they could do a lot better if they wanted to.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: What a find! In a perfect location smack in the middle of everything in Manhattan with a subway station that connects to most lines for the rest of the city, this hotel is an absolute must for first time visitors (and return visitors!). The room was huge with comfy beds and a couch and plenty storage. The bathroom was easily the largest I've ever had in a hotel and everything was clean and in great condition. Couldn't believe how quiet it was considering it's right on Times Square.The happy hour drinks and breakfast were wonderful free additions, which we happily took advantage of. If we ever go back, we're staying here again - it's absolutely perfect!
user_name:
memnoch86
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This relatively small hotel (6 rooms to a floor) adjacent to the Millennium Hotel is clean, quiet, and well-appointed. The room was a good size for New York, and the bathroom had both a tub and a separate shower. Breakfast was better than I expected, with two attendants to keep things in order. Although the Premiere has its own staff, the Millennium provides backup (answers the in-house phone, shares maid staff). It's a good choice if you want to be close to Broadway and Times Square.
user_name:
Sedgwall
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Lovely short break at this hotel with my daughter. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Nice spacious room with a separate seating area and bed very comfortable. Disappointed that there was only a space where the built in fridge/minibar should be so a lot of wasted space in the room. Also coffee machine was a bit basic and feel a kettle would have been better as it was difficult to fill the water tank to get a decent size coffee dispensed. Room was cold, even when the air con was set at 80F, it was blowing cool air and as the outside temperature was very low for May and no sign of the sun, it was a little too cold for comfort, particularly for my daughter who ended up sleeping in one of my jumpers. The free continental breakfast was very popular and more often than not, there was not enough seating which was a shame but if you were prepared to be patient it wasn't a problem. Also the two hour happy hour from 5-7pm, when free beer and wine are available along with some nice,tasty snacks, is a very nice idea and is what makes this hotel stand apart from the many other similar hotels in the city. I would certainly recommend it and will consider staying here again, if and when I return to New York.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: My daughter and I went in early May 2016 and loved it!!The hotel was great , it is on a side street off of time square and I asked for a room with a view of time square and we could see the ball and a partial view of time square we were on the 19th floor . They only have rooms with one bed, and you can upgrade to a king bed and we did , and it was worth it!!! They have breakfast and in the evening drinks and cheese I think we were never at the hotel during that time, too much to see and do ! The hotel staff was great very helpful !! I highly recommend this place .

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The bed was extremely comfortable! I always have a difficult time sleeping away from home but not this time! The staff was exceptional! We had such a terrific time! We would recommend this hotel to anyone. It is next door to The Millienium Hotel where we usually stay. Both hotels are a class act!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We researched a lot of hotels before going to New York and we were not disappointed! The Premier had good sized rooms, comfortable beds, a couch and desk. The breakfast was nothing special but nice to not have to go out and find something as we already did so much walking! It was half a block from Times Square but still quiet. The staff were friendly and helpful (except do not assume when they say they have reserved a car for you to go to the airport the next day as this did not happen and was really the only down-side to this hotel).

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The Premier is a fairly small hotel (at least by NYC standards) based just off Time Square. Having travelled with a colleague for work, we each had a room on a separate floor - me on the 11th looking toward the back of the hotel (with a fairly uninspiring view) and him on the 12th facing the front of the hotel (decent view of Time Square). Whilst I began our trip feeling a little jealous of this, I quickly changed my mind as he complained that it was so noisy in his room with the sounds of the street echoing up all night long - whilst all I heard was the gentle hum of the air con! And my room was bigger too :) For info, I stayed in 1120 and he in 1219.In terms of the hotel itself, the rooms are not bad, possibly a little tired, but pretty good. There is also a free breakfast included in the rate (albeit a fairly average continental one) plus free drinks (wine / beer / soft ) in the afternoon, which is a nice touch. So I guess all in all, a good solid place to stay when visiting NYC - well so long as you get a quiet room....

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We found this gem online and after viewing the pictures decided to give it a try! Boy were we pleasantly surprised by the spacious rooms ( NYC hotel rooms are tiny!), and the complimentary breakfast and happy hour are stellar! The room was modern, and the bath had a separate shower and tub which I appreciated! The staff was friendly and helpful. I will definitely return to this boutique hotel.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel Premier is near Times Square and ideally situated for anybody wishing to enjoy the buzz of New York. The bed and room is very comfortable and the receptionists very good especially Monique who went all out to make our stay the best ever. Breakfast is somewhat of a farce if it is really busy - not enough tables(they are coffee tables - too low to sit and eat) and chairs for the number of guests and we had to stand to have breakfast until Monique arranged otherwise - not easy with a bowl of cereal! You can upgrade for 10 dollars to the other restaurant but the breakfast is the same every morning - no imagination! Having said all this we enjoyed our stay and the rates were reasonable and it was very easy to get around by foot and cab.
user_name:
Kate M
Coventry, England, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: People: BExperience: ARoom: AI found The Premier Hotel online and decided to give it a try on my last night in the city. Wish I had stayed there the whole time.The room was outstanding--one of the largest hotel rooms I have ever had in Manhattan. The decor was beautiful and the room extremely clean and well prepared. In terms of location, it's hard to beat The Premier. Located among many of the most popular theaters and other entertainment attractions, this hotel is ideal for those who want to enjoy all that Times Square has to offer. Upon arrival I was less impressed with the staff who checked my bags and helped me with directions. Not many smiles found in that crew. A later visit back to the front desk, however, was much more pleasant with different personnel. The street signage for The Premier is discreet, so look carefully for the two plaques on the front of the building. I plan to return to this hotel.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The location just around the corner of Times Square fantastic.Staff is very friendly & helpful. The breakfast, which was included better thab expected and the happy hour in the afternoon so welcoming after full shopping & tour days.The room was fresh and constantly cleaned up. Also quiet, especially how close we were to Times Sq.Go here!!!!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I recently visited New York midweek, a Tuesday-Wednesday to do some wedding dress shopping. Monique helped me and my friend out so much! She was very professional and accommodating to our needs. The hotel itself is hidden away on a fairly quiet street for being near Times Square. The room was comfortable and the free breakfast and happy hour was a hug plus!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed at the premier for 6 nights. Great location just off from Times Square. Lovely clean hotel, room was big an spacious we were on the 3rd floor room 319 right by lift not many rooms on the floor we found it was very quite.comfortable bed had good nights sleep ..bottled water provided tea an coffee in rooms although I'm not a fan of powdered milk I'm sure you could get milk if asked.Iron ironing board, hairdryer provided also a safe in the room. Free continental breakfast which was lovely granola,selection of cereals, toast, croissants,Danishes an fab muffins,tea coffee orange juices.Happy hour between 5-7 all free which was a nice touch white,red wine soft drinks an bottled beers not forgetting nice little selection of nibbles.staff were lovely Monique was very helpful an informative places to go very professional true asset to the hotel. We was very pleased with our choice of hotel had a fantastic time in New York

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This is a very central hotel which i found to be very clean and the rooms are spacious the staff were all very friendly and helpful which made our stay very pleasant.one of the largest and comfiest queen beds i have ever slept in and just 2 minutes walk from times square and subways

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Spent two nights at the Premium tower which is part of the Millenium Hotel, but has a separate check in and lounge on the mezzanine just for its Premier guests. I have never stayed on the other side of the main part of the Millenium, as it always seems so busy and overflowing with guests waiting in the lobby. At the Premier, it is very different - no lines to check in, security in the elevator (they only work with your hotel room card), so I feel very safe as a single woman travelling in the big city! Staff goes out of their way to provide a great experience. Free wifi. Love the 5 pm wine and apps at the Mezzanine lounge and the continental breakfast available for free in the mornings there. I am a very light sleeper and my rooms there (I asked to face the back of the building though, so I sacrifice the views) are always just what I want - very quiet. Beds are comfortable and rooms are pretty large for NYC standards. Some rooms have a sofa where you can watch TV. My room this time only had a chair, where the sofa is in some rooms, but it was comfy, so no complaints. Bathrooms come with a separate tub from the shower as well! In room coffee and tea, as well as one complimentary bottle of water each day. Really great place! I have been going there for at least the past 4 years and I always have no complaints whatsoever.I highly recommend to travelers or those on business trips.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This is the second year in a row that I stayed at the Premier Hotel. Last year the staff impressed me and this year they went even above it. It started at check-in when Monique remembered me from a year a go! The staff is extremely friendly and makes your stay very enjoyable. I needed a couple special things and they took care of them without hesitation. I met Patricia in the elevator (I think she is the manager over the food and beverages), and it was like we were old friends. The staff in the breakfast are were excellent, wanting to make sure everything was there when you needed it, extremely friendly and smiling. How refreshing. The lobby staff take care of everything you need, car service, directions, questions, etc. always with a smile while making you feel that they have your best interest in mind. Engaging and friendly which makes you feel right at home. The rooms are spacious, clean, comfortable, which is also refreshing. After 2 visits, I'm a huge fan!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: First time going to NY to visit long lost friends with my family......my friends apartment was too small to accommodate me and my entire family so decided to stay at the premier....omg...right in the heart of time square....beautiful room, wonderful staff from beggining to end.....my favorite part of this boutique hotel was the lounge happy hour....drinks and snacks included from 5 to 7....and the lounge attendant Carlos, had us laughing and entertained us with his lovely and accommodating personality.....overall my family and I had a wonderful experience.....definitely will go back on my next trip

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I went to meet with my family that was staying at this hotel and the staff was horrible! I asked for the parking valet and the lady tried to tell me to go parked my car by myself because parking valet was too expensive. She seemed very annoyed with me asking questions! Hotel room is correct.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This is a great hotel for a business stay. The gym is large for a hotel and the breakfast is convenient. The room was good size for NYC and the bedding was comfortable. Check in was quick and convenient.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Great boutique hotel. Centrally located to theatre district and many restaurants. The premier has a great staff. Monique made sure we were well taken care of. Rooms are large and stylish. I will definitely stay there again on my next trip to the Big Apple.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The bedrooms are comfortable and spacious, with a large double bed, a table, a sofa and chairs, a television, and big windows.The bathrooms are beautiful : a large sink, mirrors, a shower and a bathtub. The location is ideal if you don't mind the noise.Breakfast is decent. The free wifi works very well.Overall, I was pleased with my stay at the hotel except for our rooms not being ready when we arrived !

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: 3 lovely springtime days in NYCI can't say enough good things about Premier Hotel, 44th Street,NYC There are no negatives. On arrival, we discovered a misunderstanding regarding # beds in hotel room purchased Thru Hotwire. The attention given to resolve the problem to our satisfaction was handled efficiently by Monique, a seasoned employee of the property. She made us feel most welcome and went beyond the call of duty to accommodate us, even upgraded us at no charge. Monique is a treasure!Our room was perfect..clean, comfortable and quiet. After breakfast one day, we returned to our room to find the room serviced already.!! Unbelievable!Both of us were sad to depart Hotel Premier and the fabulous friendly staff.This is a completely secure, classy place with a classy staff in particular, Monique.You will not be disappointed.Alice Spitulnik, Rochester, NY

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel itself was a little disappointing from the beginning with the lobby which da simply two desks sitting in the lobby. The room was small but maybe that's to be expected from NYC. The view was ok since we could see part of Times Square. The location was good for being near Times Square although I would not want to stay near Times Square again due to the crowd and constant hounding by people to sell you things. The room was clean and had no major complaints. Overall the hotel was ok but maybe a little pricey paying $1,300 for 4 nights for what was received. The hotel seemed like it was the little not as important brother to the Millennium Hotel next door.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Pros: Location is perfect, very convenient, half block from Times Square but not right in it. Happy hour every evening from 5-7 with free drinks, snacks. Continental breakfast service in morning. Friendly staff. Cons: Housekeeping service not the greatest: frayed towels, stained sheets, partially cleaned room, clogged toilet, room showing wear, have to call for ice, no in-room fridge. However, issues were addressed with apologies from front desk or staff.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: It was our first visit to New York and it won't be our last.The hotel is perfect, brilliantly situated just off Times Square and we didn't hear any noise. Had a fantastic room on the 16th floor overlooking the Crysler building and Times Square. The breakfast is continental, but more than enough on offer. Beats looking for breakfast when you just want to get out sightseeing.Added bonus of "happy hour", complimentary drinks and nibbles between 5-7, which was an unexpected added bonus at the end of a busy day, before hitting the shows etc. at night. Free wifi was also a bonus and it was very quick.There are plenty of eating places nearby and I would recommend Virgil's across the road, which we frequented a couple of times. Would advise booking your Broadway shows in the UK as ticket prices are much higher when you get there.The staff are all really helpful and after a though year battling breast cancer, they made sure everything about our stay was perfect.I would most definitely return to this hotel, when I come back to NY, which I hope won't be too long.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I stayed 5 nights at this hotel for the 2nd week of Apr., 2016 and this hotel was great. This was my family trip with my little daughter, so I was really wanted to find a nice hotel with great location, and I think this hotel was right choice. First of all, the employees at the hotel were really kind and supportive, especially the nice lady, Jenny Stojanov helped my family a lot and my family really appreciate it. The second one is location!! A lot of nice places are within walking distance!Overall, I will definitely visit this hotel again if I have a chance to visit New York again.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The Premier Hotel - sister hotel to the Millennium Broadway, is a good, solid choice for a small boutique stay in the Times Square area. If I could, I would rate it a 3.5 (between good and great) but without that option, rounded up to a 4. The service was good, the room on the larger side and appeared newly updated, and the inclusive breakfast was great (on a par with Hotel Casablanca also in the same area). Things not at the 4-5 level: the bathroom was nice but not as luxurious as some in the 4-5 range. The shower was very small and you could see the wear and tear of an older but updated bathroom with stained caulking in corners, etc. The more modern, Scandinavian-type furniture was also newer but I found the protruding platform bed frame to be annoying and hit my knee on the extended corners more than once (be careful if you use the bathroom at night and don't turn on lights). And it happened to be a humid, warmer day in April so I had the air-conditioning on but the condenser never kicked in so the fan just blew the humid, warmer air around all night. I was able to open windows though and that did help.Ending my stay with a very nice, continental-style breakfast on the mezzanine level (hard boiled eggs, bagel/pastry options, cold cereal, fruit etc.) was very nice and an added value to the stay.Overall, the Premier Hotel won't blow you away but, if you get a good deal (check the sties often) you won't feel like you got taken advantage of either and will have found a decent option in the Times Square area.
user_name:
Gregory M
Tinton Falls, New Jersey

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I was looking for a reasonably priced hotel close to Times Square and found everything I needed at The Premier. It is about a 4 minute walk to the TKTS booth in Times Square and about the same distance to the subway on 42nd street, so really a fabulous location from which to explore NYC. The taxi driver had a bit of difficulty finding the hotel, even though I had spotted the sign on the building he kept telling me it was the Millenium. I eventually had to explain that the Premier is like it's smaller sibling. Eventually I entered the reception area. Keep in mind the entrance is not directly facing 44th st - facing the street is a large window, with the revolving door just to the side, offering a bit of protection from the foot traffic. The room was great - much bigger than many other places I have stayed (in a similar position with regards to Times Square). As you entered the room there was an alcove to the left with a wardrobe (containing a safe) and a small table with the coffee maker on it. To the right was the bathroom which was bigger than my ensuite at home with a large bath tub, separate shower and plenty of bench space, hooks and rails. The main room was almost in an L-shape with a narrow but functional desk and the bed in one section and a sofa in the other part, separated by a flat screen tv that could be swivelled from one side to the other. The bed was plush and supremely comfortable and the pillows were good too. You could control the temperature of your room with the wall mounted control, which was perfect. I had asked for a 'quiet room away from lifts and service areas' which I did get. I was facing the back of the hotel so heard virtually no street noise but was directly opposite the air-conditioning units of the buildings behind, which were a bit noisy, but given the proximity of everything in NYC can't be helped. The other bonus was that breakfast was included - the usual selection of fruit salad (pineapple, rockmelon and honeydew), boiled eggs, breads/bagels/pastries with juice, tea and coffee as well. In the evenings there was a happy hour from 5-7pm where they served wine (cab sav was delicious) and various antipasto dishes as well, which sometimes could suffice for dinner, making the hotel even more economical overall. I wouldn't hesitate to book here again next time I was in town, providing that the price stays reasonable.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: My son and I have stayed at numerous hotels when we’ve been in New York City. However, from now on, you can be reassured that it will always be The Premier Hotel and the main reason is because of a receptionist by the name of "Monique". Tuesday, March 28, we arrived and were greeted with “Oh, how wonderful, it’s the Caruso’s.” There is no need to say more. That wonderful greeting, welcomed us as if we were just arriving home.You are fortunate to have Monique!Sincerely Nic and Ric Caruso

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Really nice hotel, close to Times Square (100 m distance). Just believe me, there is nothing to complain. High class stay, comfort on 5 star level for reasonable prices.. Free breakfast, and from 5 and 7 free drinks (as much as you can and wish) and delicous foods. Tips: book 7 days in advance on hotel webpages for extremly discounted prices. Room 1523 is cornerroom. Very spacious, Times Square view.. Extra: Ascharaf, waiter at breakfast and social program, is so nice, polite and professional with behaviour on highest hotel level..all recommendations!!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Great Location, in the middle of Times Square!!!If you have a problem, a question... don't ask at Anthony, the manager. Due to a cancellation to our AA flight, we have to stay one more night at the hotel so we ask to book one more night and Anthony tried to charge us 450 dollars for one more night!!!!! at the same time, the official website of Premier Hotel proposes the same room to 180 dollars?!? Hopefully I'm not stupid!!!!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I was expecting to walk into a really, noisy, crowded hotel...but to my surprise it was very intimate, clean and overall a great experience. The front desk man Kevin, who has been there about nine years or more, welcomed us and was very informative about the hotel. Happy hours are from 5-7pm so we took advantage of the red wine and snacks on the mezzanine level. Our room was clean, and our view was great. If you walk out the main doors, go right, you'll be right in Times Square. Shopping areas and restaurants are literally a few steps away. It was great waking up with the sun beaming in through the big windows. If you're hungry, they have complimentary breakfast. So enjoy! Great hotel, I would def come back. Thank you for everything.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Great hotel for all, right in the heart of Times Square. We had a nice big room on 19th floor beds to die for, and cleaned every day. Great start to the day with continental breakfast, free coffee all day long in lounge and nibbles and wine in evening plus free wifi all these added extras made our stay good value for money. Staff very hospitable.I cannot find anything we were not happy with and will certainly visit again. Thank you
user_name:
adinelogan
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I love this hotel. I have nothing bad to say. Staff was friendly, check in and check out was fast, hotel is quiet, the room was huge and CLEAN, and to top it off they offer a complimentary cocktail and snacks! I honestly didn't want to leave. If I'm ever back in the city (especially for NYE), I will be staying here. We had a great view of the ball!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This was my first time at this hotel and definitely the last. The rooms are OK, sleep quality not very good and the staff is very unhelpful. Especially at the front desk. They have a complimentary continental breakfast buffet in the Mezzanine lobby but there are not enough seats there so the experience is not very good. Overall, The "deal" we got was not very good.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Small boutique hotel, next door to its sister hotel, The Millennium Broadway Hotel.We asked for a bedroom on the top floor and we received one. We were on Floor 121.The room basic but clean. There was only one bathrobe in the room when we arrived, but Monique on reception quickly got us another one.Breakfast in the morning was buffet style. I am Coeliac but the waiter in the morning, always got me some bread from the hotel next door when I asked.5-7 pm in the evening was happy hour (2 hours actually). All beer & wine and nibbles were free. Lovely idea and the waiter(s) were always helpful, not sure whether I have the name correct, Carlos, I think. He was very friendly.The man on the door was always friendly and chatty. No one was on reception when we arrived, so we had to check in at the hotel next door.I am a little deaf, but there was a noise from outside when we slept. My boyfriend said it was some extractor(s), cooling tower from another building adjacent to ours.Air con very noisy in the bathroom which could only be turned off in the bathroom, but you had to be tall, as the button was on the ceiling!Ideal location. A couple of good bars on the same street. Two windows from our bedroom. One overlooked other buildings (office block) and the other, small one, overlooked Times Square, but was a distance away. Had to keep curtains closed as overlooked offices.The staff, breakfast & happy hour definitely made our stay excellent.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Excellent choice for couples. Small hotel but big on Rooms, Staff, Breakfast(Free), Evening Beer and Wine(Free).We had a room on the 14th floor and ending in an odd number(faces the ball drop on times square). The room was Clean and a really good size for NYC. Bathroom has a soaking tub and shower. Staff was great, Hector Checked us in fast, and always had a smile on as we came and went, Monique was also Great, She was always positive and upbeat. I didn't get the name nor did we see the housekeeper, but she did an awesome job. Also the guys that ran the breakfast and evening beer and wine did a great job too. Only one thing that did disappoint me was that the hotel removed the in room mini bar from all rooms and no place to get ice. I would suggest to the hotel that they either put back the mini bar or have a place to get sodas and snacks for a price. I give this place five stars for comfort and hospitality! We will be back.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Our room was spacious by NYC standards and the convenient location 1/2 block from Times Square was perfect. The people at 5the concierge desk went out of their way to provide useful information and insight as to what, where and when to see those attractions in which we had an interest. The hotel is in the heart of the theater district and within walking distance to MANY of the Mid-Town attractions. Hector and Monique were standouts in this regard but all of the folks with whom we had interaction were very pleasant and helpful! The complementary continental breakfast and happy hour daily were very nice and, given Times Square prices, were a valuable treat!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This was a perfect fit for our short visit to the city. Times Square & theater district was easily accessible. We even took a walk to Central Park when the Pope visit had created havoc with transportation by cab. The hotel was nicely appointed. We enjoyed both the included continental breakfast and 5-7 happy hour with hors d'oeuvre. We will definitely return.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: For us, a young couple, this hotel was perfect, situated next to times square. Free drinks 5-7 every day, breakfast included to get you going, fast free wifi. Staff are there when you need them, polite and approachable, but do not fuss over you which for us was perfect. Would recommend and stay again

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Wonderful Hotel 2 mi nutes off time square. Pleasant staff who do what they say they will do. Clean light room, free happy hour 5-7 in mezzanine bar. American buffet reakfast included. Would definitely go back.
user_name:
Simon M
West Yorkshire, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This place has it's ups and downs. On first impressions when we arrived, it didn't seem like a hotel as there is no usual reception area; the check-in desks looked like they should appear in an internet cafe, not a hotel. However, the decor and feel did seem nice.Check-in. We were the only ones waiting, excellent, and we were checked in within minutes, excellent, again. However, the only words the man behind the desk said were; "What's your name?" and "Can I have a credit card for the file?". There was no attempt at being polite and even more annoying, he did not give us any further information on the hotel other than our room number. One thing to note here, we were charged $100 deposit, which is probably standard procedure, but no one told us we needed to pay this. I didn't notice until I checked my credit card later in the week. We did get it back once we had checked out though.Luckily, the bellboy, David, was a lot more forthcoming and offered us more information about the hotel, for example, where we needed to go for breakfast. He also gave us a quick tour of our room and made sure we were settled in nicely.The rooms. We were very impressed with the room we got. It was very spacious and the bathroom was much bigger than expected. There were plenty of power outlets and lighting. However, one annoyance was that whenever we turned the bedside light out it also cut all electric to the TV, meaning we needed the lights on to watch it. The view wasn't great, but nothing we didn't expect before arriving. The best thing about the room though was the comfortable beds and cleanliness. I got a good nights sleep every night and the maid did a good job of cleaning and tidying every day.Breakfast. Average at best. On our first morning, we were greeted by a hotel employee who insisted on questioning us about whether we were staying at the hotel. After convincing him we were we moved into the breakfast area. The only way I can describe it is; like a waiting room, a few chairs and low coffee tables. The only thing missing was a selection of magazines on the tables. So there was nowhere to lean to eat your food, unless you fancy hunching right over the low tables. Further to this, the food was completely average. There wasn't a massive selection and the quality wasn't great either. Other than breakfast and our rooms we didn't have much interaction with the hotel until it was time to leave.Location. Amazing! If you want to be in the middle of things on Time Square, this is definitely one of the best places to stay. We also came across some very good places to eat and drink a few blocks out to the east and west.Last day and check out. Check out was simple and quick. We also needed to leave our bags in storage, which was also simple. However, the interaction with the receptionists and bellboys throughout the last day was hard work. They answered the questions we had and were helpful, but they all spoke to us in rude and sarcastic tones. It was as if they wanted to just get rid of us quickly and we were disturbing them from something important. Everything they did and said seemed to be with huge reluctance. When it came to leaving, we struggled to get a cab, but instead of the bellboy from this hotel coming to try and help, we had to rely on a bellboy from a neighbouring hotel to help. He managed to sort a hotel car for us in the end.With the exception of the bellboy on arrival, all staff we encountered were quite rude. This kind of service didn't stop there, we encountered this quite often when travelling around Manhattan during our stay. This was not the case with everyone, however.Despite the level of service, I would consider staying here again just for the rooms and location alone and at least I would book knowing that customer service isn't the hotels strength and I would keep my interaction with them to a minimum. However, the customer service does need to be addressed and greatly improved. Manners is an easy thing to improve and would make a huge impact on guests.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: A little difficult to find. There is no signage other than The Premier etched into the stone out front. Once inside, we were treated with promptness and friendliness. The room was immaculate. Our view wasn't the greatest, but I am sure if we spent more we would have had a better view. The proximity to Times Square and the subway could not be beat. The staff prepared our room everyday and left quaint little notes to show their appreciation. I would definitely stay here again. Maybe next time splurge a little more for a room with a better view.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I had an incident where another guest Id met at breakfast knocked on my door uninvited & made a strange comment. Now, as a woman Im quite use to this, but as a conscience human I wanted the hotel to be aware there was a bit of a creep staying there. This staff rallied together like a seamless unit all making sure that I was instantly removed from that room & placed in another room alone with all my belongings. They acted & reacted like an instant & continuous set of brothers checking in with me when I went in & out. Originally I didnt want to move rooms because I had a truly lovely view but they bellman Marcos insisted that I i have my room changed & with the help of Anthony, Jigme, Marcos, Brandon & another man (whos name escapes me was the )night desk man of guyanian ancestry, all made sure I was safe & sound & well the rest of my trip. I was in New York only a few days but with their attention I felt like a trip back here would be revisiting old friends. If you guys read this! Yo all were like big brothers! Thats a great team u have their & thank you! Many Thanks for making my birthday special with your restaurant tips & Ill be back in the summer with my family!~ Birthday from Bahamas MS Brown

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This boutique hotel is a Millenium property and is located adjacent to a large Millenium Hotel. The intimate lobby exemplifies the low-key, personal experience that the Premier promises. The rooms are well appointed, spotlessly clean and very comfortable. Each staff member we encountered, especially Monique, was exceptionally friendly and helpful. Guests enjoy a happy hour with free beer, wine, coffees, and hors d'oeuvres in the evening and a free continental breakfast in the Mezzanine. A full service bar and restaurant are available at the Millenium Hotel. The location of this wonderful hotel is ideal for the theatre.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Monique at the front desk was wonderful! The room was clean and they have a very nice happy hour and morning breakfast on the mezzanine level. The only disappointment was at the end of our stay when we had to wait 1 hour for our car to be brought back from valet parking, which was managed through the adjacent Millennium hotel. Our advice would be to give them plenty of time to get your car. Overall, we had a great time and would choose to stay at the Premier again.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Great stay during December - hotel located minutes away from Times Square (quiet room nevertheless). Staff friendly and helpful.Room was very spacious, clean and offered a great view of Times Square. Bath robe offered upon request.There was complimentary happy hour drinks every day which was a nice touch. Free breakfast was extremely simple (would opt out if possible)

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: My wife and I had a great stay at the Premier Hotel near Times Square. The outstanding feature of our time there was Monique, on the front desk. She was invariably warm and welcoming, knew our names from the start and has the rare quality of a genuinely pleasant and caring disposition. It's clear that she loves her job and is very good at it; and that she really does care for the well-being of her clients. None of that insincere I'm-doing-my-job-now-give-me-a-tip pretence that can startle and disconcert visitors to the US.When a parcel delivery went missing, Monique was so solicitous in chasing it up that I began to wonder if she really WAS working the tip system! But that was unkind and unjust - the fact of the matter was that she behaved as though it were HER parcel that was missing and pursued it relentlessly.Overall, the hotel was fine, in the way that good hotels do their job so that everything works and things run so smoothly that you don't even notice. But what made this hotel remarkable and truly memorable was Monique.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We had some issues with our room HVAC not working and called the desk. We were told on our way out to dinner and a play that when we got back that night our room would be changed. When we returned there was no one at the desk . We waited for about 10 minutes no one showed. Due to being tired and the late hour we decided to stay in the room. Spoke to Monique about this as we were checking out and she was very apologetic and accommodating. A special mention to Carlos, he could not have been nicer.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Great hotel that allows you to love around easily , just a few steps to Times Square and underground trains . Good restaurants and theatres are in the area too. Good simple breakfast and very clean and comfortable beds too.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Great location, I often go to New York and this hotel is a perfect location for business meetings and shopping. The staff is very attentive and polite. Special thanks to Monique that from the reception desk always give perfect and polite support.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I go to NYC often but had never heard of this hotel. I booked it on a prepaid discount hotel site and I hit the jackpot. What a great location on 44th Street and a great balance between trendy and comfy. Staff is friendly, room was spotlessly clean and roomy with a separate seating TV area, the bed was delightful, and the included breakfast was substantial. Free wine and beer each nite for Happy Hour! The lobby is small but adjoins the larger lobby of the sister Millennium hotel next door. The one negative for me was the lack of service from the doormen and the absence of anyone at the desk or security when I came back to the hotel at midnight. The elevator only works with key access, but the lack of a security presence bothered me.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Perfect location! Great room and amenities! Attentive, polite, helpful staff! Went over and above for us!! The only place to stay in NYC - if you're doing Broadway, Radio City Music Hall, Rockefeller Center - plenty of close-by dining options and shopping! Can't wait to return! Thank you Premier and staff!!
