hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We spent 6 nights at the Premier Hotel and overall had a good average experience, although we would probably preferred to be in the Millennium section of the hotel next door which had more of a "hotel" feel about it. The bathrooms are very tired and can do with a renovation, and the shower curtain must go ... a 4* hotels should definitely not have shower curtains, very unhygienic ! Generally, the room could do with a refresh and the carpet looks like it had seen better days. Rooms are a good size for NY, and very quiet considering the location - our room faced the street, only some occasional delivery truck noise in the early hours. The breakfast room small and crowded but provided a basic continental breakfast - good for toast and coffee before heading out. There are plenty of cafes and diners near by so it's not essential to get the bf included rate. The Itallian Restaurant across the road is fantastic and worth a try for dinner, and the Red Flame Diner further along W44th (1 block along) is just amazing for breakfast-brunch-lunch-supper.The location is also just a tad bit too close to the Time Square crowds, better to be a couple of blocks south around Bryant Square and not have to fight the crowds every time you depart or return to the hotel. If we had to do it again, we would probably choose somewhere else as we feel we did not get fair value for what we paid. Last time we stayed 1 block along W44th at the Iroquois Hotel for a similar price and we got better hotel service, nicer room and better location.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: My wife and I stayed here from Dec.30,2015-Jan.3,2016.We were more than happy with The Premiere,great Hospitality and Staff.We couldn't have asked for anything else.The room was clean,great breakfast to start the day and nice reception

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: My husband and I stayed here after Thanksgiving for 5 days. We had a great experience. We could see the ball on Times Square from our room. The staff was always very nice and helpful. Monique Madison was at the front desk most mornings and when we checked in. She was always so nice and always very helpful and went out of her way to help us. She made us feel special each day we were there. We would recommend this hotel and we will be back. Great location also.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel is located in the heart of Time's Square and is perfect for a short stay in the city. Within walking distance of the square and subway, with many restaurants (both elegant and casual) nearby. The complimentary breakfast was plentiful. The customer service was okay, though desk clerk "Monique" was a bit obnoxious with her self-inflated ego. We would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: My wife and I stayed at The Premier Hotel for her birthday. The hotel staff were very accommodating. The happy hour from 5-7 had nice choices to munch on (humus, crackers, olives, etc.). The red wine was pretty good. There were two couples not far from us gorging on Coronas, Amstel Light and wine, so they got their money's worth. The only negative was that our toilet ran all night. Other than that, we would stay here again.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: it is position is excellent quite the telephone number mentioned in booking is not working, I have difficulty in contacting them they hold 400 dollars as insurance although there is no fridge or minibar I make reservation according to the room picture in booking but in reality the available rooms are different. The breakfast is the same and the room is small not always possible to find place to set. I asked before for late checkout but they claim they did not receive anything and allowed my one hour and threatened in rough way that I will be charged 25 dollars for each hour delay I did not receive statement and do not know how to contact them to have it   there are 2 main issues not answeredThe first, the Hotel advertised in your site with a room picture and I made my reservation accordingly, when I arrived there and asked about this room they answered that there is only on similar room which is busy, this is not honest.The second, on the departure date I asked that they were informed by booking the receptionist which was very unhelpful she denied that they received any request from booking and did not try to check the computer, immediately I received a call from the room service in a rough way that I have to leave now.they are lacking the basic principles of behaviour and hospitalitybooking replied that my late check-out request has been sent to hotel on 21 Oct 2015 and the hotel has acknowledged the message.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Great location in the heart of things, and basically right across the street from the theater where The Lion King Plays. We took the train up, and were able to get early check in. Which was really nice and we didn't have to wait long at all. The room was nice and clean. Also quiet, one of the few times that I have gotten a quiet sleep in NYC. The continental breakfast that was included with our stay was adequate. If you are a breakfast person you might want more. All the employees were very helpful and efficient. No complaints.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here for 5 nights Nov/Dec and it truly is a great place to stay. It is right next to Time Square so your in the heart of the city and moments from subway and shopsThe staff are very friendly and helpful. The happy hour in the evening was great and an opportunity to mingle with other guests . Our room was clean comfortable and spacious.We would highly recommend this hotel and intend to stay here again when we return to NY.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We booked the Premier on Jan 4th 2015 after reading a Trip Advisor review that a couple had booked a room with a view of the famous New Years Ball Drop in Times Square. We've always wanted to spend New Years in New York but were put off by the crowds. We called and booked the room without too much hassle. We confirmed our room the day before we travelled and still had the room we had requested. It was unbelievable. I actually cried when I looked at the view. It was perfect. The room itself was very comfortable and quite large for New York. The bed was firm and warm. I'm not a fan of showers in bathtubs but aside from that that the bathroom was clean and spacious. Our room number was 1821 and I highly recommend it for the perfect view of Times Square. It's worth the extra $$$$.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I had the pleasure of staying here for the first time on business for 4 nights in June. Upon arrival check-in was flawless and Monique was incredibly helpful. I contacted her with a minor complaint on the room and she very quickly got it taken care of. The room was extremely quiet even though it is within a half block of Times Square. room is spacious, comfortable, and exceptionally clean. Wi-fi was fast and tv channel selection was superb. Cab and limo service was quick and timely with concierge/reception taking care of all the arrangements.A courtesy breakfast in the morning and happy hour in the afternoon with appetizers on the second floor were not lavish but were better than the usual fare. Location is great with Times Square being a half block away but the main entrance to the hotel is just far enough from the crowds. This was my best experience in the Times Square area.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I am a regular guest at the Premier Hotel because of its wonderful staff, its location, and pleasant and comfortable room. Every staff at the concierge desk is friendly and warm. Monique is exceptionally special because she always makes sure I am comfortable and happy with the room. Robert Bove is another very special staff who takes great care of my reservation and special needs. The room is spacious, quiet with well-appointed amenities for both business and leisure travelers. It's located in the heart of Manhattan near the Duffy Square, subways, restaurants, and walking distance to the theaters. I highly recommend the Premier Hotel to anyone who plans to visit the Big Apple!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed one night at this hotel. It is located in a prime area of the Times Square. We assumed it is like or better quality then the Millennium hotel which owns it. The rooms are OK, Ikea quality, very basic reception and concierge other then that you enjoy the city. As for the price if you get it at 65% discount you get a reasonable deal for NYC prime location.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Our stay at the premier hotel has been lovely! We arrived early for check in and Monique graciously waived the fee and quickly got us a room!! Highly recommend staying here.. Great location and very cozy and clean rooms! Easy walk to the subway and especially nice if your in the city seeing a play!!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We loved this hotel. It was inexpensive, extremely clean, and right in the heart of the city. You're literally right in time square. The staff was friendly and they offer a free breakfast. The rooms were spacious and the bathroom was huge. I would definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Just spent 10 days here over xmas and new years eve.Really great hotel .All staff we had the pleasure to deal with were fantastic .Happy hour every night was a winner as well .Rooms were comfortable. Only thing to say more bottled water would of been appreciated.Overall and very enjoyable stay

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Great hotel and good value for money. Situated about 5 minutes walk from Times Square but away from the noise and hustle and bustle. Breakfast included (cereal, bagels, muffins, danish pastries, fresh fruit) plus "happy hour" for guests between 5pm and 7pm. Clean and a fairly good size room for a city hotel. Would recommend.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here for 5 nights on our first trip to NYC, cannot fault the hotel, really cannot get a better location to feel in the heart of everything, had a high floor room and could see the lights of Times Square. Just minutes from subway, shops, bars, restaurants, theatres. Staff were friendly and helpful, room was spacious and free bottled water a nice touch. Breakfast and happy hour drinks lovely. Helpful doorman with keeping our luggage and calling us a cab. Will definitely stay here again, thank you!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed at the Premier Hotel for our 25th wedding anniversary because we like boutique hotels. We loved everything from the wonderful and accommodating staff (Monique, Patrick and Ashram in particular) to all the amenities. We loved the complimentary breakfast and as a decaf coffee drinker, I appreciated being able to choose from cappucinos to americanos. The complimentary happy hour included a delectable assortment of appetizers and some surpisingly very good wines. The service there was top notch.  We had a great view from the floor to ceiling windows of time square. A fridge in the room kept water and champagne cold. I could not rave about the staff enough. They made you feel like family. We would definitely come back to this hotel. Thanks to everyone that made our first trip to New York City one to remember.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The Premier is the less expensive annex of the Millennium Hotel next door. The upsides are its location, the fact that it is amazingly quiet considering that Times Square is a half block away, free internet, a decent Continental breakfast with expresso/cappucino machine, and afternoon snacks (free wine, beer, cheese, cold cuts). The only downsides are that we could not get a king size bed, and the services and amenities are quite limited (no pool, no bar or lobby).

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I stayed at the Premier for one night on a quick business trip to NYC. It was a pleasant hotel in a convenient location that would be a good choice for business travelers. The room was quite large by NY standards and spotless. The furnishings were not deluxe, but were comfortable. The complimentary continental breakfast was good, and I didn't have a chance to enjoy the free happy hour. Overall, the place is not incredibly fancy and doesn't have a grand lobby or gym/pool, but it was a nice place to stay for a night.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Needed a last minute overnight for NYC for an event. Could not find ANYTHING remotely reasonable for a midweek December one night stay. Ended up trying Hotwire and got the best rate for The Premier. It is extremely centrally located near our events in midtown and times square area....the complimentary Breakfast and the Happy Hour 5-7 was an added bonus, unfortunately we did not take advantage of either, but will remember that they are both included in price for future stays! They do offer coffee, tea, etc. round the clock on the Mezzanine level with a lovely lounge area. Check in/out was easy. Bed was comfy, amenities were ample and free bottled water is a nice commodity in the land of $3+ hotel bottled water. My four star rating is for two small detractors. 1) The fan in our room, for some reason the fan agitated the mirror on the wall and created an annoying vibration noise. Didn't annoy my spouse but it kept me awake, and I didn't realize I could turn it off until early AM hours, just an FYI - probably would affect only 0.01% of the population other than me. 2) This is the one star difference: WTH with charging $50 for early check in? (2 Hours) - for god's sake if the room is clean and ready, what is the problem? Check in is 4PM. it's an odd late hour and if you want your room earlier because you have an event...it's $50, I find that a little extreme.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: My Aunt and I stayed for just one night from November 30 - December 1 and couldn't have received better service! We met Monique upon checking out where we quickly ended up having a full conversation. Not only did she listen to us with a smile, but she also explained the subway to us (since we had never taken it before) as well as the fastest route to take us to our destination. She was a true professional and extremely personable! Honestly, the entire staff deserves recognition - Viviana, Miguel, Hector, and Dixson (who so very well took care of us during breakfast). Amazing staff. Beautiful hotel. Quiet and clean rooms. Our best hotel experience to date! Thanks, Premier!
user_name:
Gianna R
North Providence, Rhode Island

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here for a biz trip overnight. The rooms are a nice size, very quiet in spite of location. Great customer service and personal touches from the front desk, particularly Monique. I found that I had forgotten to pack some essential toiletries and she dropped everything to get me what I needed, all with a smile and quickly. The day prior I needed help navigating directions to a meeting and got a map and info that saved me 40 minutes of time and lots of traffic headaches. Nice place, nice people.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: My family and I were traveled from the west coast to the east coast for a cruise from Montreal to NYC. We ended our cruise in NYC and since my husband and I were traveling with our 3yr and 1yr old and I am pregnant, we really just wanted to get on a plane back to California after living in a tiny cruise cabin as soon as we disembarked. But since we were traveling with my parents, friends from California and friends from Singapore, we had agreed to stay a couple of nights in NYC. Upon checking in and having Monique greet us and hear our story, she took it upon herself to upgrade us to a penthouse room. It was heavenly. We had 2 bathrooms, a kitchenette with a fridge (which was super helpful since my littles drink milk at all hours of the day), a dining room, a living room and a king bed. We had an amazing view of times square and had we been there on New Years Eve, we could have seen the apple drop from our room. The service was amazing with every evening receiving a plate of cheese, fruits and crackers. We could not have asked for a more wonderful experience to end our vacation. Thanks so much to Monique! She was so pleasant and hospitable. I will definitely stay again when I return to NYC. Everything you'd want in a hotel!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Booked via Hotwire, so I was not sure what I would get. The staff was very helpful and polite. Amenities are great though the rooms are small. For the location you can't ask for better. It's just minutes away from subway, and theaters. I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We enjoyed a 3 night stay as part of a Voyage Prive package. It was advertised as a Premier Boutique hotel and all the 5 star reviews got it pretty spot on. Our airport taxi mistakenly dropped us at The Millennium Hotel where we were made to feel a little like second class citizens when being redirected next door to the sister hotel, but once inside the warm welcome soon made us forget this.The location, staff, room (21st floor), food, housekeeping were all more than we expected. Very efficient check-in and out, super comfy bed, helpful storage of luggage until departure and a taxi-summoning doorman with the loudest whistle I've ever heard, all helped make our stay most enjoyable.The only negatives were the lack of a fridge/minibar in the room and the slightly too small breakfast/ reception room which got full very quickly at breakfast and happy hour.We would certainly look to stay here again if we return to New York.
user_name:
Caldy999
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel is a great choice. Location for me is key, so as this was my second time in New York i had to make sure i was close to Times Square, The Premier Hotel was perfect and for a great price - it was 1 minutes walk to Times Square. Rooms were spacious for New York City, clean and comfortable and the free wifi was a bonus! Staff were helpful and where always available. The complimentary breakfast is a great start to the day, something for everyone. Although we didn't get a great view, we didn't travel to New York to look at the sights from our room so this wasn't an issue for us. Would definitely return to this hotel and recommend to others.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed at The Premier Hotel from the 6th to the 13th of November. It was my first time going to New York City so was very nervous about where to stay. We found this hotel on Expedia and came highly recommend. The rooms were spacious and had lovely views of the city, they were very modern and clean the maid came every morning to clean the room and we had a courtesy knock every evening to see if we wanted our beds made up. The bathroom was big with a nice deep sink bath and powerful shower with clean towels daily. There was hardly any noise at night except one morning when we had 3 helicopters over head hovering for an hour but hey that's just city life. The people were helpful at the front desk and very friendly welcoming you every time you came in. You get a complimentary breakfast included and you also get free drinks and nibbles in the evening which is such a nice touch as it saves you a lot of money going out looking for breakfast. The seating area isn't huge but in the whole 7 days we didn't have trouble finding seats and there is a large selection of fresh fruit to cereal muffins toast etc. Evening drinks (5-7pm) are free including wine beer and soft drinks. All served by very friendly staff. Again after a long day in the city a cold beer goes down nicely. Overall I couldn't fault the hotel or staff at allIt's nice, clean, friendly and 30 second walk from time square and also very close to a lot of other big attractions. My only negative is when we checked out there was no one one the front desk, we had a taxi outside waiting and I couldn't find anyone to check out with and ended up running around trying to find someone eventually finding a lady who took my keys and said she'd give them in as the chap had probably gone to the toilet (it was 4am) I would have like to have said thank you for our stay and that we had a really nice time. So if management read this thank you for a lovely time we'd highly recommend this hotel and we're sorry we didn't get to say goodbye Jordan (room 625) Cornwall England

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We just had a great 2 night stay at the Premier! Check-in was a breeze. We requested a refrigerator for pumped breast milk, which they waved the fee for, and it came to our room within 10 minutes of requesting. The room itself was modern and quite large compared to my expectation of reading reviews for a lot of NYC hotels complaining about how small they were. The bed was quite comfortable. Location was awesome for this hotel too. Right off the main drag of Time Square so it was not loud at all. (We actually never even heard another guest either.) Lots to see and do within walking distance. Lastly, they have a complimentary continental breakfast and happy everyday. We plan on returning to NYC this summer, as well as the Premier Hotel.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Yards from Time Square, room big and clean and lush comfy bed.the cleaning staff were fab even offering to turn down our bed. Free drinks and snacks between 5-7 , so in a nut shell this hotel is perfect. Everyone is just so nice
user_name:
Manfie65
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: My boyfriend and I had a weekend off of medical school, and I wanted to find a nice classy hotel for an evening in new york. I booked a room for two people, but the room was definitely displayed for one guest. There was one robe in the room that had makeup smears (at least I presume) all over it, so we did not use it. The pictures made it look like there was a couch but there was just one chair in front of the tv, that could only fit one. The comforter also had stains on it, and we called down to have it exchanged. Someone was sent to the room but they just gave us an extra comforter folded on top of our bed without changing the linens so we made our own bed and removed the dirty stained linens by ourselves. The only reason Im giving it a three is because of the included happy hour. But would most likely not stay here again. I was expecting a little more luxury for the price.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I stayed in this centrally located hotel for a 2-day business trip. Its theater district location provides a plethora of options for entertainment and fine dining in nearby Hell's Kitchen. Unfortunately, the hotel itself is a major miss, especially for one rated 4.5-stars by Hotwire. Upon registration, I was informed that a mandatory early check-in fee will be charged even if there are available rooms. I had no issues with that, except that I could not immediately get into my room and enjoy early check in because the elevators were not working. I waited for a long time in the lobby as the front desk clerk ('Kevin'), his manager, and several maintenance staff milled around the elevator area dumbfounded and panicked about what to do with the problem. In the mean time, irate guests streamed down the staircase into the front desk complaining about being trapped on their floor for a long time. They also complained about the information blackout as there were no communication made whatsoever about a potentially serious maintenance issue, and phone calls to security and front desk about the matter were being ignored. After waiting in the lobby for a while, the manager finally told me I had to take the service elevator to my floor. He did not know when the guest elevators will be back up and running. Luggages in tow, I had to navigate my way through exposed cables and miscellaneous debris in the dimly lit warehouse area where the service elevator is located. The guest room itself is clean and the bed comfortable. In the bathroom, however, the bathtub faucet handle laid on the floor of the tub. I reported the problem and the following day, the handle was reunited with the faucet but immediately detached itself upon touch as nobody bothered to permanently screw it to the handle assembly. It was never properly fixed. On my final evening, I requested for ice to be delivered as there was no ice machine on the floor. Again, phone calls to front desk (I knew 'Kevin' was there as I saw him on my way up to my room), housekeeping, or the bar area were ignored.The lone star goes to the cleaning person on my floor who did a fantastic job keeping the room tidy. Her friendliness and ability to make guests feel welcome are superior to the those unfortunately tasked with initial customer contact.This so-called boutique hotel does not live up to its premier moniker. I suggest taking your business and hard-earned $$$ elsewhere when booking a hotel in NYC.
user_name:
geoarc99
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Situated just off Times Square with easy access to the subway, The Premier is a comfortable and well-appointed hotel although the breakfast area needs to be rethought as space is at a premium. Our room was clean and quiet. Free Wi-Fi, breakfast and a curtesy 5-7pm happy hour were all very welcome. The staff (Hi Monique!) were very friendly and accommodating. We really enjoyed our stay.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: You will not regret a visit to the Premier and adjoining Millenium Hotel! Clean, great location, superb staff especially Monique at the Premier. Complimentary breakfast and happy hour at Premier was an added bonus... You are between the crazy world that is Time Square , the busy 7th Ave. easy walk to Rockfeller Center even Central Park is walkable.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: My wife and I stayed here 24th September for 7 nights for our 40th wedding anniversary and had a fabulous time. We had requested a room on a high floor and were given room 1721 which was great, nice bathroom, bed and a floor to ceiling window. The position of the hotel is ideal, turn one way and you're in Times Square, turn the other way and you're a short walk from the brilliant Bryant Park. It's also within walking distance of plenty of other attractions. Given it's position, it still remains a quiet place to stay. The free breakfast is perfectly adequate and the free drinks and snacks in the evening are a welcome break from the norm. From the time we arrived until the moment we left every member of staff were pleasant, polite, helpful and always had a smile on their face. Hopefully we'll return to New York and the Premier Hotel in the near future.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed at The Premier during an October trip to NYC. I had booked on Expedia mostly due to the ratings and proximity to our venues for our stay. I became worried when I found on Trip Advisor a number of negative reviews noting dirty bathrooms, etc. We DID NOT encounter any such issues. In fact, we found the rooms quite clean and nicely appointed. The free water, internet and evening Appetizer and Wine/Beer Reception is reason enough to stay! I would very much recommend The Premier to anyone looking to stay in the Times Square/Theater District. Very close, but yet far enough away from all the noise!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: GREAT location to Time Square. There are 2 parts to this hotel and I am sure like most NY city hotels the rooms are small. This one however fit our needs. Very clean and comfortable. The "included" breakfast was just a continental breakfast even after we were told it was a "hot" breakfast. Checking in was made easy and Kevin was SUPER helpful.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Very nice location - just 3 minutes from Times Square and Broadway! So quiet rooms, comfortable bed, very quickly room service, good stuff, clean. Will stay here again soon. The price is perfect for a quality. Highly recommend.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: myself and my girlfriend stayed here for 4 nights in October its my fourth time in NYC and i must say this is the best hotel i have stayed in the staff was very helpful and the facilities Excellent FREE drinks from 5-7 every night on the Mezzanine floor is a great touch and the breakfast included was excellent i will stay here again and also the location is great just off time square

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed for 5 nights end of September. The taxi ride from airport took a bit of time , the President was in town so I guess there was more traffic than normal .We arrived at the hotel which is 2 minutes from Time Square , we were checked in quickly and went to our room in 16th floor , the rooms are a good size , for a city , we had a double bed , sofa, bath and shower , free safe and most importantly a coffee machine .....oh there was an iron and ironing board and hair dryer too. There was a free continental style breakfast which was fine . The surprise we got was the happy hour between 5 & 7 where you got free beer or wine ( soft drinks) ., with snacks . This was great we didn't go every evening but it was nice to go and we chatted to a couple of nice ladies from Arizona , a really friendly welcoming atmosphere.The staff on reception were always friendly and happy to help if you needed.infact all the staff were excellent?Just to add you can use the Millennium Hotel for Buffett breakfasts ( at a cost) if you wanted .We used the Metro to get back to JFK, which actually was fine. We allowed plenty of time and it was during the day ,, we had a metro card so only had to lay the 5 dollars from Jamaica .To sum up I would highly recommend the Premier Hotel , I can't think of anything to fault it on . thanks for a great stay .

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This is the smaller hotel adjacent and owned by the Millennium. It's priced better and for the typical traveler trying to save some money where you can without sacrificing quality this is the place. The Millennium restaurant is accessed through a common door as is the Hudson Theater but for a better price. We were very satisfied with the service, our room and the rate. Very friendly staff. Dine nearby at the Perfect Pint or the Brooklyn Diner for an authentic New York atmosphere. Very pleased.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We always stay at the Premier section of the hotel, where we get buffet breakfasts & a 5-7 cocktail hour every night. It's all included, with no limit on the amenities. The rooms are spacious, the air conditioning supurb and the security key card prevents on guests to access the elevators.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Ignore any unfavorable reviews, this place is fantastic!- Best is the location - only half a block off Times Square, a couple blocks to the major broadway theatres, subways etc but not noisy/crowded outside the hotel. If you are coming to NYC for the first time this is the place to stay!- Large modern rooms with sitting area, desk area, and a LARGE bathroom with tub and separate shower. - Free continental breakfast consisting of fresh fruit, pastries, bagels, cereal, yogurt, espresso machine, etc- Free happy hour with wine, beer, pop plus canapes (usually dips with breads, olives, sometimes pasta or mini sandwiches, etc) - All staff were very friendly as well! Right beside sister property Millenium, where you can talk to conceirge, bellman, etc who were also very helpful.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Visited NYC for the first time in December 2014 for my mum's special birthday and decided to stay at the Premier Hotel for the location, look of the hotel etc. seemed to tick all the boxes and it certainly didn't disappoint. The location is fantastic, two seconds walk from Times Square, it was simply perfect!. The hotel seems to be better than the Millennium Broadway in terms of quality of the rooms and also the breakfast supplied daily, the complimentary 'happy hour' drinks & nibbles that were available between 5pm-7pm and the free wifi were lovely touches and much appreciated. NYC was magical and the 6 days spent there has given mum & I memories to cherish. We booked trips via a well known company called Gray Line so that we had guides to show us round all the famous sites of NYC including the river cruise to see the Statue of Liberty & lunch in Little Italy, for $98 it was well worth it. In the evenings we dined out and found an amazing restaurant called Guys American Kitchen & Bar situated on West 44th Street a 5min walk from the hotel. The food was delicious and service superb. Guy can be seen on the Food Network in his show Diners, Drive-ins & Dives. We also managed to catch a few shows including Motown the Musical and the Illusionists, both were absolutely fantastic. I could go on & on about how amazing the trip was but I think it says it all really when we plan on returning in 2016. For anybody looking for accommodation in NYC I would not go past the Premier Hotel. I hope you have as good a time in NYC as we did.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel is first rate. It has a great location...a 1 minute walk to Times Square, 5 minutes to the 42nd Street subway stop. It is in the middle of the theatre district, so that type of entertainment is close. Other tourist attractions are an easy walk from this hotel---Macy's, Rockefeller Centre, Empire State Bldg, Madison Sq Gardens. The room was very good and modern. The only thing missing was a refrigerator. Hotel staff were excellent, helpful, and accommodating. The happy hour and the breakfast in the mezzanine were excellent. As this is a smaller hotel, it was not busy or noisy. This is not a party hotel and I liked that. Excellent restaurants nearby, in all price ranges. I would definitely return. TIP-If you want to buy a bottle of wine for your room, do not buy from the deli store across the street. All bottles there are $25, for not great wine. Google 'Wine Wisdom', which is a 10 minute walk away. Great selection there, at all prices, many many below $20, along with alcohol.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This is our first time at the hotel, and we will definitely come back soon. We were welcomed by Monique ( she is the most friendly, sweet and proactive person in the world) and she was great, help me with everything I needed and went out of her way to do more. The rest of the staff were great too. The place is very clean, mthe rooms are spacious and really comfortable. Room service twice a day. They have a club room where they serve continental breakfast and a delicious happy hour every day. And FREE WI-FI!!! To sum it up, really nice surprise hotel (we book it though priceline), and our trip couldn't be more perfect.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Through Expedia I booked a room at the Millennium Broadway Hotel based on price and proximity to Broadway theaters. At check-in, the hotel said I had been assigned a room at The Premier, a contiguous property just a couple of hallways away. Walking into the Premier's small lobby I found two people at desks, not a counter, who were most helpful in the check-in process. My room on the 20th floor was simply delightful with floor to ceiling windows, marble bathroom with separate shower, and extremely comfortable bed and pillows. That night I found the room to be the quietest hotel room I have ever had in New York; no sirens or traffic noise. The windows must be impact windows or extremely insulated.For my next Broadway trip, I will return to The Premier.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Just returned from my 10th visit to this outstanding hotel. The staff both on reception and in the premier lounge are the most helpful, friendly, genuine people you could wish to meet, always happy to assist with information or booking trips and making my stay feel special. The quality of all-inclusive food and drink served in the premier lounge at breakfast and early evening is great. The rooms are immaculate, and the house-keeping staff are so subtle you never know they are there. The beds are some of the most comfortable i've slept in in a hotel, and the soundproofing means that you are never disturbed from a good night's sleep. This hotel must be the best value hotel within a stone's throw of Times Square - I look forward to my next visit!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed their for one night, the location is perfect, between 5th avenue and broadway! The king size room is nice and spacious. The only negative point was the breakfast... No too much options at all and the place itself was not clean at all... Bread crumbs all over the table and couch.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: My husband and I stayed here for my 30th birthday! This was 6th time in New York but 1st stay at the premier hotel! Well I loved it would definitely stay at the hotel again and would recommend this hotel to anyone! Gloria was an absolute diamond. Gloria and my husband had arranged for balloons and chocolate covered strawberries to be in sent to our room on my birthday as a surprise which was amazing! Monique was also a superstar she was always smiling and always asked how our day or evening had been! It was so nice to be acknowledged when walking through the lobby! The door man I can't remember his name but he was part Irish was also very helpful and lovely!Our room was very spacious and also cosy we also ordered a take out one night to our room!The hotel provides free wifi and complementary breakfast! The breakfast is continental breakfast which you do yourself! Perfect little breakfast before hitting the streets of New York City! Location well you can't get any better with toys r us being just a stone throw awayI honestly couldn't fault this hotel! We are visiting New York in November 2016 and hopefully we will stay here again!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I've stayed at this hotel several times and the entire experience is outstanding. Large rooms, excellent centralized locations, and good value for price. The primary reason for returning to this hotel is the amazing service provided at reception by Monique. She greets me by name and quickly handles any request. It makes me feel like I'm some type of important person, rather than just another paying customer. Keep up the good work!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I have read reviews on here that have been quite negative about this hotel. I booked this through priceline so maybe that's is why I am so happy about it. This hotel was unreal!!! The location is awesome and we were on the 20 th floor with views to the Chrysler building and the signs that light Times Square. I can't flaw this hotel, I think all the negative reviews are way off the mark.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: My wife and I visited New York for the first time and wanted to stay in the heart of things,so we choose the Premier. This hotel is fantastic! The staff were exceptional--friendly, polite, attentive and very knowledgeable about the city. Our room was clean,roomy, with a great view of times square. The New Year's ball was directly across the street in plain view from our room. The whole of every activity in Manhattan was within steps of our front door. You could not get a more central location and ,yes, this was what we loved most. The location. We can't wait to get back to The Premier. We Love New York.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: A girlfriend and I stayed here for six nights.Rooms were spaciousLocation great central at Times SquareNice quiet place to unwind after crazy busy New York daysHappy hour and breakfast were fantasticCleanliness could definitely improve. The bathrooms were nasty. But what bothered us most was that we came back to our room and it had been cleaned. We went up for happy hour and when we returned a maid was in our room for no apparent reason. The door was locked when we came in. There was no cart in the hall for her to be bringing anything to the room and she left immediately. This was 7pm in the evening. When we told the front desk they said that was weird but did nothing about it. Fortunately nothing was missing but no one cared or could explain. I expected more for over 400 a night, at a 4.5 star.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: we got to the hotel around 11, as far as i know check in time is 1. However for The Premier Hotel the check it time was at 4, we tried to check in at 1, she said we can but for extra $50 we waited, we tried to check in again at 3:15, she said again check in time is 4, if you want to check in 3:55 its still $50 charge.we left and came back around 5:30 , there was at least 7 people in line to check in, and one employee working and the computer was down, so we stayed in line for about an hour , then someone told us to go and wait in the bar until they fix the issue however, i did not leave and just waited standing at their disk until they got it fixed We finally got our room key at 7:20 Its funny though how the employee gave the girl in short dress ahead of me passes to free meals and free drinks , while he did not even look at me.anyway at this point i just wanted to get to my room the room was supposed to have view, however the view was at an old office building which is not nice at all especially when we can see them and they can see us just perfectly clear , so we had to make sure to block the view. the room was too small, the TV remote didnt work, but it was clean , and that is why they are getting 2 stars instead of 1. there was no ice machines, we had to order ice from room service , who needed around 40 min to get us some icethe next day we had what they call it breakfast , which was some pineapple , strawberry , boiled eggs , and serial. there is not even a restaurant to set at, its just this room with like 10 chairs and short tables, for the entire hotel, so we decided to skip breakfast for the rest of the tripwhen it came time to check out, we had to check out at 11, i called them and told them we couldnt check in until 7:30, so if we can get extra hour to check out they said no, its $25 per hour for extra check out i would not go to this place again.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: A very nice boutique hotel half a block from Times Square. Rooms have all the necessary amenities. This hotel offers complimentary breakfast and happy hour with plenty of food and drinks and spacious room to enjoy them in.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Monique was fantastic at reception, and turned the whole stay into such a positive experience. It is quiet, and well detailed. The complimentary lounge was at great reprive from the hectic day. I would reccommend this hotel to anyone, and I stay around 100 nights a year in a hotel!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: While i get it that early check in has a cost of $50 which i dont mind paying....its when they waive the cost for the person behind me that irks me.....then the attitudes of the staff are less than would be expected. Our room was nice.....at a glance. The shower however was nasty. Black mold, mildew smell that wouldnt go away. ...my wife finally figured it was the shower curtain. The Slippers had to have been recycled from other guests because they smelled like vinegar. There was a mini fridge in the room that was poorly nailed shut (i guess they will pry out the nails for a $35 charge...LOL-not kidding). The quality just wasn't there for the price. Location is very convenient but that's about it!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The Premier is a small hotel, part of the larger Millenium Hotel next door. The location is prime - merely steps away from Times Square. The room Is a good size and nicely appointed. The hotel offers a small continental breakfast to guests in their tiny lounge area. It's quite sufficient and very convenient. They also provide drinks and a small selection of snacks in the evening, which is great after a long day pounding the footpaths of NY. The staff - Carlos in the Mezzanine lounge is the shining star of this hotel. He goes above and beyond to make everyone feel welcome. Often he is working by himself and is literally running to keep things organised. Acharaf is also friendly and very accommodating. On the other hand, the front desk staff are average at best. Note to management: you can brush over occasional negative comments made on TripAdvisor re your front desk staff, BUT, when you read it repeatedly from various guests from all around the world, then it's time to sit up and listen. The front desk staff are the downfall of this hotel! Apart from that, it's a really good hotel and I would be happy to return.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We love this hotel.My fiancé & I were there recently for a weekend getaway from Toronto.We had a very early flight & arrived hours before check in. The gentleman at the front desk was very accommodating, allowing us to check in well before the hotel check in time.Big big cudos to Hector at the front desk & Timothy the manager, who we're very kind & helpful.We will gladly stay here again. Great location, cute clean rooms, complementary breakfast & drinks at happy hour. Steps away from Times Square, the subway & lots of shops & restaurants.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Overall this is a nice hotel, rooms are good size for NY, and just steps away from Times Square. Breakfast and Wine Hour are nothing special , go to a restaurant for a better breakfast. Our stay had several issues that prevents me from giving a higher rating . First of all our arrival was very early, before 10 am. I contacted the hotel before hand to let them know and asked for a room iif possible, I knew we could at least store our luggage. When we arrived we met Monique who had some glowing reviews here but for me not so much. We waited a good 10 minutes before she acknowledge us, while cleaning her desk and speaking on the phone . Finally we were told that no rooms would be available till 4 pm however we could pay $50 dollars for a early check in. I am not sure if a room would miraculously appear or what but after paying a good side of $300 for a night the additional money seem a bit steep. I also found this strange since she didn't even check our reservations. So we went shopping left our luggage, we returned about 1 pm and still no room, Monique told us one should be ready shortly and about an hour later we had our room , no view just rooftops. The next problem was At night when I turned down the bed, there was a small tear in the sheet, I could live with that, then the entire bottom of the bed was short sheeted and finally a large glob of hair on the sheet. Yikes! I took pictures and showed the concierge, who called housekeeping and the bed was remade. We were offered the opportunity to move rooms but we were already settled. Finally I called for ice and this was never delivered. For what it's worth the staff is friendly . I just can't recommend this place with the ridiculous upsell for early check in and sloppy housekeeping .

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel is about a 100m from Times Square, so right in the centre of the action.Evening drinks are offered between 5 and 7pm and a continental breakfast between 7 and 9am.The rooms are large and the bed comfortable. The street can be quite noisy at times with trucks, street cleaning (starting at 5am on my last day!) and honking car horns.There are plenty of restaurants in close proximity.Wifi is free, however, there is no newspaper delivery to your door.
user_name:
Lee S
Palmerston North, New Zealand

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I had a great stay with family in July of this year. The Premier Hotel, New York is a sister hotel of the Millenium Hotel (located next to each other), Times Square. Check-in was quick as they had rooms available and with help from the great staff we were in and out to explore the big apple in no time at all. The rooms were spacious with plush en-suite shower and bath. Double bed and our room had a large sofa in it which I used as my bed for the few days we were there. The rooms have cable TV, fridge, free safe, wardrobe space and free wifi. Our stay was made better as we found out that there was a complimentary happy hour at the bar (premier lounge) 5pm-7pm every day. After being out sightseeing all day, to come back and relax with a few cold refreshments before heading back out for dinner was a nice touch to the stay. Located just off Times Square on W 44th street it was right in the centre of the city but quiet enough at night to get a good nights sleep. Could not fault the service of th staff. Very friendly, pleasant, always willing to help with directions or help picking a restaurant to dine at. Had a great stay and would definite return.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel was in the perfect location in New York - approx.50 metres walk to Times Square, restaurants, local street performers, shops etc… The hotel offers continental breakfast daily and the staff are very helpful and polite. Having stayed in summer time the only thing missing was a fridge in the room to keep water and drinks cold.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I first want to say, I read Trip Advisor to guide my decisions and I am writing this review to help others have relevant information when choosing their hotel, as well. On vacation, I got to the hotel 2 hrs. early. When asking about check in, the concierge tried to upsale me by suggesting I could pay $50 for the privilege. Very questionable practice for any hotel but particularly a purported quality hotel. Upon checking in room, I noticed peeling wall paper and stained carpet. See pics. Questionable for even a 3 star but for a 4 star, unacceptable. Only being there one night, I thought to let it go and just not use them in the future. However, when I went to the rest room there was urine on the seat and a pubic hair, as well. The tub had some kind of soil, also. See pics. To their credit they changed my room, but with the same result. The toilet had urine stains. The third room had blood on the toilet. It was a small amount (see pics) but a small amount of a blood-borne pathogen is not ok. At this point, I asked if someone could just come clean because it obviously wasn't getting better. The manager graciously gave me a breakfast voucher and I appreciated the thought, but I had paid for breakfast with my room. Btw, they supposedly gave me their best room after these incidents. I had to crawl under the bed to charge my phone because (see pic) the other wall outlet in the room didn't work. Call me choosy, but being away from home, I want my phone in the room with me. The problem with Premier location makes it 2 stars. It misses the mark in two key areas cleanliness and safety. Further customer service began with an attempt to upsale me. Staying at Premier took precious time away and I had to work around the failures of the brand to enjoy myself. That doesn't happen at quality hotels. I would suggest looking at other options outside of the Premier/Millennium Brand.Their location is wonderful. It's alongside some good restaurants and two blocks from the action of Times Square and subways. Additionally, they had a very nice reception on Sat night. Unfortunately, their standard of cleaning, lack of eye for details and the upsale attempt makes their brand questionable for me.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Close to TImes Square and Grand Central Station. Rooms are huge and quiet. Will always put this first on my list when looking to stay in NYC. Enjoyed the fact that breakfast was included as this is definitely a rarity in New York.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Above all the location of the hotel is perfect. Very close to Times Square and the subway which I used a lot. The welcome was fine and I was happy that my request for a room at the front of the hotel had been met. From the 7th floor I could see parts of Times Square with no street noise. If I had a room on a higher floor I might have had a better view but it was not a problem. The room itself was larger than I expected as I had been warned that rooms in NYC were small but not a bit of it! Very clean with everything I could need. Breakfast was more than adequate and the evening reception was a pleasant bonus. My only gripe was that midway through my stay the maid stopped leaving out the complementary bathroom items. I am not sure if this was because I had been leaving only a dollar bill on my pillow as a tip but it lasted for a couple of days. It was my first time in NYC ..the States actually..and I was not used to the tipping culture which we don't have in the UK. For whatever reason it made me feel uncomfortable and while not enough for me to dock a star this would not be an honest review if I did not mention it. The tipping culture is a pain for those not used to it and hotel staff should be aware of this.Otherwise great and I would absolutely book at the Premier if I was to return to NYC.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: My husband and I stayed at The Premier Hotel on our recent trip to New York. When we arrived, our room was not available, so we were upgraded to the room one of the owners uses when he is in town. We arrived late, so were very tired. That whole situation could have turned ugly really fast, but was just the opposite. Talk about location. Our view was of the ball drop site on Times Square. We were 1/2 block from all the craziness, but the hotel was very quiet. A perfect central location to everything. The front desk staff were amazing, particularly the gentleman working the desk at night. He went out of his way to make us feel special, including getting us VIP seating at this great Italian restaurant across the street. This was all before he knew it was my birthday.From this location, you can get the hop-on, hop-off bus which I highly recommend as a way to see all the sites, but not as a mode of transportation. It is too slow and some stops are unmarked and unclear. The hotel is also walking distance to Broadway shows, good food, and Rockefeller Center. Be sure to go to the Top of the Rock. You can get off the hop on bus at Central Park to get a carriage ride. It's worth the price at least once. Be sure to ask them to stop at Strawberry Fields. Negotiate a price before you get on. We had champagne and a cheese platter at The Plaza across the street. Ok, it is ridiculously priced, but come on, you're at The Plaza. It's worth it. I did high tea once before. That was great too. The Met is an absolute must, but give yourself a minimum of 3 hours. Really, you could easily spend days. A show or two is a must, and taking the ferry to Ellis Island and the Statue are a must. If you really hussle, you can do a lot in 4 days.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel stands out for me. I have stayed in a couple NYC hotels, and this one was by far the cleanest, quietest, and friendliest. It is in a great location next to Times Square and the theater district. There are only six rooms per floor, which keeps the noise level down. The rooms are very spacious with a king bed, small sofa, modern TV, and separate tub and shower. The only complaint I have is when I arrived I had to wait to check in with one clerk while the other clerk sat next to him, at the desk, and openly complained about her not getting paid for working on Sunday. Those types of conversations should not be had in front of customers. Outside of this, the hotel was the utmost in professionalism and helpfulness.Things to note: It is attached to the Millennium Broadway Hotel as well as a Broadway theater. At night, the door into the Premiere is closed and you have to enter through the Millennium. It's not far, just remember it for those late nights! Also, I was told by the front desk that they only have king rooms, so don't book here if you want double beds.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I stayed here on a leisurely business trip last week. I was in a corner room on the Premier Hotel side, with the concierge level. The room was nice, however one light switch controlled all lights, so I couldn't just turn on the bedside table lamp. The "happy hour" was nothing special on the concierge level; I've experienced others that are 10x better. 2 choices of wine, a few beer choices and just ordinary snacks, like chips and humus dip. What really annoyed me was the maid. She was there at 8am each morning, knocking on the door. My business was a lunch appointment. Then, on checkout day, I wanted to work from the room in the morning. Again, knocking at the door. Then a phone call from the desk at 11:05am asking if I was checking out soon; the maid is waiting to clean the room, they said. I said I was packing at that moment. Then at 11:10am another call asking the same thing and telling me checkout is at 11am. I'm looking at my confirmation right now, and it says that checkout is at 12:00pm. They told me to call down next time if I wanted a late checkout. There will not be a next time.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Our stay at the Premier Hotel was the best ever! The staff was so amazing! I took this trip for my daughter's birthday. We had an amazing view of Times Square. On the day of my daughter's birthday, upon arriving to our room, a birthday cupcake and gift was waiting for her! Monique was amazing! Amiyah says hi and thank you for all you did. Thank you all for such an amazing experience!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel was fantastic but the front desk person Monique was spectacular. She was incredibly helpful,thoughtful and overall the best front desk person I have ever worked with. The hotel amenities , breakfast and happy hour were fantastic. I will definately stay here again. P.S. The location is amazing.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This is one of those hotels you cannot fault!!! The hotel is in the perfect location for anyone wanting to stay in Times Square! You are literally 100m away! The street is not overly noisy really, the same as you would get at any other hotel in a busy area. The staff at the hotel are very friendly and always greet you when you come and go. The rooms are generous in size, as to are the bathrooms. They are clean, tidy and we had no issues at all! The most amazing thing about the hotel is the breakfast and the happy hour each day! It's very rare that you get anything for free these days but the Premier Hotel has kept this alive. Each morning there is a breakfast available... Bagels, toast, pastries, boiled eggs, fruit, cereal, coffee, tea and juice. Then in the evening between 5&7pm there is free beer and wine! As well as a delicious selection of cheese, biscuits, dip, sandwiches and other nibbles! I would not stay anywhere else in New York again, and I recommend this Hotel to all! Times Square is not a cheap place to stay but this hotel is worth every penny! The only thing I would change is putting a small bar fridge in the rooms. But we didn't really miss that too much. Oh and guests have access to 2 computers and a printer for free, this made printing tickets we purchased online a breeze!!! Thank you Premier Hotel for making our trip so comfortable and easy!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We recently spent 3 nights at the Premier. We didn't know what to expect as this was our first trip to New York.The Premier was an excellent choice. The rooms were spacious and the location perfect for seeing all NY sites. The free cocktails and appetizers were also beyond our expectations. Carlos was helpful and went above and beyond. I can't remember staying in a Hotel where all the employees were this helpful and polite.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: So the only good things about this place is Monique at the front desk - pleasant helpful overall rock star- and the location I great. And that's about it. First room we got to 1620, the AC didn't work at all. Moved to 625, the AC barely worked in there and average temperature this weekend was about 90. The bathroom. O the bathroom. Stunk like moldy mildew awfulness. And the shower was so small I barely fit. And I'm not a big girl. Worst part is, I booked a room in the millennium next door and this was suppose to be an up grade ?? Lesson learned. Will NOT be booking either one again.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I am on my second day at The Premier Hotel and I am already thrilled with the service I've received from Monique at the front desk. She has been very attentive to all my family's requests, and she has been extraordinarily positive and sensitive to all our needs. She recognizes my children, husband and I as we walk in and out, and makes us feel so welcome. The hotel location is perfectly situated, and the rooms are clean and well appointed. We will definitely return. Thanks Monique!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: My husband and I took a weekend trip to New York. This was our first trip to the see the big apple and Time Square and we did not know what to expect. The Premier exceeded our expectations by far! It was so beautiful and close to Time Square. We walked into the craziness everyday since it was so convenient. The staff was wonderful and our room was very nice. We also enjoyed our complementary breakfast and drinks in the evening each night. We would stay here again on future visits! It was well worth it!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We've stayed 5 nights with another couple, great place , on time square but Quiet. close to main attraction, very comfi for shopping.Great staff especially Monique at the front desk who was warm, service oeiented helpful and very welcoming.  I was amazed to find free gluten bread at breakfest

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: a quiet small hotel with magnificent views of Times Square without the hustle and crowds. It's close to everything, yet peaceful and serene. We love the spacious rooms, comfortable beds, free breakfast and cocktail hour with snacks.
user_name:
Lucy Beale P
Salt Lake City, Utah

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The location is great if you want to see shows, shop, or catch the subway. Museums are also within walking distance. The staff was helpful and very nice. Thank you Monique! They were always there with an answer. There was a leak in my bathroom and that was taken care of right away. The view of the Times Square New Year's ball/signs and skyline was fabulous! The breakfast and happy hour offerings were excellent. I truly enjoyed my stay at the Premier.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: SHOUT OUT OF MANY KOODO'S!!! Having stayed twice now at this property, we were encouraged to become a Loyalty Rewards member (no cost) & so glad we did---this "Loyalty" says it all-we've had last minute meetings & reservations were able to confirm a room. From the staff in the lobby to the Mezzanine level attendants as well as the housekeeping staff, everyone wears a smile & are so wiling to assist! Rooms are super clean & well stocked with toiletries, coffee & are extremely spacious!! Really look forward our next stay (btw, this is business travel but we do try to slide in some fun!). What a fantastic property & incredible location!!!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: My wife had a 2 day class in Times Square so her company let her book a room. She chose the Millennium Hotel based on price and location. However, when we went to the Millennium, we were told we had been upgraded to the Premier next door. We were unable to check-in early but they were happy to store our luggage. When we did check-in, we were told about the free cocktail hour as well as free breakfast, things we were not expecting.The elevator requires a room key, a nice security measure. The Premier is a smaller hotel, with only about six rooms on each floor. Our room was pretty big for NYC standards. On the left was a dry bar and a walk-in closet. To the right was a full bathroom with separate shower and tub. Straight ahead was an elevated queen bed with a desk and chair to one side. Opposite the bed was a couch with chez lounge and an HDTV.We slept well thanks to the quiet central style air conditioning. The happy hour did not disappoint. There was free beer, wine, and soft drinks as well as sandwiches and snacks. The bartender was happy to refill our drinks and clear our table. Breakfast featured hard-boiled eggs, fresh fruit, cereal, pastries, toast, coffee, and juice. The bellman and the front desk personnel were all friendly and easy to deal with.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I stayed here on August 7th after seeing a Broadway show which happened to be on the same block as the hotel,talk about convenience,yes! The hotel is located in the middle of times square,but down the block so that your not hit with the noise and craziness that Times Square is known for. I was greeted when I walked in and was pleasantly suprised when I was told that my room was on the Premier side,so I headed next door. The check-in process over there was smooth and quick and more personal,you sit down in a chair as your being checked in. I was upstairs in my room in no time which was on the 18th floor.My room was a nice size and very inviting with a work area, and sofas. Bathroom was a good size with a separate bathtub and shower and very clean. I left my room about an hour later to go see the show and I was surprised that the desk clerk remembered me by name and wished me a good evening,very good customer service. There are plenty of places to eat nearby as well as in the hotel itself.I would definitely stay at this hotel again, great rooms and great service. And for those of you who like to come to NYC for the New Years Eve balldrop you should stay at this hotel and ask for room 1819. You can see the entire ball as it descends down the pole.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I ended up staying here through no action of my own. I had booked a corner room at the Millennium Broadway, hoping for a view of Times Square. When I arrived I was told I had been upgraded to the Premier. You go through a set of doors from the Millennium into the Premier's lobby (it also has a separate entrance on 44th Street).It feels like a different world the moment you step through the doors. The lobby at the Millennium bustles with activity. The Premier is serene. There is no front desk, just two desks where the front desk staff checks you in. It feels like a discreet private club. When I arrived I had a short wait, so I sat on a sofa and had some water with lemon (there is a supply kept handy in the lobby to refresh weary guests). My check-in was quick, and I had a pleasant conversation with the agent. My room was on he tenth floor, immediately adjacent to the elevator. I worried that it might be noisy, but it was not. The room itself was spacious, with a small sectional, a comfortable bed and a desk. The bathroom was large, and it took me a day to realize that there was a separate shower hiding behind the bathroom door. There was a large display area for a piece of sculpture or a flower vase or something, but it was empty. It was just an odd detail in an otherwise fine room. Now, if I did gymnastics, I could see a slice of Times Square from the large windows in my room. The view was mostly typical New York, water towers and buildings, pleasing in its own way but not what I had been expecting for the weekend. I got over it fairly quickly because I was literally just a couple hundred steps from the action. The hotel itself continued to provide great service. In the evenings there is a complimentary wine reception on the mezzanine level, and there is a continental breakfast there in the mornings. All in all, this was a great stay close to the action of Broadway. Kudos all around.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed at Premier for four days and must say I could not be happier with the place.In the middle of the action - right at the Times Square, steps from most of the Broadway theaters, which means most of the NY attractions are just few minutes walk. This is a huge asset as traffic is a chaos day and night. The price is reasonable comparing to other places at that location.The stuff was friendly, the room was very modern and clean, spectacular view from the window. No street noise. Complimentary breakfast was a plus too.Was very happy with my stay - would definitely recommend.My next trip to NY will try to book a room at Premier again for sure.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here for 6 nights this past week for my first ever trip in NYC. First of all, this is a wonderful location if you want to be right in Times Square and close to a bunch of main attractions and subway stations. The first day we got there we were told to go to the "Premier" side and I was unsure whether that was an upgrade or not. We arrived around 10am but we were able to check in early which was nice. The check in counter staff wasn't super friendly and she seemed to want to rush us away from the counter. The room was nice and was always clean when we got back from a day of exploring. Overall the stay was ok. I think the thing that threw me off was the staff. They never really acknowledged that we were there or that we were guests. Never smiled or greeted us and didn't even say bye when we were leaving. If you stay here keep in mind that it's best if you want to be 30 seconds away from Times Square but you won't get decent service here. Next time I go to NYC I would probably spend my time at another hotel.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Very disappointed! We stayed here for several nights in August. Arrived early and told we had an upgrade to Millennium Premier Tower attached and to go to their check in desk. Others in our family group had rooms in main hotel and were told although they were early - before 4 pm check in time, they would have their room ready in about a half hour. They were very nice. The front desk in the 'upgraded' Premier were not helpful, indifferent and with a bad attitude. Despite being the only people there, we were brusquely told to 'come' back after 4, we were early. When we explained we had plans later and it would really help to check in before 4 they offered no help. I said don't you want our name so you know we are here and can assign a room they said no. I had to insist they check to be sure they had our name in their system because my confidence was rapidly fading. My wife went back and got a room assigned later - before 4 - but it was on the second floor and windows never got direct sunlight and overlooked low rooftops, mechanical equipment and fire escapes - lovely. Probably done intentionally I'm thinking. We had to call 5 times to get a toilet fixed that malfunctioned the second day we were there. There regular staff were nice - but Front Desk were horrible. I would NOT recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The central location for tourist, for the PRICE it is very well spent. Time Sq. metro, customer service was great, Monica was awesome. Its not like your typical front desk and service, the Breakfast is ok and the afternoon drinks and snacks. If the wife loves it will be back then...

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: My best friend & I were in NYC for the weekend & stayed here 1 night. From the moment we arrived (too early for standard check-in) to the moment we left, we were treated like royalty. Hector and Monique were so welcoming, courteous, professional and charming! They were able to check us in early, provided us with options for pre-theatre snacks & drinks, directed us towards stores we wanted to visit and helped us secure tickets to that evening's sold out performance of Hedwig.After an afternoon of shopping, we visited the mezzanine lounge for happy hour cocktails were pleasantly surprised with the display of crostini, grape leaves, cucumbers, tomatoes, feta and olives (so much better than pretzels & peanuts!). The continental breakfast the next morning offered pastries, cereal, hard boiled eggs, yogurt, fruit, bagels, coffee, espresso and fruit juice.The location is fabulous - you are right in Times Square and everything is so accessible. The room itself was spacious, impeccably clean and such a comfortable place to retreat to after a day of shopping as well as a night of partying.I would highly recommend staying here and will certainly book here again.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Me and my sister have just come back from a 8 night stay at The Premier Hotel. We have saved for many years to visit NYC and did not want to be disappointed after all the planning and dreaming about it. We booked with Expedia.There were a few hotels shortlisted but we settled on the Premier Hotel mainly because of the great Trip advisor reviews and we were not let down by the majority of them.We arrived on the 21st July around 1pm, we were greeted by a very friendly receptionist as checking in wasn't until 4pm she suggested we left our luggage and called the concierge (who was also very friendly) they both told us to enjoy the beautiful day and the shops :D.Checked in with a different receptionist at 4pm who was also very friendly (wish I could remember names)Once we arrived at our room we were pleasantly surprised at how spacious our room was. (We had paid a slight upgrade for a king size bed) Beds are amazingly comfy!!!We had a massive bed with space either side and a little seating area too that looked out onto the street that lead to Times Square (You could almost jump from the hotel to there).As we had been up since 3am we decided to take advantage on the free drinks hour and was amazed that you could also choose branded beer too, also there was an array of dips/olives/crackers/meats etc.At check in the receptionist advised us to have breakfast early so we went at 7.30am and were happy to find a good choice (baring in mind this is a free facility) Cereals, croissants, pastries, fresh fruit, bagels, cream cheese, hard boiled eggs, bread, juices and muffins. Staff were always friendly and cleared items straight away. When we went around 9 one day it was quite full of people and you may struggle to find a seat. We thought we wouldn't have the free breakfast often but we used it 5 times out of 8 as it was more convenient and what more didn't cost a thing apart from a little tip to the staff (which is optional)A little disappointing that we didn't get any milk in our room for Coffee even after requesting it but a good thing to remember is that you are welcome to get one from the machine at anytime and to be honest that is the only fault I can find with this hotel so not a major thing. (we made our own coffee up which seemed to taste better, press the cappuccino option once and then the milk option twice)Room was serviced everyday and was clean throughout our stay, clean towels even when we didn't need them changing. Lift was broke for a little while one day so we decided to take the stairs, I do not recommend this if you are on a higher floor like us as it was very hot and hard work, I'd just wait as it was only out around an hour.Also a thing to remember, if you can't assess the hotel through the normal entrance (locks after a certain time) then you can gain access from their sister hotel Millennium next door, we weren't told this but worked it our for ourselves when it was locked one evening.We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel and would definitely book it again if we can ever save up enough money to visit NYC again.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Very, very clean hotel I love to stay during the 4th of July . Best experience, my room was huge , bathroom very clean very modern . Location was the best . The best staff Ashraf was in dining area very nice and the rest of team . Great job
user_name:
Nehmat A
Salt Lake City, Utah

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: WOW!!!! What a total surprise. We book our Hotel on Expedia. When we arrived at the Millennium Broadway we were told to go to the back of the Hotel. That we had been booked in the Premier Tower. This place is amazing, large rooms, large bathroom, breakfast and evening reception with drinks and appetizers. I will book it again!!!!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Monique made our trip. I was there for business and brought wife and daughter for fun for her 13th birthday. Monique was able to get us in our room very early and treated my daughter like royalty giving us a terrific room as well as a special treat the next morning. I couldn't have asked for a better trip or experience for my daughter on her first visit to NYC. Hotel was great - room was big and clean and a half block to the heart of times square. Will definitely look to stay at this hotel on future NYC trips.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Room 2023.
