Big beautiful room, almost an apartment, corner window with great views on NY skyline and part of Time Square.$915 fro 3 nights end of July.Reception / Concierge (Hector) helpful, knowledgeable and efficient.Room has lots of space, double bed, desk and chair, settee TV and coffee table. Almost zero noise from the street.Big bright bathroom, full wall sized mirror, Full sized bath and separate shower. Good lighting.Coffee peculator, room safe, iron and ironing board, hair dryer (wire lot long enough to reach mirror).Efficient air conditioning (but very noisy). Good blackout curtains, but last bit of corner wont close due to fire sprinkler pipe. This means that room starts get light from dawn.Complimentary continental breakfast; cereal, fruit, juice, pastrys, coffee in an cafe setting.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I visit NYC often, but this was the first time I've stayed at the Premier. The attention to details and excellent customer service make this an outstanding choice if you want to stay near Times Square in a quiet and wonderful hotel.My room was large and immaculately clean. The bed was very comfortable, and there was a large HD flat screen TV. Each morning the complimentary breakfast was plentiful including good coffee or tea, juices, croissants, pastries, fresh fruit, granola, cereals, yogurt, hard boiled eggs, great NY bagels and cream cheese, breads for toast, and a wide variety of muffins. From 5-7 every evening there is complimentary wine, beer, sparkling water and soft drinks along with various appetizers like cheese and crackers, tea sandwiches, and salty snacks. After a busy day of sightseeing or if you are in town on business, it makes a nice way to wind down before a night on the town.Other amenities include a good fitness center next door, room service, and free wi-fi.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: My flight came in much earlier than expected and I reached the hotel by 11 am. Check in time was only at 4 pm. I didn't ask for any special help, but Liliana, the person at the front desk, was able to organize a room for me at 12.30 pm, which was awesome as I was pretty tired after my long flight. The rooms are large (for NYC standards), very spacious and quiet. Enjoying day 1 of my five day stay here, and it's employees like Liliana that make this place what it is. Highly recommended.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Just back from 5 days at the fantastic hotel. Extremely close to Times Square. Arrived early in morning but were provided with our rooms right away which were extremely clean and comfortable. Staff very friendly and helpful. Benefits of this hotel apart from location were the continental breakfast , W.I.F.I in all locations and the complimentary beer, wine and canapes every night between 5pm and 7pm. Would recommend this hotel to all friends.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I'm really glad I chose this hotel; the other 4/5* reviews are correct, it's a great little hotspot for exploring the city! Times Square is literally round the corner, so you're best placed for all the great sights. Both the Rockefeller centre and the Empire State are short walks away, along with a plethora of great little eateries. Try the deli across the street too, it has wonderful selection of fresh sandwiches and cakes. The staff at the hotel are very friendly and welcoming, there is space to store your luggage once you check out, as well as PCs that are free to use - we used these to print off our return flight boarding passes. Also, although I had read online that check-in was from 4pm the lady at the desk was more than happy for us to check in as soon as we arrived (around 3pm) which was a blessing as we had just come from a long haul flight and a subway ride all the way from JFK. Overall I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting NYC and I'd love to stay there again!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed in the Premier side and it was Awesome,very quite,Very helpful staff and great walking distance from train station Very close to Times Square,lots to see and do the double decker bus tour because great information on the cities and one takes you to Brooklyn bridge.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The location of this hotel is great, right off the major chaos that is the delightful and crazy Times Square. Larger rooms and an absolutely spacious bathroom with a wonderful bath tub that was enjoyed by a Californian on drought water rationing. Breakfast was adequate and a bit tasteless, if an item runs out that is it for the morning, it does extend to 10 a.m. though for late night theater goers. Wine reception had decent red wine and also small nibbles that disappeared quickly. Eating out is so expensive in NYC both were appreciated. If you are sensitive to noise be sure to pack a set of ear plugs as the rooms at the back of the hotel face out on a very noisy ventilation system for both hotels. After one sleepless night the ear plugs saved me. They did move my room to a location on a higher floor but the noise still persisted, but they were nice about the move. The decor is early vanilla but it is clean if a bit worn. The front desk really functions as an ad hoc check in area and little else, all the real business is taken care of by the Millennium Hotel next door, including rustling up a taxi for us on our last day. The toilet in my room ran and I did ask the front desk and then housekeeping to fix it two times but it was never fixed so I gave up. That is a minor lack of service but all in all an enjoyable stay.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: My husband is a Pilot, and we travel frequently for business and pleasure. I have never written a review, but after staying at the Premier Hotel in NY for 3 nights, I felt I had to! We arrived to the hotel at around noon, exhausted from our travels from Canada with our bags and 13 week old son in tow. Monique was working the front desk, and was so nice and accommodating. After no more than a 5 minute wait, she checked us in so we could put the baby down for a nap and ensured that we had a room with a slight view at the back of the hotel (quiet for baby!). We were so pleasantly surprised upon entering our room - so spacious, so clean! The room had a queen size bed, couch, and lots of space. The bathroom was equipped with both a tub, and separate shower. There was also a small foyer to the right of the entrance where the closet was located and was a perfect place to store our stroller. A big bonus for us was that continental breakfast was provided every morning. Any one with a baby knows it's hard to get going in the morning, and it was so easy to go downstairs and enjoy a nice, quick breakfast before getting ready. The breakfast was lovely! Cereal, granola, pastries (muffins, cinnamon buns, danishes), yogurt, fresh fruit, toast, coffee and juices. The breakfast is served in a very clean, common seating area with couches and chairs. We met a lot of nice people, and had some great conversations while seated. Finding a seat was never a problem. Another bonus was happy hour between 5-7pm. In past travels, we've never been able to take advantage of happy hour, but we found ourselves back with the baby freshening up. Happy hour is located in the same area as breakfast, however they play soft music and dim the lights. They offer red and white wines, beer and a very nice spread of crackers, cheese, cold cuts and so on. It was really nice to sit back and enjoy a drink away from the hustle and bustle. Now, the best part of this hotel. The LOCATION. It is steps away from Time Square. It's a 20 minute walk from the Empire State Building, the Pier (Intrepid), a 10 minute walk from Fifth Avenue-Madison shopping, Rockefeller Center and so on. It really couldn't be any better - especially for its reasonable price! The staff (Monique, Kevin) were so friendly and accommodating. We were really sad we had to go...but, we'll definitely be back!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I surprised my husband with a weekend getaway for 2 to Manhattan. I decided on the Premier Hotel as it was close to Time Square and the price was very affordable, and it was worth it! We were only 1 block from Time Square (by Toys-R-Us). The room was very spacious considering the other hotel I've stayed at in Manhattan. The room featured a tub and shower, queen size (very comfortable) bed and all the other amenities you get in a normal hotel room. I could see the New Year's Eve ball from my hotel room. The hotel staff was very helpful and answered any questions we had about sites, shops and transportation in the city. My husband was very impressed with the location of the hotel as we could walk to many attractions near by. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone for your next trip into the city. I am ready to go back and I just left.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Great location right in the heart of Times Square. Perfect for business and pleasure. The room was very comfortable except for the view. My window looked right into the windows of an office building. But what do you expect in Manhattan. Hotel staff was very friendly. During cocktail hour (free beers), Carlos sparked up some great conversation with my group and I. Late at night upon arrival back at the hotel, Kevin and I had some good conversations about basketball (he's a Lebron hater). Overall, The Premier provided a great experience during my business stay.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Felt compelled to write a review for The Premier Hotel after trawling this site for hours to find the right place to stay in NYC. So much choice - but I would recommend this one to anyone.We stayed for 5 nights and wanted to be close to Times Square and a subway. Location was perfect. 30 second walk from the hustle and bustle of Times Square. We were on the 17th floor with a great view of the famous Times Square 'ball' and couldn't hear any street noise whatsoever.Reception layout is a bit strange and there's no bell - so it took a few minutes before being seen to but once we did Monique was very helpful and friendly giving us a room with a view. Arrived 2 hours before check in but were able to get in our room straight away.After reading so much about NYC hotel rooms being small I was amazed when we entered a huge room with a two seater sofa, coffee table, wardrobe, drink station etc as well as a queen bed. Bathroom also very large with a great shower. All very clean and maids did a great service every day. Bed was comfortable, pillows a bit too high for our liking but after walking around the city we were so tired it made no difference to a great night's sleep. Air con was great and easily controllable. Wi-Fi perfect for whole stay throughout hotel. Never waited more than 30 seconds for the lift.Breakfast was lovely, continental as stated and the fresh fruit was a welcome start to the day for us as we ate typical American fare for our other meals so at least this balanced it out a little!The drinks and snacks on the Mezzanine floor between 5 and 7pm were a great touch, the only downside was the terrible lounge music over the speakers which was so bad but we just took the drinks up to our room instead.This was a great base for us and was very close to Rockafeller Centre (10 mins walk), Central Park/Macy's/Empire State/Grand Central Station all within 15-20 min walk and easily accessible. Got us a taxi within minutes for our trip back to the airport - which was $75 including tip in a comfortable car.Would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in NYC and wanting to be close to a lot of the Midtown sights!Thanks for helping to make our trip so special.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here for two nights on our first trip to Manhattan. The location was awesome. Less than two blocks from Times Square and close to the subway. We got there really early in the morning and they let us leave our bags before check in, no problem. We came back later to check in and the king bed we were promised wasn't available so they offered to transfer us to the Millennium hotel next door, or have a queen the first night and then move us to a king the second night. We opted for the latter option since we wanted to stay in the newer hotel, and take advantage of the free breakfast and happy hours The Premier offered. Kevin could NOT have been any nicer or more helpful. He was awesome. He made notes in the computer so we could explain the situation the next morning and when we tried, the girl at the front desk was not very helpful. We had packed up our bags and left them in the first room like we were told, so they would be moved to a king room by the time we got back. That didn't happen, but thankfully Kevin was at the front desk when we got back and he took care of it right away. He gave us an awesome room with a view of Times Square and wanted to make sure we were taken care of since we were 'such nice people.' The rooms were clean and the bathrooms were nice with great water pressure in the shower. It needs more outlets that aren't hidden though. And you have to call room service to get ice, but they bring it up quickly, albeit just in a plastic bag. The breakfast was definitely a nice perk - pastries, bagels, cereal, yogurts, lots of fruit, coffee, orange and grapefruit juice and hard boiled eggs. Oatmeal or something hot like that seems like a nice easy addition for folks to add some more protein but it's free, and you can take it back to your room, so there's nothing to complain about. We only took advantage of the happy hour once due to our plans but it was nice that it's free. White or red wine and some beer. Some people have said the room is too small to eat or drink in, but there were plenty of seats and it wasn't crammed, so I'm not sure what they mean. You won't be disappointed if you stay here!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Our booking from the Millenium was upgraded to the Premier Hotel upon our late evening arrival. BUT we had booked a King room at the Millenium and ended up in a Queen room at the Premier, a supposedly "better" facility. The room was relatively small, thank goodness the suitcases actually fit under the bed or it would have been a very cramped space indeed. BUT our room looked right out onto a section of Times Square and I could take a photo of the big crystal ball right out my window. The facilities were clean and tidy BUT when we came back one evening of our four night stay the room was untouched. A trip back downstairs was met with a chilly "we'll get on to it when we can" response without a hint of apology.The night we checked in the desk clerk/manager was a sweetie. He could not have been more friendly and helpful, with good advice about travelling around, etc. BUT other nights a woman on duty was as unfriendly as it is possible to be. The Premier included breakfast and also happy hour. BUT breakfast was supposed to have been included in our I Love New York package originally purchased which included the King bed room. Breakfast....well, there were danish, toast, fruit, cereals, all the usual suspects...BUT a coffee machine that produced just about the worst coffee I have ever tasted. The seating arrangements meant guests often had no place to sit, cleaning up of the area was haphazard at best and non-existent most of the time and the staff seemed to spend the entire six days we were there in deep discussion trying to figure out how to reorganise the set up to make it less convenient. Each morning three of four staff would appear, consulting and gesturing about moving the tiered tray of pastries here or a bowl of boiled eggs there, while the milk ran out, the hot water ran dry and the queues for the toaster mounted. Also amusing and worth watching was happy hour. Red and White wine and beer were available and staff attitudes varied from social to oblivious. Sometimes there were nibbles, cheese, even cold cuts. Other days pretzels and that was it and even those ran out. Time wasn't a factor, but we never worked out quite what the criteria was for what was served or when. There is a two-computer and one printer business centre off the breakfast/happy hour room with free internet and printing. Final assessment. Shop for the best rates and go for a good location. If you want to be right on Times Square, and you plan to be out most of the time, you are looking for a fast and simple breakfast, and you anticipate being back and would like a glass of wine after a long day of sightseeing (between 5-7pm), this is the place for you. Check on special rates and specials in general. The room is small, but then apparently so are most hotel rooms in NYC. You can probably do better, but you could certainly do a lot worse. Would we stay again? I'd check other options, but depending on the rates would stay again because of the great location, right on Times Square and very convenient to the subway. But I think's I'd go for the king room at the Millenium rather than the Queen version at the Premium.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: My husband and I stayed 5 nights at the premier, the check in was warm quick and easy and the room was just fantastic, really quite specious with amazing views of the ball drop (times square) through the floor to ceiling windows! Sofa in the room was a nice touch to lounge on after a long day site seeing! large bathroom with separate shower and bath, slippers bath robe and umbrella also provided. Breakfast was fine bagels muffins cereal and always fresh fruit was a perfect start to the day, although sometimes hard to find a space to sit we just took a coffee and muffin up to the room and that was fine with us. The afternoon wine and beer served for 2 hours was heaven sent perfect pick me up and chance to relax after busy days sight seeing great ambiance and the snacks where just lovely! Also to mention the free WIFI which was super fast and available in the room, all in all a perfect stay was had util it was time to check out, we had the misfortune of having to deal with Monique who was quite patronising when we asked about getting a cab to take us to the airport later that day she said that we would struggle to get a taxi at the time we wanted to go as it would be close to rush hour and she couldn't guarantee that we would get one and how there where a lack of Taxi cabs in NYC so all day i was worried about the cab and getting back to the airport due to being ill informed by Monique! when we came back to leave we dealt with someone different and it couldn't have been a more helpful gentleman (I'm only sorry I didn't get his name, as he truly deserves some recognition for his fantastic customer service)! The hotel have there own cars to take guests back to the airport a little bit more expensive but much nicer than a NYC taxi! if only we were told this by Monique earlier that morning our last day would have been enjoyable without any stress or worry, just such a shame that one persons negative and unhelpful attitude can effect someone else's day! Thank you to all the staff who made our stay so lovely.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Right next to Times Square and the subway. What else do you want from a NYC hotel? How about a clean, spacious, quiet room. Check! Now add in free breakfast and afternoon reception with wine and beer. It's all there. Book it now.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: What a lovely hotel. We stayed for 3 nights in the premier section.It was immaculate - very clean, really tidy and in the best location - just off Times Square. The room we had was big and clean and the bathroom was nice.The only thing that lets this down is the breakfast - a really small continental breakfast that actually only included sliced bread, jams and pastries - no cheese, ham etc.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I have been staying at The Premier Hotel since 2007 and would not stay anywhere else. Monique Madison and Hector Garcia have welcomed my family and me each time we have visited. I cannot imagine coming to the hotel and not seeing them. Their kindness and courtesy are such assets. Thank you very much for making us always feel special! Katherine Carr

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Good find at a good price for New York City Center. The front desk staff ,in particular, Monique was fantastic. Always ready to assist and we never felt rushed. She made us feel welcome . The rooms were comfortable, well appointed and modern and spacious. Excellent Continental Breakfast was included. Close proximity to World Famous 'JUNIORS CHEESECAKE RESTAURANT and Time Square and Theater District.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed for 5 days in the Premier and found it an ideal spot, just round the corner from Times Square and in the heart of the theatre district. The room was pleasant and the bed was comfortable. The room evan had a comfortable sofa, a rarity in most hotels. The staff were helpful, especially the guy who gets you a cab at the front door. Monique at the front desk was just brilliant. We would stay there again. Free wi-fi.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: How often do you take a vacation and, within 24 hours, find yourselves on a first-name basis with 7 of the hotel staff members? If you were to answer honestly, the answer would be "infrequently." Add NYC as the destination, and the answer would probably be "never." Well, my husband and I recently traveled to the Big Apple to celebrate our 20th anniversary. Our great fortune was to be welcomed by the incomparable staff of The Premier, on W. 44th St., to toast 20 + years of memories and be given an opportunity to create some fabulous new ones. The Premier has many attributes: 1.) It's located less than 1/2 block from Times Square. 2.) It's an easy walk to all of Broadway's theatrical productions, 5th Ave. shopping,  and Central Park's vast, green space. 3.) Gray Line's sight-seeing options can be purchased on 7th Ave., about a 5-min. walk from the hotel lobby. 4.) Accommodations are modern, clean, and spacious. Breakfast is ample, fresh, and well-presented. The cocktail hour (5-7) offers tasty appetizers and unlimited wine, beer, and/or soft drinks. Great time & place to mingle or relax. 5.) The staff is first-rate! - Hector, the manager, was delightful. We expected professionalism, of course,  but his Latin heritage colored all of our interactions with tremendous warmth  and humor. - Monique, an attractive and charismatic concierge, would be reason enough to return to The Premier. She even graciously escorted us to our departing  shuttle. - Carlos was frequently our host for breakfast and early evening wine-toasting. His friendliness and attention to detail allowed us to feel far- removed from the hustle and bustle of the city streets. - Raymond and Jenny, high-tech skills at the ready, went above and beyond to  assure we were able to access tour vouchers which were purchased on- line  prior to the trip. - Dixon and Carlos (a fellow Peruvian like my husband) were present for a few of of the breakfasts and cocktail hours we attended, as well. Both were engaging, attentive, and professional. Should we ever choose to make NYC our vacation destination again, we will make every effort to return to The Premier, as well. We've been recommending the hotel to family and friends since returning home to Michigan. Hey, its name says it all!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We wanted a central hotel for our first visit to New York. The hotel suited perfectly, as it is just off Times Square close to major shops, restaurants and attractions. Despite being close to busy Times Square it was quiet at night and we slept really well. The staff were polite and friendly and Monique the receptionist was particularly helpful with a warm welcome for us and lots of visitor advice for us during our stay. The happy hour each evening was very welcome after a busy day around the city. Although the breakfast is a casual buffet style it was very satisfying including fresh fruit and juices each morning. We would be very happy to return to the hotel.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: My parents and aunts booked a special trip at the Premier and from the second they arrived at the hotel, all staff were incredibly friendly, helpful and courteous. One that stood out was Monique - nothing was too much trouble for her and she greeted us in a sincere manner every time we passed through reception. She really made the stay extra pleasant! Monique is a real asset to the property.The breakfast and evening happy hour were an added bonus. Once again, all staff in the mezzanine area were incredibly accommodating and friendly. House-keeping was thorough and rooms were well-appointed. The door staff were also extremely helpful and nothing was too much trouble.Would highly recommend this property for a stay in NYC if you like to be close to the action. From my perspective, what sets this property apart from others I have stayed in in the area is the staff. Special mention to Monique but thanks to all.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: My husband and I booked the premier for the first week of June, based on the reviews we saw on trip advisor. We were completely blown away by the staff at the hotel. Every employee went above and beyond the call of duty to ensure our stay was great. The staff at the reception were very kind and helpful! Although (as some reviews mentioned) it is a boutique hotel and the staff may have been limited for check-in, we never once had to wait to ask direction or check in/out. In fact, we showed up about 5 hours before check-in and were greeted with a smile and checked in immediately. The housekeeping staff were also 100% on their game. We would leave to head down for breakfast, and without fail, our room would be clean everytime before we came back. The fresh robes and slippers were also a nice touch! The free cocktail hour and continental breakfast was also fantastic! There was a very good selection for breakfast given it was a continental breakfast (pastries, toast, bagles, muffins, cereal, boiled eggs, fresh fruit...juices...espresso, cappuccino, tea...). We never once left hungry. The cocktail hour was amazing! Dixon went ABOVE AND BEYOND to ensure we always had enough to eat, and make sure our glasses NEVER ran dry. He treated us like friends, offering up great stories, and suggestions of what to see and do. Dixon certainly gained our vote for the hotel. We will absolutely reccoment the Premier hotel to friends and be booking it next time we are in NYC. Thanks for the amazing service Dixon!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I was going to write how positive my experience was at the hotel. Its close to times square and all the Broadway shows and restaurants. They have daily breakfasts and happy hour with snacks. The hotel has a comfortable sofa and flat panel television. The internet works fine. On the molding behind my sink was very black mold. The shower works fine. However, a few days after I left the hotel they charge my credit card for 671 dollars for absolutely nothing. I called them and they promised to refunded it back. I am waiting. If you take consumer credit cards and then decide to bill them after the fact, why should any consumer choice to stay there.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: From arrival Monique on reception made our New York visit one to remember, she was courteous, helpful and a accomading in every aspect , nothing was to much bother, her smiling welcoming manner was a asset to the hotel. Will defiently go back.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed at this hotel from June 13-June 15. We loved the location a half-block from 7th so we were close to all the action but didn't hear a lot of the street noise from the room. The room was a nice size for NYC standards. The shower could have been a little bigger, perhaps if they didn't bath tub. They offer free continental breakfast which included hardboiled eggs, cereals, muffins and breakfast pastries. They also had coffee and juices. It is a boutique hotel so with that, there are not a lot of staff members to assist with check-in or check-out so you could experience a wait depending on time of day. All in all, I would recommend this hotel to others and would stay there again.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I got this room at a great price about a month beforehand. The hotel was a little hard to find from the street, as there is not a large sign noting what hotel it is. But once you enter, the lobby is bright and clean. The man who checked us in, Kevin, was extremely friendly. The only complaint I have about reception is that they have combined reception/concierge, and seemed to only have one person working there at any time. So in order to check, I had to wait for the concierge to finish giving recommendations to European tourist couples- while I was trying to head out the door to the meeting.The rooms themselves were quite large for NYC Times Square! The décor has a modern feel to it, without being over the top. The hardware in the bathroom was a bit outdated, but worked just fine. The bathroom was also quite spacious, with both a tub and a shower, and plenty of room to dry off. It was a rainy, cool evening, so I was glad to see a robe to be able to lounge in before bed. I was also glad to see thick curtains to block out with bright flashing lights of Times Square. The only complaint about the bedroom is that there was no outlet by the bed, so I had to charge my phone across the room in an odd corner.Overall, it was a short, but great stay!
user_name:
Meg M
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I've stayed at The Premier Hotel over 50+ nights per year for 10 years. It's a smaller, boutique hotel focused more on business travelers, as compared to the adjacent Millennium Broadway, a massive, very crowded tourist hotel. The rooms are very large with king size beds. I've been very impressed by the friendly, helpful staff: concierges, bell men, and room service personnel. All concierges (Monique, Viviana, Ramona, Hector, Kevin, and Veronica) are excellent, but the best of the group is Monique -- always cheerful (greeting guests by name), always helpful, always conscientious, superb in every aspect. I highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Very rude staff specially Monique from front desk ..small beds ,bad food ....if u want to stay in time square stay at any of the near by hotels like Marriott or Hilton or even the Premier's sister hotel The millenium for the same price

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The premier hotel is is connected with the millennium Hotel group it is the perfect Tower lovely rooms with a large king-size bed a little sitting area a large bathroom breakfast was included when we stayed they even had Time in afternoon for appetizers and drinks It's location is a half a block off the main street I lovely location and great staff

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The entrance to the Premier Hotel New York is somewhat modest so at first we were unsure we’d been delivered to the right place. However, once through the revolving doors and into the small lobby, our reception was welcoming and check-in swift and efficient. We had arrived early from a long flight so it was a huge relief to learn that our request for an early check-in was not a problem. The rooms are simple in style, clean, quite spacious (enough to include a couch, desk and extra chair), boast floor to ceiling windows, and very importantly the bed is extremely comfortable! Many rooms have views, and ours overlooked the street - yet although in such close proximity to Times Square there was no noise from either traffic or late night revellers.All guests are able to enjoy breakfast in the lounge on the mezzanine floor, as well as evening hors d’oeuvres and cocktails. The lounge is small so when the hotel is full it can be difficult to get a seat, but most of the time this is overcome by sharing tables and vacating them swiftly for others when finished. The breakfast was more than sufficient, with bagels, juice, bread and pastries, cereals, yoghurt, boiled eggs and a selection of fruit. The various evening snacks included such items as fresh asparagus spears, tomato with mozzarella, crisp bread and dips of tzatziki and hummus, to name a few. To be able to begin each day with this hearty breakfast and then to return for a relaxing break for pre-dinner drinks and snacks prior to going out for the evening was a huge plus. The location of this hotel is excellent, not only for exploring the immediate theatre district and finding a plethora of nearby restaurants and bars, but also within easy walking distance of Central Station, the Rockefeller Centre, Fifth Avenue and other popular attractions. The team here was very friendly and helpful – our sincere thanks go to Lidia in Reservations who kindly arranged our early check-in, as this made such an enormous difference to our first day! Also to Viviana and Monique for their relaxed friendliness and efficiency, and to Dixon, Carlos and Acharaf in the lounge, who always wore welcoming smiles, were proactive, made time to say hello, and were simply charming! Finally, our extra special thanks to Patrick for his outstanding, genuine personal service! When advising us in thorough detail about our intended exploration of Chelsea, Soho and Greenwich on foot, he went far and beyond the normal call of duty, and in our opinion is a great asset to the company!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Firstly, the staff at the Premier hotel were very friendly! We were upgraded free of charge, which really set the holiday off to a good start. We were in a kingsized room which looked on to Times Square. The staff at the front desk were always very helpful in helping us find what we were looking for, making reservations for us or recommending places to eat.My only complaint, and it's not a big one, is that the complimentary breakfast was served in a fairly small area for the number of guests that the hotel accommodates so we opted to use a diner further down the road on 5 of our 7 days as we felt we had to rush our breakfast. I would happily return to the Premier Hotel!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: You won't believe this story. A beautiful property in a wonderful location marred by the worst guest relations I have ever experienced. Upon returning from the theater at midnight we found ourselves locked out (yes, imagine?) of the hotel. No sign or note on the door to tell us how to gain access. There's one entrance and there is no employee visible from the outside street. Mind you, we spent $300 for the night and WE ARE LOCKED OUT. After pounding on the glass window a woman desk clerk came into view and waved to us, indicating that we should go down the street. Huh? Really? She's inside, we're outside, she's NOT LETTING US IN.We went looking in the direction she had pointed to, found a theater next door, tried the door and it was locked. We returned to the hotel window and knocked on the glass again. She once again waved down the street. REALLY?We went two more doors down the street, found that there is a sister hotel with an unmarked corridor that leads to our hotel, and we arrive into the lobby very annoyed. We expressed our utter disbelief that this was a normal procedure for a $300/night hotel. We asked to see a manager. Do you want to venture a guess who the desk clerk called? Two large and threatening security guards. How could this be happening??? While we were standing there asking to see a manager, the goon security guards proceeded to let other returning guests in the door that we had been denied access to. All while the desk clerk maintained that she is NOT ALLOWED TO LET PEOPLE IN THROUGH THE FRONT DOOR AT THIS HOUR OF THE EVENING. Wha??????? I told one of the guards that I didn't appreciate his threatening demeanor and he countered with "do you feel threatened?" Gee, let me see. Two brawny guys respond to the desk clerk's phone call and there is no attempt to locate a manager. Perhaps I am easily threatened. What do you think?I would not recommend this hotel to my worst enemy.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: If you want to be close to Times Square, this is a great place. I usually like to stay downtown but my conference was in Times Square so i decided to stay closer so I could walk. Times Square is a mad house but the hotel was quiet and clean with nice sized rooms. Great irish pub across the street.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I stayed at the Premier for 6 nights in a business/leisure trip to NYC. While booking, it is presented a a "sister" hotel to the Millenium Broadway Hotel with a more upscale concept. I believe it boasts a 4.5 star rating, but I saw mixed reviews on TA but decided to book anyway as they were advertising a 15% room rate discount promo. Pros: -The rooms are spacious and nicely appointed. - Location is excellent just off Times Square- Happy hour between 5-7pm on mezzanine floor with free drinks and snacks. Cons: - Expect NO service. The whole idea of staying at a luxury hotel is not just the room and location, but the staff and service. -Upon check in, I was rushed through, which is fine, but the demeanor of the staff is as if you're at the Tax Office or a busy KFC restaurant. No one helped me with my luggage (solo female traveller). I was given the key and a perfunctory overview of breakfast timings. - Housekeeping was terrible. Many times I had to physically hand my full trash can to the lady who was in charge of my floor to empty them after she had cleaned my room. - No one greets you at the door and reception staff just looks defensive and as you walk by to the elevators heading to your room. - I had requested late check out which I didn't get as the hotel was sold out. Fair enough. But when the hotel car arrived to pick me up and I needed to get my luggage out of storage, Monique at the desk informed me that the bell boy was on break and "you should have had your claim tickets out sooner!" I didn't understand this. I am not in kindergarten to be admonished like this. I informed her that I thought this was a luxury hotel and had assumed there would be a bell boy to help me. Anyway, I had to lug my stuff to the curb myself in the pouring rain. I would never stay here again and would recommend the Millenium Broadway next door which has a bustling lobby, doormen, bell boys galore, a smiling staff.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We were booked into this hotel & on arrival found we had been up-graded to the Premier hotel, part of the same hotel ! Situated 5 mins from Time Square, great value, Happy hour between 5pm & 7pm also Free breakfast served on a mezzanine floor, Ideal venue for exploring N/Y. We had a day with a "Big Apple Greeter", this is a voluntary organisation, found on the Internet, who provided us with a guide to take us around the city! We also recommend the Hop on Hop off Bus!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Just stayed at this hotel on a recent trip to New York and was very impressed. We arrived at 9:00 a.m. after a red eye flight expecting to just check our luggage for the day but they let us check into a room right away which was a very pleasant surprise and very much appreciated. The room was very spacious for New York standards. It had plenty of room for a couch & coffee table, a desk and a good size entranceway with another built in desk for a coffee machine & large closet. Bathroom was a good size with a separate tub & shower. We also requested a small fridge as we read other reviews prior to booking and this was delivered with no extra charge. One of the reasons we chose this Hotel was that it included a continental breakfast which was very convenient. My only comment here is that they might consider adding hot oatmeal. Access was available to the lounge all day with coffee/tea. Happy hour was also included daily with a great selection of snacks and unlimited wine which was really appreciated after a long day of sightseeing. The room was clean & the staff very helpful. Being only half a block off Times Square you would expect to hear some noise but this was a non-issue. Would definitely stay here on any future visits to New York and have already recommended to numerous friends/family.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Great room, superb service. Amenities were also fantastic. The front desk was most accommodating and friendly. Especially liked the snacks and drinks from 4-6. I will definitely stay here again and will highly recommend it.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: first time in NY, we had heard of the very small hotel rooms. However, we couldn't have been more pleased and delighted with our hotel/room! We were on the 18th floor which was quiet. Not much to see out the window, but didn't care! Very nice amenities. 1/2 block from Times Square....perfect for all the walking we did. Check in desk consisted of one desk and one clerk, but we were able to check in and out quickly. Clerk also assisted in tickets and advice.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I attempted to get rooms at the Millennium for this Memorial Day weekend but the prices were prohibitive. Through Priceline I was able to get a lovely room at The Premier Hotel Times Square which it turns out is a separate small hotel owned by the Millennium. We arrived early and Monique at the reception desk was very professional and efficient. We were assigned a king size room without much of a wait. Not knowing what to expect we were pleasantly surprised to find a spacious, clean room with all the amenities except a refrigerator. Not a problem. The breakfast area is small but continental breakfast is more than adequate and at 5 pm they offer a happy hour and complementary hor d'oeurves. We were on the 11th floor but suggest you request a room on a higher floor. The hotel is perfectly situated for exploring NYC by subway, bus or taxi. We would definately stay here again. Kudos to a very professional and welcoming staff.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here over Memorial Day weekend for a conference in a nearby hotel in Times Sq. We originally booked at the main Millenium hotel but they were overbooked and they put us in the next door affiliated tower "The Premier" (seems like a good upgrade). The rooms here were very chic and spacious, with a marble bathroom, velvet couch and huge floor-to-ceiling windows looking out to the "ball" in Times Square. Rooms were super quiet and clean. Free and super fast wi-fi. Excellent menu and service at the lobby restaurant Charlotte. Only 6 rooms on each floor at the Premier tower, so quiet, but no ice machines and no fridges, so plan accordingly. Excellent breakfast area with lounge on mezzanine, great assortment of items to fuel up for the day, nice/friendly staff downstairs in lobby, overall a very positive experience.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We went on a NYC getaway weekend and stayed at this boutique hotel. Wow...what a location. Just a a short walk to Times Square. It is a quiet place to stay with a very professional and welcoming staff. Hector at the main desk was very nice and certainly happy to help the guests. The hotel offers a continental breakfast which was full with fresh fruit, pastries, breads, cereals, juices, coffees. Arschaff (forgive my spelling) greeted everyone with a smile and kept the Buffet fresh and full of food and very clean for both breakfast and happy hour. The happy hour was perfect as well. The hotel rooms are very clean and nicely appointed. This hotel is truly worth the price. Would absolutely come back again.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We had a very nice King room on the 19th floor overlooking the "Ball Drop" on Times Square. Room was spacious and quiet. Great location - we walked to all shows and restaurants. It is part of the Millennium but is separated by a theater and has a separate front desk and bell staff. The staff are very pleasant but since there aren't that many rooms, the amount of staff is minimal at times. At 10:00pm at night the lobby was unmanned which is a little unnerving since you are ½ block from Time Square. We felt safe in the rooms because you can't use the elevator without a room key, but when we walked in one night there were a couple of rough looking characters just walking out of the lobby. Any of the service you might require apparently has to come from the Millennium which is unsatisfactory. We asked for ice for our room (you can't get your own) and had to wait 20-30 minutes, usually with a second call. That was true for any request for service. They have a complementary evening cocktail and morning continental breakfast which is one of the reasons we picked them. It was very nice and manned by pleasant staff, but seating is limited. They had very nice hors d'oeuvres but it seems that once they ran out they were not set up to refill (because food had to come from the Millennium). The breakfast/cocktail offering at the Casablanca one street over is far superior and they stock all day and late evening treats.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Hubby and I have just returned from a 5 night break at this hotel. It was arranged as a surprise 40th birthday treat for me and we weren't disappointed. Perfectly located, just a minutes walk away from Times Square but surprisingly quiet considering the location. The rooms were clean and a good size, bed was comfy but hot water was limited at times, however this didn't bother us too much as there was a mini heatwave while we were there!I would definitely recommend to others.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Tucked next to the millennium Broadway this adjunct hotel is top notch. My room, 625 overlooked the famous Times Square ball drop. With huge windows that you can open at the bottom ( and feel less claustrophic and actually here the sounds of NYC) this room was worth the upgrade. The complimentary happy hours and breakfast saved a great deal and was most convenient.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here from Thursday till Monday, everything is fantastic. The room we had was huge and we only paid for a standard room. The breakfast was great, only continental but was fine for us. The happy hour between 5-7 is also an added bonus and we made full use of this, they also put on a few nibbles to eat. Location is on a quiet street and if you walk round the corner Times Square is right there. Also very centrally located for All other NY attractions. Would definitely recommend.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Centrally located, large rooms, very clean and above all, the staff. Easy check in, responsive, smiley. Monique at the front desk was helpful, kind and ward. late check out was not an issue. Breakfast can be slightly improved.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: My husband and I stayed at the Premier Hotel for a weekend away without our kids! We could not have been happier with our stay! We had a great view of the New Year's Eve ball from Times Square. The room was larger than I had expected, especially the bathroom. The location is absolutely ideal. And you cannot beat the price! The staff were wonderful. Extremely polite and always inquiring about our stay and if we needed anything, particularly Hector and Kevin. My only complaint was that our room was warmer then I would have liked. However, I never called the front desk about this as it was tolerable. I will definitely return to this hotel in the future!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here for 7 nights and we could not fault anything about the hotel expect they dont have a bar to relax in at night but that wouldnt stop us from recommending the hotel or returning to stay, the hotel is very clean, beautiful big bedrooms and bathrooms. The staff were helpful and very pleasent. couldnt ask for a better location..

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Upon arrival to the hotel, we were pleasantly greeted by Monique, the front desk lady in charge. She quickly arranged for our room, and in 5 minutes we were in our rooms. After a long 20 hour flight, this is a very welcome speed of service.Whenever we see monique, she would ask if we need anything that she can help us with. She asks with a smile, which felt that she is sincere in being of service to the guests.I left an expensive watch on the day i left for the airport. Fortunately, monique was on duty and she took care of finding the watch, and ensuring its safekeeping. The house keeping services should be equally commended for their honesty as well.Monique was off duty, but she continuously updated me on where my watch is. There is an unfortunate incident though when it was made clear that my sister would be able to pick up the watch, but the hotel didn't want to release it. However, monique is helping me handle the release even if she is off duty.In staying in a hotel, the honesty of its staff and the sincerity to be of service, is more important for me than the "bells and whistles" that a hotel offers. usually, you just stay in the hotel to rest and go about your day. It is important that your personal belongings are safe while you are out and when you get back, the staff pleasantly helps you on your needs.Premier Hotel provided me with that safety and world class service.Will definitely go back.- Walter

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed in this hotel 30.12-01.01. It was most acceptable prices in Manhattan for new year eve. Close to Times Square. We arrived very late (2.00 am) and were a bit confused when saw closed entrance door )))) what to do??? But after staff appeared and we got our room - 21 floor next to elevator. Room is big ! Has sleeping and living areas. Fast wifi. Free breakfasts (real New Yorker style))) in m floor. Staff was nice - preventive and friendly! Special thanks to mr Kevin - he helped us in the early morning on 01.01 with luggage and taxi))) ordered dinner in room from hotel restaurant - non forgettable steak!!! Will visit again !!!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Location is great, just meters from Times Square, but away from Times Square noise.Rooms are great, quite spacious (as opposed to most of the hotels in the area).Nice and friendly staff. Good breakfast. Will keep coming!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: After scouring the internet for the best value hotel I came across the Premier Hotel and it was ideal for our trip. Located just off Times Square (about a 30 second walk to the bright lights) but at the same time down a side street so no noise or lights through the window. The staff on the front desk were great - friendly and helpful. Hector who works the front desk was fantastic. Our room was perfect, 14th floor with a view of the New Year Times Square ball. We preferred this hotel to its much bigger sister hotel the Millennium next door as it felt far more personal. Complimentary food and drinks every day between 17.00hrs and 19.00hrs topped off what was a perfect stay in a very cold New York!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: A great hotel. Terrific location. Great value for money. Very helpful and friendly staff. Special mention of the staff at the Level M breakfast buffet/ happy hour. Also Monique on the front desk was terrific

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I was a guest at this hotel and first impression very clean and the door men were welcoming. It was prime location with from being out of town I really loved that. Sad to say the customer service level was awful. Monqiue who was at the front desk, was rude...unfriendly and frankly didn't make me feel welcome in the slightest. She was short, did not smile and didn't even advise me of the total of my stay, just to sign on the line. A few times I would go in and out of the hotel, she was at the desk and again no smile, no enjoy your day or evening, nothing. When I checked out, no thank you for your stay, looking forward to seeing you again, how was your time with us? Not one word, just a look up from her glasses a stare and a good bye. I am so beyond surprised. I personally would not ever go back to this hotel due to lack of customer service. I believe if you want to be in the hotel hospitality business it should be done willingly and with a SMILE. I do hope mgmnt addresses this with her and perhaps the next guest will feel a little more welcome.I will say , when we came back late night after an evening out after a show there was a lovely bubbly girl that GREETED us right away. I didn't catch her name but I wish she was the one who was representing you throughout the day and not on an evening shift. Monqiue should not be dealing with customers with her snarky attitude and frankly should be put on a night shift.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed for 5 nights in feb. Had various dealing with the concierge Gloria prior to my stay who organised a surprised for my wife's birthday. On checking in, Monique looked after us who was super helpful and nice throughout our stay. The rooms are very spacious. Great bathrooms. All very clean and comfortable. The free wifi and breakfasts were so good. Saves a lot of money and time. Location was perfect. Literally 10 seconds from the heart of Times Square. Right on the corner of toys r us. Out stay was perfect in every way.Massive thanks to both Gloria and Monique. Also our daily maid who was excellent and very friendly!!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: When checking in they only had one receptionist and he did a lot of things at the same time, serving a queue of customers and answering the phone, so it took a while until I was able to get up to my room. The room itself was actually very spacious, considering it being in the middle of Manhattan. I asked for a room higher up, didn' t get one. But I guess the view was okay from the fifth floor too. For some reason there's some space between the room door and the floor, so everytime people were talking in the hallway you could hear them loud and clear. I wonder if it worked the other way too...The staff was able to help me with issues, bathroom light didn't work at one point and they fixed it asap. The cleaners were a bit all over the place... One time I had a list in my room with all of the customers names on it. The one water bottle provided per day was awesome, although one day I didn' t get one. The complimentary drinks and snacks were amazing, I went to get them everyday. The space provided for them was a bit uncomfy especially in the mornings, it's a bit hard to eat your breakfast from your lap. Overall I do recommend the hotel for everyone.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I liked very much my stay at the Premier Hotel NY! An authentic boutique hotel, with wonderful attention from the staff (specially Monique, at the front desk) and a very good location.I arrived early in the morning at the hotel and Monique let me check in early, which was really very kind and helpful, after a 10 hours flight from Rio de Janeiro.The room was in a good shape, could be a little larger, with modern decoration and good bathroom.The coffeeshop is a little small, which sometimes caused lines in the morning, to get a sit.I hardly recommend!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: A less obvious choice of hotel. So much so our taxi driver hadn't even heard of it!?We booked our Christmas getaway just 72 hours prior to departure and got a great deal. We chose this hotel because of location and value for money. The hotel isn't anything special, but adequate and good size rooms for a central hotel. The room decor is a little bland, but we had a small lounge area, a Queen size bed which was firm, but comfortable and our bathroom had a walk in shower. We stayed in room 2022, which meant we had a great view of the city. the room has a safe, ironing board and iron, hair dryer and coffee machine. Our package included a free breakfast which you can get in the Mezzanine. The options available here were limited cereal choices, pastries, bagels and cold hard boiled eggs as well as tea, coffee and juices. We found the concept of the Mezz quite strange. I believe the hotel would have benefited from a properly equipped room where you could have breakfast. The seating is relaxed, therefore sunken chairs and sofas and small coffee tables which in my opinion is not an ideal environment for eating. The Mezz is also where you have your happy hour. Which includes limited wine and beer selections as well as tea and coffee, soft drinks and canapes. The selection of canapes depends on what day it is and how late you arrive. It was a nice touch that it was all "free" but I can't say we were exactly excited with the environment or selection on the couple of times we popped in. The hotel is fit for purpose, and if we want to stay in Times Square again we would reconsider it. Pros - Great location and clean. The bed is turned down every night, and the lady that did this is lovely and we were glad we were able to tip for this quaint service. Cons - One dressing gown, one bottle of water left daily in a double room!? House keeping was sometimes lacking, left a tip every day but sometimes wouldn't replenish the coffee/creamer and toiletries. We had a fridge in our room which was on but wasn't cold. So instead of fixing it, the door to the cabinet door that housed it was nailed shut! This wasn't so much of a problem for us, so we didn't complain.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Nice hotel, comfortable rooms, clean - housekeeping was excellent - staff attentive and helpfulVery centrally located and a nice walk from Broadway, MOMA, great shopping and restaurants, Rockefeller Center, Bryant Park, NY Library, etc.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I ordered and paid in advance for king size bed. NOT AVAILABLE. Saw e-mail from your company for queen bed. Their room rate $212 for 2 persons x7 nights approx $1500. We paid$3270 .that means you got $1770 for our coach seats from fl.and this was your special deal.no complaint with hotel.we feel that travelocity overcharged us and we would have been much better served if we had made our hotel and air reservations ourselves. Never again!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: My Wife and I have always dreamt of going to NYC together for Christmas and New Years. This year was the year for us and we made it happen. We found The Premier Hotel and it is literally in the heart of NYC. We flew a red eye from California and arrived at 6 AM. When we arrived at the hotel we were greeted by Kevin at the desk. He was so helpful for us and got us checked in early, which was so great after a 5 hour flight. Monique also helped get us checked in and the whole staff is so friendly, can't say enough about the hospitality, they really make you feel like family. Our room was clean and perfect for our stay, it has a coffee maker and they provide a bottle of water for the room each day as needed. One of the highlights of this hotel was that they have a continental style complimentary breakfast from 7-10 AM and a Happy Hour of sorts that serves beer/wine and appetizers from 5-7 PM. This was awesome! The best part of this hotel was it's location. It is next door to the sister hotel, Millennium Broadway hotel and had a great bar/lounge that served good food and we made friends with the bartender Alec and the staff was all very friendly. There are restaurants all over the area, it is 2 min walk to times square, Good Morning America, all theatres and bars and pubs. For New Years is was perfect as we were right at the center of the action! We loved NYC, but what made it so nice was staying somewhere that was so friendly and close to everything. The Premier provided that and then some, we will definitely return!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Reached there Christmas night and left the Monday after Christmas. From the beginning to the end the experience was fantastic.We had complimentary breakfast from seven to ten during the week days and seven to eleven on the weekend.There was also happy hour from five to seven pm.The hotel is in the heart of everything so we really did not need to use a taxi.We walked .The rooms were cleaned and linen was changed on a daily basis.The staff was friendly and very informative.I would definitely want to stay there again if ever I am visiting that part of the country again.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: New Years Eve 2014. My Girlfriend and I bused in from Boston. Arrived in NYC around 6pm. We figured we can check in drop our bags and use our confirmation as tickets to explore times square. I was wrong. Officers denied access to times square even with confirmation on hand. We walked around the city for 9 hours before we were able to check in to our rooms. When we finally got there we were offered a "late check-out" as a courtousy for the inconvenience. Regular check out was at 12pm and late checkout they offered was at 3pm. Thanks Premier for the three hours. I know this isn't the hotels fault NYPD had to close streets down but I dropped $530 for a room I never got to enjoy. Compensation or even an extra night would have made us come back for other stays. But no way will I ever go back.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The location is prime!!! So close to everything in Times Square! We were there for New Years Eve and the ball was dropped on 43rd, a block away!!! The rooms are very nice and quite large for a New York City hotel. They have a complimentary happy hour from 5-7 every night and continental breakfast until 1030 am every day!! Small boutique hotel, quiet and very good atmosphere! The staff is what makes it even better!!! They are SO nice and helpful, and just go over and above to make sure you are having a great visit!!! I will stay here again and again when traveling to NYC!!! LOVED it!!!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I had originally booked a room through the hotel website at the Millennium Broadway Hotel but was upgraded to a room at the adjacent Premier Hotel New York when I arrived. I had previously stayed at the Millennium Broadway Hotel two years ago which I liked very much but the Premier Hotel is much superior to the Millennium Broadway Hotel. I stayed twelve nights at the Premier Hotel.My room was on the 20th floor. There were a total of six rooms on my floor. The hotel uses the RF key card system to access your floor and room. Room was very spacious. The bathroom was quite spacious with a shower stall separate from the bathtub. A robe and slippers were provided. The minibars were removed from all the rooms but a fridge can be provided on request. A coffee maker is provided. There was also an umbrella provided in the room. A complimentary bottle of water was provided each day.Free wi-fi was reliable. There was a business centre on the mezzanine floor with two computers and a printer. The 24-hour fitness room was on the 16th floor of the adjacent Millennium Broadway Hotel which you can access with your room card. Complimentary cold breakfast was provided in the Premier Lounge on the mezzanine floor every morning. In the evening, there were also complimentary drinks and hor d’oeuvres in the Premier Lounge.The staff was very friendly and helpful. Location is ideal with being so close to Times Square and the Theatre District. There are two elevators which are quite speedy. Although I did get stuck in the elevator for 20 minutes on my last day, I would still definitely return this hotel.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: My wife & I visited New York for the first time recently. This hotel is actually part of the Millenium Broadway Hotel. We chose it because it included a continental breakfasts plus a happy hour (actually 2 hours) each night serving complimentary wines,beers or soft drinks with snacks. This is not available in the Broadway.We loved it, ideally situated in the Times Square area with easy access to all the major tourist attractions. Metro station 2 minutes away.The reception staff were very polite & helpful. Particular mention to Ramona & Hector who were great.The breakfast was fine with a selection of fruit juice,cereals,fresh fruit,dried fruits, pastries, muffins & a toaster for your bread & bagels. Unlimited tea & coffee is available 24 hours. Breakfast is served in the lounge on the mezzanine floor & this is where the evening reception is held between 5 & 7pm.We stayed in a premier king room (416) which was very spacious & included free safe, a hairdryer,coffee/tea machine & even an umbrella if it was raining. A large toilet with bath & shower with complimentary toiletries. The only issue we had was the noise outside in the early hours. They are doing road repairs & the noise is quite disturbing. A higher floor might be better.Overall we would thoroughly recommend this hotel & when we visit again we would return.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Let me just say, if you want location in New York near Times Square then look no further. This is a very good hotel but after staying at a few other hotels in New York I feel you can do better for the price paid at this property. Please not my booking was last minute as such it my compare better if booked further in advance.The room was nice, staff friendly and willing to help although the lady checking in before me was a little upset with her service (she had moved hotel as was not happy at her first one and her booking hadn't gone through the system when she arrived as it was done basically as she walked into the property. It went through 5 minutes later.)They had some nice little touches such as free beer and wine with snacks in the afternoon which was great after a stressful day. Breakfast was also free but it was average, and I presume built into the price of the room.For the location my room was very quiet, bathroom was a good size and bed very comfortable. The gym is in the property next door and due to this I did not visit it.A good hotel in a fantastic location - my only query is the cost in comparison to other options would most likely make me look elsewhere for a cheaper option and at this price point I dropped from 4 stars to 3

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This quiet tucked away hotel, 1/2 a block off Times Square is a hidden gem. Included in our price was a continental breakfast, free wifi and wine and cheese (and beer) happy hour. The staff was wonderful, the location ideal to access all sites and plays. The area is safe and although the fridge in our room was disconnected, there was really no need for it.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Four couples visited the hotel last weekend. Great location for touring the city. Rooms were a good size for New York. Beds were comfortable with no street noise. Although there was no hot breakfast items, there was more than enough to choose from. Staff was very friendly and helpful, especially Kevin and Acharaf(sp?) . Kevin, at the front desk, answered many questions, searched for the best prices for entertainment, and welcomed us back to the hotel every night. Acharaf, in the lounge, provided top notch service. Complimentary drinks were served every evening from 5-7. I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I was at the Premier a few nights on business and it was, for the most part, lovely. The room was spotless and cozy. The location in the heart of midtown is hard to beat. My one complaint is with the staff member encountered at check in. She was not terribly friendly and clearly thought she was doing is a big favor checking us in. Given the price of the hotel, the receptionist needs to drop the attitude. Other than that, I liked the hotel very much.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: One of the best hotels I have stayed in! We were here for a week for a birthday treat and I would totally recommend! We stayed in room 821 the views were great! The bed is really comfortable and the room is really spacious. Breakfast wasn't a traditional American breakfast and you do have to share your table with others in the hotel but I actually enjoyed meeting new people. ALL staff at this hotel have been lovely and if I come back to NY I will be staying here!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Booked into millenium broadway hotel with a friend for our first trip to New York to take part in the marathon. Trip advisor reviews were getting alittle worrying so i voiced my concerns via email direct to the hotel. Some were very good some disappointing as i understand refurbishment of rooms is in progress. On arrival at front desk we were informed that we had been switched to The Premier next door. It was amazing nothing was too much trouble a very relaxed few days. Apart from 26.2 miles whoch we both completed despite the winds. Would definately recommend.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: From the moment we arrived till we went home everything was superb!! Panicked a bit when we tried to check in at the Millennium and they sent us next door to the Premier - but wow we were very impressed!! Breakfast every day, free drinks between 5-7 and free wifi- all of which we were not expecting!! Breakfast was plentiful with a choice of cereals, toast, bagels and fresh juices and coffee machine. Just what you needed to set you up before heading out!! The evening drinks were a lovely touch too - choice of either wine, beer or soft drinks with a range of nibbles and all free!! The free wifi was a godsend also, as I needed to be in touch with my children on a daily basis, and with brilliant signal!! The rooms were lovely and spacious with a large bathroom with both bath and shower and a dressing area!! We were in room 1220 and the view was poor - looking out over other roof tops and the back of the hotel but this was just a minor thing to us as we were not in the room long enough to worry about the view!! The service from the hotel staff was great - very friendly and helpful - especially Kevin!! If ever I head back out to New York (which I hope to 1 day) I wouldn't think of looking to stay anywhere else - would definitely return!!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I had the misfortune of blindly booking this hotel through Hotwire which advertised it as a 4 and 1/2 star hotel. I would rate it as a 3 star at the very most. As a matter of fact, I have been to several 3 star hotels that are MUCH MUCH better appointed than this. Our room had bare walls and had a very austere feel about it. Nothing about the room was warm and inviting. They only had 1 washcloth in the bathroom and only 3 small size bath towels whose ends were fraying. The lobby was hardly decorated where two unwelcoming front desk staff members were present. It was quite noticeable when the female staffer shifted to less a pleasant attitude when she realized that we booked through Hotwire....the only positive note i have for this hotel is its location

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This was a treat after being burned by other NY Theater district hotels that promise great location but make you sleep in a old dirty closet of a space. This was a spacious, clean and comfortable King room. Floor to ceiling windows with a view. Quiet even though less than a block off Times Square. Hotel Staff was friendly and responsive. Outstanding restaurants so close. (French next door and Italian across the street). I will be back.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This is the worst hotel among all the hotels we have stayed in our 2-week trip in the US. We arrived at the hotel at 1pm. The staff (male, can't remember his name) was very snobbish and not at all welcoming. We were told that we're early and we need to come back at 3pm to check in. The lobby looked very empty and I don't think there was no room for us. Anyway, we decided to go for lunch and requested to leave our luggage with the hotel. Then, this staff carried our bags one-by-one into the storage room. Half way through, he was interrupted by another guest. He attended to this guest, leaving my last piece of baggage in the middle of the lobby! We have walked out of the hotel but I felt uneasy and I had to return (and saw my bag was still in the lobby) and remind him to keep my bag. Finally, we went back at 3pm to get checked in. The same staff who spoke to me earlier said that he is knocking off, and I have to wait for the next staff to take over him. Then, he continued to laze around chatting away with the bellman, leaving us waiting at the counter. It took 10 mins for the next person on duty to come and he took his own sweet time to settle down, and finally we waited for another 20 mins to check in successfully! I mean, how could there be only one person on duty at the check in counter? I have been to many hotels and I must say that this is the first time a reputable hotel like Grand Millennium really let me down. I must be so unlucky to meet one irresponsible and one lazy staff in just a short 30-mins of my arrival at the hotel-- definitely not the first impression you want to give your guest. Our room was not very big, but it was quite decent. There was no street noise. There was complimentary wine in the evening (5pm) and breakfast was included in the room. However, the breakfast was really limited in choice. There were only some rolls, fruits and cereal. The location of the hotel is superb, steps away from Times Square, lots of shops and restaurants around. Personally I feel that there is nothing wrong with the hotel, but there is a big problem with it's staff attitudes. I will not go back to the hotel again. There is no short of good hotels in New York city.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We booked a room at the Millennium Hotel but encountered a nice surprise at check-in when we were told to go check-in at the Premier next door. We stayed at the Millennium before and was not impressed at the level of services and amenities with regard to the star rating it got. Now the Premier is an impressive hotel. It also benefits from being a smaller, less busy hotel compared to the Millennium next door. The room was large with a nice layout. It appears to have been recently renovated. The breakfast buffet is beautifully presented although the choices are somewhat limited: no hot foods. The evening wine hour was very nice. However, not many guests showed up while we stayed there. Location near times square should be ideal for many visitors. We love being able to walk everywhere we want. The front desk was very friendly and professional. We had a pleasant experience throughout our 2-night stay. We will add Premier to our list of consideration the next time we book a hotel in midtown Manhattan.
user_name:
CliveNYC
West New York, New Jersey

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed for a night & was satisfied. Its proximity to times square was a very good advantage. Had the tour of the area, shopped a bit too. Happy with the service at the lounge. The room is nice & clean with street view, not noisy.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Detailed ReviewDates of Stay25 September / 30 SeptemberWe have stayed at Millennium hotels in Singapore and Bangkok in the past and found them to be a very good place to stay. The Premier Hotel on W. 44thLOCATIONGreat location. It is only a few meters from the silliness/craziness of Times SquareROOMRoom 1919 facing W. 44th with a great view of Times SquareRoom was of good size. Bed was fantastic.Wi-Fi was strongWork Desk with great chairIn room safe large enough for a laptopSofa/couch was the very weak link of the room. Uncomfortable but one is not in NYC to sit on a sofa/couch.Flat screen TVBathroom was large for a Times Square Hotel. Separate bath and shower.Hot Water was HotWater pressure was strong.Shower was small but OKDownside was that it was hit and miss for a full towel complement after room was serviced and toiletries replaced.On Friday when we came back around 2:30pm the room was still not cleaned which was OK. There was a phone message stating we needed to change rooms due to the drapes being replaced on Sunday. In going down to the front desk to inquire I was told that there was no need to change rooms. Just for the record the drapes where never replaced while we were there.On Saturday when we got back to the room in mid afternoon there was a strong paint smell. Again I went down and the front desk and they were surprised that we were on the 19th floor. They thought it was cleared. The 18th floor was closed and being remodeled or something and there was painting. The smell had come up into the 19th floor. They were very willing to change our room but the wife did not want to pack and unpack. So we put a towel at the door to block the smell from getting. That helped.On Monday at 8:34am they decided that was a good time to test out their security and fire alarms over a period of time. Thus, at points, the elevators were unavailable. Made no sense for the timing of this event and told the front desk same.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Our room was great and the service was, too. Our concierge, Monique, was delightful and was very attentive. She made my friend and I feel as if we were her top priority. The location of the hotel is right in the middle of all the action in Times Square. I highly recommend it.Liz Greaves

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
