review_body: An extremely comfortable and clean hotel. Its proximity to Times Square and the subway was very convenient. No noise in spite of being in the middle of New YorkPremier Concierge Monique Madison was very helpful and friendlyWMJToronto. Ontario

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Great location, great service and staff, nice amenities. FAST wifi! The hotel was clean, bed was comfy and room was spacious for NYC. Had to deal with construction outside that did rattle the windows but luckily a small fan that we brought helped any light sleepers. Great view of Time Square! Would definitely go back.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Had a very pleasant and enjoyable 3 night stay at a Premier room with a Queen-Sized bed on a high floor at Premier Hotel. There were minimal to no street noise. Managed to get an upgrade to Premier Hotel from Millennium Broadway Hotel for our 1st night (we had reservations for the next 2 nights at Premier Hotel) for the same room which was appreciated. The room was spacious for New York City standards and we were pleasantly surprised at the size of the bathroom! It came with a bath-tub and a separate shower area. Was able to get a complimentary use of a mini fridge as well. There was complimentary Wi-Fi too which worked well and was appreciated.The bed was comfy and is a decent size for couples but it can be a tad small for friends looking to share a room. Enjoyed the complimentary breakfast and the use of the Premier lounge. There were also complimentary evening reception serving cocktails, drinks and appetizers from 5pm to 7pm daily.The location of Premier Hotel is excellent. Walking distance to all the Broadway theaters and Times Square is just round the corner. The staff from both Millennium Broadway Hotel and Premiere Hotel were friendly and efficient.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Its all about location location location and this hotel has it. You are right there Broadway / Time Square. You couldn't ask for anywhere better.This is my second visit to New York first stay was in the Millennium Broadway Hotel right next door (sister hotel).The room was fantastic had all the amenities that are required for your stay. The hotel is situated close to all the good restaurants, bars, theatres and sights to see. The concierge was very helpful and offered me all the assistance I required for my stay. Nothing was a problem.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The first thing that must be said is that the location of this hotel is second to none. There are a number of others that state they are in Times Square but if I was that far away from the main drag I would not be happy. Times Square is not for you if you are shy retiring or want a quiet getaway to soothe the soul. If you want to see all the ny has to offer and want to be in the midst of the madness that is time square this is a very good choice. The price is very reasonable and if you can get it from the site that doesn't give names it's unbeatable. Now the price is very reasonable and for the location way below that which the others charge. Here is the problem. The hotel room size is great for ny but the general trim fit and finish, decor all are not up to par. There is things like wallpaper peeling in areas. On floor 35 by the elevators for example. The night staff are either totally absent or grunt for your room keys. This is something I don't get because we kept our room keys so even though I am no longer checked in I can still get in. It doesn't really offer any security. I guess it must be there to stop the prostitutes sorry escorts getting in but the john can just meet them downstairs so not too sure what purpose it serves especially as the security staff are often totally absent anyway.  The room itself is a little tired but the views even the back streets like we got are great for people watching and general entertainment. Soap and towels are at a premium here which is weird. If you are all action and hardcore like us you will be out all day. We often got back at 10pm even though the plan was for returning at 2ish, ny is like that! Coming in gasping for a shower only to find no towels or soap etc is not great. Overall for value for money it's hard to beat. There is a grocery store opposite the hotel and this place is best avoided as it is so overpriced and the old Asian guy is obviously too rich and older than customer service. Walgreens is nearby just get what you need on the way back to stop this pirate getting away with your loot. Also generally avoid the food places in Times Square as there are some truly shockingly amazing places to eat and these tourist traps do not deserve your money or time. You have come this far go to nice places and they don't have to be expensive.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The location of this hotel was superb. Right smack at the Broadway and Times Square. Though crowded at Broadway, this hotel is at 44th Street which is on the less crowded side and its on a quiet mid block. Very convenient to walk to all the happenings and it is part of the Millennium & Copthorne group. It is a 125-room luxury boutique hotel and next to its sister hotel, Millennium Broadway New York. Stayed at the premier room with complimentarh wifi and breakfast. The room was spacious at 30 sqm and I didn't find anything that I was not happy about. It has an over sized bathroom that include a European-style soaking tub, separate walk-in showers, revitalizing bath products and an over sized illuminated vanity table. Our room came with an exclusive use of the premier lounge with breakfast and evening cocktails served there. There wasn't much variety though but it was quiet. My flight was late at night and they could allow me to check out and used the bathing facilities at the gym of Millennium Broadway next door. It was indeed a very quiet hotel compared to the larger ones I used to stay. Overall, I was happy that I stayed here.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: the hotel was in a great location. it's within walking distance of Times Square and Central Park. Tons of shops, food, and sights. The room was nice. My boyfriend and I got to the hotel at about 1pm and check in was at 4pm. The concierge Monique was awesome and let us check in early. She was also a big help in telling us where to go and all the sights. We got in on the 17th floor. Our view wasn't all that great because we we're on the backside of the facility but it was fine because we weren't in the room that much anyways. I feel like the room was overpriced because there was no refrigerator, no microwave, no ice machine, and not even a place to get something to drink inside the hotel; no vending machines. So we stocked up at the walgreens down the street. All in all, i enjoyed out stay. I like how we could walk pretty much anywhere and not be too far from our room. I would stay here again but try to get in at the millennium tower.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Baths maybe could use an update (they are aware of it), but LOCATION, PRICE, and PERSONNEL make this a no brainer for NYC. Book it! Would return with no question. Hector was awesome and made you feel important! We were on 10th floor facing Times Square and had NO noise problem!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Overall, the hotel was clean and comfortable. Our room was very spacious as was our bathroom. However, during our two night stay we had trouble sleeping because of the overnight construction works outside. Obviously not the hotel's fault, but it started after 11:30pm. Jack hammering was the worst! The breakfast was decent and the comp WiFi was nice.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I am a regular customer of the Premier Hotel. It s well located on 44th street and usually I am quite satisfied and happy to stay there.This time I got a room at a low level floor facing 44th street and I must say no insulation to the noise and the the traffic of 44th street. The noise was horrendous especially with the proximity of Time Square.Moreover I had a problem with the shower of the bathroom and it took 3 days for the maintenance people to fix it.The staff was aware of the issue and sorry about it but it seems that they had very little influence on the maintenance people.The concierge did try hard to find a solution but it was too little to late....I like the hotel so I guess i will be back....

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: My husband and I have stayed at the Premier many times. Each time it is more enjoyable then the last. The hotel is boutique like in nature with morning breakfast and cocktail hour in the evening. It is charming and lovely. The hotel is clean, well maintained and the staff are terrific. They are very accommodating and wanting to help wherever possible. Monique, the Premier Concierge is wonderful. She is attentive, well informed and wants all the guests to have a positive experience. She is really a gem and wonderful to the guests at the hotel. I would highly recommend the Premier to anyone staying in NYC and have had nothing but positive experiences there.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: My wife and I stayed here during our vacation and had an amazing time. The hotel is very welcoming and will hold your luggage for you prior and after your check-in/check-out. The complimentary breakfast has a lot of options. Their evening cocktails and drinks is a great way to socialize.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I would like to personally thank the hotel's concierge Monique Madison for her kindness and assistance during the stay of myself and business associates for her professionalism and knowledge with all our questions and inquiries for surrounding services and points of interest in New York City.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We had a great stay. Hotel staff was very friendly and provided good service. We walked thru the adjoining hotel (The Millennium) several times and was very glad we stayed at the smaller boutique side The Premier. No crowds in the lobby, no noise, and no wait for the elevator. Some floors are out of service at this time due to renovation. There was no impact to us due to construction. We found an on-line promotion with a great rate which included Wi-Fi. We did call for extra towels late in the evening which didn't arrive but that wasn't a big bother to us. Our expectations were met.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The staff is very helpful and friendly. They provide the best service they can. The location of the hotel is also great, it is in the middle of Times Square. The only difficulty that you will face is the breakfast, which isn't great but satisfying.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: You must have really good luck to stay here because if anything goes wrong you have excellent service but zero assistance. I didn't so let me share my experience:(1) F&B - a glass vase of fresh orange juice at the breakfast lounge actually broke into 2 pieces (top and bottom) when I tried to pick it up from the buffet spread. The server apologized immediately and left me waiting in my wet apparel for his manager to handle the incident. The F&B manager Anna came after a good wet wait and also applogized not knowing otherwise how to handle it. I had to suggest that they send my apparels for laundry as I'm traveling (who isn't if they are not staying in the hotel?!). Like the server she showed great service and agreed to do it. However when my husband handed the wet apparels to her shortly after she said she is not handling this "department" so she can't promise to get the express laundry (which is offered by the hotel) done. She promised to get back to us which she didn't when she left for the day and even before we checked out the next day.(2) Front desk - we checked with the front desk at least twice throughout the day for the status of the laundry request.Each front desk person said with great confidence and assurance that they will look for the laundry which by the time (less than half a day since we have handed it over to Anna) was considered missing and promised to hand over to the next front desk person properly after their shift ends. It was such great assurance that we didn't quite jot down their names. They were Rominia and Hector and another Hispanic origin night shift lady who didn't wear her name badge. So anyway each time we had to repeat our story because none of the front desk person followed through with their promise neither did they handed anything over to the next person. And the last one actually said it was probably because we had a do not disturb sign on my door that's why as if there aren't any other way to reach us (like when they could slip our bill beneath the door on the day we checked out). The last front desk person promised with great confidence and assurance that she couldn't said for her colleagues that she meant what she said and will inform her manager to find other ways to compensate us for all the trouble we experienced. Not surprisingly another lip service officer in The Premier. (3) housekeeping - who confidently told front desk and us that there was no such article for our room. We had to sit at the front desk and personally insist that they locate it there and then (at midnight cos we were leaving first thing the next day). The housekeeping had to summon 2 extra pairs of hands from the concierge to help find the laundry at housekeeping which they eventually did. The laundry was done. A proper laundry slip with our name and room number was also properly detailed on it so how is it they said there wasn't anything for us all day and had to use extra pair of hands to look for a properly tagged laundry?? And you would think you would be safe not putting anyone to the laundry? Try checking the water container of coffee making machine. Not sure if they ever washed it. They have powdery substances in it. Bath tubs are dry probably due to dry air and have things dried on top of it. Overall you might find this hotel has great location and really great customer service (on the surface) but when you are traveling you really want to be sure the hotel can do more than a bed at the centre of a busy place and lip service hotel staffs.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Great hotel and service. Was originally booked at the Millennium hotel upgrades to the premier hotel for a small up charge. Awesome value. Included Wifi, breakfast and 5pm cocktail hour. Monique (Premier concierge) was awesome in assisting us with everything we needed. Only issue was a malfunctioning air conditioning one night. Monique and Melanie (manger) removed the entire up grade charge. Hotel is clean, rooms were quiet. Great location the heart of time Sq. This is our second stay at the Premier. We will definitely stay again every time we visit NYC. Thanks again Melanie and Monique.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Originally had a reservation for the millennium broadway hotel. We were upgraded to the premier hotel at no extra charge and couldn't have been happier. Our concierges Monique Madison and Viviana took great care of us. Monique set us up with site seeing info, got us checked in promptly and took care of us when we requested to have our belongings held for us even after checkout so that we could see the city without having to lug around our belongings. The room and the amenities were very nice and everything you did for us was much appreciated! Thanks so much for helping to make it a great trip into the city. When we come back we will definitely stay there again and hopefully Monique will be there to assist us again.Frank R.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We only stayed here for one night and we will absolutely come back!! The rooms were beautiful; very spacious, clean and a beautiful view! The staff was exceptional! Very friendly and efficient! Monique Madison was amazzzzing and she made our experience one we will never forget! Monique was extremely friendly and helpful! We would also like to mention Patrick as well! He was also extremely nice, helpful and informative!!! PS. The conditioner was fabulous!!!!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We made reservation using Groupon so did not know what to expect. However, from the moment we arrived to when we checked out, the staff was amazing. Our reservation included access to the private lounge on the mezzanine floor, where drinks such as beer, wine, along with soda, water, hot drinks and snacks were readily available. A continental style breakfast was also served in the morning. Although our room was a bit small, it was very nice. The bathroom was quiet spacious and had a tub and a separate shower. We have stayed at other hotels in the area and have had some good and bad experiences. By far, the Premier, was the best and look forward to stay there again, hopefully soon.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Our stay at this hotel thus far has been very good. The rooms are neat, clean and enough space for two, with a seating area. The location is in the heart of Time Square and convenient. I originally booked at the Millennium Broadway Hotel but was upgraded to the Premier Hotel for free, which is the adjoining building but has free perks included. Our concierge assistance and customer service was very good, with special mention to Monique Madison, who was excellent.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I stay in NYC many times per year, so I have the opportunity to compare many hotels. We originally were booked with the Millennium Broadway Hotel, but we had the privilege of being upgraded for free to the adjoining hotel, The Premier Hotel Times Square. We were greeted by a Premier Concierge, Monique Madison, who rolled out the red carpet for us. She was incredibly courteous, polite, and knowledgable! Our room was impeccable with high-end amenities and furnishings. In addition, our package at this hotel included a gourmet Continental Breakfast every morning and a free Happy Hour every evening with specially selected wines, beer, cheeses, etc. Even the bartender was so helpful and friendly. There was even a gourmet computerized Cappuccino Maker complete with a selection of coffees and real frothed milk - no imitation stuff, but the real thing! Security was top notch with a special card that worked by an embedded chip to enter our room and elevator selection. I can go on forever, but the bottom line is that this hotel receives a 5 star rating from me for quality, service, and amenities. Every employee treated us like royalty. I don't know of any hotel today that gives this type of service anymore. Best off all, the location was perfect-right in the heart of Times Square, but always quiet inside. My personal thanks to Monique and her friend Vivienne, both concierges, to make our stay a dream-come-true vacation! It was like arriving on the red carpet and entering the gates of Heaven. Domenic G.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: My wife and I visited Time Square to celebrate our dear friend's 40th. We picked the perfect hotel to fully experience Time Square. Conveniently located for Broadway plays and fine dining. Staff was extremely pleasant and provided us with excellent site-seeing recommendations, as well as a late check-out @130pm. Room size was slightly above average and overall hotel amenities were very good. We will likely return to the Premier.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Had a brief stay here. Good location as only a few steps to Times Square but still quiet enough. Room allocated to us was quite spacious by NY standard but design is normal. Staff are efficient and were kind enough to extend late check out from 11am to 1pm.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The rooms are small, but I guess no one stays in their room all day in NYC. Bed is comfortable and because of the high floors, it's pretty quiet for a good night's rest. Breakfast is nothing to shout about, but adequate. If you book this place, it's probably because of the location at Times Square. If you want luxury, go somewhere else nearer to Central Park.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: decent hotel - clean, ok bed and decent room size. Great location, just a 5 minute-walk to Times Square and slightly more to subway stations.complimentary breakfast was good, loved the bagels. It was slightly on the expensive side, but still comparable to other hotels in New York City.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed hers for the second time during a birthday visit.Was upgraded from the Broadway hotel and it really was wonderful.Had access to the breakfast and evening wine and snacks.Both were very good and save us from having to go out of the hotel for food.As we had the theatre every night this was a wonderful start of the evening.As travel agents we would highly recommend this hotel

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel is very central. Yes it is on Times Square and a bit more quiet than its sister property the Millenium.It is just ok, nothing really fancy, but that what really striked me is how the staff were. They weren't at all welcoming, and if you are in New York after looking for this hotel, walking on Times Square one good hello would be wonderful.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We stay at the Premier every year for a conference, and always enjoy the experience. It's far more relaxing and intimate than some of the larger midtown hotels, and the staff are uniformly friendly and helpful. (Special praise to Monique, who really goes out of her way.) Rooms ending with 21 are quite spacious by New York standards, with big picture windows and lots of light. There's a lounge with free breakfast, coffee, and a happy hour in the evening. The location couldn't be better.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: No complaints. Service was fine. People friendly. Great location. But, the room was worn. Multiple scuff marks, chips on doors, etc. Comfortable enough, but certainly not better than average. At the right price, the location makes it worth it.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I had a free stay ticket at this hotel so I wasn't expecting much, but I still ended up disappointed by the professionalism of staff. For the actual listed price of the rooms, I would definitely stay elsewhere in NYC.As others have mentioned, I felt the staff were snobbish. While I sat at the counter waiting on my room to process, the counter staff was at the same time busy chatting with another staff about his day. One of them even grumbled about how much money he's losing on stocks. I don't think that is professional at all. I had left my luggage with them earlier on, and when the bellman was not around to pick them up, the counter staff begrudgingly stood up and went to pick them up, because I needed to access something in my bags for check in. In fact the bellman was the only one who was at all professional and was the only one I tipped. Room was nice and what you will expect from a four star. My room had no view at all because it was facing away from the main street.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The "smaller" brother of the Millenium hotel om 44th street offers very good service in quiet luxurious rooms. Friendly staff, verry good cleaning and maintenance people. Helpfull doormen. Prefer the "Charlotte's" at the Millenium for breakfast!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: My wife and I, as well as 4 of our closest friends, spent 4 days in NYC last week for a little fun in the city. We all had reservations in the Millennium Broadway hotel but were upgraded to The Premier upon check-in. The Premier provided a nice, clean room, great complimentary breakfast and a very convenient location in Times Square. The hotel was great but the absolute star of The Premier is their concierge by the name of Monique. The entire staff was helpful and courteous but Monique constantly went out of her way to ensure our stay was an awesome one. My wife and I have traveled quite a bit and been to NYC multiples times. We've never encountered a hotel employee as helpful, professional and courteous as Monique. If you're headed to NYC for business or pleasure, stay at The Premier and be sure to meet and work with Monique. You won't be disappointed.
user_name:
Todd H
Salt Lake City, Utah

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We were booked into the Millenium Broadway but upgraded to the Premier. How lucky we were! It was a great hotel, the room was very well appointed, the bed was extremely comfortable (much needed after a hard day's sightseeing) and it was such a bonus to have the complimentary breakfast. The young waiter at breakfast was charming and very helpful. The location of the hotel was very convenient for our sightseeing trips as we were able to walk to a lot of places and were close to the excitement of Times Square. A fantastic first experience of New York City. Patrick, the concierge, was very friendly and gave us excellent and informative advice of where to go, provided us with maps, and on our last day oversaw a quick and efficient pick up for our transfer to the airport, taking care of our luggage and ensuring it was loaded into the minibus on our behalf. Thanks to you all.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: On a recent business trip, I originally checked into The Millenium Broadway but was upgraded to a beautiful room in The Premier (adjacent/connected to The Millenium). The room was immaculate and extremely comfortable. The entire floor (4th) was extremely quiet. The complimentary breakfast in the morning was delicious, the location was perfect (could easily walk everywhere) and the staff was very friendly and helpful, especially Monique.I enjoyed my trip so much that I hope to return shortly with my family for a nice long weekend in the city, taking in a show or 2 at one of the theaters close by.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: very nice hotel conveniently located in Time Square. pretty lobby with a lounge. our room was small but had everything we needed. it was mostly clean, the bathroom sink area couldve been wiped down better. continental breakfast was served in a nice clubby type room with a delicious selection of fresh croissants, danish and bagels along with yogurt, granola and fresh fruit. we received coupons for 2 free drinks per day. the staff was friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Great trip , got great deal on room, breakfast nice , free drinks, néed self service ice machines in halls, slow to get ice when you needed it for fast drink, manager was great , big mix up at first and she stepped out and made us happier campers

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: My hotel stay here was definitely on par with many other higher end hotels, but what set them apart was the great service we received from Monique.Due to the huge snow storm that hit the city in February our flight was delayed, cancelled, and then ultimately rebooked. The hotel was fantastic about accommodating us as we tried to secure a new flight. They helped with us to ensure we had our room for the extra night and rearranged cleaning schedules of our rooms so that we could work through the morning. They put us first and made sure that we were taken care of in what could have been an even more stressful situation. Thanks Monique for caring and going the extra mile!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Hotel is club floor type annex of The Millennium Broadway hotel. Separate entrance but shares some facilities like restaurant /bar etc. Rooms are good quality, size with quality furnishing etc with great views. The included continental breakfast in the lounge is sufficient and ample. They have stopped the evening drinks and canapés in the lounge in favour of drinks vouchers per night to use in The Millennium bar next door which is a shame. The concierge service at The Premier is great, they remember you by name each and every time you enter. The Millennium is more an inbound tour property so sharing facilities with it does downgrade somewhat the overall Premier experience as Millennium itself not of the same standard. Overall, good option and location in mid town. Recommended.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I was in Times Square for business and stayed at the Premier Hotel. The room was nice, with good climate control in the heart of a very cold winter. The hotel staff is extremely friendly and went that extra mile to impress. Monique was particularly helpful and provided my colleague and me with exceptional service. We got snowed in during the alleged "3rd worst travel day in history" when several flights got cancelled. We had to stay an extra night, and Monique graciously kept us in our same rooms so we didn't have to switch rooms. We had to book a late flight the next evening and went down the next day to see if we could get a late checkout. She let us stay until she left at 3:00 pm. She remembered who we were and our room numbers the second we walked down without having to even look us up. You don't get that kind of service at many places, and I don't usually take the time to go out of my way to provide feedback. All staff were very helpful and pleasant to work with, but Monique stood out because she really provided great service and went that extra mile. I will be staying there for future business travel.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here for a weeks break in NTC. Situated next to the Millenium Broadway Hotel, this is a much quieter and superior wing of the hotel. It has its own entrance and lobby and has the appearance and feel of an expensive apartment block rather than a hotel.The staff are extremely friendly, welcoming and helpful. The hotel has a business room with computers and printers. Breakfast (and evening reception which we never went to) is provided daily. The breakfast is excellent, well presented and plentiful.The rooms are spacious, the beds very comfortable. The hotel is very quiet. You would never believe you were just off Times Square.I highly rate this hotel and would not hesitate to stay here again.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: A hidden gem, great location, with excellent staff throughout, simple format, very comfortable rooms, plenty of cupboard space, free wifi which works well, great continental breakfast. For Bar and large meals you can go to the Millenium Broadway Hotel which is accessed through the foyer of the Hudson Theatre which joins the two hotels together.The front desk staff and concierges, particularly Monique and David, were exceptionally helpful and nothing was too much trouble.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Booked a night at the Millennium Broadway Hotel to celebrate my wife's birthday in NYC. We were upgraded to the Premier Hotel. The guest services people (especially Monique) were wonderful. The theater concierge was knowledgable and helpful. The room was impeccable. The price was reasonable given the location a few steps from Times Square. We will certainly be back.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We booked one night stay at broadway millennium hotel yet got upgraded to Premier Hotel. Excellent location right in the theatre district. Nice beautiful room with large bathroom all the amenities. Wifii was fast and complimentary continental breakfast was well presented. Service was friendly. Will definitely book this hotel next time in NYC.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I had a first class view of the ball dropping for New Year's Eve at this very impressive hotel. Special thanks to Robert Bove, Monique, the other front of house staff and the lovely lady who oversaw the Continenatl Breakfasts and the nightly drinks gathering. Exceptional location, literally steps from Times Square, very high standard of operation, knowledgable staff who actually CARE about its occupants and learn their names which made me feel very special!! Todd, the relieving barman, was exceptional value in The Millennium bar. He made all who dropped in for either a short or extended time feel special. His lack of presence on my last two nights was very much missed as he took an interest in each of his customers and made them feel very welcome. Highly recommend this hotel. Flora from Australia.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Monique Madison was AMAZING.. SHE made my whole trip easy and enjoyable. She is a beautiful person inside and out. I have been in the retail industry and never met anyone as nice and helpful as her. Anytime I needed anything she was there with a smile on her face. She needs a RAISE! I have managed people for years .. I can see a good employee!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed at the Premier Hotel for New Years Eve.... I had a great time!!! The highlight of my trip was Monique... she was very helpful. Even with wacky requests like teaching my group of girls to apply make-up like a pro (she's georgous by the way). I would go to this hotel over and over again just to see her and to get that special treatment. She made us feel like we were special, like we were the only ones in the hotel. I could see by all the hugs and smiles "all of the guests felt the same". It takes a special person to make everyone feel special and cared for. Thanks for the servcie and see you soon Premier (well only if Mo is there).

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Can't beat the location! So close to Times Square, transportation and many midtown attractions. Friendly & easy check-in. Our room was clean and nicely furnished. The continental breakfast with fresh fruit & croissants was wonderful. The drinks between 5pm and 7pm were an additional treat. The whole staff was attentive. The hotel concierge, Kevin, was so helpful without being condescending or put out. The only thing I noticed was on one of the days the room was a bit too warm and there was no way to use the air conditioning.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Monique, the Manager at the Premier Hotel did an extraordinary job to make our stay a remarkable one. Kudos Monique. The hotel Concierge did a good job too. The hotel location is excellent to visit Broadway, Times Square and many nearby attractions and stores. Excellent public transportation nearby too.We'll come back next time we visit NYC. Many thanks.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We very much enjoyed our stay at The Premier. The location was perfect and yet it was so quiet in our room that you would have never known you were right around the corner from Times Square. The rooms are large and comfortable. We did not have a street view but that wasn't a big issue for us. The front desk staff was so polite and helpful and we absolutely loved the happy hour and breakfast in the mezzanine. We would not hesitate to book a room at this hotel again. Thanks to the staff at The Premier Hotel for a great stay!!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This was a last minute booking. We usually stay at the New Yorker but felt it was getting a bit tired so decided to try The Premier. The whole experience was amazing. The large room was laid out to more resemble a suite. We were on the 18th floor and had a view of the lights on Times Square. I am confused about the complaints about cleanliness. I found it spotless. I was very pleased with the fact that they didn't try to rip us off with extra charges. In fact we were warned about the mini-bar ("just move something and you'll be charged') and international call charges ("no, I would have to look it up. Please don't. Local calls are at least $10 a minute"). Now that is good service.After reading moans on here about the FREE continental breakfast I thought we'd try it once and then probably eat out every day after that, WRONG. We had the breakfast everyday. Unlimited bagels, croissant, Danish pastries, cereals, cold cuts, cheeses, hard boiled eggs etc. And the coffee was from a Nespresso machine and if it's OK for Mr Clooney it's OK for me.I mean, what else do you need to set you up for free. Between 5 and 7 drinks were served with snacks in a mezzanine lounge. Again FREE. In 2 hours you can get quite tipsy on the free wine. The staff were absolutely lovely, totally unobtrusive but always to hand if needed.I strongly recommend and we will certainly use The Premier on our next visit to NYC.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Visited The Premier Hotel Thanksgiving 2013. Excellent accommodations and Ms. Madison, the Concierge, was friendly and professional. Location of hotel for Parade was convenient. View from our room was of the New Year's Eve crystal ball.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: First I have to start my review by saying that were guests during one of the busiest and most expensive weeks of the year, the week after Thanksgiving-the kick off of the Christmas season and the week of the Christmas Tree Lighting. I was apprehensive about staying in Times Square and was worried that we would not get any peace & quiet and because of the price (which was about $450 a night this week, but dropped to 1/2 of that on our last night) but my friend who I was traveling with won out and I do not regret our decision! First of all, the staff is wonderful and they were very helpful, from the moment we checked in, to their quick action of moving us to another room, when the toilet seal started leaking. We felt very safe and secure because you had to have a key to work the elevator. The added bonus of the room and nightly cocktail hour were great! The breakfast was a simple breakfast of fresh bread, bagels, pastries, cream cheese, ham and cheeses along with juice and coffee. It was a great way to quickly start our day and saved us from having to spend $20 a morning on breakfast in the city. The nightly cocktail hour, consisted of wine, beer and appetizers. It was a nice way to sit down and relax for a little bit before going back out into the city for the evening and before grabbing dinner. The staff in the lounge were very attentive to our needs and were very friendly. The rooms on this side are very spacious as far as hotel rooms in the city go, they do only have 1 queen bed or 1 king bed but that works fine for friends traveling together or for couples without kids. This side of the hotel was very quiet, could not hear the commotion from Times Square but our room also did not have a city view, we had a view of another building, but that was fine with us because the only times we were in the room was to relax or sleep. If there are just 2 people in your room I would definitely suggest staying here, you will not regret it. Thank you to ALL of the staff for making our stay an unforgettable time, we will definitely stay here again on any future visits to NYC!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Everyone was great, everyone from bellman to waiters to concierge to everyone. They all seem to know our names. Great location and accommodations. Closeness to everything in Manhattan was very impolrtant. Rooms for seminar were great, the Hudson Theatre. ..greg and Sharon noto

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I really enjoyed my visit at the Premier. Great location, in the middle of Times Square. The service was excellent and I definitively recommend it. The get together evenings are a nice plus to start the night. Having complimentary breakfast is also good but the space is limited so it can be crowded.
user_name:
MJR595
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Paying extra for The Premier because it was suppose to be better...lol It was not any better or even worse then 4 star hotels we have stayed at. Breakfast was terrible, fruit bagels and bad coffee. The only good things were the evening together for free drinks and snacks and location to Time square. The shower there was mold in the corner and a long hair on the wall. The glass counter top had a long hair on it too and mold around the sink edge. My fiance went to use a glass and there was a lip prints on it. I have pictures of everything in the bathroom but it will not let me post them here.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Poor food choices and the worst coffee ever. Most service was good. Front desk has some attitude but everyone else was good. We did not see a room in the regular hotel but would recommend it over the Premier even so.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Monique made our stay at the Premier pleasant and relaxed. She was helpful and kind. The hotel was clean, in a perfect location. You can easily walk to many theatres and other places of interest. We would stay here again.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Monique! Thank you once again for making my stay in NYC so special. I just love that I can count on you for getting the room I want, when I want it and (in a fun coincidence)(this time) a ride in the elevator with Miss America! Fun. Thank you to Patrick, Viviana as well for their consistent courtesy. I'll be back in a few weeks for the night and...all I can say is The Premier is THE place to stay for location, service and a fair rate.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: this was a very special spot in a great location. No hussle or bussle here. Everyone was very nice and informative. The nightly happy hour with appetizers was a great addition as well as the daily breakfast. Will be sure to stay here again.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We were in the city for four nights staying at The Premier Hotel (a Millennium property) on W. 44th street between 6th and 7th Avenue. A Perfect Location ! Check in went smooth as silk. Our room on the 17th floor was clean, comfortable and quiet. You couldn't hear the street noise or the next door neighbor. Our concierge Monique was delightful, considerate and very helpful. The housekeeping staff did a great job of keeping our room immaculate. The queen sized bed was very comfortable, the bathroom meet all our needs and had nice products to use. The hotel is located a couple of blocks from TKTS for theater goers, and obviously in the heart of Times Square. The only disappointment in our stay was that the included breakfast was nothing special. However, that being said the Premier is an outstanding hotel and we will return.
user_name:
nycnative1919
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Our room faced the street with a view of the Times Square ball. Very cool! Monica at the front desk and all the staff were exceptional. I will and I have recommended The Premier Hotel to my friends and family.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: in NY, hotels don’t come cheap, we all know that. The Millenium is actually a reasonably priced hotel with great service. I stayed on the premier side and loved it. The staff downstairs (Monique) was a great help throughout our stay and I would like to thank her very much for it. Everything we needed – Monique could arrange – remarkable! Breakfast isn’t really a breakfast, so I’d suggest eating elsewhere, but the late afternoon drinks are a nice touch to the hotel. Great place guys – well done!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Hi, this is a block from Times Square so it's. great location. I stayed on the premier side if the hotel, which I think is the cheap side. If was clean. The only drawback, no Tv as it only had 4 channels touting New York stuff so I watched on my laptop. I would stay again.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed at The Premier Hotel which is a part of the Millennium property located on W 44 St. It was very expensive. The carpet was filty in our room. when I checked with the management they were overbooked for the first night. They changed the room for the second night. There was nothing offered in the way of dinner at their restaurant or dessert. I wrote the management of my disappointment and he suggested I contact him directly if I use their services again.Not a great experience.Plater 85

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I booked one night (Oct. 11, 2013) on Priceline and was told that we would be at the Millenium Broadway. I was concerned after reading not so great reviews about Millenium. When we checked in they sent us around the corner to the Premier. I'm still not sure why we moved or what the connection was, but we loved it! Everyone was very pleasant and professional. The room was not overly large, but very nice. We were so close to Times Square! The bathroom was huge and had very nice amenities. I was there to run the Brooklyn 10K and we were a little uncertain as to how to get to Brooklyn and the concierge was extremely helpful. They offered breakfast with the room but we left too early to eat so I cannot speak to what was provided. After we returned from the race, I asked for a late check out and they were accomodating. The price was a lot to me at close to $300 a night even on Priceline. I would stay here again if I could get the room for less.
user_name:
celmo46
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The Premier offers the privacy and service you would expect from a luxury hotel in a fantastic location for business or pleasure. The staff consistently welcomed me by name and made me feel right at home. Great continental breakfast in the private lounge and good internet access too. Rooms are very well appointed and bright.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We wanted to be in Times Square and this hotel is right there, in the center of it. We liked the lively and crowded atmosphere there. We booked for Millennium but they gave us rooms in Premier section which is apparently an updated version of the rooms. The room was very nice and modern but rather small for two and the queen size bed was ok but it could have been bigger I guess. The entrance to this section of the hotel was through a small lobby and it was't exactly the main grand entrance. The staff were nice and helpful and breakfast good. Maybe we should have reserved a two twin bed with a bigger room?
user_location: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
user_name:
Hossein A
Washington, District of Columbia, United States

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I had a business trip reservation at the Millennium Broadway (company-mandated property), and I wasn't expecting much from a 750-room hotel a block off of Times Square. When I tried to check in, I was directed around a corner to the Premier Hotel. Once I figured out that the entrance was through two sets of double doors, I emerged to find a burly agent clad chicly in black, seated at a low, sleek desk--more bodyguard than front desk attendant. If I had had any trepidation about staying here, the big guy in his wood-panelled lobby would have dispelled those fears immediately. Security is a hallmark here--I was given room keycards that also activated the elevator. Unfortunately the first set of keycards didn't open my room door, but I was able to summon help quickly via a phone in the hallway. My room was worth the wait--spacious by New York standards, with the same cool Scandinavian decor I found in the lobby. Great big view of the street and a glimpse of Times Square, very comfortable king size bed, flat screen (but not HD) TV, bathroom with tub and separate shower. Despite the location, the room was extremely quiet. I had to catch a very early train, so I missed the complimentary breakfast. A pity I could only stay one night. I would definitely stay here again for business or pleasure.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: My daughter and I had a lovely stay here. We found all the staff really helpful especially Patrick. :-) The location was superb. We were upgraded to the Premium from the Millenium Broadway and enjoyed the extras provided( for example the free breakfasts ) and the opportunity to socialise at breakfast and during the evening.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: It was my husband's birthday - we were upgraded to The Premier and treated with excellent service, especially by Monique Madison at the front desk. We felt so special - I was thrilled. We enjoyed the spacious room, the complementary cocktail hour and breakfast. It was the best possible birthday present I could have given my husband - thank you!
user_name:
April C
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Let me start by saying that I had researched places for over 1 month and was very excited to have "captured" a room in the PREMIER towers at this hotel. It was for our 25th wedding anniversary and our 1st time to New York - very big trip! So, one of the things you're paying for and you have set in your mind as you've had this important room booked for so long is this beautiful view - that's why they have floor to ceiling windows - right? So we get their early and I'm prepared to ask if we can just check our luggage till rooms open up but the "girl" snobbishly says "oh, I do have a room open for you. I told her that we can wait and explain the above info.... blah blah blah I want to make sure its a nice room and she tells me that it is a wonderful room - ends up on the 8th floor, rotten view, wait did I say "view"? Not. We wait till later in the day when things open up and are told that we can't switch as they are filled for the week. I've really been treated better at a Holiday Inn and overall the room was not fantastic as pictured, its a pretty average room and in hind site I wish I would have gone with a smaller place and paid a lot less since I wasn't ever going to get a view that I'd hoped for and I'd had better service too. P.S. I hate people who write bad reviews and complain about petty things, that's not me, I just kind of feel jipped.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The Good: Times Square; very convenient and centralized to everything. From what I gather, the room was spacious considering it's NY. The Staff was phenomenal! You get a free so-so breakfast every morning & a great free happy hour every evening. The Bad: The mattress is hard as a rock, bet on a back ache. The shower is tiny!! The TV was static and pretty much unwatchable while in the room. The rooms look pretty out of date and there were a lot of visible TV wires all over. Wasn't terrible experience but would probably give another place a try next time.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed at this hotel for one night before a cruise. Check in was friendly. Our room was clean and spacious with a nice view of the city. We enjoyed both the evening happy hour and the included breakfast. What a treat for New York City! The location was convenient with restaurants, theaters, and shopping nearby. We will definitely stay again next time we are in The Big Apple.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: As you would expect from a Luxury ranking, service is excellent, from the private check in at the Premier Tower location, to the cookies and cupcakes available in the lobby during the day, to the bell hop. There is continental breakfast on the Mezzanine each morning (although the attendant didn't look up from his newspaper to acknowledge me or others who walked in at the same time) and evening appetizers and drinks. The 2 elevators can be slow (there was a large conference also staying in the Premier). The room was large and clean. I agree with the reviewer who was disappointed with the quality of the TV service, which was less than clear and certainly not HD. The baseball playoff game on TV was "fuzzy". There are 2 comfortable leather chairs in the room to watch TV, BUT, if you want to watch in bed, can only watch at an angle, as the TV does not turn all the way towards the bed. Location is in the middle of everything, from Broadway shows, to restaurants, to Times Sq. Even being so close to the action, the windows worked as a sound barrier and I could not hear the outside noise in the room (great for a quiet night's sleep.)
user_name:
SteveI1302JZ
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: You know me by now, I typically only stay at the old Helmsley on 42nd st. but my boss is into these "boutique" hotels & since I was traveling with her, I booked it & guess what....I LOVED IT...so clean, nice size bathroom, couch in the room & a USA today at my doorstep every morning, gotta love that! Honestly, the location is great! Even though it's in the middle of Times Square, it's very quiet & easy to get around as I was on a business trip & forever going up, down & around town.If you want to stay mid town & enjoy a nice, spacious & clean room, BOOK IT, you won't regret it.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: For $500+/night I'd expect a more ship-shape room, especially in the Premier Tower, which I was told was "more luxury." TV barely worked, looked like SD. Couldn't even get a solid signal for ESPN for Monday Night Football. A little rough around the edges infrastructure wise, for example grout and paint job in bathroom has seen better days. Bed comfortable, though, and room was very large for NYC.Breakfast was continental, similar bagels to a $150/night Holiday Inn, if you ask me. Premier lobby cold and a bit unwelcoming. Seems like a private lobby perhaps for serviced apartments? Actual Millennium lobby next door. I image the Marriott Marquis around the corner, for instance, might be a bit more up-to-date and polished, something to expect at this price point.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The Premier is an excellent "vacation" when in NYC. We had stayed at the Millenium several times but the Premier is an excellent bonus. The special breakfast & happy hour was great - especially the staff!!! The rooms are immaculate & very quiet. Definitely excellent value. Look forward to a return visit knowing the Premier will be

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: My daughter and I had a lovely stay here. We found all the staff really helpful especially Patrick. :-) The location was superb. We were upgraded to the Premium and enjoyed the extras provided( for example the free breakfasts )

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I booked this hotel for my daughter and I for a week. On arriving at concierge we were advised that we had been given a free upgrade to a Premium room and me being the sceptical person I am assumed it would eventually cost me! Free breakfast for both of us...could this be too good to be true?No it was all legitimate, we accessed via the Premier concierge desk - all the staff were extremely friendly really cannot fault any of them. Nothing was to much trouble, we were always greeted with a warm smile and polite conversation.The all you can eat continental breakfast was much appreciated and set us up for the day, again, staff were very polite and helpful. We used the bar a couple of times but it never seemed overly busy - not sure why. We received excellent service when we used it, shame it was not used more!Situated in the heart of Times Square, we found this hotel perfectly located, all the Broadway theaters are very easily accessible - we went to see Phantom of the Opera...HIGHLY recommended! You really can shop till you drop - typical New York everything is BIGGER and BETTER and it really is the city that does not sleep.On a side note: I highly recommend a meal at The Hard Rock Cafe - well worth a wait, you wont be disappointed. And finally - As two women travelling together I have to say that at no point did we feel threatened in fact quite the opposite...every one we spoke to and met were extremely helpful!Downside: There are however a lot of people 'asking' for money for food, drink and the honest one's are asking for money for weed! It does get on your nerves as there does seem to be a lot of this going on around Times Square.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: First I want to state that I have stayed at several Millennium Hotels across the globe and have generally found them to be outstanding. Perhaps that's why the train wreck we experienced this weekend was such a surprise. This was clearly a case of poor management and poor customer service. I spend over 100 nights a year in hotels and I can honestly say that this was the worse customer service experience I've had this year Round 1 First we had booked three rooms for a family weekend of theatre in the city. My partner arrived before I did and tried to check in. Instead of politely telling him he had to wait till four or explaining as the reservation for all rooms was in my name so they needed proof he was authorized to check in the front desk clerk was rude and hostile questioning if my partner was at the right hotel. Then he quizzed my partner over which room he was sleeping in and despite my calling the hotel and explaining the situation I had to have the reservation changed by the booking agent. My partner asked to speak to the manager and first he was told that the manager didn't work on weekends and when he insisted the guy told him that "there was no point as the manager would tell him the same thing". When after my partner insisted that he he speak to the manager the front desk manager came out and was actually quite competent and explained that as the room wouldn't be ready till four it was a moot point and suggested that my partner have lunch then come back. In the meantime I called the booking agent and asked them to alter the reservation which they did. When we then attempted to recheck in the new desk clerk insisted there was now only one reservation. Only after insisting he look by confirmation numbers did he find it. Then he gave me a lecture on how this was a result of adding my partners name ...huh. ..I added my partners name because they asked me to. Overall, rude hostile and misinformed. Round 2Getting home late to the room we noticed the AC suddenly shut off and the room was filled with smell of smoke. I immediately called the operator and said we smell smoke. She told us she would send security. 10 minutes later and more smoke we called again. The operator seemed surprised security hadn't arrived. I said it was urgent and also we needed to switch rooms. She connected me to front desk and this snide and offensive woman answered. I told her the situation and she said there were No more rooms and there wasn't anything she could do. I insisted that since it was her hotel room that smelled like smoke she needed to deal with it she said "I can't do anything till I talked to my manager " huh...a guest has a smoke filled room but she has to talk to a manager. Finally the security guy arrived and to be honest he was great. He acknowledged that there was definitely smoke in the room, he called engineering and told me of course we needed to move rooms. The engineers came in and decided to pull the room from inventory. The phone rang and it was the front desk clerk who told me a room had been found and we could come down and get a key. Okay. Maybe it's me but since this is the premier tower and it's their equipment pouring smoke in the room at midnight maybe they should have offered to bring the key to us and send a bellman to help us move rooms...that would be good service and the front desk staff here seems immune to it. When we did go down to get the new keys she was brusque and rude and not once said " I'm sorry your having to move rooms at midnight" or I'm sorry this has been a problem " the phrase I'm sorry or how can I help is not in her vocabulary. All I can think is people like these get what they deserve...unemployment as their business dwindles..perhaps she can get a job at the DMV but that would require better customer service skills. I'll never be back to that millennium or any in the future. Of course one of the great things about NYC is that their are hundreds of great hotels...this just isn't one of them. It's awful

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Location perfect, close to restaurant row and ofcourse all the shows! Rooms are comfortable, clean with great view of Times Square. The Hotel Staff are knowlegeable and friendly. Monique went above and beyond are expectations with great recommendations for site seeing and restaurants! We will definately stay at the Premier when we are in NYC. It was our 3rd time there!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Despite some average or poor reviews of this hotel, my experience of staying at the Millennium Broadway was fantastic. My son and I stayed in a double room on the 49th floor, the room was very comfortable with a huge bed, large flat screen tv and a filter coffee machine. The tea and coffee was replenished everyday as was a fresh bottle of mineral water. The room was very clean and tidy and well furnished, I'm guessing by some of the reviews that this room may have been recently refurbished. The best thing however was the view, we could see directly into Times Square as well as having views of the Empire State Building and the Crysler Building, we could also see across the Hudson and over to NJ, it really was stunning. Although being on the 49th floor, the numerous elevators really can be described as 'express' and take you from top to bottom in a matter of seconds. As is mentioned many times in other reviews, the location is perfect. A few steps from the entrance takes you directly into Times Square and the main sights of the city are all easily accessible. If you get a room like ours, then I can't recommend this hotel enough.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Many pluses for staying at The Premier. We booked the Millenium Hotel and were upgraded to the Premier Hotel.Staff were very, very friendly and helpful. Monique and Hector, Thanks so much.Times Square is right around the corner and the rooms are very peaceful and quiet.Rooms are spacious and have a great view. Elevators are easy to get...no waiting.Above and beyond our expectations. Highly recommended!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Very nice hotel, excellent customer service, great location. The room was wonderful and great size. From the moment we entered the hotel, the staff were all friendly and very helpful especially in all our queries going around the City. Will definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel was absolutely perfect! It was quiet, the room was a great size and beautifully decoratedm and the location could not have been better for seeing New York City. We will definitely stay here on our next trip to New York City.
user_name:
Peggy M
Plano, Texas, United States

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: My daughter and I went to NYC to celebrate her graduation and we booked with the Millenium. When we got there, we were pleasantly surprised to have been upgraded to the Premier Hotel. The room was wonderful, large and spa like. The free breakfast was great as well as the complimentary happy hour. The staff was great from the check in, to the bell hop who helped us store our bags and get a taxi. I would definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Excellent customer service. Stayed on the premier side. And loved the rooms. Excellent location. Will be back. We were treated like royalty. Felt like they really valued our time and they went the extra mile to make us comfortable.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Having spent 3 nights at that hotel, I can say that the price was well worth it.They had complimentary happy hours, breakfast and VERY helpful staff. Personnel was always smiling and happy to help us even with the foggiest questions.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I got a reservation at Millenium but I got an ugraded room at the Premier, modern rooms, nice 5 to 7 complimentary drinks at the Mezzanine, they also have complimentary continental breakfast...basic food. Nice place for business since it was close to my office, but in my case too close to Times Square that is always full of people, that make difficult to walk. i would recomended for business.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Location, price, service- they have it all! Beautiful spacious rooms, quiet, easy to get anywhere. Great concierge service- talk to Monique at the Premier! Helpful and professional. I'll never stay anywhere else

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: A 6 night business stay at a hotel I have never used before. I will be using it from now on. Superb location near Bryant Park, 5th Avenue and the overrated but must-see Times Square and in the middle of theatre-land. Excellent, large room and bathroom with separate shower and bath. Room had desk, sofa and the bed was comfortable. Excellent, friendly staff who were incredibly helpful. Hate to single anyone out but Monique was great.Far better value than other hotels I have used (Grand Hyatt and the Intercontinental). If you want comfort and excellent service at a really good price, stay here.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here for a business conference taking place at the attached Millennium Broadway hotel. The Premier (and Millennium) are just perfectly located. Easy walk from Grand Central and half a block from the craziness of Times Square. The hotel itself was a refreshing change from what I expected. The check-in was calm and smooth. The staff were highly accommodating and the room was clean and well laid out. There was an interesting view of Time Square through the buildings.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I usually don't stay in Times Square but the places I usually stay were booked and this location is still within walking distance of my firm's NY office. If you are looking for a place in Times Square, this is a good choice. My standard room was very comfortable - big by NY standards as was the bathroom. The fitness center, which is next door at the Millennium Hotel, was large with lots of equipment. I was there at 7:30am "rush hour" and ad no problem using the equipment that I wanted. There are a couple of nice cafes next door for dinner and the complimentary breakfast was fine - bagels, fruit, cereal, juice, coffee - the basics. The breakfast room itself is small and as a result I just grabbed what I wanted and took it back to my room.My only complaint is that when I went to check in there was a sign in the lobby of the Premier that said "check in at the Millennium." I went next door to the Millennium and at the Millennium there is a sign that says "Premier Guests check in next door at the Premier." The one person at the front desk of the Millennium was overwhelmed and check in took forever. Hopefully this is not a commonplace experience.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I was booked here for business, and it's not my usual spot when I book myself. Ramona, who seemed to be at the check in desk no matter what hour I walked by, was friendly and professional and one step ahead of we whenever I needed something and/or had a question.The room was less than a block from Times Square, so I had a really unique view from my room, but it was quiet, and dark and night.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The Premier hotel is located in Times Square, 1 minute walk from the theaters and stores. The rooms are modern and new with lots of space. They have free WiFi, breakfast and happy hour every day at 5pm. The staff are very friendly and eager to help at all times. it was a great experience and we would love to stay there again!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The Premier is a boutique hotel NEXT to the Millennium owned however by the same company (I believe both are Hiltons.) However, the experience of staying at the Premier is nothing compared to the Millennium. The Millennium is crowed and the lobby is packed with tourists and luggage. At the Premier we had a private concierge check-in which was calm and quiet. Our luggage was brought to a well-appointed room, very large by NYC standards. Clean (I am a stickler for clean!) and on private floors with only 5 rooms per floor. Any noise heard was from the street and that is to be expected in NYC. Very nice view, we stayed here to attend a Broadway play and looked for location rather than ambiance. The Premier, however, managed to deliver both in hectic Times Square. There was a private guest Happy Hour with wine and sushi which was very nice. It was a nice way to mingle with other guests. Breakfast was continental, nothing fancy but unusual to have breakfast and/or Happy Hour included within the hotel in NY. This was a nice touch. The bed was a little firm for my liking but that is preference not complaint! All in all I would recommend the Premier but I personally would never stay at the Millennium. If you are a visitor to NY and are looking for the hustle and bustle of Times Square, I highly recommend the Premier. Easy to come and go through out the day, we returned several times to our hotel room to drop off our shopping packages.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I visit The Premier Hotel, both for business and pleasure, & each time it is "like coming home".The hotel is indeed a "boutique" hotel - one where registration and check-out are seamless and painless - Monique is always awaiting me with a smile (even before I arrive) with room prepared. Patrick will take care of your every need, and other individuals, including Viviana and the staff of the complimentary breakfast/cocktails room, are so pleasant and accommodating. The rooms are sophisticated in their decor and spotlessly clean. The location cannot be better, and the in-house access to the Millennium Hotel affords an excellent cocktail lounge, gift shop, and fitness center.Staying at The Premier is "like coming HOME", and honestly I really would be very happy to live there!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel is in a great location! Plush for the price by NY standards. Great location - literally a few steps from Times Square main drag. Clean accommodations and great service!BUT I have a word of caution for you...if you come during the hot hot hot summer months...stay away from the higher floors! I got upgraded to a suite up on the 21st floor, which was nice...EXCEPT...it's hot...and humid...and heat rises...and the A/C has to share with all of the lower floors. So while the view might be slightly better from the 21st - i recommend sticking with the lower floors. Put it this way...it's cooler in the hallway than in my room! This is not so bad for a day in the 70's or cooler...but for a day in the mid/upper 90's - oye! I'd still come here again - I don't think they can help it that NY is so hot...great hotel - just be wary of the upper floors in the summer (request lower!)

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I have stayed at the Premier a multitude of times for work and it has always been an excellent experience. Not only is the staff extremely friendly and accommodating, but they also go above an beyond to make sure you have the most enjoyable and comfortable stay possible. They also have an amazing concierge service. I have dealt mainly with Monique and she could not be anymore friendly and helpful! She has always checked in asking if I need anything and making sure I'm comfortable! the rooms are also very spacious with floor to ceiling windows.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Staying at The Premier Hotel Time Square was a vacation in itself. From the moment we arrived we were treated very well. Monique was very welcoming and treated us not as hotel guests but as VIPs. Monique and Patrick were extremely helpful and knowledgable about all of the questions that we had about places we wanted to visit, restaurant recommendations, etc.The hotel room was spacious, clean and very comfortable. I wish we had a room like our Premier Hotel room in our home (wonderful bed, chairs and fabulous (but quiet) view of Times Square!). I would recommend this hotel to everyone who is visiting NYC.Thank you Monique and Patrick for treating us so well and making our visit to NYC extra special.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: From the minute my friends and I entered the property, we were treated as VIPs. The staff (especially Monique and Patrick) were extremely knowledgeable about the ins and outs of the city, along with advising us about all The Premier offers. This centrally located property has clean, quiet rooms well equiped with the extra touches to make one feel pampered. I have already recommended the property to others and I will happily return in the future.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I came to New York on my own for a holiday sadly my partner become unwell in Australia whilst I was here in New York. The friendly and helpful staff at this hotel helped me through this very difficult time. Monique in particular was fantastic as was Veronica, they did a great job at being accommodating and were always able to provide any information or help. This hotel is in a fantastic location, I was able to walk to everywhere I needed to be. The room is spacious for a New York Hotel I was impressed at the size. Breakfast is provided for all guests and Happy Hour is a fantastic way to meet the other guests. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to New York. Cannot say enough good things about things hotel. Loved my stay!!
user_name:
Alexandra J
Sydney, New South Wales, Australia

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The premier is a 5 star hotel in my stay from the great front desk staff to the breakfast and cocktail staff that have the greatest personalities! they like what they are doing and are very helpful! Keep up the great work! The rooms are gorgeous with floor t ceiling windows wow!!!
user_name:
James C
Wilton Manors, Florida, United States

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Many write about the location (which is stellar if you need to be in the center of town), but there's a lot more to love about The Premier. It starts at check in, where Monique takes great care of you. She's personable and makes you feel like you're the first person she's encountered that day. A great "Director Of First Impressions."The rooms, especially when compared with other mid-priced hotels in NYC (and I travel a lot), are well above-average. They are spacious, well-appointed, and great for the business traveler.I've stayed at this hotel at least six times and always feel like it was the right choice.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I accompanied my husband to NYC who was a guest lecturer in one of the NYC companies. There are so many things I like about the hotel and these are; conveniently located, in fact, less than a hundred meters to Times Square; reception staff is very friendly and one of the receptionists even went out of her way to ask not one, but several colleagues to be able to provide me with information regarding my inquiry; our room at the 21st floor was not huge, yet very comfortable, and the bathroom was spacious and nice; happy hour food and booze and other refreshments good. I have to agree with one of the reviewers though about breakfast. Although it is not wise to compare The Premier's breakfast to European standards, I thought it was not what I expected from a luxury hotel. My husband even commented that the Happy Hour food is so much better than their breakfast food. We stayed for two nights and three days, and on the first night, my impression of the Happy Hour attendant is that he is not friendly, too stiff for someone who is in the hotel business. The second night though, the attendant was very attentive, professional and anticipated guests' needs. I understand that the set-up of the mezzanine interior is informal and casual which is ideal for the "Happy Hour" crowd, although not so ideal for breakfast. I'd say that the my positive impression far outweighs the negative ones. Given the chance, I'd choose The Premier again on my next trip to NYC.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This was not our first stay at the Millennium Broadway and we have made it our 'go to' hotel in NY city. Each time we've stayed we have been placed in the Premium Tower section of the hotel and have totally enjoyed it. Check in was fast and courteous and all the expected amenities were accounted for. Complementary breakfast and late afternoon cocktails just added to our enjoyment. We highly recommend the Millennium Broadway when looking for a truly great hotel with a superb staff and great Times Square location.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed at the Millenniun Premier attached to the Millennium hotel on broadway. Same hotel just detached with larger rooms and personal service. Hotel room was above average for NYC, big walk in shower and seperate soaking tub. Turn down service, happy hour 4-7, breakfast provided was a little on the small side. Overall a great place to stay. I did not care for the broadway location, however if you wanted this it would be a great location.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: After a very nice stay at the Fairfield Inn Queensboro, we expected that our last 2 nights in this Millennium would make our city trip complete.
