But it very disappointing.The room itself was quite nice and large. The couch however was stained. Only the reception staff was friendly. The ones in the breakfast 'salon' didn't bother to say a word.Breakfast was absolutely nothing! I understand that in NYC breakfast is not the same as in Europe or Asia, but here it was a real disappointment. Not to mention that you have to sit on a couch to eat breakfast and so it is rather a salon than a restaurant.The only advantage of this hotel is the location. But we would not spend money on this again as the subway is very easy to use in NYC.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We were unsure what to expect as sometimes the pictures of the rooms have been taken just after a refurbishment. We were delighted with our room which was spotless and had everything we required and more. Even down to an umbrella which we have never had in any other Hotel room. Might not sound that exciting but at least we were prepared for the rain!! Staff were superb and very friendly, they couldnt do enough for us and we even had a maid to turndown the bed and leave us chocolates!! We had a fantastic time and the location is perfect for accessing everything there is to see and do in this vibrant, colourful and exciting city.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Quiet room a block from Times Square. Comfortable bed and room. Monique was a great help to us in selecting restaurants and with site seeing times. Will stay here again. Cocktail hour before the theater. Continental breakfast. Both provided with room.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I visit NYC about once a year. This hotel has been my least favorite. The location is good... right off TimesSquare. The room itself was just "meh" It was incredibly small... the smallest I have seen in the city and I don't think I have ever seen a smaller shower. They did have a continental breakfast, which was ok. The doors had absolutely no seal on it... I could see the light in the hall around all four sides... which meant of course we heard everyone who came and went. I would not stay here again.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed at the Premier hotel and had meetings at the Millennium Broadway. This is for rooms in floors 16-19. Decent size rooms--smaller than Westin and about the same size or larger than the Grand Hyatt.Mostly modern amenities but starting to show age, wear and tear.Bed--comfortable and on the stiff sideSheets--average to soft--did not stand out.Pillows--goodGood size closets with safe. Fridge, coffee maker, and tea.Biggest disappointment was the wear and tear in bathroom, water stains, yellowish and moldy looking caulking, uneven joints and cracks around bath tub and sink.Final issue--if you get a room on the Times Square side you get about a gadzillion lumens into the room. While that would not be an issue if the blinds did their job the rooms only had one layer of drapes and those drapes did not roll easily on the tracks and did not cover the windows completely. So if you need a dark room to sleep you are not going to get it.The location and rates might attract you including some of the reviews. For me there are better options out there.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Spent 6 nights here to celebrate our 20th wedding anniversary. Had a few niggles before we arrived (on line requests ignored etc) but as soon as Monique got involved, all was sorted! We are loyal Millennium travellers - always choosing the brand when visiting Boston and we stayed in the Millennium UN Plaza and Millennium Broadway in previous NYC visits. We were excited at the prospect of staying in the Premier this time.Ok - first the good points. It is small - only 7 rooms on each floor so it really does have a boutique feel. The rooms - certainly our room - was larger than the NYC average with a comfy bed and decent bathroom - bath and separate shower. Monique was simply fantastic and , mindful that we were delayed by 3 hrs, had arranged for extra water and towels in our room. She had also organised welcome gifts to mark our anniversary - frsh roses, champagne on ice and a nice selection of chocolates. Well done Monique - these touches guarantee return visits.Hving access to the premier lounge for free continental breakfast and evening wine receptions was a nice touch - though the lounge oftens stuggled to cope with the number of guests.On the negative side, a premier hotel should pay a little more attention to detail - so the toiletries could be much better, the towels should be replaced, wallpaper should not be peeling off the walls and shower tidies should not be hanging off the wall. all areas of the rooms and bathrooms should be dusted and if the guest information says that ice is available on each floor, then it should be - in reality it's not available on any floor and you ring for ice. Not a big issue, but symptomatic of a lack of attention to detail.The location is perfect for midtown - seconds form Times Square but in a quiet street. We were unwell during our stay so did not get to venture too far. Local restaurants that we enjoyed included Losteria, the Long Room and Virgils - all just opposite the hotel entrance. Had a fab steak dinner at Smith & Wollensky.So, in summary, a decent, rather than Premier hotel. Monique is so good that I forgive some of the minor irritants. More attention to detail needed if this place is to retain its premier status - we would return for sure but get the feeling it's due a refurb any time soon - and with the right refurb, this could be a winner in the millennium portfolio.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Overall my 3 night stay on business deserved the 4. A couple of reasons stopped me from giving a 5 - the lack of view, my room was at the back of the hotel and looked out over the back of other buildings. The plus side of that should have been quietness, however, there was a persistent droning noise from what sounded like a very large air conditioning exhaust unit which, of course, becomes more pronounced during the night. My room (420) was located right next to the elevators and I could hear them going up and down through the bathroom wall and the door wasn't soundproof enough to stop the sound of the chimes of arrival and departure. We tried the complimentary breakfast on the first morning only, but sometimes being free isn't reason enough to partake and this was one of those times. For the price of the rooms and being 'premier' you still have a level of expectation which wasn't fulfilled at all. The room is quite small and on our visit, very busy. With no staff in attendance huge pressure was being applied to everything, seating, food, dishes etc. Dirty dishes were either left on tables or overflowing in the 'kitchen' area of the room. Clean cutlery had run out, my colleague had to wash a knife to use, the bagels ran out and the tea was cold. Maybe some can relax and ignore things like people standing with food in their hands waiting for a seat to become vacant, clutter and unclean dishes but we can't and so didn't bother going again. Based on that experience, we didn't even try the happy hour. From the disappointments to the positives, because 4 stars is still a good rating. Times Square location is superb, the reception team are very friendly, helpful and fun, the rooms are indeed pristine, a good size (not large) with good amenities, separate bath & shower and my favourite (because all hotels should offer this as standard) is a pretty quick free WIFI service. I would stay again depending on comparative room rate. Such a premier location demands a high rate, but in our experience, they do vary by hotel.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This Hotel is in the center of it all, Time Square! A beautifully maintained Boutique Hotel with all the amenities of a larger luxury hotel, including Premier Concierge Services. The Hotel staff is just wonderful, beginning with Concierge, Monique who will greet you with a beautiful smile and extend the most welcoming invitation, then she follows through accommodating your needs for the duration of your stay! I will be returning to The Premier Hotel again this year! The perfect Hotel to escape the hustle and bustle of New York City's Time Square for some quiet comfort!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I've stayed here for 3 nights for business. The location is great, the staff are nice and friendly, the room is specious and clean. There are only 7 rooms on each floor, so the atmosphere is very relaxed. They also serve free continental breakfast and an happy hour with beer and snacks every evening. It is a bit expensive hotel, but for business I will stay there again.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The location of the Millennium is exceptional: half a block off of Times Square, with all that entails. I stayed in the Premier and was very pleased with the experience. Evening happy hour was a nice touch, with good wines (red & white) and tasty Mediterranean finger foods. Breakfast could have lasted a tad longer but was still a nice selection.The absolute best part of my experience was the service. When my initial room had an unsatisfactory view (there are, unfortunately, on the north side of the hotel), Monique at reception was quick and kind in accommodating a room change for me. The replacement was what I had expected when booking the room - a fantastic panorama and very pleasant amenities, including a comfortable couch next to the windows to relax in view of the skyscrapers.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed at this hotel while on a business trip. Per previous reviews, we booked at the Millenium and ended up at the Premier. Though connected, getting from one building to the next was odd--up three steps, through a theater entrance, through another door. We received attentive service from check-in to check-out. Monique was excellent--ask for her! The location is excellent to TImes Square and Broadway.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Stay here! My boyfriend and I loved this hotel. The location was perfect in Times Square with access to all of the subways. We stayed in The Premier section of the hotel and we were very pleased with the size of the room and the bathroom with a sunken bathtub and a separate shower. The complimentary continental breakfast and the happy hour were excellent. And it's right across the street from my favorite BBQ restaurant Virgil's - go there for the wings, which are nothing like I've tasted before. They marinate and smoke them. Delicious! We would stay here again.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: My daughter and I stayed at this property which connects to and is owned by the Millennium Broadway Hotel, March 2nd for 4 nights. The two are separated by the Hudson Theatre in the middle. I have had many trips and hotels to and in NYC but prefer to stay in the West 40's for convenience. Other hotels that we have stayed in recently have included the Westin on 43rd and the Algonquin on 44th.Being a previous flight attendant for Eastern Airlines of which NYC was my route while based in Miami, I have been in alot of hotels. With enough background said, I would like to thank Monique Madison, the Premier Concierge and her team which includes "Mo", Hector, and Joey among several others who couldn't have been more gracious and helpful with any questions we may have had. They went above the call of duty and by the time we left I felt like we had made new friends. Our room was spotless and with the floor to ceiling windows we could see the Times Square Ball.Room ammenities included hair dryer, coffee pot, bath robes, mini bar and a nicely upholstered sofa and chair as well as a lighted surface vanity. Separate shower and deep bath tub as well. We were offered a continental breakfast every morning which was fresh and delicious. Happy Hour from 5p-7p seemed popular-basic beers and different wines with light samplings.Our King platform bed was very comfy with a white down comforter and extra pillows. The Premier Tower has only 7 rooms on each floor thus given the feeling of being secluded and quiet. We were on the 17th floor with a wonderful view and absolutely no noise. I would definitely stay here again and hoping to return in October. Lastly, what makes a great trip has alot to do with the people one encounters along the way and I can say that without hesitation when it comes to the staff at the Premier who made us feel like we were in their home away from home. They truly enjoy their work and do it well. See you soon. Iris and Emily

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This is our favorite location to stay in NYC. It is always a little nerve wracking to drive into the city, but once you arrive here everything changes. The staff is so friendly and accommodating, especially Monique (over at the Premier Towers). She greets you with a warm smile and always makes us laugh. I can't say more about the location, it is central to everything (we never take a cab). The rooms are modern in styling and very clean. Love the linens, soooooo comfortable. We use the gym in the main hotel in the mornings and then go to the FREE provided breakfast before we hit the streets for the day. It is so nice to be able to walk back to your room during the day to return shopping purchases or just freshin up....and enjoy the happy hour between 5 and 7.Can I say more? It is worth every penny...don't even look elsewhere.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: My husband and I stayed at the Premier Hotel in Dec 2011 for 4 nights and will definitely visit again soon! We felt like VIPs at this smaller boutique hotel right next to Time Square. The room was very large (for NYC) and had a comfortable king size bed. We could see time square from our room, yet didn't notice alot of noise. The best part of this hotel was the free breakfast and nightly wine, beer and appetizers. Staff was wonderful, as was location!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: After reading other TripAdvisor reviews on this hotel, I was very hesitant to book it, but a friend highly recommended it, so... I stayed in a queen bed room in the Premier tower (adjacent to the Millennium, but separate). The room itself was very small (200 sf at most), but had a small sofa, desk, and flat screen TV, as well as a small "bar" area for the coffee maker and minibar. The bathroom was a decent size, with separate shower and large tub. The room was clean and modern (it did not have peeling paint or stains that others have described). The bed was comfortable. The windows (which actually open) were floor to ceiling and wrapped around the entire room, with a great view of Times Square.The Premier tower room includes free breakfast and evening snacks (cash bar) on the Mezzanine. Breakfast is the basic continental, including oatmeal, bagels, pastries, fresh fruit, very good coffee. The evening menu varied; one night was sushi/Japanese, one was antipasto, one was Mediterranean; all three were good.For the price, you can't beat the location. It is a block from Times Square, a couple of blocks to the Theatres, and steps away from some of the best restaurants in NYC (The Lambs Club, O'Lunney's, Virgil's BBQ).The fitness room is located in the Millennium tower. It's small, but has almost everything you need for a good workout: free weights, machines, ellipticals, bikes, treadmills, and a stairclimber. No mats or exercise balls.Room service from the restaurant Charlotte (had a dinner and a breakfast) was excellent and timely.The only negative I have is that the second day there was no maid service (even though I left the sign on the door while I was gone -- all afternoon-- that indicates "please make up the room"). I had even left a $10 tip that was untouched when I got back. However, I did call housekeeping for fresh towels and coffee for the morning, and they were delivered.All in all, for the location, I felt that this was a very good value for my money. I would definitely stay at the Premium Hotel again.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The Premiere is part of the Millenium Hotel on Broadway, in the City. I had stopped staying at the Millenium because it was tired and in need of an upgrade.Wow, what a difference a few years make! The hotel has been redone and the Premier has the club rooms that have also been redone and are superb.The room I stayed in on the 16th floor was good for two people with reasonable probably large by NY standards, closet space.I had a special price deal where the room only cost $199/night that added to the great stay. I am not sure I would stay here at the rack rate of $399/night. However when everything else is pretty comparable, I would choose here and be just off Broadway any time.Welcoming staff and a complimentary continental breakfast. The hotel is a great choice for location.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Spent two nights at the Premier Millenium Hotel. The staff I encountered were very friendly and helpful. The rooms were a fair size for NYC, clean and comfortable. Great location for site seeing and business meetings. I will return to the Premier on my next NYC trip.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: You book a room at the Premier Hotel and you arrive looking forward to a nice 4 Star hotel in a pretty good location close to Bryant Park, Times Square and Rockefeller Center. You check in at the Premier front desk and they appologize that they have over booked this evening, but don't worry, they have a room for you next door at the Millenium and your have free breakfast tomorrow for your inconvenience. They walk you through a couple of doors and you enter the insanely busy lobby of the Millenium. Immediately, you feel you have been taken for a ride. The Millenium is a VERY average room, that has not been updated for over 20 years, the bed is hard, the furniture is worn and in the case of my room the bed sheets stained. The Millenium is officially a dump.This is why you should not book at the Premier, you may not stay at the Premier. Oh, yes, they didn't change my room rate either.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed at the Premier Millenium for one night in February. The location (Times Square) was perfect! The room was a decent size for a nyc hotel room; however, it was very plain, I expected the room to be decorated with pictures and have a little more pizzazz considering its location. At check-in the lady at the "desk" was not very friendly and when I later asked her where a certain street was, she looked at me like I had no idea what I was talking about. It turns out, she had no idea. Other than that, the staff was great and the cocktail hour was a nice treat! Would stay here agian.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I have been staying at the MIllenium Premier for the last year, and Monique has always provided me with outstanding service - I have stayed in many hotels in NYC - but her level of customer service and commitment to making my stay as seamless as possible is far and away the best in the ciy. She has even been able to assist me when I had a serious mix up online with booking my reservation - and she went above and beyond to make sure to accomodate me.Thank you Monique!!Regards,Tim Osta

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights in December. We booked through agoda.com and got what we felt was a brilliant deal at $248 a night including tax. A quick side note though, the booking process was a little confusing as we did not realise this hotel was essentially a seperate hotel to the millenium broadway (seperate check in desk and enterance etc). On our confirmation from agoda it stated we were in the millenium broadway hotel but a premier room so before we arrived we were a little confused as to which hotel we were actually staying in! On arrival we entered the millenium broadway and checked in with a friendly staff member who confirmed our rooms were actually in the premier hotel (next door).Our room was on the 15th floor (room 1521) and I would highly recommend this room! It was a lot bigger than we expected and had a lovely modern bathroom with seperate walk in shower and tub. It also had a lovely view of some of the lights of times square and the new years ball. The bed was a king size and very comfortable as was the seperate lounge sofa. There was also a decent size tv in the room as well as hot drink making facilities, an ironing board and a mini bar. Despite being so close to Times Square the room was really quiet and we hardly heard any noise from the street below. My parents had room 1621 and were very happy with their room as well although it did seem slightly smaller and the bed was facing the other direction which meant they couldnt see times square when sitting in bed like we could. Both rooms were lovely though. The room included breakfast in a morning which was good and included bagels, pastries, cereal, juice and hot drinks. Ther was also an evening reception from 5 until 7 which included complimentary beers (budweiser, coors etc) and wine or soft drinks as well as snacks such as cheese and buscuits. We found that this was a really nice touch and a lovely way to relax before going out for dinner. We also had a paper delivered to our door each morning which was nice. There were only two things that we felt could have improved our stay. One of these was that one of the elevators was broken for the duration of our stay and there was only one working for the whole hotel. The other was that on the Saturday after leaving the theatre we wanted to get a quick drink before bed and intended to visit the bar in the lobby of the millenium broadway. It was around 10.50pm and despite a sign near the door saying it shut at 11 we were told by the waiter/barman that it was closing and he couldnt serve us. This was annoying because firstly because it wasnt yet 11pm and secondly why would a hotel that is in Times Square close its bar at 11pm on a Saturday night?! All was not lost though as there were many other bars in the area and we went and purchased drinks elsewhere.Overall we were over the moon with this hotel. The location is perfect for tourists who are visiting the main shopping areas and sights. The reception staff were always friendly and helpful as was the barman on the mezzanine level. We hope to return to this hotel when we next visit the city and would not think twice about recommending this hotel to our friends.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I stayed with my friend only one night at the Millennium Broadway Hotel, and we booked the Club Queen bed room in the Premier Hotel, which cost us 600$ per night. I assume that 80% of that money is for the location only since the room is at the Times Square, but it really is not worth it. We were supposed to have a beautiful view but the only thing we saw was a huge building just in front of our window, so no natural light at all. The breakfast was a disaster, if you do not eat pork you will probably not be able to eat anything else then eggs and cereal. The room was just as any other three star hotel room, nothing special. The sofa had stains on it, and the ventilation was so noisy that it kept me from sleeping. Just spend your money somewhere where you will be at least valued as a guest!
user_name:
L H
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I stayed at the Premier for the first time for a two night stay. The check in staff was friendly, my room (though small) was not unusually small for some New York boutique hotels and I thought it was smart and stylish. The evening reception had nice wine and again the service staff was friendly. I am writing this for one reason - and that is to complain about something that IMHO opinion should never happen in a higher end hotel - barely warm water in the morning shower. Yes, I took a shower at probably prime shower time - between 8 and 8:30 a.m. and yes, I was on a higher floor but I don't care.... The water never got hotter than tepid, and by the time I was finished I was absolutely freezing. Not the way I wanted to start my day on a chilly December morning in NYC!
user_name:
Stacey H
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I stayed one night in the Premier Hotel side of Millennium. The room was entirely adequate had everything necessary and represented a good value in the area.A basic continental breakfast on the Mezzanine level was included and adequate.Several things were irritating: the handles in the closet had broken off and had not been repaired, the bathroom had bath and shower but the area of the shower was quite small and the blackout drapes did not overlap - defeating their purpose. The horns of Manhattan cab drivers were not audible to me on the 12th floor.Stay here for location and not the fineries of the hotel. As it currently stands, its a budget room in an expensive city Our meeting over on the Millennium hotel side went well - it was a good venue for this

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Great location for visiting New York City, especially if you enjoy going to the theater. Lovely, comfortable rooms and fantastic concierge (special thanks to Monique for all her help!). Highly recommend this elegant boutique hotel which is located next door to the larger Millenium Hotel.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We chose this hotel by location and price ($350/day). This past weekend we and another couple stayed at the Millennium Hotel Broadway - Premiere which was considered to be the upscale part of the Millennium. Our friends left because both rooms that they were shown looked like they had been lived in. Neither was clean by anyone's standard. Our room was OK, but for a supposed upscale of their regular hotel I cannot imagine what the "regular" hotel was like. The bathroom had tiles masking taped to the wall (and it looked like they had been that way for months.) The carpet was also beyond it's life and next to the bathroom it was obvious the shower had flooded as the carpet was badly stained. The furniture was OK but a little worn, the bed was comfortable and appeared clean. Since we were on the sixth floor, lots of street noise. The "Happy Hour" served beer and wine and sandwiches!!!! Breakfast was continental and OK but not enough seating in the breakfast/happy hour area. Won't stay here again.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: My wife and I stayed for five nights and found it a perfect location right in the heart of Times Square. We found it to be a friendly, personable little hotel attached to the larger Millenium Hotel. The concierge, Monique, would have to be the most friendly, helpful concierge we have ever encountered in our stays at hotels throughout the world. We left for a week in New England and then returned to New York for another 3 nights. We had not pre booked our accommodation in case we were not happy with the hotel. After our stay we had no hesitation in rebooking at the Premier.The rooms were spacious (for NY), clean and quiet.
user_name:
Deb U
Waiheke Island, New Zealand

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I recently spent the weekend in New York City after a business trip to New Jersey. I selected the Millennium Broadway Hotel for its location. I also stayed at this hotel two years ago for a family vacation. I expected to be at the main hotel, but was directed to the Premier side which was unexpected. The Premier lobby was very nice. I also liked sitting down to check in instead of standing at a high counter. The Premier concierge was a little snarky - like I should be thrilled to have been redirected. The Premier is for the business traveler. Perks of the Premier are coffee makers, free breakfast and happy hour and free internet. Nice!My original room was next to the elevator even though I requested via phone that morning to be in a quiet location away from the elevator. When I returned to the lobby and asked to be moved, the concierge said she had stayed in that room and it was very quiet. I could hear the elevator bell inside the room - not quiet and I'm the customer here.The second room looked great, until the bathroom. The whole bathroom could use some attention. The wall paper is peeling, the ventilation didn't work. The glass counter had gunk under it that was visible since it was glass. The shower was awful - moldy and small. I travel with Clorox cleaning clothes, so cleaned it myself. I was only there for a weekend so, no problem.I called down for ice (the hotel information said ice was across from the "10" room - but there was no "10" room.) The concierge said "we don't do that here", but she would contact housekeeping. I also asked for a channel guide - then had to confirm that I had looked for one. The bellman brought ice, but no guide. He said he would be back with one. About 10 minutes late I got a call telling me to look on channel 78 for the TV guide. Shesh. The sheets were not very good (felt rough, like a poly/cotton blend with fuzz balls). I love Hilton sheets/duvets; those are my ideal hotel bed sets.The room was very quiet. The internet was fast and free. The room was sleek and modern with a couch on one side and the bed on the other. The large flat screen TV was on a table that swiveled to face either one.The happy hour was fine. The wine was decent, but the appetizers were not my style.I'm glad I cleaned the shower because it didn't drain well. I was standing in water by the end and the shower curtain was a "hugger".I could hear dripping in the wall at different times during my stay. Once was 6:30am - it was really noticeable because the room was so quiet. It sounded like something above me was leaking (maybe a shower?). I stopped in the main hotel lounge one evening for a drink. Excellent service and really friendly!Would I stay again? Maybe if the price was right because the location is fabulous. I would rather be in the main hotel though, not in the Premier side.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Situated between Times Square and 6th Ave (Ave of the Americas) the Premier Hotel takes some beating for anyone wanting theaters and mid town shopping/dining. Unlike one other contributor we found the staff friendly and helpful. The entry and check in is quieter than the main Millennium Hotel attached to it as it is smaller and does not have the group travelers. Breakfast and happy hour drinks are included so it makes it worthwhile paying that bit extra for rooms in the Premier tower. D&J

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: My wife and I recently stayed at The Premier for three nights. I'd stayed there in 2005 and found the hotel to be fresh, modern and professional. Seven years on, it's showing more than the average signs of wear and tear. The service was courteous and efficient but not special. We were moved to room with a king sized bed on request without too much trouble. The location is great if you're looking for a mid-town experience. The complimentary breakfast was fine. I'd probably stay again if I got a good rate but I wouldn't go out of my way.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Let me start by saying that for business and pleasure, I've been to over 1,000 hotels including about 10 in NYC. The Premier Hotel has THE WORST SERVICE. The front desk receptionist called Ramona yelled at me and my business partner when we tried to check in and explain to her that our booking included a late check out. Her reply was: "I don't know what our website says, I didn't write it". She did not make any efforts to accommodate us and it took her 20 minutes to check us in and we were the only folks there. After being yelled at, we went to our rooms. The sofa in my room was stained with all sorts of juices and stains - simply discussing. The room was furnished with an IKEA style bed that looked like it will fall apart. The only good thing about this hotel is its location. Do yourself a favor and go to one of the neighboring hotels like the Hilton Times Square, Westin, Crowne Plaza or the Intercontinental Hotel. There you will get the same location but also much better rooms, service and bang for your buck. Even if these hotels end up costing you $100 more - trust me it's worth it. Simply avoid the "Premier" dump with Ramona. Regards, Your Guardian Angel

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I've stayed here on business several times now because its location is great for both work and play. However, after this last stay, I think I'll look for elsewhere next time. Distinctly average, lacking in the attention-to-detail and special touches that make solo business travel bearable. The main bar was seriously dark and smelly - the stink was unbearable, like the place had been cleaned with a dirty cloth. My room was dusty, with stained furniture and was devoid of many of the usual hotel room essentials such as a clothes brush, pen and paper, bathroom scales (luggage weighing - wouldn't dare step on them in NYC after epic portion-size) and sewing kit (I needed it, had to buy one). There was an iron and ironing board already in the room which was good but the replacement board cover had clearly been put on by someone who had never ironed in their lives - rumpled and lumpy. Hairdryer was good.Housekeeping knocked on my door around 8:00am each morning while I was getting dressed. Way too early! They also removed my duvet and replaced it with a single blanket for reasons best known to themselves - I had to ask twice to get it back. Turn-down had already been done when I arrived back in my room around 6:30pm – strange to leave the blazing sunshine outside and walk into a room with the curtains drawn. Air con was loud - I usually turn it off anyway in hotels but there was some sort of back-up fan that was almost as loud.The complimentary breakfast on the Mezzanine floor was good; it was nice to have a couple of slices of toast and some juice for breakfast instead of the usual hotel expensive gorge-fest. The bar in the evening was good too; nicely chilled beers and some delicious snacks, friendly guy serving. Just one more thing... why oh why does the hotel laundry not offer the option of washing jeans? Dry-clean only...really?

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We were originally booked into the Millenium Broadway hotel during a busy convention. Upon arriving to our room, it was clear the room was not cleaned. A crib, bag of old fruit and messy bed prompted us to flee. The front desk was accommodating upgrading us to their Premier Hotel, next door. It was a totally different experience. The smaller, more intimate business hotel was a welcome improvement from the crowded Millennium. Although the furnishings had seen better days, we enjoyed the stay.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I booked this room because of the continental breakfast and the room looked lovely on the website. When I checked in there was a large orange stain on the carpet floor. My bed sheets were stained. There was no wireless internet in the rooms. Unacceptable. I was transferred to a superior room in the Millenium Broadway hotel and was much happier. The woman working the desk, I believe her name was Monique was amazing, extremely helpful!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I stayed in two different rooms because the first room was unusually hot. After being told in the morning that an engineer would fix my thermostat, I returned to a room that was even hotter, only to be told the thermostats were irrelevant, the hotel was in "winter" mode and it was only blowing heat! They moved me to another room that was much cooler, and as the outdoor temperature dropped, so did my room temperature, but it was better than being hot. The beds were good and both rooms were clean in terms of housekeeping, but the couches were stained, the walls and flooring showed wear, as did the showers, which are very small. This hotel was very adequate, but definitely does not fall into the luxury category. Check-in was a breeze for me, but my colleagues had to check in at the Millenium and the line was more than 15 people deep and slow, so it is luck of the draw on the check-in experience.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This is one of my favorite places to stay in New York City. The hotel is very conveniently located for me, for business meetings and for entertainment venues. The facility is modern, stylish with a minimalist approach to furnishings, clean and very quiet. A guest lounge has breakfast available in the morning and hors d'oeurves available in the evening.Like some of the other reviewers I arrived while the desk staff was at lunch but this has happened before and I am accustomed to handling check-in at the Millenium Hotel. If you have the misfortune to arrive while a large group is checking in this can result in annoying delays but I generally have been lucky.I'll be back.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We arrived in the rain on Friday night for a two night stay around 7:30 p.m. When we went to check in at the Premier there was no one there to help us as it was their dinner break. That is all well and good and it was not much trouble going over to the Millennium to get checked-in. I did notice that there was more than one concierge at the desk in the Millennium and was wondering why one of that staff might not be sent to the Premier to cover the break so the desk was covered at all times. We arrived at our room as was pleased. I did notice that there were some stains on the sofa and although the bed was great, the rest of the furniture could use an upgrade. I ordered ice at 10:55 p.m. and at 11:30 p.m. I had to call again as it had not arrived. On the second call, the ice was delivered in 7 minutes. Should there be an easier way to get ice??? Monique, the Premier concierge who we met on Saturday, was knowledgeable, exact, helpful and had a wonderful personality. This was a highlight for use as we gathered information on activities for the day. She's a keeper. Was a little disapointed in the breakfast. When we last stayed there a number of years ago it felt like there was more variety. I did have to ask for water as there was none out. It was delivered promptly. We will choose this hotel again, but hopefully my few concerns will be addressed.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: My wife and I decided to stay The Premier Hotel for a brief two day/one night mini vacation to NYC. We booked at Queen-sized bed, room for a Thursday/Friday stay. Upon arriving, we waited over 30 minutes to check-in because they only had one person working...I should also mention the check-in area is very poorly marked and we wasted another 5-10 minutes trying to figure out where to go. After we finally got our room, we found it was pretty dirty. The sink area had visible dirt marks, the light switches and telephones were dusty and appeared soiled, the walls/ceilings had large portions scratched and missing. I should also point out that the TV (which was 26" at best) had a terrible static hum as we tried to watch (calling the front desk, I learned there was nothing they could do and they were entirely booked due to a conference).My wife and I decided to stay The Premier Hotel for a brief two day/one night mini vacation to NYC. We booked aa Queen-sized bed, room for a Thursday/Friday stay. Upon arriving, we waited over 45 minutes to check-in because they only had one person working the desk. I realize 45 minute doesn’t sound like a lot of time, but I really didn’t expect to encounter this at a “premier” hotel. I should also mention the check-in area is very poorly marked and we wasted another 5-10 minutes trying to figure out where to go. After we finally got our room, we found it was pretty dirty. The sink area had visible dirt marks, the light switches and telephones were dusty and appeared soiled, the walls/ceilings had large portions scratched and missing and the bed comforter was some minor stains on them. I should also point out that the TV (which was 26" at best) had a terrible static hum as we tried to watch (calling the front desk, I learned there was nothing they could do and they were entirely booked due to a conference). When you book, they tell you that you can get a mini refrigerator on request; they don’t tell you it costs extra. Oh yeah, and no wi-fi.I was also disappointed by the breakfast, which is about the same as any continental breakfast you'd find at a regular chain hotel. However, they did have a happy hour the night before which was nice –they provided a few different wines and beers.Lastly, I should point out that they put us in a room with a full size bed, and not a queen like I booked, and again, said there was nothing they could do due to being completely booked. Bottom Line: Please don't stay here. I absolutely hated it, as did my wife. For $250-300/night, there are MUCH better options.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I just returned from a 4 night stay at the Premier Hotel--what a pleasant surprise! I was booked at the Millenium, but upon checking in after a long day of travel, was upgraded to The Premier Hotel. Justin at the front desk was delightful. My room was beautiful and immaculate. I didn't get the chance to try the continental breakfast or the happy hours, so can't comment on that, except to say that I was using the computer to print boarding passes and the selection looked nice. I loved that there was a very good feeling of privacy/security. My only suggestion for improvement is that I would have liked in-room wireless, as by the time I got back to the hotel, I didn't feel like going down to the Mezzanine to read my tablet. Location is great; steps away from Times Square and the subway. I would definitely consider coming back for another stay!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I stayed here for a day before catching my cruise from Manhattan. I entered the Millenium hotel thinking that my check-in was there but it was just around the corner as the hotels are joined. Monique, the front desk clerk was so professional, nice and accommodating--- I was not sure at the time if I wanted to stay on the Premier side or the Millenium side, so she let me view the rooms on each so I could make my choice. Without a doubt I preferred the Premier side simply because the lobby was so quiet and intimate.The room impressed me greatly for New York City! It was quite large, had floor to ceiling windows and a nice view. I could even see the Times Square ball as I arrived just six days after New Year's. The furnishings were modern, sturdy and the room sparkling clean. There was a nice sized closet with ironing board and iron and unlike many hotels I have used in New York-- this one had a nice large private bathroom--no sharing!There was no noise at all, even from the street below. The lounge was wonderful for the cocktail hour and for the nice breakfast in the morning. Some people are not concerned about breakfast but I will admit that it was nice to just get up and not have to worry about searching for a place close by. I just hopped into the elevator and got out at the lounge and there it was, brekkie:)What I was most impressed by, other than the excellent service by Monique, was that the elevators were secure. Each guest had to use his/her room card to get the elevators to work so this extra layer of security felt great in a large city.Location is excellent. Though steps away from Times Square, it is just off the main street so traffic noise is not an issue.There really was nothing wrong with this place and the only complaint I could conjure up, and this is minor, is that the room did not have wireless. The lounge did so I often popped down there to check my email but that would be the only downside. I so enjoyed my stay there that I am planning a long weekend sometime in the Spring!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Travel with 2 young kids alone during July, was told by front desk kids were not allowed to go to Breakfast Area during the snacks time and I did not see anywhere in the Hotel Web Page mention about it at all.Strange thing happened again when I was 2nd in line during the check out, the front desk just ignored me and talk to a man with business suit just step out from the elevator who said he was in a rush. Noone even said a word to me if I mind to let to this man to do the check out firstSo my conclusion is Businessman welcome and family with kids sucks..

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The room was clean. Not a bad location for the price. Expedia was a bit misleading in that we understood we were staying at the millenium broadway (which is next door). No free wireless. We waited a long time to check in and were generally unimpressed. The buffet breakfast turned out to be very "continental" with no option to upgrade what so ever, so having paid an extra $14 for a danish, we weren't thrilled.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel was sold to me by my travel agent. I was however told this would be the Millenium Hotel Broadway and not the adjacent Premier Hotel. What a mistake this turned out to be.I arrived in the room 1022. There was a loud noise coming from the outside as if a plane was passing. This didnt go away and when I looked out of the window there was this huge unit which I believe to be an air conditioning unit in front of my window, but belonging to a building opposite. There really is no excuse for a hotel to sell you a room at 230 Dollars without making mention of this. This price just is not low enough to make up for that infernal noise which allows you no sleep. As far as I could gather the room 1022 had two ajacent rooms. I presume any room ending in 22 has the same noise issue so avoid at any cost. This is if you must go here. The complimentary breakfast (which may be an attempt to make amends for your lack of sleep) was ok: croissant, coffee, juice, toasts and bagels. Basic but consumed in more upmarket surroundings than usual for this type of breakfast.The concierge service was appaling by the way. A guy called Joey was not the brightest. He was unable to answer simple questions about how to get to the airport by public transport without resorting to asking a colleague and even so, both were rather disinterested. Still I left an undeserved tip. They were also playing loud house music when there were no customers around. The team seemed bored. The receptionist, Vivienne, was nice and professional but beneath it all she might be fed up with this low class of hotel trying to position itself as belonging to the classy one next to it which boast a far more attractive decor and presumably clientele.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I love it here. It is not the Renaissance or the Sofitel, my favorite ($$$) mid-town hotels, but the modern room furnishings and clean style of the Premier are very appealing. Check-in is very classy and, best of all it is very quiet and private. The location could hardly be better.Rooms are clean, service is friendly - there's little not to like. The morning breakfast buffet area would be more functional if there were tables or other accomodations for coffee cups, plates and cereal bowls, and I wish it would open at 6:30 rather than 7:00 a.m., but the selection is wonderful and the quality of the food is very good.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here for business because they had the government rate and close to where I needed to conduct business. First - the plusses: Location was great - just off times square. Room was large with a nice view. It was very quiet on the 20th floor, which I like. The free cocktail hour was awesome - free beer, wine, sandwiches, etc. They got me in very early, at 7:30 a.m. which was nice but only after I pressed (I knew they had rooms, and had to sign up for their club to get in early).  The negatives: the decor was worn. caulking was peeling, shower leaked spontaneously in the middle of the nights, pieces of wall covering (was that paper?) peeling off. I'm sure it all looked nice 15 - 20 years ago. I thought I was staying in the Millenium, their sister hotel where I had reservations, but ended up there. As a result, I had an ice bucket but the ice was down 20 floors and over three addresses if I really wanted it. (same with the gym) Service was ok but not necessarily stellar. Overall, it worked out ok, but if my wife had stayed with me, who's much pickier than me, it would have been a disaster. And if the kids had come, it would have been worse. The windows at ankle level (on the 20th floor) actually open! (albiet only about 4 or 5", but still a bit scary)

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I found this hotel through affiliate of Orbitz for a reasonable price (for NYC standards). This was my 6 years old first overnight stay in New York and this hotel had great location on the heart of everything. Since we arrived around 10 am we were able to use the option to leave our luggage until the normal check in time and still not missing on the sightseeings either.The staff was very polite and helpful to us. Great perk was the complimentary drinks and hors d’oeuvres between 5 and 7 and the breakfast in the morning with fresh fruits, muffins, yogurt, juice and coffee. I mean how many things are free in New York! The hotel room key is the only way to use the elevator, which is a nice thought for the guests and their safety. Our room was pretty nice with a modern flair. I found our room to be spacious for New York standards and very quiet considering that the hotel is few hundred feet from Time's square. Bathroom is nice and big with separate shower and bath tub. It was clean,but I will suggest to try to clean better underneath the glass counter and the shower tiles. From the amenities what every room should be equipped ours did not had the bathrobe, but it was not something I really needed anyway. Also, there was a nice choice of teas and coffee in the room.You might consider that if you apply for their hotel rewards card on site you will be entitled for 2 complimentary items from the bar in your room.I need to thank personally Patrick from the concierge staff who despite that was at the end of his shift spend extra time with my son to make him feel welcomed. I also need to thank the security who was able to come quickly and resolve a little glitch with the security safe caused by my lovely kid (lesson learned - never forget the code lol).I highly recommend this boutique hotel to all. Personally, I am already looking to reserve the same hotel in September for a Broadway trip.Thank you Polina

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: This is the most private hotel I've stayed at in NY. The decor is very modern and very clean. The room feels like the Sofitel a couple blocks away with a couple exceptions. As others have noted the staffing is very light as they service from the Millenium hotel, next door through a theatre lobby. No restaurant, no gift shop, but a nice lounge on the mezzanine with a good, free breakfast in the morning and drinks & snacks after work.Great location, great corporate rate, I really like it. Two small issues - the showers are really small and a little primitive, hidden behind the door, and sometimes I haven't been able to get hot water in the morning, only warm. Second, the TV's are set up with a funky aftermarket remote control/receiver that works quite poorly. No channel flipping here - you can only input one signal every 30 seconds or so, very annoying. All in all, I'm very happy to stay here when I'm in the city.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: My travel agent booked me to this hotel for a conference. Very nice private entry and clean room with a good concierge floor. Bathroom looked a little tired for a $425/night. Great location right outside Times Square. However, when I finally fell into bed at 12:30, the bottom sheet was 6 inches too short! The mattress pad was showing at the bottom of the bed! Now for a hotel like this not to have sheets that fit the bed! I get better linens from a motel 6. I was too tired to deal with it. I spoke with the receptionist the next morning and after 2 attempts to talk to the head of housekeeping, nobody was available to address my concern. No apology or offer of compensation. Of all the hotels in Manhattan, I advise choosing another one or check the sheets before you collapse into bed!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We loved this simple hotel. The free breakfast is offered weekdays and was perfect before heading out to see the sights. All staff was courteous though hands off. If there is a concierge, we not see him. The hotel seemed more private, very low key, hardly saw any other people there. We were pleased with our room and the free upgrade to a king bed. The room was huge, not just huge for NYC, seriously huge. We had a great view of 44th street and even the flashing lights of Broadway. The room was clean, carpet was worn a bit-but who's complaining. We found the location to be perfect, just steps from the heart of Times Square and easy access to the subway. We had a 7 year old in tow and she had no troubles keeping pace. We felt safe and had no issues at all with the hotel. The elevator will not move without a room key-nice feature for women traveling alone. My daughter loved making tea for us at night-great perk after a long day on our feet. We got a great rate (for NYC) right off the website and we loved the couch in the room as it made a nice bed for the little one. Every request to housekeeping was met in minutes...We will definitely stay here again! Thanks Premier!!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We flew to New York for 2 shows and an overnight stay. When we checked into the Millenium, not only were we given an early check-in (it was only 10:30am!), but we were upgraded to a room at The Premier Hotel. The room was big, by NYC standards and included some nice amenities (flat screen tv, coffee pot in room and a decent size bathroom). However, the lighting set up was weird-you could not have one bedside lamp on by itself. The other REALLY annoying thing about the hotel was the towels. They didn't seem to dry very well and, worse than that, they left huge amounts of lint on hands.body, hair. On the plus side-everyone we encountered at the hotel was very, very nice.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Loews Regency has bigger rooms, but this was kinda like a boutique. Rooms were a little bigger than the rooms over at the Morgans, and had a similar flair to the Morgans. Platform bed, but super comfy with THE BEST pillows I have encountered. Bathroom had the modern edge to it, but the shower stall was pretty small. The bath tub, of course, is huge. The view was of a building under construction across the street, but you could see the lights of times square. Free internet, but no WIFI. You have to connect via LAN. Getting on the internet took a lot of time, but they eventually got it sorted out. At the end of the day, the room was doable - clean, a touch small, but a very comfy bed.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: My partner and I have stayed here several times. Each time we've stayed there it improves, not that it needs improving. They just get better each time.The lobby is very clean and there is always a smiling face at the desk. The rooms are small but just right. On this visit our room was larger than before. The bed is amazing. We had a bath tub and shower. Everything was spotless.There room service was fantastic like always. Try the chicken wrap, its very good. And if you want something sweet they have a cake.If you have the chance stay here!
user_name:
Inanreca
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We had actually booked a room at Millennium's adjacent property the Broadway, but on checking in got bumped to the Premier. I suspect we had one of their lesser rooms - a queen bed when we'd requested a king, and no view to speak of - but it was still clean, quiet and spacious (especially for mid-town NYC!), with nice amenities like flat-screen TV, a comfortable lounging area in the room, and free continental breakfast and cocktail (well, actually beer & wine) hour every evening.For the $220 or so we paid per night it was a great value, especially for the location - if we were paying anywhere near rack rate (more than double that) ... not so much.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: The premier is a boutique hotel within the Millenium Broadway. We were upgraded from teh Millenium and let me say we were delighted to be so. THe concierge service is second to none. Great rooms, decent size. Good evening reception and breakfast. Highly recommend

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I decided to try The Premier, which is the Millenium Broadway's more upscale hotel. They call it the premier portion of the Millenium Broadway.They have free cocktails and free cold breakfast. They also offer free cable Internet access.The room was quite nice with sofa, large desk area and good sized flat screen TV. That's where the good news ended. The cable internet was slow. It was quicker for me to use the wireless at Starbuck's on 45th Street. The shower stall had the waterpipe coming out of the wall about a foot above my head. The shower head was inflexible, so all I could get wet was my head and shoulders; the rest of my body couldn't get any water on it. Useless.I had issues with room keys and access to the elevator (which is by room key only).It was a premier price versus the Millenium Broadway, but not worth the additional cost.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed at the Premier 2 weeks after staying at the Casablanca. Both hotels are worth the visit. the room at the Premier was considerably larger than that at the Casablanca. We had to be moved to another room, as our first room had a terrible water leak and was somewhat dirty (stained sofa and bedspread). The breakfast and cocktails were more upscale than the Casablanca, but the staff wasn't nearly as friendly. Amenities were better, but I prefer the charm of the smaller hotel.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I spent 6 days during thanksgiving week @ the premier.I choosed the hotel was based on the critics i had read on tripadvisor and i was not disappointed.The room was clean and spacious enough, well isolated from the noise outside. Large bathroom with bath and shower, nice amenities. breakfast was included in the price and was a self service buffet. Not amazing food but sufficient choice and always filled. Staff was very pleasant and welcoming.I was a little bit surprise by the lobby which was rather small and unpersonnal, probably explained by the fact that Premier is an annexe of the millenium hotel broadway next door. I didn't expected anything special but it looked more like some kind of office building hall than a luxury hotel to me. All in all, i found hotel common parts lacking of personnality, and overall aspect could probably be improved to look more luxurious than it is, but it's not really what matters to me.Again room was good and there were no false note of any kind during my stay....Except one thing, though it is not the responsability of the hotel.Beware of the Driver limo in front of the hotel. They do business in the back of the hotel with the help of a doorman, offering ride rates cheaper than the hotel rates (to go to the airport) but try to crook you at the end pretending highway taxes where not include in the price, though it was very clearly stated they were included by the doorman who offered the rate ....

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed at The Premier for 5 nights during September and thoroughly enjoyed our time there. Check-in was fast and efficient. The room was bright and modern and the bathroom large with separate bath and shower. We had a view of the Chrysler Building from the side window and from the floor to ceiling front window could see the Paramount Clock and a few of the lights of Times Square. We were on the 20th floor it was so quiet at times we thought we were the only people in the hotel. The complimentary continental breakfast was very good. There were also complimentary drinks and hors d’oeuvres between 5 and 7 if you happened to be around at that time.The hotel’s location is just steps from Times Square and within walking distance of The Empire State Building, Central Park, Grand Central Station, etc. After a day out seeing the sights it was just great to walk through the doors into such a haven of peace and quiet and relax for a while. The staff were always polite, friendly and attentive and each time we returned to the hotel made us feel really welcome. We would certainly choose to stay here again.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: I originally booked a superior room at the Millenium Broadway since I had a very good experience previously. I upgraded to a club room at The Premier at the last minute and I am so glad that I did. I arrived around 11am and my room was ready which was unexpected since check in is at 4pm. My room (1721) was amazing. The view was great, the room was clean and modern, and the bathroom spacious. The staff was courteous and pleasant. The complimentary breakfast in the mezzanine was better than I had expected. The location was perfect, right in the middle of times square! I definitely will be staying at The Premier when I go back to NYC.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: As a frequent (2-3 times a month) business traveler to New York, I have no use whatsoever for Times Square - the visiting throngs make getting there and getting out of there a nightmare. That said, Millennium's Premier almost makes it worth running the gauntlet. Rooms are modern, serene, comfortable, and thoughtfully laid out. The bathroom is roomy and luxurious, scarcities in NYC. The staff is courteous, personable and adept, and checkin/checkout are a breeze. I never take advantage of hotel lounges or continental breakfasts, so I couldn't comment on those except to say it's nice to have them available. A bonus, because you're in an area not noted for its dining choices, is that Virgil's Barbecue is right across the street, Cafe 123 (an unexceptional but quite passable French bistro that's been a reasonably-priced mainstay for many years) a few doors down, and a fully-stocked deli/convenience store a bit further down the block. Cabs are surprisingly plentiful on 7th Avenue or Broadway (Times Square), because most tourist gawkers never leave the vicinity.I've stayed in most all of New York's big hotels and can say without qualification that the Premier is one of the nicest hotels in the city. And if it were over on 9th Avenue, or below 30th Street, or just about anywhere save Times Square, I'd probably stay there on every trip.
user_name:
homesick_and_grumpy
somewhere on a lumpy mattress

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: is like a wing of the much larger Millennium Broadway; I've stayed several times and really like it. Rooms are somewhat small but nicely appointed; extensive continental breakfast (i.e. no hot food) in the mezzanine lounge. My complaints: (1) No Comedy Central, so I can't watch the Daily Show each night. (2) the desk setup is a bit cramped. (3) The sign says I shouldn't show up to breakfast in the complimentary bathrobe -- why not?!

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: Upon entering my room (1019), I was shocked by a wall where the previous guest had scrawled, "wash me" in soot. I should have left then. If the housekeeping staff could overlook such obvious filth, what else in the room might have been overlooked and never properly cleaned?The room was cramped and unwelcoming. The carpeting and the room in general were dirty and unkempt. The uncomfortable sofa was a worn sectional in two pieces with wooden arms. There was no lap blanket. The magazines were piled carelessly on the table. There wasn’t even a pen in the room. A Zen garden with a broken rake rested on the desk.The ironing board was not properly attached to the door, so it banged loudly every time I opened the closet. There were no bathrobes and only three very small bath towels for two adults. The paint on the exposed ceiling pipe was peeling off.I cannot stress enough the disturbing effect of the hotel’s disappointing and dirty facilities had on me. We didn't book two rooms at a luxury hotel for nearly $900 a night to have such a shabby, careless and poorly maintained accommodation. On Sunday morning we never received an in room checkout or a hotel evaluation card, making me wonder if the staff suspected we would comment negatively about our stay. Prior to check out we called the desk for our car. We were told we had to go to the Millennium Hotel Bell Stand for information about it. We had to drag our luggage through thePremier to the Millennium lobby to the 45th Street entrance. The bellhop did not know how we would be able to get out of 6th Avenue. The parking attendant handed us our car keys and parking stub, left us facing a crowd of people and a wooden barricade, and told us to ask the police to let us drive through it. Only after we approached some NYC police officers did we get help. We had to turn our SUV around and the police officers guided us the wrong way down a one-way street. Finally we were on our way.When I am on a vacation I do not like to confront service personnel. I choose hotels and resorts with the highest ratings for service and accommodations. I do not want to voice complaints, have confrontations, or draw attention to myself. I try to choose recreation that is stress free. And mostly I do not want to be concerned about the sanitary conditions of my bed or bathroom.I looked at your web site before I booked. I expected a relaxing stay at a luxury hotel. Your advertisement clearly misrepresents the quality, service, facilities and attitude of the Premier.Your customer service director is quoted in one press release as saying she wants consistently satisfied customers and that the Premier guarantees it will "meet and exceed the expectations of our guests." The Premier facilities are far from hitting that mark.My stay at the Premier last night was most unpleasant. I keep recalling the sooty writing on the wall and am unnerved by the unseen filth it may represent. I feel I have been grossly cheated, not only because of the high price I paid for a very bad experience but also because my weekend was so hurt by this situation. I can see no reason to stay at your hotel again and I will certainly share my experience with as many people as I can.I hope you will address my complaints and respond. I sent my letter September 18, 2005 and I have not heard anything from anyone at the Premier Hotel in New York City.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: My husband and I stayed here in June 2003 for our honeymoon. Room was great extremely well furnished and comfortable. Close to Times Square and the theatre district would stay here again definately!We had complimentary beakfast buffet in the adjoining Millenium Broadway and the food was great.

hotel_name: Millennium Premier New York Times Square
review_body: All I can say is WOW!!!!!!!!.....We got upgraded from the millenium Broadway to the Premier(which is a Mellenium hotel). Everything was just perfect. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was beautiful. If you are going to a broadway show this is the place to be. Half a block from Times square on 44th street. We will definitely be going back there again.
